reviews.review:
OutOfThisUnderWorld. We have an 8 year old girl. We had a blast.
If you're lucky enough to get Martina as your guide, you'll have the chance to feel safe and well informed about these amazing watery caves. #SpoilerAlert
The caves are ancient coral reefs!

Beautiful. I felt like I was on an episode of Expedition Unknown.Make sure you sign up for the plus program it's a great full day. Romain was our guide and he was great! They separated the groups by language so you can enjoy! I loved the knowledge and link to Mayan history as well as geological knowledge. This is an ecological park so don't put lots of products on as you are in drinking water supply that needs to be maintained. Ask questions and get involved we learned so much!And now for the repelling! WOW! I was scared and anxious, but don't worry they walk you thru it step by step and there are safety precautions in place. This is worth the trip!

Cave was amazing, the price was not. I booked the Rio Secreto Plus tour for the "cheap" price of $99 USD. The park refuses to let you bring a camera into the caves, claiming it's for cave preservation, but the real reason is because they have a "proffesional" photographer who takes about 6-10 photos of each person/ group throughout the tour. At the end of the tour they try and pressure you into buying their photos for $25 USD per photo or you can get all the pictures of your group for $89 USD. Yes that's right, 7 photos for the same cost of your tour. Its a joke. The cave itsself was beautiful although not worth the extra money for the Plus tour. The light show is not fantastic and the bike riding is just a 500 ride on very old and unkept bikes from point A to point B so they don't have to drive you. Allow people to bring their own cameras... the people who still want to purchase the professional photos can do so.

The brochure doesn't do justice to this place!. An unforgettable experience! We did this with three other couples with a very knowledgeable guide. First we walked through a dry underground river cavern. For the next cavern we donned wetsuits for about a two hour underground river tour through mostly knee deep water but at times over our heads. Stalactites and stalagmites formations were beautiful. At times we had to squeeze though tight passages but never had to crawl. At times we were able to float through some passages . To get out we went through shoulder wide walls and shoulder level water with our helmets rubbing against the cavern ceiling! There were no lights in this cavern so we only had our helmet lights. When the guide had all of us turn off our lights the complete darkness was indescribable. Most of us had no previous caving experience but we were able to put our complete trust in our guide. After leaving this cavern we rode bicycles a short distance to take turns rappelling down into another underground river cavern. We were able to walk out of this one. The physical exertion was not as much as it seems. Not to be missed!

Splendid!. We really appreciated Rio Secreto, it was interesting and the guide we had was able to answer well to our questions. The only negative point is that you have to pay a little fortune for the pictures they take (25 USD for 1 picture).

Wow! . The most beautiful place I've visited! It's a bit scary, being in the dark all the time, some of the passages are very narrow, but it was an incredible experience! Especially if the weather is not great!

Bucket List Place. Strongly recommend this cave exploration experience. I am a little claustrophobic but had no problems as it's wide open and good lighting. Our guide Vickey was great. If she is available, I suggest you ask for her. A very stunning experience and lifelong memory. Your about 65 feet below the surface into a different world than you have probably ever seen! You do some swimming (dog paddling really) and they supply all your supplies including wet suit, water shoes and helmet. The water is cool but you quickly adapt. A lot of walking in water ankle to waist deep but the water is so clear you can see straight down to the bottom. We did caves in Solvenia and these are 200℅ better. You have lights on your helmets but the guides have powerful lights to show you all the formations you will experience. You will also have two additional guides working with your main guide taking photos and assisting your journey. They are very safely conscious! You can't bring cameras but the photographers take some amazing photos of your group for you to buy if you desire. No hard pressure on the photos which is nice. We ended up buying due the overall experience which we rank as this trips highlight. Enjoy, this type of tour is very unique and memorable.

Cool, Sweet Spring Water. The entrance is on the main highwway from Cancun to Tulum. This area is full of subterranean rivers that sprout up into beautiful, calm and serene springs called "Cinotes" pronounced CY-NOTE-TAYS. The locals are correct when they tell you that the water is sweet. You can wade and swim in these nylon pools of aqumarine spring water with stalactites everywhere, hanging like chandeliers.

Excellent experience - one of a kind!. This is a very smoothly run experience. The underground river is amazing. Our guide was very knowledgeable and friendly. All equipment was provided and of good quality. You need to be able to walk on rocky, uneven surfaces. Would recommend this to my friends.

Worth the Time and Money. You need to be in reasonable physical condition to do this excursion and not be claustrophobic to really enjoy this underground river experience. You first don a wet suit, already damp so hard to get on and then put on a hard hat complete with light. The hat is important as it is easy to knock your head on the low hanging stalactites (or are they stalagmites?). You also put on a life vest and swim shoes if you don't have you own. You wade a lot through knee deep water, the bottom is very uneven with jagged calcium protrusions below the surface, and swim in a few places where the water is fairly deep. The water feels chilly but is actually about 25C so not that bad. All the while your very knowledgable guide is sharing interesting information. To wrap it up a buffet of local fare is offered...after they try to sell you photos that have been taken throughout the tour (no personal cameras allowed).

A visit to a unknown world!. This was an outstanding experience! Our tour guild was Lu, she was very knowledgeable and really down to earth, you can tell she really enjoys her job and teaching others about it. The entire hike thru the secret amazing river was magical. They have professional photographers that follow your small and personal group through the cave to catch every moment and make your experience last a life time. The ride to the secret river was entertaining and we even stopped to see some wildlife our driver was very fun and kept the drive entertaining. Even the food was beyond great. Overall my experience was by far the best I've ever had. - Miles

very unique experience. Our tour guide was Vicky,she did a great job.Our group was 4 people that spoke english and 6 that spoke german,she did well with both.Very informative.After you arrive you take a 15 minute rocky road drive through the jungle then you are fitted with wet suit life jacket and wet shoes.The trek through the cave is about 1 1/2 hours.You gow through the dry and wet parts of the cave walking and swimming.Do not do this if you are nervous of walking on uneven surfaces,lots of that here.It is really neat.Only con is no cameras or go pros.I think there prices for pics were $25 for 1 or $99 for a thumbdrive with all pics and pics of the caves.We bought it but I do think that is to expensive and pics were just ok.Buffet after is just ok.

Intriguing and unique experience . We recently went to Rio Secreto with a group of friends and had a fun experience in the unique environment. As you probably know this location allows you the opportunity to move through underground caves via the water after putting on a wetsuit and a life jacket. Most caves require you to walk on the path that has very limited access. Safety is definitely a concern and they do a good job making sure that you're comfortable and in a safe environment. Here's a few things we didn't like. They took our group of six and merged us with a group of four and created a bilingual group. This meant the guide spent approximately half of his time speaking to the group in Spanish and the other half of the time speaking to us in English. This seemed to limit the ability for us to interact and ask questions and made it a less than enjoyable time. It would've been easy with all the guides they had there to split the groups differently as they had minivans of people coming in to take these tours. Another thing that limited our enjoyment was the drive in from the greeting spot to the point where the tour starts. It is a 15 minute journey through the most sloped and potholed road you can imagine. You arrive to start your tour in a fairly unsettled matter. From there it all goes smoothly they fit you they give you equipment and they get you going.Overall we liked it and we would not do it again but it was worth doing one time the caves are spectacular and unique and you get a chance to do a tour that I have not seen in my travel around the world.

Out of this world!. This was the best of the best. The "Plus" tour gives you everything from the underground river to repelling down to another river. Our guide Vero was absolutely amazing. Knowledgeable, funny, and efficient. They don't allow for your own pictures at all. Don't even try. It's good because it gives you 1) the opportunity to not be distracted while walking through stalagmites underwater 2) to really be "present" and "disconnected." And 3) probably they'd like to make a few extra bucks. Can't blame them. They have a photographer along with each group so you don't lose those moments, too. And yes it's not free. The experience is completely worth it.

Awesome tour. My girlfriend and I wanted to see the caves in a more "personal" way, it's not an easy find here but we did find this place to be awesome, groups are made of a maximum of 10 people only, so it does become somewhat more personal. Of course, if you are claustrophobic it's not a place for you. So, do yourself and everyone around you a favour and skip this tour. A bit of swimming is required but you do have life vest and it's a part of the tour that makes it so special, when you rest on your back and enjoy the quietness and darkness of the caves, I promise you will come out of there enchanted.

Fun Tour, great staff. Very well organized tour through a cave partially filled with fresh water. Staff was knowledgeable in caving and helpful in guiding us through - be sure to ask for Victor R.. Lunch was EXCELLENT (try the lime soup!). This is not your ordinary cruise tour to a beach or to snorkel. Be ready for a unique trip underground that was very well run. I would have liked to had time for their longer 5 hour tour, but the ship wouldn't wait!. On my list if I ever I get back to the area.If you sail into Cozumel, be prepared for a bumpy ferry ride to the mainland if there is any wind (usually is, we were told). You should be able to negotiate uneven terrain but the guides were helpful.
Amazing place!. It is an unbelievable place. There is no other place like this! Tour guide was very knowledgeable and friendly. We had an amazing experience!

ABSOLUTELY BEAUTIFUL attraction. Best kept secreto!. We had initially scheduled a trip to snorkel along the reef, but many things made us change our plan. We took this guided tour through the small jungle/forest leading to the cenotes, with extremely interesting information about the Mayan people and their culture. The trip through the cavern was stunning, interesting and fantastically beautiful! Recommend this detour to anyone visiting the area!! Loved it.

Highlight of Our Trip. My husband and I did Rio Secreto about a week ago and had an amazing time. The tour is very well planned and you get to spend a good amount of time in the cave system. Our guide was Diana and she was funny and informative. We used the company's wetsuits over our swimsuits and purchased their water shoes (which was cheaper than buying them at our hotel). The photo packages start at $89, which may at first sound pricey, but the photographer basically was with us the entire tour and got some awesome shots of us going through the cave. We would definitely recommend the tour, and would probably even do it again if we got to do another route.

Cruise ship excursion from Cozumel . We are very glad we picked this excursion. We had a great ride in a ferry from Cozumel to Playa del Carmen. The ride in the tour vans was quick but very bumpy. Once we arrived at the tour location we were assigned a guide, given appropriate gear, and head off walking through the jungle to be blessed by a Mayan before entering the cave. The walk/swim through the gave was awesome. The information provided by the guide was great. The BIG NEGATIVE is they forbid cameras except for their own very expensive photographers. We refused to buy the pictures for $89 because we feel they are exploiting tourists by charging an unreasonably high price.

Great day seeing the underworld of the Yucatán Pennisula. We visited Rio Secreto today, caves and underground rivers. We weren't sure how the day would go or what to wear. We wore swim suits which was perfect. The company provided wet suit, life vest, water shoes and helmet with light. Optional walking stick also available. Our guide was enthusiastic and knowledgeable. We went down into the cenote. The tour, about one and a half hours, consists of walking through the water to see various caverns, stalagmites and stalatites. At one point there was a very short swim, meaning between the depth and the stream and the life vest my feet did not touch bottom. Nothing scary, but just so you know. Another place was low enough I bumped my head twice. Glad for the helmet. Again, nothing scary. After getting back to the surface, we could view and purchase photos taken along the way and there was a light lunch provided. All in all, an enjoyable afternoon.

Amazing experience. My husband and I loved our experience on this tour. The entire excursion was well-organized and flawlessly executed. We were promptly picked up from our hotel lobby and taken to the starting point where all the necessary equipment was provided (helmet, wet suit, shoes, life jacket). Everything was in great condition and the facilities were spotless. Our tour guide, Alfredo, was amazing. His passion for the cave was infectious, and we really enjoyed learning about the history of the cave and the Mayan culture. Although English was not his first language, he was perfectly fluent and we had no issues understanding him. We participated on the Plus tour, which involved a tour of the dry and wet parts of the cave, and a short jaunt through a cenote entrance. Although we enjoyed it all, it did feel a little long, so if you're not crazy about spending a significant amount of time in small spaces, you may want to seek out a shorter tour. Overall, we spent 6 hours on this excursion. It was a whole day away from our all-inclusive, but it was well worth it!

Incredible Underground Caves!. Rio Secreto is really cool! The limestone caves are roughly 60 feet beneath the surface. Our guide was excellent. Our entire family went, with ages ranging from 5 years old to 73 years old. Much of the time you are in an underground river walking and occasionally swimming. They provide all of the gear. There really isn't any current. The stalagtites are beautiful. I highly recommend it for anyone.

Experience of a lifetime. What an amazing experience this was. I have been in caves before, but never have I gone in one through water. it was a bit of a challenge walking through the water and not seeing what you are walking on, but definitely worth the work. Our guide Veronica was so knowledgeable and helpful. Fanny the photographer was excellent. I loved that the group was small and all English speaking. I've been on tours where the guide has to constantly change languages and it can get confusing. All equipment was included and the guides helped us put it on properly.

Fascinating! . One of the most fascinating caves we have ever seen, and we have been to more than 40 countries. It is a bit more than 1 km walk part in water, sometimes you need to swim. The company provides all necessary clothing including water shoes and safe helmet. Our guide Romain was perfect.During the tour it is not allowed to carry any sort of camera and there is a photographer who takes all photos. The big drawback is the cost. One photo costs US $25 and all set of photos US $89. It is of course not a must, but otherwise you are left without a memory. This is the only thing which is so unfair in this tour.

The magical world under us!!!. Wow...amazing caves, great people, what more can I say! Our guide was Vicky and she was knowledgeable and a great guide.. Once you arrive you watch a video then they drive you about 10 minutes in to e jungle to the cave area.. There you shower, put on wet suites and water shoes (all provided). There is a bit of a hike through the jungle to get to the entrance. Once inside your guide should start giving you a history and a lesson on how the caves forms and the type of formations you will see.. FYI small fish can be seen... Ohh make sure take the walking stick they offer you--comes in handy. There will be someone taking lots of pics, Sorry no cameras allowed. I was pissed about that, but once inside you see why they want to protect the caves.. Pic package was afordable.. Anyways long story short we had a great time, ohh and they feed you at the end...Hope you try it and get Vicky she was awesome...

Awesome experience!!!. We just loved this! Jorge our tour guide was great!!!! We took a tour with Jorge and he was so good to my mom who is 80! Helped her through the caverns while guiding us all and telling us about this amazing place! We took the easier tour which was plenty for us. The tour was a small group of 10 which made it more fun! We got to know others on the tour and all had a great time together! It was really a really something spectacular to see. Can't wait to go back and do it again! Be prepared for a bouncy ride there though!

Wonderful. My husband and I did this and it was beautiful and fun. Just remember the water is cold. There are fish in the water and coral. It can be deep but you have a life jacket and all snorkeling equipment was provided just bring a towel.

Great authentic cave experience. I'm visiting rio secreto the second time (last time was 2012) but this time with my family (daugher 9). We booked the tour "plus" which was great, it is only in small groups and you visit another cave system. First we had a very good introduction to the Mayan world and culture and it's goods.After we went for the light show by foot (in normal cloth) for the first cave visit. Memo did a great introduction, we were only 5 in our group. After returning, we went to change (and shower off the deodorant/sunscreen etc) into the wet suit. We did bring our wet shoes, but the ones available were good too. Then the cycling (not far) to the entrance of the special cave. My daughter loved the cycling (also kids bikes available). then we went down 15 m to the entrance of the cave (it was just a great). If you are afraid, they guides help you, not probs. Then our journey started for more than 1 hour in the cave system. At the end we came out in the first cave visited and could walk back. It was safe for the entire walk/swim.It is fantastic what nature built. It's a must if you are in Yucatan.

Definitely recommend!!. We have visited caves and cenotes but this is by far the best! Gonzo was an excellent guide and you should request him if at all possible. We took the Supreme tour and the cave was amazing. Although you are not allowed to take cameras or video inside the cave, it is breathtaking! The pictures are available through the company for $100. This is a definite to do!

Trip Plus. It took almost an hour to get there from the hotel, but it was worth it it. Yayo, our guide was enthusiastic and helpful. We were in a mixed group, but he made sure that everything that was said, was translated into English and Spanish. The caves are outstanding and we were lucky enough to see some bats / fish / Blue Crab and a spider. Not much lives down there. It's not arduous, so all people could do it. The paperwork says to take your own water shoes (we bought some) but they supply everything when you get there.Fully recommend this as a visit and go for the full day.
Honeymoon excitment. My favourite tour of our trip - Tour guide was fun and kept us al entertained. My wife and I loved this trip.

Don't Just See the Natural Beauty.... EXPERIENCE IT!!!! This was truly the best part of my cruise experience. We did this excursion on our cruise to Cozumel. I never dreamed I would ever do a cave tour like this. This is in a beautiful setting. The guide was very knowledgeable about the rock formations and life in the cave. It was dark but we had lights on the safety helmets. The light illuminates the cave by radiating off of the crystal clear water. You hike over rocks and you have to wade thru water. Water shoes are a must. There are areas that you have to float thru the beautiful water. They provide a life jacket. The only issue is they give you an option to use a provided walking stick. The walk thru the cave and the water can be rough. The walking stick should be mandatory. I did not have any concerns about anything in the cave. The guide is very protective of the natural habitat. I am not athletic but was able to manage the cave. This is not for everyone but you don't have to a spelunker to explore this cave. They provide a lunch the is some of the best Mexican food I have eaten. The ride on the bus out was a little rough but the cave made up for the trip. I loved this and would do it again and again!

Beautiful...if you've never been in a cavern before. My husband and I went to Rio Secreto October 2016. For anyone that has been in a cavern before, I wouldn't recommend it. Only difference is swimming through parts of the cave. Water was extremely clear. Our guide was very informative and watched out for our safety. If you've never been in a cavern, this is an experience!! There are different paths that the guide can take you on. Our path was...just ok. I think I'd rather have gone on the enchanted tour. You do not get a choice, nor were we informed of the different tours until AFTER.

Fabulous Adventure. This was probably are most favorite trip of our stay in Playa Del Carmen. We were told of this tour, but never could have imagined how spectacular it really was. I highly recommend this experience.

Great experience. My husband and I took a trip to Rio Secreto. Very interesting and different experience. Water was chill but we were wearing special suits. The moment we really loved as when the guide asked us to turn off our flashlights and stay quiet. It was so unbelievably dark and quiet. I hight recommend this trip.
AWESOME!!!! GO. We did the PLUS that included rappel bikes and light show.SAVE YOUR TIME and skip the PLUS version. rappeling was neat but bikes and light show were boring.
Conference speaker. An amazing integration of unique natural phenomena and Mayan culture. Staff was wonderful and a joy to be around. Wish I could have spent more time exploring.

MUST SEE -- Highlight of our trip. This is a MUST SEE! I loved every second of this excursion. Our tour guide was great! The ride down was a tad bumpy, but all apart of the experience. I really enjoyed the walking and swimming combination. Thank you for a fun day experience. We enjoyed getting out of our resort and visiting other locations around the area. I would recommend taking the walking stick they provide! The location also provides water shoes, wet suits, lifejackets, and helments. No cameras allowed :( Love from Georgia, USA
The name suits itself. Rio Secreto or Secret River is a awesome water activity. My wife, son and I enjoyed the experience. The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable. Definitely a must see!

Breathtaking . Be prepared as it can get dark but just a head torch to guide you through the caves I think it makes the views that extra special. 1000's of years of stalagmites and stalactites will leave you speechless....oh don't be scared by the bats who fly above your heads too hehe...tour guides are very informative in the history of the caves. Go see it for yourselves people, truly a wonder.

Rio Secreto. Amazing underground caves and a precious memory find! This is something I hope is preserved by my environmentalists and is certainly a "must see". It is absolutely amazing what was forming underground And was only discovered in 2006!!! A historic find for sure!!

Hands-Down The Best Thing to do in Playa!. I found this hidden gem while hunting on Pinterest for ideas of things to do in Mexico. My boyfriend and I were staying in Cancun and organised the trip through Viator, so transport to the facility was included. It was a fairly long drive (over an hour) from Cancun, but definitely worth it. It is by far our favourite memory during the time we spent in Mexico. This off-the-beaten-path attraction is unlike anything I've ever experienced. After arriving, you're given a quick safety tutorial and then taken to the locker area to change your clothes. Lockers are provided free of cost. Swimwear is required and wetsuits are provided at no extra cost, as are wet shoes and a hard hat with light. Then you walk down a path and a local Mayan man offers a prayer on your soul - apparently we learned that they believe visiting the underground is essentially going to the underworld. You're given a walking stick to help you with balance and to work your way through the cave as you aren't allowed to touch anything (it will prevent future stalagmite/stalactite growth). The tour through the cave itself was probably about two hours long and included areas where you had to swim through, wading, crouching through tight areas etc so, while I don't think you have to be "fit" to do this tour, you do have to be comfortable with those activities. We saw fruit bats, baby catfish, some kind of unique spider (I forget what it was called). There was also a part where we all turned off our lights and just sat in the dark listening to the dripping of water. It was a very cool experience. Words cannot even justify it. Tip: book the earliest tour as the sediment at the bottom of the cave will be least disturbed then and the water is the clearest for seeing wildlife. Also, be prepared for the water to be cold (mountain rain/water cold), even with the wetsuit! During the tour, a professional photographer took our photos and you can purchase them after. Cameras, phones etc are not allowed on the tour. A traditional Mayan lunch was included in the tour after as well.
Amazing . Amazing please, amazing experience. Romain was the best tour guide. Thank you Romain. Stuff very friendly. High recommend.
This is very cool, don't drink the water!. The respect for the Mayan culture is commendable. Must be in decent physical shape for the bike ride.

Very unique experience. This is one of the MUSTS of playa del Carmen. When we got there we went straight to the registration area to confirm our reservation. After that we were directed to a waiting area where we filled out a release form and were given some instructions. We waited for a few more people to get there as they only take you in small groups of 10 maximum. We ended up being a small group of 7 which was great. Once the groups are made they drive you out about 2.5 miles in a van through a small dirt road. Once we got there we were introduced to our guide and our photographer as you are not allowed to take any cameras. You are assigned a locker to put your stuff away. You have to take a shower to remove any sun block or anything in your body. After that they give you your gear and you walk toward the cave entrance. Before you enter they do some sort of mayan ritual as a welcome and for religious purposes they explain to you that it is just a welcome and that is it. Once inside you are able to appreciate every single detail of the "secret river" or underground river. Our guide was very knowledgeable and explained every detail of what we would see and do. I highly recommend using the cane or stick they provide for you as it is very helpful when walking underground to keep your balance and to feel the ground underneath the water. We were not lucky enough to see any bats but we did see some guano (bat poop). Overall it was a great experience, very unique and different to other things we have done. Upon finishing the tour you are directed to see your pictures. This is the only reason I am giving them 4 stars and not 5 because every tour you do they want to sell you pictures and of course they are way overpriced, they were not the exception. Though we liked some of the pictures and it would've been nice to have that as a nice memory of our tour, we decided not to buy. I think if they would lower the prices on the pictures a lot more people would buy them hence giving them more profit vs just selling some pictures here and there for such a high price. I don't think anyone in our group bought pictures. We were told you are not allowed to take camera as to not get distracted and hurt yourself and because the camera batteries are bad for the water, I personally think that is a lie, but that is just me. I just see it as an excuse to sell you their picture packages. Anyways, after that we were directed to the buffet area. Their food was amazing! I loved the different foods from the region they had available. The best part of it is that it is a buffet so you can eat as much as you can. After that they drove us back to the entrance where we parked our car and were able to go on our way. Summing everything up, you must go to rio secreto!

A must do . We visited Rio Secreto, and were not disappointed. Our guide, Gonzo, was excellent, very knowledgeable and so happy to share his vast knowledge with us. We booked our tour online, through the customer service available in the chat section, which got us an extra discount. From Playa del Carmen we got to Rio Secreto using the Colectivo service, 50 pesos one way for two people. A must do!!! Highly recommend it.

Fantastic! 5 star hidden gem!. Gonzo was the most incredible guide as you can tell he is very passionate about the caves and loves his job. My fiancé and I came all the way from our resort on Isla Mujeres (on our honeymoon to Mexico from USA) and the hour drive was worth the trip. Gorgeous and unlike anything I've ever done, swimming in crystal clear water surrounded by beautiful formations. Gonzo was extremely informative and fun, so many great photos too! You're provided a wet suit, water shoes, helmet, and buffet lunch afterwards. A once in a lifetime experience!However be aware especially if traveling at the end of of the rainy season, the initial van ride from the front entrance to the cave entrance is extremely bumpy. I get motion sickness easily and it was the only downside. Rough ride. Other than that, I highly recommend!

Awesome trip. We visited Rio Secreto on 10/3/16 as an excursion from our Disney cruise. It was fantastic, from the moment we left the ship we had a guide with us the whole way to the destination and then back to the ship. Our guide Valentino was great and it seemed all the guides were passionate and excited to show us all about the underground caves Pictures don't do this place justice it is absolutely amazing and probably a highlight of our trip. It's only been known about for about 10 years so it hasn't been ruined by too much traffic and they seem to be very aware of keeping it that way asking us not to touch the formations as we walk along. Our family of 5 includes three kids from 13-10 and all were able to handle the whole trip.

Day trip. My husband and I did a day trip at Rio Secreto. We bought the excursion on the resort property. We did the 1/2 day trip that was about 4 hours or so. You are not allowed to take pictures inside. They do supply a photographer to take pictures and charge a $$$ for them. He did a good job and its hard not to want to buy the pictures (we did). We were paired in a small group 6 of us total with our guide. We were all so amazed at our guide who spoke 5 languages (And I feel terrible for not remembering his name). 3 of the people in the group only spoke French so our skillful guide did the tour in English and French which was fun to hear. It is simply beautiful inside the cenotes. They do a great job of acclimating you to the water. You go in and then out for a while and then in. At the end of the tour you are in the water that is about 9-10 foot deep. It was so cool to see all the bats and creators that can survive in the dark under ground. After you hike back to the huts you are feed a traditional meal. All the staff were very nice and happy to answer any questions you have.

Spectacular!. Having an opportunity to walk, float and sit in an underground cave in the Mayan Jungle is amazing! Our guide was Santiago. He took such care of everyone in the group. Walking in the water around stalagmites and ledges, floating in chambers looking up into magnificent limestone stalactites was breathtaking! This sydtem was found only maybe 12 years ago! The property is large and well cared for. A treasure. Fall is great time to go as the water level is higher and you might hear the rain dripping through the limestone layers. In the winter you might be chilly when you leave the cave.

Don't Miss Rio Secreto. Rio Secreto is fabulous. At first we were unsure. However, the experience was exceptional. We had a larger group (50) but the staff was able to create groups of 8-10 to make it more individual. Our guide was Lu. She was exceptional. Based on the rest of the group feedback all of the guides were very good. You're negotiating rocks and underground streams so it's a bit more aggressive than sunning on the beach. But the total experience is not to miss. Thumbs up, Lu.

Breathtaking Experience. This tour is a must when visiting Riviera Maya. Such an amazing wonder and unknown world in the cenotes. I am so glad to have a keepsake in the beautiful pictures the photographer Manuel took. My guide Raul was excellent in his explanations and the wonder in discovering the history and cultural significance of this beautiful site.

Holy WOW, just WOW. Great time for all four of us! Memo (Guillermo) was amazing with my mother and father in law who had the time of their lives but couldn't be in too big of a rush. Families, friends from 7 to 70 should NOT MISS Rio Secreto. Photo CD is up to 90.00 USD but we got 40 professional photos in addition to the EXCELLENT ones staged and taken during our journey (yeah, stops can feel forced for photos but wait till you see them, totally worth it)!

Amazing and unique. Remarkable cave. You spend 1 1/2 hours in the cave walking through very cold water and at times you are up to your neck and swimming. Those episodes are fortunately brief but so worth it. The guides are fantastic and make it very special. However, be ware that you are walking on the bed of the river and it's a little treacherous at times because you can't see well and there are a lot of rocks and drop offs to navigate. There are a couple of times they turn all the headlamps off to show how dark it is and if you have a child like mine that's a bit afraid of the dark it can be a bit scary. Oh, and to address the photo issue. No you can't take photos and I wouldn't want to - you really need to focus on where you are going and stepping. Taking photos would be unsafe and it is pitch black in the cave except for the headlamps. I don't think most people's cameras would get enough light from the flash to capture anything worth while. The photos they shoot are fantastic but very expensive. $25 for one, $50 for 3, or $90 for full CD of all pics. Very overpriced for mexico but no different than what we've paid for cds of white water rafting trips in the US. Also, what they do with the money is reinvest it in their conservation efforts which make it for a good cause.

Should be one of the 7 wonders of the world! . Rio Secreto is an underground cavern/river in the Mayan Riviera, about 1.5 hours from Cancun, which is in the most pristine of conditions. The cavern structures and dynamics and water are simply and quite phenomenally beautiful... I'd go as far as to say "beyond words". The location and surrounding jungle is gorgeous and my tour guide Santiago was exceptional. If you visit Rio Secreto it might be a good idea to try and request him as your guide. The underground cavernous river is majestic and also quite cold. You will be provided with all the essentials for your trek thought the cave and this will include a neoprene wetsuit. Young children about 16 years and younger seem to feel the effects of the cold water much more than adults and young adults. The tour lasts approximately 1 hour 30 minutes and though young children do complete this tour frequently, they will be shivering most of the time. My personal recommendation is that you purchase and bring your own neoprene wetsuit shirt at least .5 to 1 millimeter in thickness if you are an adult and a full neoprene wetsuit for your young child at least 1 to 1.5 millimeter thick if any of you are sensitive to the cool water. However if you easily tolerate cool water they will still make it mandatory that you wear their wetsuit, so I still recommend you bring your own wetsuit. If anything, it will make the tour much more comfortable for all of you using your own neoprene. I also highly recommend bringing and using your own water footwear, otherwise it will also be provided for you. Use only non slip footwear that does not come easily off your feet. FYI, during this tour you will be mostly walking through shallow pools and moist cavern floor, but you will swim or wade trough some deeper sections. Meals and drinks will also be provided after completion of the tour. There are also shower, clothes changing and restroom facilities on site. The only thing I did not like about this tour is the fact that you cannot carry or use your own photographic equipment and thus are forced to purchase their own photographer's pictures at an exuberant prize or left with only the mental memories of this tour. The picture package will cost just over $100.00 US dollars for about 50 pictures whether you like all of them or not or choose each individual picture at about $25.00 dollars each. You don't really get to pick your backgrounds, angles or poses. Even so, the trip to Rio Secret is more than worth it! One more thing... For those of you who are hard core, very adventurous and in good physical condition like myself, there is a 5 hour tour of this underground river called the "Privilege Tour". This one is not for the common adventurer, and if you want more information about this amazing and deeply involved tour, contact Rio Secreto directly. Happy adventures!

Explore a new world. . This was incredible. Not just to view it but to experience it by repelling, crawling, swimming, learning and balancing. A must see. Our guide Alfredo was not just an informative leader making sure we were safe and happy but more of a passionate explorer getting to introduce the caves to us through his wondrous eyes. As he said "this isn't work for me" and it showed in his enthusiasm for our group to absorb all the underground river had to offer. It's a long day and I wouldn't have been disappointed skipping the part after lunch and just relaxing in a hammock. Don't be afraid to ask to do that while the tour goes on. But there is still cool stuff to see in that afternoon part of you're not "caved out". Lunch is adequate. Don't expect much. And don't worry about bringing anything more than a bathing suit and change of clothes. They provide everything and have lockers.

Rio Secreto. This was a great adventure. There is a fair amount of walking, hiking, exploring caves on uneven ground etc. Unfortunately, there was someone in our group who was not physically fit enough to keep up with the group. So it is not an ideal excursion for those who have trouble with excess weight, balance or fatigue issues. Also the water is quite cool, definitely use the wet-suit they provide. Our tour guide was awesome, she did a great job!The long, 7 km drive into the location was over very rough roads and not at all enjoyable.

Awesome Underground Tour. We loved the tour! We got to repel down into a cavern, bike through the jungle, and see some of the most beautiful underground rock formations in the world. Our guide Yayo took us on a breathtaking underground tour and swim. This was the last stop on our trip and it sent us home with memories for a lifetime. We highly recommend this tour.

Amazing!!!!! 😍. That was Amazing!!!! This is something you just can't miss... we went there with my mom, 7 aunties and my children... at first I thought I had done a mistake because it was a little scary for my 4 and 5 year old children,,,, and old family members, but no...They LOVE IT we had a great time!!!! Something to remember for ever

Best cruise tour ever. The description on the cruise ship didn't do this place justice. It is absolutely amazing. I would go again and again. Cruise said it was "easy", there is some swimming, I'd call it moderate. Totally worth it!

Great Tour. Great tour, there's about 7-8 underground rivers so you may do a different tour each time. Tour with hotel pick up was $99, they provide a video at check in and a shuttle to the prep area with showers, lockers and restrooms. Water shoes and wet suits with helmets are provided along with walking sticks. The sticks are very handy, when you're in the water, there is uneven footing almost the whole time. The guide will tell you the history, science and fun facts of the river and formations. The water is cold but def worth it, the wetsuits help quite a bit. The river we did, never got the name, did get very small at the end and if you're claustrophobic it may cause some panicking. You end the tour with a short walk back to the lockers, return the equipment, change then review your photos that are taken by an employee from the tour. They do not allow anything on the tour, can't take pictures, bring water or jewelry. The picture packages go 1 pic for $25, 3 for $50, or the whole set of all and 2 printed out for $99. They put the pics on a cd for you so it isn't printed. While the pics are being set up, they feed you a buffet on site which is salads, fruits, rice, cactus, pork, beans with some drinks. The buffet provided was actually very good. Would highly recommend.

Spelunking in a secret river - what could be better?. We did this as an excursion during a work event held in Cancun. It was a top memory for the trip. I was glad we brought our own water shoes but they also have them available there. You suit up in a wetsuit and life jacket, hike a bit thru the jungle and then descend into the underground river. The descent was not hard. From there, you walk, wade and sometimes swim thru the river. I don't think there are many (any?) experiences that will compete with this.After the river, there was a quick but tasty lunch. I saw in the reviews complaints about the price of the photos so I knew to be prepared for sticker shock. But the photos were so good I took the splurge. Glad to have a memory of this special place.
Great Experience. Rio secreto is so cool! The price for the excursion is a little bit expensive but totally worth it! We loved it. A great excursion for the whole family. Highly recommend.

Awesome tour,. Great experience. Food was so-so. We had a great guide, although a little intense. I highly recommend the wetsuit although our guide did not. Sadly in order to take home pictures, you have to pay the 60 USD for their CD. We chose not to. The drive was a little long and bumpy on the road into the place. FAntastic once-in-a-lifetime kind of caving experience, though.

Still Amazed!. We booked this excursion through Carnival and were so pleased with the trip. It's a short boat ride to Playa del Carmen, then a humorous 10-15 bus ride to the river. The guides are VERY gracious and informative. The experience was incredible. Way too much to describe, it's something you have to live for yourself. We had an excellent lunch and a little time to relax. The ride back to town was brief and left us enough time to do a little shopping and have an ice cold beer before the boat ride back to the ship. We are going on another cruise next year and plan to book this excursion again!

Awesome adventure. We have cruised for 25 years and have done many tours, this is one of our favorites!!Jorge was very knowledgeable on the caves and was very friendly... I can't say enough about him and everyone involved at this location.They took exceptional care of us... lunch was very good..I would do this again if I had the chance

FABULOUS. One of the best things ever done! This cenote is really a special one. Tbey really try to keep it preserved and pristine. No sunscreen or bug spray. It is spectacular-a cathedral of stalagmites/stalactites underwater! There are many other cenotes/ tours in Riviera Maya buy please don't miss this one.

Truly Amazing. My wife and I agreed that this was the best part of our vacation. I called ahead and they were able to provide childcare for our 5 month old baby while we were on the cave tour. Great people.

the highlight of our cruise. Amazing excursion! Our guide, Miguel, was very informative and we were lucky enough to have a great group as well. The cave was absolutely breathtaking! We were able to see a coati at the end and interact with it before our buffet, which was also very cool. We enjoyed shots of mayan liquor after our tour together as a group.. a great addition to our journey. The buffet food was delicious and you really do get to eat as much as you want, unlike at other tours. I highly recommend this tour... the only thing I did not like is not being able to take my own pictures.

Outstanding- Do Not Miss This!. My wife and I did Rio Secreto through Viator while staying outside of Playa Del Carmen. This was one of the my most favorites things I have done in my life. The swimming/wading though the underground Rio Secreto just seems out of this world. The natural beauty of the cave is spectacular and that coupled with the adventure of the swimming and wading in the water was a once in a lifetime experience. Leo, knew a lot about the cave and the geology and was very friendly which added to the tour. Rio Secreto has won numerous awards from Tripadvisor and other groups and they are well deserved.Even the hot lunch after the tour was excellent. This is a top notch activity all the way and worth the money. One note though, they do not allow any cameras and their photos are overpriced. $25/one or $75 for the tour.

Nothing like it in the world. Unless you are a pro cave explorer, you will never experience anything like this. They keep the cave system pristine, so it is really like exploring it for the first time. My boys (11 and 8) absolutely loved it. The water is not cold, but make sure you ask for wet suits. It makes the whole trip warm and comfortable.

Breath Taking - picture service needs improving . A must see...Lu our tour guide was very well educated in her field and was a pleasure been shown around by her.It amazes me that such beauty lies beneath our feet.If you are from the US or UK you have to do this as the laws and HSE in our country will never allow this.The experience is completely real and slightly daunting.Only a swimsuit is required. No jewelery, watches or waterproof cameras allowed.Photographs are take at a cost of $25. These are available on a CD at the end of the tour which is not idea as they make a mistake and gave me the wrong CD. I only found this out as I asked them to show me what was on the CD... an improvement to this would be to email the pictures.

Once in a lifetime sight to see . Amazing once in a lifetime experience, Victor our guide was very knowledgeable an friendly. We toured the cave, repelled down into the cave, bicycled thru the jungle & enjoyed lunch while at Rio Secreto. It is a good bit of walking & an all day excursion but once in a lifetime experience.

An excursion like no other. This is an experience like no other. Put on a wetsuit, helmet, water shoes, life jacket and you are off to a short hike to the caves. You will see the underground up close and personal. Floating thru the water and seeing so many different formations was amazing. I am not the most coordinated and found some of the terrain tricky, but absolutely enjoyed myself. We also had a non swimmer in our group and with some help, he did just fine too. Lunch was good and we did see them use a device to check food temperatures in the buffet line so we felt safe eating here. Also, I can't say enough about the customer service from Santiago in the photography department who allowed me to order my pictures after the fact. All around this was an excellent excursion.

Unforgettable adventure!. Fascinating, is the best word to describe Rio Secreto. We went on the Carnival Splendor and booked the Amazing Secret River excursion, it was worth every penny (ferry from Cozumel to Playa del Carmen, bus ride upon arrival from ferry to the location and yummy lunch was all included) Upon arrival you must put all your belongings in a locker, keys and locks are provided at no additional cost, you must shower, put on your gear, wetsuits, watershoes, life vest and helmet with light (all included) - Ones you're ready a Mayan ritual takes place right before entering the cave. Our guide was Gonzo, his passion is contagious, he's friendly, extremely knowledgeable, he made the tour and our time at Rio Secreto great, he even walked us back to the bus, super attentive. I was speechless, Rio Secreto exceeded my expectations, the pictures are gorgeous but this is definitely a must see for yourself adventure.

Neat and easy splunking. Pros: - Super guide (our guide was very knowledgeable, fun and funny)- Up close views of the underground world (beasts, bugs and all)- All the gear you need is supplied (helmet with light, wetsuit and life jacket)Cons:- Even with no reason not to, you cannot take any cameras (rather they take pictures and offer exorbatent rates for them. 12 for $90USD or 1 for $25USD)

Yolo. You only live once. Rio Secreto is an underground cave/river. According to our guide, it was discovered by a Mayan native 10 years ago while chasing an iguana. This "experience" is about going through a cave system 40-50 feet underground with a fresh water river in it, surrounded by stalactites/stalagmites with an experienced guide accompanying your group of up to 10 people.If you're not afraid of dark, enclosed, and sometimes tight spaces, plus wading, swimming, or floating on water, traversing rocks and clear pools, then this is an other-worldly experience unlike anything you can ever imagine. This is a once in a lifetime adventure, exploring the unknown, educational, appreciating nature, and having fun. If you're the adventurous type, then this is for you. Just please make sure you listen to your guide and you will have a safe and memorable experience.
Great experience!. Explore the cave system in an educational and safe way. Fun day out and suitable for all ages. Highly recommended!

Must see in person!. I read lots of reviews and looked at quite a few photos trying to determine if this was something that would be fun for our group. Honestly at first I thought the photos looked cool but wasn't sure that it was mind blowing enough to spend most of a day on- was I wrong! This place is unbelievable in person!! The grounds alone are so beautiful with so many trees and pretty landscaping. It did feel a little gross to put on used water shoes so bring your own or buy a pair there. We said a little prayer in the woods to ask for permission from the mayans to enter their underworld which felt weird but gave an authentic vibe to what we were about to encounter. When we entered the underground river it was a little scary but so beautiful you forgot about the fact that you were inside of something that could probably collapse at any time. The humidity is high as you get further into the cave which helps offset the chilly water. You do a good combo of hiking throughout and going in and out of the water so if you aren't good with a bumpy road utilize the stick they offer you at the beginning. Overall I was so wrong about this possibly being boring/not worth a day off of the beach but it was an indescribable experience that is well worth it! The photographer took amazing photos of everyone of us so be prepared to want to buy them afterwards. Luckily we were a group of 6 so splitting the cost for the entire CD full of photos was only $15 each. They provide a buffet of food after the tour which wasn't spectacular but you'll likely want to eat after all that adventuring through the woods and cave. After eating you get to relax in their hammocks and shop at the gift shop. I would definitely recommend this tour for a unique experience that you won't likely have many times in your life! Ps: email ahead of time to book and they'll offer you promotional pricing (we paid $67 a person!!) and our resort set us up with a van for $20 per person round trip (taxi would've been 10 per person round trip but we had 6 of us so chose the van)

Awesome Experience. If it weren't for the price of photos, I'd have given it 5 stars. I swam with the whale sharks and got all the pictures from that for $35. Here the pictures were $90 and just one was $25. They don't let you bring go pros or anything in so if you want to remember it with pictures, then you better bring some money.That said... it's super cool in there and Roberto, our tour guide, was so fun and knowledgable.

Caves trip. Great day out, Hugo our guide was amazing. My mum couldn't manage walking in the caves so she floated on her back and Hugo pulled her round. Very, very informative and very well organised.

Fabulous. what a fantastic day. My guide was silas he was very informative and cheerful. He took you though the cave where u get to swimm deep into caves its was so beautiful and refreshing as was so hot outside. I have never been so deep inside a cave I was in awe
Great adventure!. The place is great, the tour is really cool and Diana Sánchez our guide was excellent! Highly recommended!

Wow. Wow is all I can say for this excursion. We wanted to try this excursion because of the reviews it has received and I can say it's definitely a 5 star. After the tour, they fed us a nice Mexican lunch which was delicious. I would highly recommend this to anyone

Spectacular!!. Our guide was Nunes. His passion for the preservation of this amazing place and its heritage was evident in our tour. We were on the Happy trail. It is a physical trek, but not difficult. (I am 51 and over weight and managed it easily.) Nunes took time to make sure everyone was safe and comfortable. The pictures from inside the caves were breathtaking! We will definitely do another trail on our next trip to Mexico!

Vacation. First time doing this activity really enjoyed it. They provide walking sticks if u want, helps to feel for any change in your path since floor is not even .Our guide Silas was awesome very friendly took good care of us the only thing i would recommend is having a little hand held flashlight as well to see where you r walking a little better. The headlamp helps to see ahead but not directly where u r walking. Still enjoyed it

Worth every Penny!. It is a great trip rain or shine!we booked over the phone and got 15% off from their website They give you wetsuits and headlamps and a guide to walk in the caves. Are guide was wonderful it is so relaxing and very interesting as well!It is a must see great for kids as well you do have to walk but not to hard in the caves so wonderful!Just go you will love it!

Amazing!!!!. Our hotel recommended this and another cenote but this onemail was closer to us and we didnt want to waste much vacation time driving so we chose this tour, arranged by our hotel and wow was it an amazing experience. Mexicour has so much to offer that people dont even think about, the photos dont do it justice because people look a bit bored, but in reality its a beautiful experience, especially if you're going with a loved one, its a nice day adventure.

Beautiful caves and cool river!. We booked this excursion off of the ship, it was cheaper than hiring a taxi and paying the entry fee. It is a bit of a drive, 20+ minutes to get to the location. The wet suits are a little clammy when you first put them on, but the water is a nice temperature and you quickly adjust to it. Our day was rainy, so it was a perfect excursion to be underground for. Very cool tour, walking, wading and swimming down the river. The lunch was a good buffet and we were back with plenty of time to shop and peruse down 5th avenue.

Unclear restrictions . In the brochure there was no mention of the potential for serious injury and cuts. My wife is on blood thinners and it was not worth risking. Unfortunately we were not told any of this until after we had ridden the ferry to playa del Carmen. We did not take the tour and caught their bus back to the beach meeting area. Which would not have been bad if they hadn't refused to give us our ferry passes. We wound up waiting in the sun for 5 hours for the tour to return. They did refund our money. I recommend that they revise their brochure to include potential cuts and bleeding.

Tour Guide. We had a very good time visiting the cave. It was very interesting to see a whole different world that goes on beneath the jungle floor we walk on. What made the tour even better was our tour guide Silas. A very fun, energetic, and just overall great guy. I highly recommend him. He had a very good knowledge of the caves, and explained it all to us.

Take me back!!!! Gonzo is a rock star . This is one of the best things I ever did in my life who ever writes a bad review about this excursion I do not know if you want to the same place our guide Gonzo was amazing you can tell he's very passionate about his job and the caves he didn't rush us he let us take every sec in. I am kicking myself in the butt for not buying the pictures even the pictures don't do justice.. This is a must to do ..I would book a another. Cruise just to do this again it was that good

Awesome!. Definite must do adventure! Had an amazing guide Paola. Took very good care of our group. I can see why it's #4 on the advisor to do list here in cancun. Wanted to go thru again when we finished. Bring a change of clothes-recommended. They provide wet suit,water socks and life vest. Lunch was included as well as transportation to and from resort. Well air conditioned vans provided a comfortable ride. Can't bring camera or cell phones inside. Lockers provided to keep your stuff safe as well. Two thumbs up for the company and staff. Would do again without any hesitation. Worth every penny. Photo packages available after the tour. Got the disk and extra goodies-$119. They have less expensive packages as well and even got a new pair of water socks for ten bucks! They were 50 at our resort. A++ to the staff and a adventure we won't forget!

Amazing Nature. Instead of booking this trip through a company we decided to rent a car for the day and drive ourselves which gives us more flexibility to explore the areas around Playa deal Carmen afterwards. We got there around 9.30 and got our tickets. This may represent a problem in high season but we had no problem getting in. You have to fill out a waiver and then they take you to the cave which is a couple of miles from the entrance. The road there is pretty bad. Lots of potholes etc. When you get there your guide will meet you and give you a locker key. Once you get changed in your bathing suit you take a nice cold shower. It will get you ready for the water in the cave. You are not allowed to wear jewelry or anything else for that matter other than your bathing suit. Also you can't take cameras. Waterproof or otherwise.Next you get your wet suit and water shoes. We had our own shoes. When everyone is ready you take a walk to the entrance of the cave. Just before you get there a Mayan man will give you a blessing. The cave is amazing. Some parts are very shallow other parts you swim. Our guide was very knowledgeable and interesting to listen to. The whole cave experience takes about 1.5 hours. A photographer keeps following you and takes pictures at varies stops or when you walk. I found that part a little much. But the cave is definitely worth it. At the end you get changed and go for lunch. But before you go for lunch the take you to the photo area. First they gave us a shot to drink. You can buy a bottle there. It was actually tasty. Then they show you the pictures. The quality of our pictures weren't that great. So we didn't buy any..Then they tell you the prices for different packages. A single picture will cost you $25. Then you can get a disk with pictures of the cave and about 10 pictures of yourself for $89 and the one with the the bottle of Mayan tequila was $109 I think. Lunch is buffet style which was pretty simple. Nothing special. Water and a couple of juices were included. Other drinks were for sale. After that you are done and they take you back to the top. The cave is 5 stars for sure!

Beautiful underground adventure!. We absolutely loved our 2 hour trip through the underground caves and river at Rio Secreto. The stalagmites and stalactites are stunning and our guide did a fantastic job of guiding us through this incredible once in a lifetime experience. Would definitely go back and do it again. May not be the best tour for someone who has hip or knee problems or lower back issues as there are a lot of tricky spots to navigate inside the caves.
Enjoy!. We just love touring this awesome place. It's quite an adventure through Mexico's water system and caves. The food afterwards is great too!
Awesome Experience. This was an amazing experience. Our tour guide was awesome. My mother doesn't know how to swim and he made sure he took extra good care of her the entire tour.

Amazing trip!! Worth every penny :). This trip is one that I would do again, so beautiful and peaceful. Our guide Miguel was AMAZING. If you enjoy nature, caves and new things this is the adventure to go on. Food after was also very good. Overall the trip was one I will always remember.

Wow! What a cool experience!. My husband and I did Rio Secreto as our token "pricey" trip on our Riveria holiday. I kept the brochure and secretly look at the pictures before bed. It was one of my favourite things I have ever done on holiday! The entire experience is authentic feeling. The attraction is handsomely set up and is clean and well maintained. The equipment is kept in good condition and the operators care deeply about preserving this wonderful treasure. The guides are very knowledgeable and the group sizes are small enough to get a great experience. Well worth the money. The food is great, too!

breathtaking. This was a awesome excursion. The water was very chilly but appreciated after the hot humid weather. Lucielle led us thru the caves and was very knowledgeable. Lucielle showed us an explained all the sites in great detail. We were very impressed with the views and the information experienced on this tour. I highly suggest you experience these natural formations. A highlight at the end was the authentic Mexican cuisine which was so deliscious!

Absolutely Amazing Excursion. You just have to experience it for yourself. This was my favorite part out of the entire cruise on the Carnival Breeze. We had the best guide, the funny and informative, Pablo. Along with the very sexy and charming Addy as a helper. Take their advice and grab the walking stick. I would do this again and again in a heartbeat. As soon as you touch the water, you think it's cold but no- it's completely refreshing. Have you ever been out in the sun all day and then had a drink of some water that freshened you right up? Imagine soaking in it, because that's what you're going to experience on this trip.

A real adventure. Surprise! Not a cheap, disappointing, touristy theme park experience. You are walking, floating and swimming in these beautiful cenotes. A beautiful, mesmerizing and authentic eco-experience. Watch out not to get gouged when you hear the price for your CD of photos when you're leaving; $$$, Negotiate the price. Stay for the included meal on the way out. Surprisingly delicious.

Overpriced for what you get.. As of September 2016 the price for general admission is 79$ USD. Seemed a bit high but since they added the "gastronomical experience" aka terrible Mexican/Italian that it would be close to worth it. The cave itself was pretty awesome. It is darker than the pictures make it seem as you only have your little cave lamps. You may want to bring another waterproof flashlight if you have one. This tour is not for people who are extremely out of shape or have a hard time walking for far distances. If you have trouble with hiking, you will definitely have trouble with this tour. I saw a few reviews of people complaining about the terrain, but seriously, IT'S A CAVE! (not an amusement park) YOU CANNOT BRING ANY CAMERAS! That being said, they do take professional photos and offer you about 8 pictures at the end for the low low price of 89$ USD...Are you kidding me!? So for the fun experience we have no pictures to prove we were in the cave, which sucks. The food was as cheap as it can be and they were so stingy they couldn't include cheese. Also the shuttle drivers want tips too...so it can be a very expensive place to go, especially with a family. Do your research and I am sure you can find something far cheaper than this as the Yucatan is FULL of caves. As a matter of fact there's a fancy restaurant in Playa Del Carmen that is inside of a cave. We paid less for four people eating, two drinks, and a bottle of wine than we did for four people on the cave tour...and you can take pictures! Take your family out for supper there, at ALUX in Playa.

"An AWESOME Experience". This place is AWESOME!!!!! Carlos the instructor was very knowledgeable about the reserve, always had safety in mind, and was there to guide me when I was scared. I learned soooo much from him. The caves are unlike any experience that I have ever had.

Highlight of our trip. I was looking forward to this so much before we came and it did not disappoint. Our guide was Yayo who was so knowledgeable and you could tell he was passionate about what he did and protecting the cave and its ecosystem. I thought I would be afraid since not being able to see in the water and spiders are a fear of mine. There was nothing here to be afraid of. The guide said their are a few types of fish, weep spiders and bats. We saw bats and one non intimidating looking spider. The food was good! Nothing fancy but good. The only pain was getting back from the jungle to the entrance was a bit of a wait for a van to pick us up.

Mind-Blowing Bucket List Excursion! Must Do!. After watching so many BBC documentaries about cave exploration, I've always wanted to experience that kind of excursion myself. Rio Secreto did not disappoint in the slightest! The staff was amazing, funny and kept us calm during the creepy moments. The cave itself was way more than I expected, right out of the documentaries. Though it wouldn't be something I would bring young kids to (under 10) or older frail folk to. At times we were navigating in some tricky areas (rappelling too), but it really got your adrenaline pumping. My teens loved it and would go back in a heart beat! Highly recommended if you're in decent shape!!Note : No pictures can be taken in the Small & Big Wet Cave for obvious safety reasons, but you can take pictures in the Medium Dry Cave.

Great trip for whole family. We enjoyed our underground river adventure with a group of 8, ranging from 6-80 years old. Although our seniors are healthy, they are not confident with walking on uneven terrain, or steep grades, or swimming. We had Miguel as our river guide, and he did a great job helping our parents navigate the hike down to the cave, as well as within the cave waters and floating along. My parents had a great time, overcoming any anxieties they had, and we're glad they enjoyed an experience like nowhere else.We were given wetsuits and water shoes to borrow, as well as life jackets and helmets with head lamps. The water was cold at first, but we easily acclimated with the wetsuits and the activity. Without the wetsuit, it would be quite cold, so I strongly recommend taking the wetsuit. Lunch afterwards was also good, and despite being late in the day, we were not hurried at all.This was definitely one of the highlights of our trip, and a favorite of everyone from young to old!

Xel Ha Versus Xcaret versus Rio Secreto. Xel Ha Versus Xcaret versus Rio SecretoThese are all expensive parks and for a family on a budget visiting all three may be a stretch. So I thought ti would be helpful to give a quick comparison of the three.Xel Ha is all about the water and came in third on our list. It was enjoyable but certainly not as enjoyable as the other two. The snorkeling there is OK but not great. The river swim is thru the mangroves and we found it a little dull. There are fish feeding spots but get there early as the fish food will run out during the day and is not replenished. The SNUBA was good but was at additional cost. Also at additional cost is the sting ray feeding however if you are happy to just snorkel with the rays (i.e. not touch of feed them) then you can swim up to the edge of the feeding area and hang out. The rays will swim past you on their way into the feeding area. A good day but perhaps not worth the high price, especially for those who have snorkeled elsewhere. Xcaret provides the most variety and came in second. There are small shows thru the day and a major show at night. There is an excellent aviary and variety of other animals on display. The river float there is mostly underground and a lot of fun. You will fill a day here no problem.Rio Secreto is a one trick pony but it’s a heck of a trick. It’s really only a river swim/hike but unlike Xcaret the caver river system here is all natural and spectacular. It was our favorite by far. We had already swum in other cenotes however Rio Secreto was in a class of its own in terms of beauty. It also happens to be the cheapest of the three parks reviewed here. The only downside was that the lunch was average at best (as opposed to the other two who had substantial buffets). Unlike the others, Rio Secreto is only a few hours of entertainment (as opposed to a full days the Xel Ha and a full day and night for Xcaret). So if both time and money are tight, we’d say Rio Secreto. If you can afford the additional cost, do Xcaret as well. If money and time are no object, then you can certainly add in Xel Ha.

Chichen Itza Tour What A Day!. During our trip to Playa Del Maya, we went on a day tour to Chichen Itza. Little 15 passenger van picked us up from the resort and at another resort we transfered to a huge bus. Very comfortable. The ruins were about 2 hours away. Our guide was Beto, very nice, funny. Doing all the speaking in Spanish and English. Gave us a lot of good information on the land and the Mayan's. Finally got there and unloaded. Very hot day 90+ and humid! Pretty crowded but manageable. Once through a restroom break and the entrance gate we walked down to the heart of the site. Very open area, very interesting. Beto, our guide, walked us around to all the major things to see, explaining as he went. They had broken up the group to English only and Spanish only. The time there was a good balance of Beto speaking and time to walk where we wanted and take pictures. After this the group left and went a short distance from the ruins to a local restaurant for a buffet lunch. Good variety of food but quality was fair. Next to the restaurant was a fairly large store, with a variety of goods where we wandered through before leaving. Interesting to see pricing marked in Mexican pesos! Conversion rate was 18 pesos to 1 US dollar. After this we were taken to IK KIL cenote (say-no-tay) which is a limestone cave where the ceiling has fallen in. This one was open to swimming which my wife and i did. It was very crowded from locals and other tour groups. Water was about 57 degrees! We stayed a short time and got out changed clothes and were back on the bus from the 2 1/2 hour drive back. We did go through a larger town to see a very beautiful old church and square. We were near the last people to be dropped off. The tour guides and driver were excellent, friendly and helpful. If you are heading down to the Cancun area book a tour with Rio Secreto!!

Awesome tour. Excellent tour and very informative about how these caverns are/were made. My wife and myself wanted to see something different while on our cruise and this is definitely a must, our tour guide Gonzo was awesome and very patient with my wife and helped guide her thru the caverns.

Excellent tour. Fascinating and fun.. We chose to go to Rio Secreto during a rainy day on our recent holiday to Playa Del Carmen and were very glad we did. The tour was great fun and our guide - Andres - was excellent.On arrival we were split into groups and driven down to the entrance to collect our equipment. Wetsuits (optional), water shoes, lockers, lifejackets and walking sticks (optional) are all provided as part of the entry fee. You are not allowed to take your own camera down with you but this makes sense as you do have to do some swimming and walk through some tight spots. A cameraman follows you around during the tour but this was not obtrusive and there is no hard sell to buy them. As others have said they are expensive but you can buy individual shots for $25 each. A buffet lunch is provided at the end of the tour - this isn't extensive but it's nice to grab a quick bite to eat and drink before heading back to your hotel.We arrived at around 12 midday and were back at our hotel at around 4, so it's a great trip if you don't want to be out for the full day. Everything is very well organised and I would thoroughly recommend visiting here - You do need to do some swimming and walk through some tricky, rocky areas in enclosed spaces to bear this in mind before booking!

Absolutely Amazing. My tour guide Lucila was absolutely AMAZING!!! She is so knowledgeable and funny. She took time to answer a lot of questions. Her answers were not scripted and were definitely from the heart. The trip was worth every penny especially for those who love nature. The history of this amazing river is phenomenal. If you decide to take this trip, make sure you ask for Lu (Lucila). She will give you the best experience. (We asked others about their trip and they didn't get as much info from their guide.)
Expensive but great!. a lot of money for this half day trip but is very interesting and cool. Not something you can do in all parts of the world, so a must try!

Playa del Carmen 2016. A MUST do while in Playa! I was excited to do this prior to our trip but, as it got closer I started to feel closturphobic and anxious! Closturphobic or not we signed up. We arrived to Rio Secreto and met our guide Silas (Brazilian CPA gone tour guide) he made us (especially me) feel very safe and relaxed. He was amazing! He has so much passion for Mother Earth! He was very knowledgeable, caring, respectful, very approachable, patient, such a gentleman the whole tour ( he waited/ assisted every member as we passed through rocky , tight and dark areas. He had amazing data regarding these incredible hidden waters. He's a gem! The tour was amazing the meal was very nice. Silas went out of his way to introduce me to one of the cooks in order to get the recipe for "cochinita pibil" If given the opportunity to retake this tour we definitely would! I hope you all consider it if out in Playa! If you choose to do it make sure you take Silas advice and use the walking stick they offer, I would also suggest if you have water shoes take them with you. They do provide But they can be a little a worn out take your repellent to apply after the tour. They provide but for some reason both dispensers I tried didn't work. Don't even bother taking your cameras they don't allow themIn with you while on the tour they have their own photographer. Be prepared to pay $25 per picture. You can always opt not to buy the pictures...you will want at least one after you see the pictures. Our photographer was Jaime he was able to capture some very nice pictures! This tour is worth every dime ask for Silas if you can.

Wonderful experience. The underground "Secret River" is extraordinary. The crystals that grow are amazing, but so is your trek through the water and caves. Tour guides are very knowledgeable and nice. The food served is fantastic too!

Outstanding Adventure!. This was a great experience and worth the time and money! We had an excellent guide with Lara who was so knowledgeable, entertaining, and had a great sense of humor as well as speaking three languages during the tour!

Great way to spend a day out of the sun!. This was a great experience. The Mayan history made it all the better. Very good guides. It was more than just a cave tour, it was almost spiritual. Hard to explain but very much worth it. We did not do the extended tour, just the basic tour and I'm glad about that. As great as it was, we were ready to go by the time it was over (about 3 hours).

AMAZING activyty. Had some much fun with friends at Rio Secreto. Great activity to do with children too. Equipment provided is perfect. Security surrounding the activity is also very good. Lunch served after the activity is delicious. I recommend.

Never imagine this wonder. We visited Rio Secreto during our stay in Mexico last week. We chose the basic package as we were crunched in time. The entire trip was incredible from start to finish. We were a party of 3 adults, my husband, our friend and me. A Rio Secreto’s driver picked us up at the Moon Palace Resort Sunrise promptly at 7:45am. Our ride to the first stop (where we checked in) was about 45-50 min. After a short briefing they divided the guests in groups of 10 and we were lucky we got in a small Spanish speaking group. Our second stop was at the actual place, where we met our wonderful guide Jorge. He was amazing! He took time and took great care of all of us.He made everyone feel so comfortable and safe during the whole trip. Jorge was very knowledgeable about the caves and the formations and he was also very funny (saying: I’d like you to see my ‘office’). He was able to answer all our questions.The river that runs through the cave was cold, but very refreshing because of the heat outside. The formations are second to none. I loved that there were not any lights throughout the cave. It is a relatively new place open to the public so I felt like an explorer.
