The only light you have is the one on your helmet.At one time Jorge asked us to step aside in a shallow part of the river and had everyone turn their lights off and stay quiet. You could only hear a few drops falling into the cave…Incredible! The basic tour cost about $109 USD, but it is very worth it!! A professional photographer follows your group and takes awesome shots. They do provide a wetsuit (optional), a life jacket, a helmet with a light and, water shoes.Seeing those caves was something out of this world and I highly recommend this to everyone to experience. We all had an amazing time.

The ride. Don't be fooled once you leave the port or your hotel. You will be fooled by roads similar to ones where you come from. But once you turn onto the back road to this awesome adventure you will quickly learn... You should have sat in the front of the bus. The ride is 15-20 minutes of backwoods roads. But the final destination is the best. Can be very slippery and uneven walking are a given. If you are not good at balance then forget this one. But if you are it is a must. Everyone was the best and very polite

Plus package. We visited Rio Secreto during our stay in Mexico. We chose the plus package. The entire trip was incredible from start to finish. I was alone with my 2 daughters 7 and 8. We had Miguel as our tour guide. He was amazing! We couldn't be happier. Me and my 2 daughters were the only English speaking during our tour and we were with 2 other families that spoke Spanish. Miguel made sure to translate everything for us. He took time and took a great care of all of us. His English is excellent! Even at some point my daughter got a bit cold and he helped her out and carried her at the end of the trip in the water. I am sure it is not in his job description, but it was so nice of him to help. He also helped us to arrange the transportation back to our hotel as we took a cab one way. It was literally 15 min ride from our hotel Paradisus at playa del carmen. He made everyone feel so comfortable and safe during the whole trip that my daughters want to come back again and they are very, very picky and don't like everything but they absolutely loved him and loved this adventure. Miguel was very knowledgeable about the caves and the formations and he was also very funny. He was able to answer all our questions and he even translated the questions back and forth. We all had an amazing time. We did cycling and they had bikes the size that fit my both children and Miguel made sure that everyone was OK. Everything was so well organized. We did get hungry at the end, but the food was pretty good. The rappelling was so much fun. It was the first time my daughters did it and everything was explained very well and they felt very safe. We were with very nice group and everyone was so respectful, curtous and friendly that we couldn't be more lucky. It was a great adventure and great educational experience. The best place I would recommend during stay in Mexico. And if you could ask for Miguel, you should. And yes as many people say their pics are expensive, but seriously if you go to other adventures in Mexico $89 seems actually pretty cheap for all the amazing pics and for $20 more you get 3 souvenirs . I don't think I could get 3 souvenir the shirts for $20. Maybe $20 each from my experience. For example you will play nearly $200 for swimming with the dolphins photo package depending on how many people you are. It is not very different from other places like Disney, and it is such an unforgettable experience that it is well worth the price. I highly recommend this place to visit for everyone with children. We want to thank Miguel very much for being so helpful and so knowledgeable. Rio secreto you are lucky to have him!

Very exciting tour. The transportation provided by this tour company was awful. We had various pick ups which took close to an hour to reach a place that was ten minutes away. Also, after the tour we waited about an hour because they wanted to put people in vans going to the same place. Problem is that not everyone arrived at the same time and you are stuck waiting for latecomers. Total waste of time. Seeing the caves or cenotes was something out of a movie and highly recommend this to everyone to experience, but arrange better transportation to save you hours of waiting. Could be on the beach instead. Our guide, Jorge, was very knowledgeable and made the experience very beautiful.

The best tour we did in Mexico. We did the Plus tour and it was by far the best trip we did on this holiday. The transfer from the Iberostar Quetzal was only about 20 minutes. However, once we arrived at Rio Secreto there was a further drive of about 15 minutes to reach the plus tour (but as all this was in airconditioned minibus it was no hassle.The tour its self was outstanding. We had a short walk on a well defined path in the jungle and were given information about the mayan culture.The underground tour was epic, however, I will not tell you about it as I would not like to spoil the tour by letting you know the fantastic things you will see.Go there or miss out!

Best cave tour I've ever done!. We were visiting for my best friends birthday. Miguel was our tour guide, and by far the best guide I've ever had. I've gone on many cave tours in the states, but none compare to this one. Miguel made the tour fun! He has a great sense of humor and is very knowledgeable. The river that runs through the cave was very cold, even in the middle of august! The formations are second to none. I like that there aren't lights throughout the cave. It is a relatively new discovery so you really feel like an explorer. The only light you have is the one on your helmet.At one time we were floating in a deep part of the river deep in the cave. Miguel had everyone turn their lights off and stay quiet while we floated. It was a sort of deprivation tank-like experience. Amazing. The tour cost about $98 USD through our resort, but it is very worth it!! They run you in small groups of about 10 people. A professional photographer follows your group and gets some awesome shots. We bought the picture package that came with a total of about 90 pictures and 3 souvenirs for about $119 USD. You wear a wetsuit (optional), a life jacket, a helmet with a light, and they provide water shoes. The lunch afterward was pretty good. Tour took a few hours total.If you do any tours while in Cancun or Playa Del Carmen, absolutely consider this one.

Untouched and extremely interesting!. My husband and 10 year son said this was the highlight of our time in Mexico. They combined it with a trip to the ruins in the morning, so they enjoyed the lite lunch that was provided.
Birthday at Rio Secreto. wonderful half day in the semi cenotes. About 3 km walking and swimming 30 meter below surface. It's an experience of how the eco system of the earth.

Beautiful place. Wanted a trip that wasn't too far from where we were staying in Playa del Carmen so chose Rio Secreto which was only 30 minutes awayPicked up from our hotel by their own staff and mini bus which was air conditioned and comfortable. One couple had already been picked up, four of us came from our hotel and then just two more from another hotel, so no time was wasted on going around a lot of hotels picking up.Arrived at the outdoor reception area where the friendly staff told us what we'd be doing. We were then taken in mini buses again to the caves which was actually 20 minutes on a very bumpy track into the jungle (this was the only part of the trip I didn't really enjoy but was obviously unavoidable)Once there we were allocated a guide in groups of about 14, given wetsuits, water shoes and helmets and taken down a short path to the caves entrance. The guide was very informative and helpful, pointing out uneven flooring and assisting where necessary. Walking sticks were offered and I was glad I took one as it helped with feeling ahead in the water to see where the drops or rocks wereWe were inside the caves for about an hour an three quarters but it flew by as it was so enjoyableAfterwards we were given towels and got changed into dry clothes and then had a hot and cold buffet lunch which was pleasantA photographer accompanied us the whole time and at the end you are given the chance to view and buy either all or some of your photos (on a CD)Transfer back to hotel was just as quick as on the wayTwo trips are offered a day 7.30am and 11.30am. We took 11.30am which was fine cos its cool in the caves so doesn't matter how hot the sun is. Got back to our hotel at approx 5pmOverall a very enjoyable day which I'd highly recommend

Best day out in the Caves. I hesitated to do this excursion but I am so glad we went. The organisation of the excursion is great. The only thing that was annoying was the photographer that follows you in the cave as you are not allowed cameras. It was like having a paparazzi. I would recommend you wear a wetsuit regardless of the weather outside it really cool in the caves and you are in the water for over 1 hour. If you are claustrophobic I would not recommend this tour but otherwise it is unique. The caves are beautiful, the water very clear and more importantly the guide is very knowledgeable

Our BEST excursion!!!!!!!. Our tour was off the cruise ship, but however you get there- just GO! You won't regret it! Stunning cave (I've been in many) and they have the fun tour guides, and despite the large crowd there, we really felt our group was almost alone in the large caverns. I wanted to bring my camera, but they don't allow it. Most likely cause you will get it wet. They DO have a professional photographer assigned to each group and you get fantastic pics for $89.00. I'm tight with money and I thought they were well worth it so plan on that cost.

A very interesting; have to do at least once in your lifetime experience. My wife and I loved this day trip. The river is a bit off the beaten track but once you get to the place the facilities are clean and modern. Getting to and through the caves require good balance so if you do not have good balance you should skip. The caves are a wonderful example of nature at its best. Very calming, very peaceful, very beautiful and very fun. You must try this if you have the time and are in the area. They run rain or shine so if you are having bad weather then please do this activity.
ABSOLUTELY BEAUTIFUL!. This is the place to go! Amazing! I didn't want to leave and was upset when the tour was over...would love to go again.
Amazing place!. Went in June with my family (4 adults and 2 children (9 & 6) and we had an amazing time. Just a beautiful place and beautiful natural beauty!

Once in a lifetime experience!. My husband and I did the Rio Secreto Privilege tour on our honeymoon. It was such a special experience that we will treasure for a lifetime! Raul was a great guide. The private lunch afterwards was a great bonus. A must for your trip to Playa del Carmen!

Best kept secret in cancun for nature lovers . People will tell you about Xceret and the beaches but nobody tells you about this cave that was recently found where you can swim, see four different kinds of bats, a spider featured on national geographic, catfish, and tree roots from the jungle above for $79-$125. The price difference is based on one of three tours. I wish I knew of the longer tours prior to booking the basic tour but there is always a next time.

Karina is the best guide I have ever had. Karina thank you so much for taking the time to explain everything about the cave. You gave a great insightful tour made me aware about the cavern and why it is so delicate and needs to be seen but at the same time protected. I absolutely love the tour your gave us, once again thank you and I promise next I go in will ask for you and make sure I have more money to tip you what you deserve.

Best Experience Ever. This experience is awesome. You learn so much and you have so much fun. Our tour guide name was Alfredo. He explained so much to us about the caves and the Mynas. I can't even explain how awesome and amazing this experience was. I recommend this trip for your whole entire family. I would definitely do this experience again in the future

Incredible experience . It was beautiful we went the Algeria way. For those who don't know how to swim. It does get deep to about 20 feet but you have a life jacket and the guide will help you through. It only for a really short period of time. You won't feel claustrophobic. I do recommend that if you wear glasses and have contacts too, wear contacts. Your glasses will fog lol.

Spectacular Experience . We booked the 'plus' tour which involved exploring 3 underground caves, a 'dry' cave and 2 'wet' caves, one which required some wading. Our tour guide was Lucita who was excellent. We were placed with a Spanish speaking group. Lucita was meticulous about ensuring we were provided with detailed information in English about what we were seeing. Each cave/cenote we were taken to was progressively more spectacular than the previous one. The geological formations were stunning. Our time underground was a welcome relief from the heat and humidity. We had to rapelle down into one of the caves which was a new experience for my wife and I, all well instructed and perfectly safe. What impressed me about this tour was the genuine ecological focus on preserving this unique treasure and properly educating tourists and the local visitors about it. They have an association with National Geographic Society and are truly dedicated to preserving this site. This is not a 'tourist trap'. I felt good about supporting this venture and found the tour to be a unique educational experience. I wish we had our children with us to see this amazing place. I consider it a 'must see' when visiting the Mayan Riviera. Thanks again to Lucita for a spectacular experience. It was the highlight of our vacation.

Cave exploration for the entire family. We chose this activity because rain was expected that day. No matter what the temperature is like outside, in the Cenotes its always a nice and cool so it is a good way to get out of the sun for a little while.Service and the guide was great. I forgot her name but she was a french speaking guide from Montreal. Suggestion: Bring your own water shoes. While they supply everything you need including a towel, for the sake of hygiene youo should bring your own water shoes.

U gotta see this place!. Discovered just 10 years ago by the landowner chasing an iguana, this underground "cenote" or cave is 23 miles of crystal clear rivers full of geological formations that took millions of years to form. The tour guides are wonderfully smart and the experience is worth every penny.
super atraction. thi is something you have to see and do take the tour you will be facinated with this espectacular underground river

EPIC!! If you are undecided this is the cenote to visit!!. This was a tour set up by our cruise ship, but a place we had been told to visit prior to the cruise. The transfers etc went smoothly and we were met at the dock by our guide Veronica. We were quickly split into groups and we had a nice van with eleven in our group, six in our party. The distance was relatively close and a short Mayan Massage dirt section before arriving at the cenote. The briefing was quick and thourough and lockers, dressing areas etc. clean and uncrowded. No jewelry cameras or things you could drop or lose allowed. We were fit with helmets and lights, wetsuits and walking sticks and water shoes for those who wanted them. I have river shoes that are a bit sturdier so I used my own. Flip flops wont work at all and I doubt they would let you use them I chose not to use one and was ok but most people including my wife,4 knee surgeries, utilized them and they were very handy. You do not need sunscreen in the xenote so try not to use any and preserve the water quality. The hike to the mouth of the xenote is fairly short through lush jungle. No mosquitos today but I strongly recommend being prepared. Once we reached the xenote it was underground and in water the rest of the way. Crawling, climbing, ducking swimming but nothing a person in fair condition should have any trouble with. I do a lot of mine exploration, caving, canyoneering etc. and this was an EPIC experience. The tour and sights were spectacular. The water was cool and refreshing but not too cold. No cameras are allowed but a photographer accompanies you and took some spectacular shots. Veronica was very informative and patient as we had a non swimmer in the other family. 11 was a perfect size and we never saw or heard any groups until we were exiting the cave. The lunch was traditional Mayan fare and was good and plentiful. We purchased the pictures which were on CD and were awesome. The price US $89 seemed a bit steep but we split the cost with our friends so not bad. Unfortunately the CD did not work when we got home and I was really bummed but when I contacted the tour they got back to me within 15 minutes with a link and the pictures downloaded without problem. This was very impressive.Overall this was an awesome tour and the price standard for these types of adventures. Expect a lot of swimming and make sure to pay attention to your footing and if tall like me your overhangs. I would strongly recommend this tour and will do it again with my kids on my next visit.

Beautiful, great to escape the heat or the rain. We really enjoyed this, even the teen sons who seem to be unimpressed with everything. It takes some mobility - you need to duck walk and and carefully float your way through the rock formations. They provide everything you need - wetsuit, water shoes, life jacket even a towel and lunch after the tour. Our guide Nunes, was friendly and informative. We bought our tour at the hotel, including transport and it was $98 for adults, half price for kids. We heard other people who paid less elsewhere.

Secret River. You crawl, walk, swim and duck walk thru the river and caves. We had Alandro as our guide. You can tell she truly cares about the caves and her job. She was very attentive to our needs and has a wealth of knowledge. This was our second time to do the Secret River.

Great but challenging walking/wading. This is a tour of an underground river in a cave. It is fairly new, so there is no lighting installed. It is fascinating for nature buffs. Rio Secreto provides helmets (with lights), flotation jackets, and a wet suit that goes down to your thighs. The walking/wading part is on very uneven terrain, made especially difficult by the darkness and water. I suspect most of the eight people in our group, young and old, suffered at least some scrapes and bruises. So, I do recommend it for the adventurous types, but try to bring protection for your shins and feet, and shoes that are non-slip. The included lunch was excellent local fare.
Mesmerizing!. To be able to go into this underground river was a great experience. The beauty of this natural wonder that you are able to walk and swim in is an experience you don't want to pass up !

Wonderful experience!. This was a wonderful experience! All of the staff was nice and knowledgeable. It's family friendly, as my 12 and 7 year old children were able to participate. The ride to the site was probably the bumpiest ride of my life, but everything was smooth sailing after that. The walk through the jungle was nice, and safety was very important. Swimming in a cave, in clear water in Mexico was a very memorable experience for me and my family. The tour is about an hour and a half but that didn't seem nearly long enough - I didn't want to leave the cave! No cameras allowed during the tour and the pictures they sell you are VERY expensive, but if you want any pictures, that's the only way to go. I recommend this tour.

Beautiful. My wife was very apprehensive ahead of this tour as she was concerned that being underground would be very claustrophobic. She is now happy to admit she was wrong and thoroughly enjoyed the trip.The trip was well organised (we were picked up from our hotel in a minibus and transferred to the main coach en route) and the staff excellent. Tours have no more than 10 people to a single guide and are accompanied by a professional photographer. Before entering the caves we were given a Mayan blessing (this is a sacred place to them).The caves themselves were magical and the tour was not overly taxing although in some places you need to take care. At 6' 3" and as a not particularly slim guy I managed fine moving through the narrower and lower gaps so don't worry about size. I highly recommend this.

Natural Wonder that You Do Not Want to Miss.... This is a must do activity if you are in the area. It's an underground natural wonder that involves walking, swimming,and repelling into caves. We opted for the Plus show which included lunch, a light show projected onto the walls inside one of the walk-in caves and a bicycle ride to and from one of the caves you repel into. Besides admiring the natural creation of the underground caves, we were very surprised to encounter wildlife while meandering around in the caves. (Bats, fish, and even a scorpion!) Our guide was pretty entertaining too. His name was Raul from Mexico City. Funny man which made the experience very pleasant.

Must see...better than a man-made adventure. I always enjoy seeing the unique ways that nature has shaped our earth. This is one of the most amazing things you will ever see in your life. There are a few limitations for those with mobility issues, so see it while you can. The only thing I would change is that the "video" they show underground should be nothing more than a laser-light show with classical music. They try to show the evolution of the earth, but it doesn't quite have the effect they are going for. The photos you can purchase are nice, but make sure you get a few of yourself away from the rest of the group. And, smile at the camera otherwise they just look oddly like your walking down the street.
Unbelievable. Fantastic trip. Amazing sites in underwater caves full of stalagtites You swim in crystal clear waters in an underground river.

The Best Excursion We've EVER Done. If you've ever been to Natural Bridge Caverns or Carlsbad Caverns, you're NOT going to believe the difference of Rio Secreto. Splurge and get the adventure package - it's SO worth it. This experience leaves you feeling like you've been invited into a very close-knit family's inner sanctum where they share all their secrets with you - it's moving, it's incredibly special, and it's unique to any other spelunking experience.

Discover the underground secrets of the undergroud world!. It was definitely one of the best excursion that I have ever had. When we arrived at Rio Secreto, it turned out that they do not have enough of people to form a group with English-speaking guide and I was offered to join Spanish-speaking group, My Spanish level is a beginner and I could not understand that much, however, guide Jano, translated the most important parts for me. However, the most important and magical part about this excursion is that you are exploring underground river and nature. During the excursion you will learn about the culture and traditions of the people who were living in this area. You will be surprised with the beauty of the caves, crystal water and bats :)After the excursion in the river you will be invited to take a bicycle ride to another natural entrance where you can try rappeling and the guide will provide you with necessary instructions. Do not worry about the safety. Just follow the directions and have fun!I think that this excursion is an ideal for adults and kids, Also, do not worry about buying or taking water shoes with you. You can buy them there. And if you do not speak Spanish that good, you can give it a try and join a Spanish speaking group :)

What an experience!!. Fantastic tour.. it is a whole other world down in the caves. The tour lasted a few hours. I went with someone who could not swim and very claustrophobic. The guide was amazing helping her get though the caves without one freak out! You can not take your camera with you, and the photos that they take are very expensive. 1 for 25 USD or 3 for 50 USD. But if you are going to only do it once.. this is the one to do!

Very informative and fun!. I really enjoyed exploring the underground. Our guide was very knowledgeable. I thought I might get claustrophobic but felt safe the entire time! I highly recommend doing this excursion!

Excellent. Amazing place to visit. We decided to go on our last day of our stay. Very welcoming staff and our guide Juan was knowledgeable and funny and made the tour exciting.. you are not allowed to take pictures but there is photographer who takes them and you can purchase them at the end of the tour. There was not to many people there compared to the other tours that we went to.. the history and beauty of this cenote is undeniable..

Natural experience. Rio Secreto is a very natural way to see something different in the Rivera Maya. Going underground and experiencing the caves and river in their original state is a nice break from 5th Ave in Playa. I like them both, but Rio Secreto is unique and one of a kind. Our guide, Tomas, was great-- very knowledgable, funny and fluent in English. Great time.

Very nice caves but expensive photos. Went there in July. Drove up to the place and parked for free. Got the basic entrance ticket including lunch buffet. You are presented with a guide for your desired language, gear up, and after there's a long and bumpy car ride for about 20 minutes before you get to the cave entrance. Not a very comfortable ride.You then spend around 90 minutes in beautiful caves with just your headlights providing you with vision. At one point you turn them off in the middle of the cave and enjoy pitch black darkness while everyone is silent, this was awesome! You walk and swim, and everyone are protected with a life jacket. Our guide Adam was very attentive and had a lot of knowledge.Food buffet was not brilliant, but OK.Cons: Your own photo equipment is not allowed. They say it's for safety reasons but in reality it's because they want to totally rip you off in buying your photos. A guy with a camera follows the group and takes pictures here and there. The photos are cool, but they charge a whooping $20 for ONE picture and $89 for around 15 photos. Way too expensive and not worth it in my opinion. Too bad for those who want to have memories from this beautiful place but have to pay more for pictures than for the entrance.

Family Vacation Summer 2016. We were very satisfied with our day at Rio Secreto. Our guide, Diana Sanz, made it extra wonderful. We were a group of 12 people including my 5 year old niece and my 60 year old mom. Diana made it a wonderful experience with her help and guidance. We truly appreciate everything she showed and taught us. We highly recommend Rio Secreto and Diana! Thank you again to Diana! We hope to see you around the world again!

Remarkable experience. We were a group of 8 and our tour guide was Leo and photographer was Victor. We were thrilled from the get-go because Leo's personality was very laid-back and humorous, much like our group's personality. They play a short video before they take you to change. You are provided with a wetsuit (optional), life jacket and water shoes. They also offered walking sticks for individuals that have difficulties with stability. Leo was really informative about the cave and all the formations. Leo made our experience one to remember always. Some members of our group had a few scratches coming out of this excursion, but everyone agreed that it was beautiful and worth it! If you are able to, do this excursion!

Loved it!. This was such a great excursion. We really enjoyed it and purchased two photos. Do yourself a favor and go. The only drawback was putting on a wet, smelly wetsuit that I'm certain had not been sanitized.

Amazing guide. We had a guide called Pablo. He was passionate and lived and breathed the Mayan culture. His knowledge was second to none and a great credit to this site. We had a fanatic insight into the cave and the history. Thank you Pablo if you read this you made our visit truly special

Privilege tour. Absolutely stunning private tour of underground caves and water system. Our tour guide Alfredo loves his job and it clearly shows. He is extremely knowledgeable and entertaining. We felt lucky to have him and our photographer Juan with us for our special day. Booking was very personable. I called a month after an initial email and the operator knew exactly who I was and made all requested accommodations. We had a delicious wine and cheese break towards the end of the tour and at the end a gourmet meal that topped of the day. The chef and her staff made you feel right at home. Cannot recommend the privilege tour enough. It is a must see when visiting the Cancun/riviera maya area. Thank you rio secreto for a memory that will last a lifetime!
Best experience ever. Must do thing. This is such an amazing experience that you will never forget. Our tour guy Memo was awesome.

amazing secret river. This was beautiful! Another world below ground. Water was nice and cool. Swimming is involved but you have a life jacket on. Tour guide was great. Getting there is a bumpy ride but well worth it.

Enjoyable experience. This was our second visit to Rio Secreto and we enjoyed it just as much as the first one. The walk through the underground river takes about an hour and a half. The walk is not strenuous but you do have to bend down to negotiate some low points of the roof at times.All equipment is provided and our guide (Hugo) was very knowledgeable. The depth of the water varies from ankle deep to depths where you have to swim, but as these distances are extremely short and life jackets are provided, even a non-swimmer would not experience any problems. This is such an enjoyable experience, we fully intend to visit again on our next visit to Playacar.

Wonderful place. We booked this day through our hotel and opted for the 'plus' package. It was about US$30 more per person but so worth the extra money. The more basic tour is essentially one cave tour. With the Plus package you get three cave tours, one of which you cycle to and then abseil down into the cave - a little scary but fun! Our tour guide for the day, Rene, was knowledgeable about the caves, Mayan people and surrounding environment and took pains to answer our questions, he made sure we were all ok with the more challenging parts of the cave tour. The whole day you are in the same small group and accompanied by a photographer. You can purchase a disk of all the photos or just select a limited number. A nice record. The caves themselves are beautiful and amazing. We've been to other caves before as a family but honestly this really is different. We were there nearly 6 hours before a very late lunch but the time passed so quickly we could not believe it was 4pm when we'd finished the last cave tour. All in all this is a fantastic way to spend a memorable day so leave your poolside lounger and get yourself down to Rio Secreto! All you need is your swimmers, they provide a towel and you can buy water shoes there (US$10 I think) if you don't already have them.

Do not miss this gem of nature!. We were attracted to this trip because it sounded adventurous but fairly easy to handle and also because it was educational. This trip was amazing. You actually hike through an underground cave that is wet and dry. There really isn't a lot of swimming. The water is cool and refreshing. Our guide was amazing. We learned that if people touch the structures below, they die so this trip may not be available for very long into the future.Here are some hints:Bring and wear water shoes.They give you a towel. You do not need to bring one.I would suggest asking for a trip with no really small children. We had a 5 year old and a 7 year old and they did not behave and disrupted the trip somewhat.There is some climbing and there are some steps.

Be prepared to be Wowed!. This truly was an amazing experience. We had the best tour guide, Valentino. We had two young children in the group, one with adhd and he knew how to keep the boy happy when he was getting anxious to get out. There was a part of the cenote where the cavern was getting lower and lower and I think the little boy was getting claustrophobic. Valentino was amazing with him. The cenote are impressive and beautiful. You do have to be able to walk in the caves and swim. Water shoes are essential and if you don't have it they give you a pair or sell it for $10 USD. If you're claustrophobic then this is not the place for you. Everything you see is natural. No jewellery is allowed to be worn and we take a shower to wash off the oils and tanning lotions off to preserve the environment. You're not allowed cameras in with you and nor would you want to take it in there with you as you need to balance yourself on uneven floors in the water. There's a wonderful photographer that goes with the group. She is experienced and takes awesome pictures. Mind you the cd is usd$89 for all the picture or 1 picture is usd$25, 2 pictures is usd$40 and 3 pictures of usd$50. It was definitely a must see. Don't leave Praya Del Carmen without travelling to a cenote. They are special in this region in Mexico (Yucatan region). I am so glad I did it and I'm not fit but you do need some strength. There were grandparents on the tour but you do need strength. The tour guide will help you. Valentino looked after us really good.

Awesome!. Fun and unique experience for ages 5 and up. The tour was easy just because the guide was really good about warning us about drops and rough patches on the river floor. Bring your own water shoes!

Great Excursion. Gonzo was our Tour Guide. He was amazing, passionate, knowledgeable. My mom/niece/father all needed some assistance navigating the rocks at times and he was very helpful. I didn't find it challenging moving around in the cave at all butttt. There was definitely some breathtaking views. The only disappointing things were the lunch afterword's, it was just average and was hoping for more after reading all the great reviews on this site about the lunch. Also, I think because of the queisotns asked during the excursion Gonzo said that was why it left us less time for the mediocre lunch which was quite disappointing, felt rushed. Overall though very organized operation and ran smoothly!

Amazing - A MUST SEE. This was phenomenal - you must see it. My advice - if there are children in your group, ask to be put in a group with no kids. This is not an activity for kids and I can't believe they allow them. There were 2 in our group and it was very distracting and annoying. Kids aside, this is great. We did the package with the show, repelling and bike ride. The show was OK, but nothing great. The bike ride was about 15-20 minutes on a road with a lot of small hills. It wouldn't have been bad except the heat was really bad the day we went. The repelling was really cool. They have a photographer that follows you around for the day. This is great because even if you were allowed, you would not want to deal with a camera during this outing...there is just too much to enjoy!The tour through the caves and river is unbelievable and our guide - Yagot- was amazing and you could tell he loves what he does. We learned a lot while enjoying the beauty and the water. I can't recommend this highly enough...I seen a lot of cool things and I am not easily impressed but this did it - I would go back tomorrow!!!

Unique natural wonder!. I'll try and include information that has not been included before.We purchased the tickets last minute, one day before, on a whim, by calling the toll free number on their official website. I used the online chat initially and was told that if I booked directly, by chat, or by phone, they would give me a 15 percent off, so I called them and booked them on the spot. When I received the confirmation email, I realized that I had to print out the voucher. Fortunately, I was able to do that at my hotel. If you are thinking about going, you should do that from home. You have no reason to cancel due to weather because the tour is completely underground. If the event that it rains, it won't ruin your day. Its seems like they group together as they arrive, based on language, so the schedule seems flexible. The guide mentioned that they have 40 guides (who speak different languages) , so it seems like they wouldn't really ever be completely booked, if that makes sense.We drove ourselves and parked in the small parking lot. Fortunately, there was plenty of parking at 8:30 am. The official start time was 9 am and we were done at 12:30, for the basic entrance. If you take a taxi, outbound taxis seem to be readily available. Its located near Xcaret, just in case you are thinking about taking a taxi.The tour was well organized from beginning to end, and the guide had our safety in mind the whole time. He was very knowledgeable and passionate about the mayan jungle and traditions. In fact, his hobby includes researching the jungle.I would disagree with the reviewers complaining about the food. It was simple, Mexican food and it was delicious, especially after a 2-3 hour trek. We especially enjoyed the fresh tortillas, chicken and beans. Kids liked the pasta.It's true that the photos are expensive, and in hindsight I regret not looking at the camera more, because they turned out great. The cd includes really great stock photos of the jungle flora and fauna. They are better than anything I could have taken with my phone. The photographer was lost during one of the good photo ops, but it's ok because it wasn't her fault. We purchased the big package: photo cd + 3 items. They are very organized here. By the time you are done with the tour, all of your photos will be shown to you on a tablet. The items you can choose from are the RIO SECRETO t shirt, baseball cap, photobook or liquor (which you get to taste). We chose 2 tshirts and 1 cap. The only drawback was that we were kind of put on the spot. We requested an english tour because 2 of the 4 of us are not fluent in spanish. When we met with our guide, he said: "Is it ok if I just speak in spanish, or do you want me to translate everything into english, even though it will take longer that way?" We were kind of put on the spot and said that all spanish was ok, but please translate only the important safety instructions. We translated what we could to to the people in our party, but things kind of got lost in translation, and the 2 people in our party not fluent in Spanish kind of didn't get the full experience. In hindsight, I should have just told him to translate everything. But you can see how we were kind of put on the spot. My words of advise: bring your own water shoes and plan on buying the photos. Don't get guilt tripped into listening a specific language.All in all, it was an amazing experience! You won't regret it.

Awesome Excursion. We booked the excursion through Carnival Paradise. We took a ferry boat from Cozumel to Playa Del Carmen and honestly that ride was uncomfortable. We sat at the air conditioned area, but the smell in there made me nauseous. The boat ride itself made me feel sea sick so I suggest either using a patch or taking a motion sickness pill. When we got to Playa Del Carmen, a van picked us up to take us to through the jungle. The ride was bumpy, but wasn't too bad. When we got to Rio Secreto, we were briefed on the rules and safety, then they provided us our wet suits, helmets, life vests and water shoes. Our tour guide, Pablo, was AWESOME and informative. The tour didn't feel rushed at all and the place was AMAZING! We were also provided lunch and drinks afterwards. The only thing I didn't like is that you can't bring your own camera. The photographer took some nice pictures, but the pictures cost a lot. The CD cost us about $90. I wish they would allow us to at least take a go pro. Aside from that, I would definitely recommend this to other people, both kids and adults.

Very fun cave excursion!!. This was our favorite excursion during our trip to Mexico. Unlike Xcaret(which in my opinion is more touristy), this one has smaller groups, which allows the guide to give you more attention. We had a great time exploring the cave and the water isn't really cold, so don't worry about that. Just have to watch your step at times, but no one got hurt. Had an older gentleman who had difficulty at times, but nothing major. The food afterwards was pretty tasty as well! The staff is all very friendly and helpful. Definitely a recommended excursion!!

REALLY COOL EXPERIENCE. This was by far one of the coolest experiences we have EVER done. From start to finish the tour was well organized and very fascinating. Our tour guide, Daniello, made the experience even better. He was fluent in both English and Spanish and extremely knowledgeable about the caves and the wildlife of the area. Overall the experience was supercool, and unlike ANY cavern experience stateside.The only downside was that since we were on an excursion from the cruise ship, there was not a lot of down time to hang around the area after the tour. Regardless, this is a MUST SEE ADVENTURE!!!

Fun Cave Adventure. I've visited many caves around the world, but the caves here at Rio Secreto are pretty amazing. What I like most about this experience is that it isn't covered in multi-colored lights like a vegas show (caves like that seem way too touristy).Most of the time you're exploring through the darkness with only your headlamp. It feels like a proper cave adventure. Plus the walking (and swimming) through water. Even the most jaded adventure traveler who's done it all should still be able to enjoy this experience. And for anyone exploring a cave for the first time, you're in for a treat!

Excellent morning. Went here early morning and were lucky to only have one other couple on our tour. So it was nice and intimate. We had the lovely Argentinean girl (sorry your name has escaped me) she was funny and very knowledgeable. We paid for the photo package, but felt when I was looking at them at the end that he could have taken more photos of us and the caves. I see a lot of pictures on here and we didn't get those ones taken. Got a rash later in the day from the wetsuit, it smelt funny too, like mildew. Heard something about rappelling down some caves, would have paid to do that, but didn't know about it. Enjoyed our time down in the caves, especially when she turned her torch out.

Very interesting. Different from the main parks like xcaret or xelha, this place is worth your while if you want something completely different. Friendly staff, tours in english, spanish or french and a good easy to access location.

Great place, bad personnel. The place by itself is awesome, it's really a must at least once in your lifetime. The drawback was our guide, Lara. Unfortunately she was an example of how a person with no service vocation could ruin what could have been a great experience. She was more worried to finish the tour on time, than to keep an eye on our safety. At several points she advanced in the cave for 20 or 30 yards by herself, leaving us behind, and just waiting for us to catch up. We were traveling with two children (9 years old), which certainly made us slow-paced. However she never mentioned even once that there was an specific schedule to accomplish.During the bicycle part of the tour, we were also left behind maybe by 100 yards. In our hurry to catch up our guide, one of our childs had a pretty bad fall. We had to walk to the next stop to get some assistance. At that point she didn't know where to find a radio to call for help, she didn't even know where the first aid kit was located. For me this is just a proof of a deficient training.This caused a big delay on our return, which seemed to troubled the driver who got us back to the hotel. He drove really fast through a dirt road, passing other vehicles at high speed. When we reached the main road he sped up to 120-130 km/hr in a 80 km/hr zone.In summary, Rio Secreto is a beatiful place. I would just hope that the personnel in charge could have a higher standard towards the visitors.

Overall okay trip . I just visited Rio Secreto and overall the tour was good, but if you do a plus tour you will get to ride bikes, and the problem with the bikes is that the rode is rocky and the pedals are mostly broken. However, the tour guides are super nice but if you use the transporting service the vans are extremely hot and sweaty. I brought my own water shoes and I am glad I did because the provided ones smell like my dogs food and the wet suit smells like vial. I do recommend to use a walking stick because I even tripped on a rock in the water and the stick helps you see where you are going. The food is not amazing and I suggest not to eat before going on the van since you will probably feel sick. I bought the pictures and loved them, and the staff was great overall a good trip but there were a few kinks in the road.

Tour plus. Underground Mayan world, a stunning place! We did the tour plus which included bike ride, repelling into a cave, dry tour, wet tour a light show projected onto the cave wall. Had a great day and our guide Alfredo was top draw!

Awesome!. This place was so amazing. This was a part of our cruise excursion. About a 20 mins bus ride from the beach port to the caves. There they gave us body suits, helmets, life jackets, and water shoes. USE A WALKING STICK it's so helpful when you can't really see the big rocks under the water and helps to catch your balance. You don't need to be a swimmer because of the lifejackets. The water is very cool like mid 70's but not a huge problem with the watersuits. Our guide was Alondra she was very funny and knew so much about the caves. She told us exactly where to step and made sure everyone was having a good time. She let us touch some of the formations and answered any questions we had. I wouldn't recommend this for big sized people or the elderly: we had a few tight squeezes my dad who's a little bigger than average could barely get thru. We had an older lady maybe in her 60's was able to get thru the rocks but she looked relatively healthy for her age and constantly used the walking stick for support. There are bats and fishes but they won't bother you. No cameras allowed but our photographer took great pics we got the package of all the photos and tshirts. The buffet had simple food but was great after working up an appetite from the walk. As we waited for the bus they had hammocks and plenty of sitting area while we waited for the buses. Do it!!!
Beautiful. The guides and the location are amazing. The only down-side was that they charge $25.00 per picture and they don't let you take any of your own.

A must go place. Just visited this place, I can tell you that the underground river they have is really awesome, if you like adventure, this one worth every penny.As you arrive the staff from Rio Secreto will show you a video that explains about the origins of the place, history, etc, and then after this opening overview you will be better prepared to what is next. There is a 10 minutes ride from the main entrance of Rio Secreto to the place where the underground river is located at, be patience, it really worth the trip.Once at the venue, follow every instruction an recommendation of your tour guide, trust me, they know the place better than anyone and are prepared to help you enjoy at it most the activity and keep you safe while you are there.You will be amazed of what is underground in this region of Quintana roo, simply spectacular. Water is obviously a bit cold, so be prepared for thatAfterwards there is a nice buffet lunch offered as part of the tour (or at least the tour we got), food was very good, nothing extraordinary but not really important, what it matters is that the tour inside the underwater river is just fantasticI guess price might look a bit high but once you are there you will understand why, it s a total experience that you must have. Enjoy

Amazing experience . We booked our trip through the travel agents in our hotel. We were picked up by a mini bus at 8.45am and went to collect other passengers from other hotels. This didn't take too long. There were 9 of us on the bus and the driver informed us it would take 1 hour 30 mins to get there. Once at the location I used the simple toilet facilities and we were asked to sign a waiver. We weren't given much information and I think we were meant to watch a video but this wasn't shown. We went on a bus to the cave. The bus was clean and adequate for the journey. It is a bumpy road so if you get travel sick it may be worth taking tablets before hand. We met our guide Lara who was very friendly and asked where we were all from. She showed us where to get changed and provided us with a locker. The lockers were big enough for 2 of us and the toilet area was clean. We were provided with water shoes and there were plenty of sizes to try on. We then had to shower to get rid of chemicals. The water is quite cold so be prepared for the shock.We were then given wet suits and helmets. Again lots of sizes and good quality. Lara insisted on us having sticks to walk with. She did comment that they are optional but that she feels they are essential and she used one her self. It was great to see her passion for not only keeping us safe but for protecting the cave as she stressed that we shouldn't be touching the cave if we could help it and the stick would help us to avoid this. I really enjoyed the traditional Mayan ceremony before entering the cave. This was unexpected and a good tradition to experience. Once in the cave we were given rules and information. The cave was incredible. The water again was cold but you got used to it quickly. It was so amazing to look at and there was a good mix of walking on dry cave wet cave and to float in the water. Some people have moaned that there isn't enough swimming however this trip isn't about the swimming it's about experiencing the cave and learning about it. There are lots of parks close by to swim in the caves at your pleasure so that may be a better trip if your not so interested in learning about the caves.All the way through Lara kept us safe and showed us the best way your manouver around. She kept us well informed but also had a good sense of humour to keep it light and friendly. There are some small spaces, very deep water and times where it's very dark so it may be best to avoid it if you are afraid of any of those things. The buffet after was great. The food was delicious and was being replaced regularly. Some people mentioned flies, there were a few but then it is the jungle and that happens. They weren't causing any bother and the food was well looked after. The only downside was the photos. I felt there were a few too many photo stops in the cave that took away from the experience and then at the end they cost so much money that the quality wasn't worth the cost. It's a shame when you can't take our own photos at all and the option to just buy one wasn't available. 3 for 50 dollars is a little steep! I would highly recommend this trip and especially Lara who did an excellent job of keeping us informed, preserving the cave and making us laugh!

Something different. I like his place because it just had a different feel to it than other Mexico excursions. The people there were friendly, the pace was nice and comfortable, you are in small groups, it doesn't feel crowded and the caves are really cool. They give you a nice Mexican lunch afterwards, and then you're on your way home. It doesn't take all day, which I liked and everything was pretty straight forward and thoroughly explained. Compared to one of the natural water parks - which I found were nothing more than giant tourist traps - this place has a better overall feel.

Fantastic!. What a great way to spend a day. Swimming underground in caves, the water is calm and cool (not cold) and the scenery is just wonderful. A very relaxing and informative few hours and definitely worth your time.

Enjoyed going though the cave. I enjoyed going though the cave, as it was a work of art that you do not see every day. Also, I never realized how dark it can get in one. At the time we went, the water was just cool enough to need a wet suit.The food they serve at the end of the tour is very simple.
Amazing Caves. I have been there 2x in July. Each time I am amazed at the pristine beauty of the caves. Very professional destination with very knowledgeable staff.

Great and amazing time!. Tour guides were extremely nice and professional. We had Addy and Alondra. From the get go they were helpful and knowledgeable. The river itself was awesome. Many thought it was a little chilly but they provide wet suits that definitely help. They also provide the helmet, watershoes, and lockers. Lunch was provided and it was actually very good! Def. recommend to anyone!

Amazing experience, opt out of transportation!. Absolutely stunning and a once in a lifetime experience. If you are staying with a resort opt out of the provided transportation and just take a taxi to and from. We had to pick up and drop off several people at other locations and it took us an hour and a half to get back to our resort when it could have taken 15 minutes. Be ready for it to be a bumpy and long ride but it's worth it! Ask for Gonzo as your tour guide if you can, very passionate about what he does and for the protection of Rio Secreto.

Worth the Money!!!!. This was a fun experience! I have been Cenote snorkling before and this was even better! It was educational as well as adventurous! Easy for any age, although you could easily twist an ankle on the uneven surface. Felt super safe, guide was very knowledgeable. You cannot take pictures but there is a photographer that comes with you. Pictures were ok, wish we could have brought in a GoPro. Water is cold but you get used to it! If you have a sense of adventure and are looking for something exciting to do, you won't be disappointed!

Highlight of trip! . This tour was the most pricey that we did but it is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity. You are 60 feet underground and the water that you are going through is as clear as can be. We saw stalactites, stalagmites, and beautiful columns. My 12 year old and ten year old sons were amazed as well as me and my husband. Our tour guide was Jorge and he was very knowledgeable.

Best excursion ever..... Superb.We booked standard, it was over half a day in total and we all loved it.Kids are aged 9 and 8 and had a great time.Caves are superb and guides make the experience superb.Photos and gifts realistic in price, so keeps it all in very best place.Will go back, there are 30km of underground caves so plenty to see!

Great Experience With Nature!. One of our greatest experiences in Mexico! Staff is so professional and attune to your needs. Our family of 8 consisted of ages from 8 to 56. Awesome way to see another part of Mexico. This is one experience our family will keep close to our hearts forever. This is a must see when visiting the Mayan Coast!

Group of 10 Had a blast. You'd think that getting a group of 10 together would be a challenge, however, the staff did it, and we all thouroughly enjoyed this experience. Would highly recommend to all of our friends...

Extremely Cool!!!. This place is amazing and our guide - Denisse- was fabulous. She was so knowledgable and friendly and helpful! The caves and cenotes are a sight to behold! TheFoods was delicious!! We lived the rappelling into the sinkhole. Suggestion-- I wish they'd create a package that had more rappelling turns for your visit! We loved it.The only reason I didn't give a five out of five is because at the end, staff kept saying "just wait ten minutes" and the van will take you back. We were told that a fewTimes and ended up having to wait over an hour. Either be straight with people on the actual time or provide more transportation so people don't have to wait so long for them to coordinate it. That REALLY annoyed us.

A natural wonder. We really enjoyed our trip into the Rio Secreto. Our guide was Vero. She was very knowledgeable about the river and about the area. She was an excellent guide! We went through our cruise ship and were impressed that we were split into small groups. Each group was around 10 people and we never ran into each other in the river. I went with my mom and dad (both in their 50s) and they were very able to do this attraction. My father was initially scared because of claustrophobia concerns, but Vero put him right at ease and he was able to do the entire trip. I was very impressed with the importance of conservation that was evident throughout the trip. You could tell that the establishment was trying to keep the river as pristine as possible; no outside chemicals or gadgets went into the cave. The base had everything you need for the trip. There were nice clean bathrooms, free lockers, many sized wet suits and life jackets, and helmets. The food afterwards was wonderful. We loved our tacos and fruit! We did purchase photos at the end. They were pricey, though. Overall, our trip was wonderful and we have already recommended it to friends!
Wow just wow.. Caves are most beautiful experience ever. They take you to see bats in cave holes and how those caves formed, and water is clean. Very Fun! Do it!!

An amazing experience, not to be missed!. We were not really sure what to expect when we booked this. We are a family of 4 with a 5 year old and a 7 year old. I was a little worried it might be claustrophobic and cold based on other reviews and the kids would struggle, but this is not the case. It is quite spacious inside the caves, the water was warm enough and not even needing the wetsuit that is provided really. Our guide Paola was really amazing, excellent with the kids, able to speak several languages and she really made us all feel very comfortable. The tour is quite long in time but not really in distance, I am very unfit and I didn't have a problem at all. It is simply a wonderful thing to see, and to be able to swim in the caves and learn about how they formed. We could have stayed down there all day! The food afterwards is simple but delicious and the guides assist you from the start to the very finish of the trip with lunch changing, getting the correct gear on etc. Excellent. If we return to this part of the world we will almost certainly do this again. Just a word of warning - the 10/15 minute trip from the road to the caves through the jungle is incredibly bumpy and up and down hills - it is an off road experience. Just keep this in mind before booking!
A must see. Great tour guides, great experience! Everyone needs to take this adventure. The cave is just beautiful and it was great to see how they do not disturb nature.
Great caves and rivers . Wonderful morning spent exploring these beautiful caves - guide very knowledgeable - meal was a bit rushed but great experience
Coolest Thing We Have Ever Done. Rio Secreto was amazing. One of the most incredible wonders that we have seen. My whole family loved it, and wished it lasted longer.

Credit Card Cloning, Expensive Photos, Plus Tour not worth it. For Rio Secreto tickets, you get a special discount when you book by telephone, and this discount is not given if you pay online on the website, so I decided to buy my tickets via telephone. Once you call, you are asked to give all your card info (16 digit, expiration date and cvv) to a sales operator who will then send you your confirmation number by email. The sales operator who I talked to cloned my credit card first with an online purchase of $5,000 mexican pesos and then with a hotel online reservation of $32,000 mexican pesos. So be aware of this situation and take your precautions.I bought the Plus Tour and I do not recommend it. I think its too long, a bit boring, and not worth the price difference. The lights show is not as good as I thought it would be (quality of the projection) and almost fell asleep while watching it. I recommend you only do the basic tour which will take you around 3 hours to complete. The water in the cave is very cold but you get used to it soon. The pictures are very expensive (89 usd for about 40 pictures) and you are not allowed to take your camara in. If possible, take your own water shoes to walk the cave because the ones there are dirty and smelly. Wear the water suit because otherwise you will freeze!!

Great time. The depths of Rio Secreto is amazing. Our group was taken aback by the sights inside. From the pristine water to the caves dating back hundreds and hundreds of years!I don't think the wet suit was necessary. However, save yourself the hassle and purchase some water shoes before visiting this attraction (though they are provided if needed). You will find yourself maneuvering over sharp objects on the floor of the caves.Also the 'Walking Stick' is a MUST!!! Most of all have fun!!!

Awesome and unforgettable. I am 2 months short of my 77th birthday and wondered if I could do this, but thanks to my wonderful tour guide Gonzo, he made it appear easy. Gonzo is very knowledgeable and passionate not only about Rio Secreto but also about the environment. He led me down into the caves explaining the awesome site that we saw before us. I couldn't believe what I saw there, and now when I see the pictures of our group on the CD I purchased , I experience once again the beauty and solemnity of Rio Secreto. Thank you Gonzo.
Amazing!. This turned out to be the highlight of our trip to cancun. It exceeded our expectations and will be something we will never forget. Valentino was an amazing guide!

It is just ok. Beautiful place, amazing staff, very very friendly people working over there.Sadly the food selection is very poor, I could not even find a piece of chicken in my chicken soup and they only offer rice, beans, salads but nothing special. It was just ok to visit this place on a day off, continue preferring other parks. If it was not for the food, I would rated this place with a 5 star, but was not the case. Oh by the way, theo offer a great beverage like green color which is really good.

Must do for anyone who appreciates natural beauty!. I enjoyed this tour far more than I anticipated. I knew it was going to be great, but I didn't expect the experience to be better than that - it was fantastic! My family loved it! For those who have a great appreciation for nature and natural beauty, this is perfect for you! Due to the popularity of this tour, I was worried that the experience would be crowded and detract from the overall tranquil experience. To avoid this, my family opted for the PLUS tour. This tour was $20 more per person than the standard admission fee, totally $99 per person (if you drive to the place yourself). From Cancun to Rio Secreto is about an hour's drive so plan accordingly.Perks of the PLUS over the standard:- (theoretically) those who opt for PLUS generally don't mind paying more for a more exclusive tour- (theoretically) groups are smaller than the standard- Everything included in the standard- Dry walkthrough of a cave- Light show within the dry cave- Opportunity to bike through the jungle from one cenotes to the next- Rappel 50 meters down from the surface into second cenotes for more explorationSavings Tip: Check the website for discounts and promotions. When I scheduled the tour, there was a 20% discount if I made my appointment over the phone. With this promotion, I essentially got the PLUS tour at the rate of a standard tour, saving quite a bit!We scheduled for the 11AM tour since we were travelling from Isla Mujeres. We did not know this until we started the tour, but the buffet part does not happen until after the tour is done. So while we were thinking we'd be having lunch on the tour, it ended up being an early dinner instead. However, I'd like to say that the company who runs Rio Secreto does a really impressive job at making a well-operating branded business. The meeting area for the tour is clean and spacious with plenty of shade from trees and cabanas. All staff wear color coordinating uniforms for easy identification. There's a video presentation before everyone is escorted to a van that takes them to the next pit stop to meet their tour guides.After a 5-10 minute drive, we meet our tour guide (ours was Roberto who was so knowledgeable AND entertaining!) Roberto showed us the locker room where we placed all our belongings in. While you are allowed to bring your camera into the dry caves, you cannot do so in the wet caves. Your guide might give you the option of going without a wetsuit (so you're just in your swim suit), but I highly advise against it. The water in the caves are cold!We got wetsuits that are National Geographics branded so you know this tour has some serious sponsors! We also got a helmet with a light (you will definitely need this because you will more than likely miss a stalactite overhead and bump your head into it) and a life vest. Our family brought our own water shoes, but they can provide you with water shoes too.Before you can even get into the caves, you'll need to take a cold shower to rinse any contaminants off you. This is the same water you'll be walking/swimming in - glad you opted for a wetsuit yet? After a short trek into the jungle, we were met with a Mayan ceremony. The Mayan native asked the Gods permission for us all to enter the sacred cenotes as well as to keep us safe. After thanking the man, we slowly started to descend into the protected natural reserve.The overall tour experience was 6 hours and the time flew by! We were well taken care of every step of the way from one cenotes to the next. There was no down time. Everything transitioned from one location to the other so smoothly. There was never a single moment of boredom, hunger, or tiredness. Awe would be the most encompassing feeling as we marveled at the beauty of nature's creation over centuries.Roberto was a wealth of knowledge. He retold stories of ancient Mayan traditions and the science behind the cenotes' formations. While knowledgeable, he was also a funny guide as well, making the tour so enjoyable. There was never a dull moment while we were adventuring through natural beauty. Physically, this tour was not exhausting. If you are not on your feet, carefully walking through the caves, you'll be floating in the water with the help of a life vest (all the water in the cenotes is fresh water). If you don't want to participate in the biking for whatever reason, there is an option to ride a van to/from the next destination stop. For those who are worried about balance, there are walking sticks that can help keep you steady. All you really need to be mindful of is where you step and what is near your head.Throughout the tour, we had a dedicated photographer taking photos for us. Despite all the countless of photos here on TripAdvisor, I was wary if ours would turn out just as nice. Trust me - they turn out really, really nice. I have attached a couple from the tour at various points of our PLUS tour to depict that the photos are high quality. The cost, up front, is a bit apprehensive at $89 for all photos written on a CD. However, take the following into consideration:- These photos are undoubtedly nice.- Our family photos consisted of 122 pictures. 72 of them were photos taken at the actual tour. 50 are more stock images that they provide to showcase the "best of" Rio Secreto.- You won't be able to get photos these nice in low light conditions unless you have the appropriate expensive equipment.- Each photo is about 4500 x 3000 at 300 dpi- You just experienced a magnificent natural treasure! Why would you not want a memento of you actually there?!?!- Finally, take cost into consideration. I technically paid $80 per person for 6 hours of smoothly guided PLUS tour that included lunch and had everything provided for us on a silver platter. How can I not shell out a little extra for a memento to support such a fantastically run touring company of a beautiful preserved national reserve?
100% Natural. Excellent natural attraction. Be ready to walk 1 KM and enjoy the view at the caverns. Few places offer this experi

Must-see caves. This is a once in a lifetime experience. The guides are knowledgable and professional, and give excellent tours. This cave system is the most beautiful cave I have ever been in. Great for a rainy day, since you are underground most of the time. Highly recommend it.
Great experience. Great cenote exploring experience, less swimming than some others, but very knowledgeable staff and interesting time. Would definitely recommend.

Would definitely recommend this excursion. First of all I would like to have rated this excursion "Excellent". The only reason I didn't is because they don't let you take cameras into the cave (which I fully understand and do not mind).. The cave is beautiful and the guides were very informative. This cave is one of the most beautiful places I've visited in Mexico. My reason for downgrading my rating is because of the ridiculous prices they charge for the photos. My husband and I also visited Cenote Maya Park where photography also isn't allowed. We purchased the pictures at both locations. We got 4 times the amount of photos at Cenote Maya Park for a lot less then we did at Rio Secreto. The photos you pay for aren't printed photos, just photos on a disk. I understand that a photographer is taking the photos but really. To give you some idea of prices they charge nearly $50 for 3 photos, $89 for all photos or $119 for all photos on a disk plus three items at the store (shirt, liquor, book, hats, etc.). If you're going to spend that kind of money you might at well buy the package that gives you the most. Prices are way too high and more people would purchase them if they lowered the price.

on the way to being great. I'm writing this review from the perspective of also having participated in another tour (Jungla Maya) already, which means it's a little hard to not compare. First off, what you should know if you decide to go:1. You really only need your swim suit and a change of clothes for after the guided tour.They provide: wetsuit (if you want one - it's optional), a life jacket (not optional), swim shoes (if you don't bring your own), and a helmet with a light (not optional). *Wetsuits and life jackets come in sizes XS-XXL + kid's sizes*You don't need: camera (can't use it anyway), sunglasses (it's a cave), sunscreen (you are required to wash it off before you get into the water so don't put it on!)2. Once on the property there is a ~15min drive into the jungle. This is a BUMPY ride and there will be swerving involved as the driver tries to miss the potholes. If you tend to be motion sick, take something or wear a sea band.3. The water is chilly (~72*F) but not truly cold. If you don't want to wear the wetsuit, you'd be fine without it (if you're okay with being a bit chilly. Frankly you work up a sweat walking to the river anyway so you may appreciate the cold)4. The ground is incredibly uneven because it's a natural formation. There are many potential tripping hazards. They do provide walking sticks - USE ONE! (Even if you're in great shape it helps because it'll hit the unseen rocks on the bottom of the river before you do). The walk to and from the river is uneven as well. All in all, it's a decent hike - not terribly strenuous but enough to get some exercise. 5. The entire tour is underground - but usually in large caverns. There are only a few tighter spaces, so claustrophobia wouldn't be as big of an issue as you'd think - unless the idea of being underground contributes to it. 6. They provide a lunch afterwards - water/flavored water, salad, fruit, chicken & potatoes, rice, beans and tortillas. 7. There is a short blessing by a Mayan priest before you enter the water. PROS: Crazy amazing cave formations. Great guides. CONS: It's not truly "swimming" in a river. 95% is walking, with only a few deeper pools of swimming. My husband and I were disappointed by this actually. The transportation was a little disorganized when returning everyone to their resorts, the photographs they take are really pricey, and there isn't any "leisure" time to just hang out in the caves. In summation, I'd go. It's too cool to see nature look like that and not see it. However, Rio Secreto, if you're reading this, consider adding an option to actually float around in a cave or two once the tour is over. I would have loved some time to look around me at leisure rather than trying to keep up with the guide, or consider adding a tour that includes more floating rather than walking.
Beautiful excursion, so worth it!. Great experience, and I'm not too "adventurous". Food was also provided as it was a full day excursion.

Amazing Secret River. This tour was a highlight on our Caribbean cruise! My adult family and I would definitely return to experience a different part of the underground natural water springs the next time we are in the area. Rene was our tour guide, and he was fabulous! He was very knowledgable about the Mayan history and also the formation of the caverns. He knew exactly were to take our group to give us the most amazing experience! We highly recommend this tour set in a natural preserve.

OMG so Cold!. We decided to tour the Rio Secreto since there really wasn't much else we cared to do while in Cancun. First, you have to put on wet suits that have been used by someone else. I can only hope they are cleaned each day but not holding my breath.Next you have to rinse off in an ultra cold shower before they will allow you in. If nothing else, this will prepare you for the extremely cold spring water you are about to get into.The formations are lovely and the spring water clear and beautiful, but I simply could not enjoy it for shivering so much.This is a must do, but only one time!
Amazing. Everyone needs to do this excursion! I went by myself and felt safe and well taken care of. The staff is amazing and very knowledgeable. I will do it all over again

Amazing experience!. We had to book this ourselves as our tour rep didn't have an excursion here. We booked it online and took a taxi there. Fortunately the tour guy gave us a lift back as we couldn't get a return taxi. Our visit here was fantastic. The caves are huge and our guide Miguel was so enthusiastic and knowledgeable. We were given wet suits, water shoes and towels so you only need to bring your swimming costume. You get a life jacket so there no worries about being in the water and it's so clear and blue. You can't take any photos yourself, but a photographer follows your group and you can buy these at the end. You also get a meal and soft drinks. It's not a cheap tour, but a good portion of the entry fee goes toward education and conservation of the caves. If you fancy something a bit different then I would strongly recommend a trip to Rio Secreto.

Amazing caving experience!. Rio Secreto was an amazing experience. Their transportation team picked us up right on schedule from our hotel lobby. Our tour guide Hugo was amazing, providing us great information about the cave and even helped out someone out that was afraid of swimming (we had life vests on)... after the 90 minute tour we changed and enjoyed their buffet lunch (sodas and beer were not included). Hugo hung out with us and even helped clear our dishes which wasnt necessary but the man provided A+ service. I would recommend this excursion for people all of all ages and hope you have Hugo show you the cave

Rio Secreto. My husband, myself, and our 13 yr old and 15 yr old went on this. It was one of our favorite activities while in Playa. Our guide Kenzia was very knowledgable about the caves and local culture. After reading some of the Trip Advisor reviews I was a little afraid to go on this but did it anyway. So glad I did and there was nothing to be afraid of at all. Super safe, Kenzia went as slow as we needed to. They have three different routes that they can take - so you can just ask them to take you on the easiest route if you are concerned about difficulty. My husband and I are overweight and out of shape and we didn't have any problems. There are a lot of complaints about the price of photos but we bought them anyway because this was such a great experience. Also the photos are taken by a professional and are actually really good. The meal at the end was decent but not great, but I still give it 5 stars because we came here for the amazing cave, not the food.

Amazing Cave experience. My husband and I enjoy unique travel experiences and this was definitely one of them. We took out 10 and 12 year old kids with us this time and they enjoyed it very much as well. We did the least complex tour of all the ones available at this location, which was plenty for the kids of this age. The tour took about 3 hours and involved hiking above and under ground, wading through the underground river and swimming in it for a bit. The guide and the equipment ware great and we really enjoyed the fantastic views of the stalactites and stalagmites and learned quite a bit about the formations. The only thing we weren't crazy about was the lunch. The "gastronomic experience" was "ok" at best. We had much better authentic Mexican cuisine on other tours. We would still recommend this trip to all the spelunkers out there :)

This gem shouldn't be so secret.. The tour is great, the equipment is new and has sizes for all. The care for the environment, avoiding damage of the natural formations was pleasing to observe. The guide "Gonzo" was informative and fun. At the end they provided a delicious and refreshing drink followed by plentiful buffet of local dishes. Price for photos was a bit exorbitant.

Great Family Activity. Had a fantastic experience with my 3 and 7 year old. They excursion provides everything for you that you need. I've done this 2 times, last time was 4 years ago. I used a provided walking stick this time and I recommend to everyone no matter how in shape you are. Great scenery, great guide (Pablo), and food was not bad. Try the cactus, looks and kind of tastes like green beans. Bring your credit card for suvineers. The pictures are amazing. Great activity to do if you want to get out of the hot sun for the day too.

Breath Taking!. Our family just visited Rio Secreto!! Our tour guide was Ro! They said he was the best....and he really was! Very knowledgeable and passionate about his job!! He made it truly memorable! The caves were absolutely gorgeous and swimming through them was just an incredible experience we will never forget! A must see!

Amazing experience!. Our family (incl 13 and 18 yr old boys) just visited this attraction and I highly recommend it. Small groups (ours was 10 people) led by experienced guides. Our guide was Julian who was excellent (funny, knowledgable) and made it a lot of fun. We did not do the extended visit with rappelling and other activities, but the basic tour was long enough for us (4 hours total; 2 hours in caves) and we loved it!

Phenomenal Experience!. I booked this tour as an excursion with Norwegian Cruise Lines and it was amazing. The natural caves with the river running through it was definitely worth the trip.
