It is hard to believe that the caves are totally natural forming and there is nothing man made (except one set of stairs). I am a bit older and not normally adventurous. I normally opt for sightseeing tours rather than this type of excursion but I don't regret it a bit. Our tour guide, Alfredo, was also amazing and went above and beyond. He was so passionate about sharing his love for the caves with all of us. It makes for a much better experience when the tour guide loves what he is doing. Walking through the water on the uneven rocks proved to be a bit challenging at times (for an older adult who who normally doesn't indulge in this type of activity, as stated earlier), but Alfredo was a great help getting me through the caves and river (without a scratch). I am so glad that I participated in this excursion and that Alfredo was our guide. It was the best excursion of the cruise! Once inside the caves, you will just be awed! I also would like to say that the photographers did a great job! Personal cameras aren't allowed in the caves but they have photographers following the group taking pictures. Although $89 may be a bit pricey for a CD of pictures, the CD has about 70 pictures (about 20 of you/your group and 50 of the inside the cave and the other items of interest). I felt it was worth the money. Pictures look great but keep in mind that the life vest and wet suit (optional) will add 25 pounds to your pictures!

Amazing!. This was a lot of fun! The caves were beautiful! You have to wear a wet suit and life jacket which was a bummer but I understand they have to be safe. The inside of the caves are really cool - some spots are very narrow so if you get claustrophobic this might not be for you. Our guide was Diana and she was spectacular!
Best excursion of the cruise . Amazing ! Beautiful ! Diana,our guide, was the best ! Swimming in this underground aquifer was unforgettable. After the tour the food was great !

The advertising tour pictures are awesome! But its hard to get that view in person!. We booked this on our recent excursion from the Carnival Dream Cruise. I thought it would be more like a lazy river tour through the magical caverns but this was a spelunking experience at its best. Its truly fascinating but if you dont like the adventure of feeling your way through the pitch dark caves with a miners lamp and a walking stick, you may want to think twice about this tour. What i was most disappointed by was how long of a ride to and from the Carnival cruise dock in Cozumel. This took....2 bumpy hours each way! So there was no time to really rest in Cozumel nor Cancun.
Best underground river!. We luv our experience at Rio Secreto! Our guide was super nice and knowlegeable! We even had a photographer take pictures for us all thru activity! Fantastic place to visit!

Amazing. I could have stayed here all day long. It was breathtaking and absolutely beautiful. My husband and I loved this excursion and would do it again. Our tour guide was Rudolf and he was very informative.

Second visit & I will be back soon!!. I did this tour a couple years ago, I love it and this time we get it from the cruise excursion nice welcome well organize & small group. I have the beautiful chance to do it again our Tour Guide was Alfredo and we did the "Joy" route, first time for my husband and he loves it. The food like somebody said 3 to 4 starts, but I didn't go for the food.

Underground adventure. Our guide, Julian, led us through the underground caverns of Rio Secreto, skillfully juggling English and French for our small group of 6. His knowledge and passion made for a truly memorable experience. This is an excursion you won't want to miss.
The highlight of my vacation.. This was my birthday treat on our week-long stay in the area, and it was by-far my favorite. If you exploring and the hidden side of nature, then you'll love this.

Educational and fun!!. I am not a fan of heat but wanted to see something spectacular outside of our resort. This caught my eye because of the pictures and not to mention cool water. Our guide, Nunes,was informative on the caves and showed us the beauty underground. Our group opted to hold hands in a single file line as opposed to using the canes. After reading previous reviews a lot said the cane was the best option. However my group wanted to hold hands. We all worked together in guiding each other not to fall and I think in the end it was better. It's amazing to see how Mother Nature works and the importance of preserving it!!! Buy the pictures they sell because they really capture the beauty of the underground caves. This was fun but I wouldn't recommend it to anyone with bad knees or is claustrophobic. I consider myself to be pretty clumsy but made it out safe with bumps or scratches lol.

Amazing experience!. Definitely top recommendation for a Riviera Maya excursion! 6 people in our tour with guide Vicky who loves her job and it shows! Our two teenagers loved it. Food served only 3 star but didn't go for the food.

Amazing Experience. This tour is really beautiful, peaceful, and fun. Our guide was Alondra. Not only was she very knowledgeable about the caves, but she was also hilarious which made for a very fun trip! You could tell she also has a very deep love and respect not only for the cave and its inhabitants, but also Mayan culture. There were parts of the cave that you could walk in, some parts you had to wade through water, some parts you can swim. There are beautiful formations everywhere and it really is just a great experience! Helpful tips: -The ride from the Rio Secreto entrance through the jungle to the caves is very bumpy! I would suggest taking some motion sickness medicine beforehand (even if youre not prone to getting sick), just to be sure. -Leave all of your jewelry, valuables, and cameras back at your resort (in a safe if you have one) because you are not allowed to bring them into the cave. They do provide you with a locker (which you will have a key to around your neck for the tour), but it is just easier to not have to worry about it. Bring water shoes if you have them! They can provide you with some, but I can't remember if you had to pay for them or not. - You will have to wash off any chemicals (bug spray, sunscreen, etc) off of your body before entering the cave to protect the waters that feed into the reef. It is just easier to not have anything on prior to arriving. I was super worried about mosquitoes (b/c of Zika), but neither myself or my husband were bit. We tried to schedule for a mid-day tour (12:00 PM) so we could avoid any morning or evening mosquitoes. I did bring some natural citronella bug spray and we applied it after we got out of the cave. -The photo package is around $90 for a CD with all of your photos. I would just factor this price into the total for your trip beforehand, so you aren't surprised with a big bill later. Of course, you don't have to get the photo package, but I am sure you will want the pictures after!Notes:-I was worried that I would be cold the entire trip (as I am always cold! Haha), but I was totally fine! The water is only cool when you are completely swimming and even then its only cool and not cold. -I ate all of the food they provided (even the salad) and did not get sick, so I would not worry about the food.

Had to go back. We were here approx 2 years ago and thought so much of it that we went back. The guides and the tour through the cave are like nothing you ever seen. We have recommended this tour to so many and no one left disappointed
Great excursion. This unusual trip was fascinating! It was a bit athletic walking through the rocky water and crawling through tight spaces but just beautiful.

Very unique experience, only drawback was all van ride.. We took a large group and they opened a little early for us, which was very nice. The caves were very neat and floating through the parts that were deep was such a cool experience. Our tour guide (Benito) was so knowledgeable and helpful. We all wished we could have played around in the pool just a little more at the end, but it was nice. The outdoor lunch afterwards was very cool too. The photos they took of us were amazing but WAY overpriced...still kind of sad that we didn't buy any though.

So cool. I have been through caves before but being able to go through these caves and walk and swim through water was definitely neat. We paid for the transportation to and from also. Our guide was so funny and cool. This is a must do if you visit the area.
AWESOME excursion. Can't beat the price, the experience, the hike to the cave, the walk thru the cave, the food after the excursion, the photos, the education. IT WAS FABULOUS!

Awesome Adventure. Best time ever! Don't miss this excursion! We had a great time, we have never experienced anything like this before. Highly recommended! Great tour guide. You will learn all about the history and people, but the best part was exploring the cave; being in the water was awesome! They give you helmet, water shoes, wet suit, and vest. They really took their time to make sure you had a good experience! The ride in the van was a little scary, because we didn't know where we were going, all dirt roads a little creepy. But once you are there it was awesome. I can't say enough about this trip, do something out of the ordinary, you won't regret it!! We are going back again next year..can't wait!
Fun. Good morning trip. Be aware, they don't let you take cameras, even GoPros (unless you have a secure mount for it) then charge you $50 for the photos.

Our favorite cenote experience. Seems pricey, but it was such a neat experience. You get to explore an underground cave system that was discovered in 2006 with a guide and a very small group. A one of a kind experience. Book online to save a little extra too!

Good time for all. We enjoyed this with our children, but did find the photographs were now too expensive. Almost $100 for the photo package did not translate to a deal. The experience otherwise is very unique and fun, and it is nice to see them take a serious responsibility for the environment.

Really good - shame about photos!. Really good day out. The caves were magical and beautiful. Guide was knowledgeable and fun. Lunch was ok. Only issue was the photos, $100! More than we paid for 2 people to do the trip. They weren't even that good quality so obviously we declined.

Beautiful tour and awesome tour guide!!. My family and I completely enjoyed our tour of Rio Secreto! The whole day was so exciting and filled with adventures! We were picked up from Moon Palace in the morning and headed off to Playa del Carmen in a comfortable van. We took part in the Rio Secreto Plus tour, and at a little past 10 a.m., we arrived and were given a brief introduction and we were assigned to Santiago, our awesome and knowledgeable tour guide! There were only 10 people in our group so it was a perfect group size. For a little over an hour, we explored a dry cave where we participated in sacred Mayan rituals, watched a mesmerizing sound and light show, and walked around listening to Santi's in-depth knowledge of the history of the peoples and the area. It was cool to see the sound and light show because it was like watching modern technology on a huge, ancient backdrop of rocks and stalactites that are several thousands of years old.Then, we took our bicycles through the jungle for about half an hour and went to the rappelling site. The rappelling was a little over 50 meters and it was our whole family's first time but we all loved it! Dani and Pablo, the rappelling guides, made us feel very safe too! Plus, the water was very cool and refreshing at the bottom of the cenote.Then we bicycled back to the meeting area and got our wetsuits and gear and headed off to Santi's "favorite route." This route is called "Allegro," which means happiness, and the inside of the cave was huge! If you have claustrophobia, I think this route is for you because there wasn't a single tight space that I could remember. Here, Santi talked about the geography of the stalactites and stalagmites, how the Yucatan peninsula was formed, and more. Of course there were more things but I won't spoil it all for you! We also briefly experimented being in the caves in complete darkness, which was awesome, and we finished off with the floating part, where we float through the cave until we hit the end! It was truly a magical experience. The whole tour including the lunch buffet ended at around 4:30 p.m. and I was so sad to say goodbye.There is also a photographer who follows each group, and our photographer Anna was always one step ahead of us to capture amazing pictures of us! We aren't allowed to bring cameras into the caves, but honestly I think this policy is better because it would have been too distracting to take pictures because the sights are breathtaking and it's better to be in the moment for these kinds of activities. Plus, the caverns are dark so constant flashes from other people's cameras would also have been distracting too!Couple of notes: Apparently visiting Rio Secreto is a great rainy day activity because apart from the bicycle ride, everything is pretty much underground. It's perfect for those days when you can't go to the beach! As for us, we went when it was pretty hot outside and the water from the caves cooled us off all day.Also be sure not to wear any sunscreen, even the biodegradable ones, because the oils will spoil the natural waters and alter its composition. Plus, as I mentioned earlier, most of the activities are underground and there are a lot of trees and natural shade so you don't need it. And they will make you take it off if you have trace amounts of sunscreen so don't even think about it! Also, make sure you have a big breakfast because these activities will make you hungry and you obviously can't carry food into the underwater cave so I found that it's best to come in a full stomach! They do offer a delicious lunch buffet with traditional food, but depending on the time of your tour and which activities you do first, you might not get to eat until a couple hours after the tour starts.Last but not least, definitely ask for Santiago! He was so thorough with explaining the geography and history of the caves, the Mayan people, and more! We learned so much from him. He was always on the lookout for us during each activity and making sure we were safe. Also, he is very caring about the environment and it was nice to be a part of his goal of educating visitors on preserving these natural wonders! Overall, Santi made this experience unforgettable and our family cannot thank him enough! I definitely recommend this excursion to everyone visiting Cancun!

Great staff/ amazing place . I went with my parents, my sister and my nephew that is 7 years old. The staff is so lovely and kind, they help you in everything all the time and the smalls group made the experience much beautiful, the place/ caves are breathless.I highly recommend it in your first time in Cancun!

Fantastic half day adventure . Driving a few miles into the jungle was just the start of our adventure. We put on a wet suit, water shoes and a hard hat with a headlamp, then set off on a trail thru the jungle to the cave entrance. Our guide, Nico, took us wading and floating thru a labirynth of underground chambers. The stalagmites and stalactites were awesome! After exiting the cave and walking back to our starting point, we changed into our regular clothes and enjoyed a nice buffet lunch. If you are in the Playa del Carmen area, be sure to add this to your itinerary!

ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!. Definitly out of the norm... Very beautiful experience for the whole family. My son and grandkids loved it and so did we. It can be a bit taxing if you are older but well worth it.
This was so much fun!. I loved it so much I wanted to go back in right away!!!!!! I whished my boys were with, we will definitely bring them next time!

Amazing Caves and excellent tour guide!. We booked a Cave tour that came with a meal, and it exceeded my expectations! We booked through our hotel and got it for $99. This included roundtrip transportation to the excursion and a meal there. We were introduced to Alondra, who was full of life and knowledge! She was great with explaining our gear and helping us put it on. We went in a group of 10 and she remembered all of our names! Prior to entering the caves, we did a Mayan ritual that really puts into perspective how sacred and monumental these caves are. The caves were beautiful. Alondra shared her knowledge and the history of all the formations. It was truly an intriguing experience! Afterwards, we were taken to our Mayan meal, which was delicious! Also, they do have photographers that take you photo during the excursion for urchase after you're done. Highly recommend this excursion and ask for Alondra, or Juanita, as she sometimes goes by it! lol
Cool place.. Beautiful inside. Can't take your own picks. But worth it enjoy the darkness and the beautiful views inside

Amazing!!!. Me, my husband and my son went to see this and loved every minute of it. Our guide Alondra was amazing. She was full of information and made our visit fun and exciting. While teaching us about the amazing history behind the cave and the Mexican culture. I highly recommend going to see this. It will be something you will never forget.
Amazing!. We had an amazing guide, Pablo! He was very knowledgeable about the caves. The tour was beautiful. This was the highlight to our trip! A once in a lifetime thing to see.
Cool Cave. This was a really cool cave adventure! I have never swam thru a cave before. I loved it and would highly recommend it to anyone!

Spectacular!!!! #1 in my book!!. Breathtaking caverns in the Yucatan! I did the plus adventure package. We rode bicycles to a cenote where we rappeled into a magnificent cave. If you like adventure go for the Privlage (expensive but extreme adventure) which I plan on doing when I return! Julian our tour guide was knowledgeable, attentive and very passionate about his job. This has been my favorite tour so far. It's busy but not too crowded like the theme parks.They don't let you take a camera and the pictures they sell are overpriced $25 for 1 $50 for 2 and $87 for all 15 or so pics.

Awesome tours of Mexicos beautiful cenote. First excursion on our 10 day honeymoon in Mexico. This is a very professional but laid back tour service that does a great job with its visitors. Our tour guide, Veronica, was AWESOME. She was very friendly and informative and was able to efficiently communicate with both english and spanish speaking individuals. Is a bit pricey compared to some of the other cenote sites in the yucatan penninsula, but is a fair price for what you get. They will provide wetsuits, water shoes, storage, and helmet w/ light free of charge. Cannot bring much else besides a bathing suit, but for good reason. The team at Rio Secreto does a fabulous job stressing the importance of preserving the fragile underground cenote, but without sacrificing quality. They also had a dedicated photographer with each tour group for multiple 'paparazzi' shots. You may purchase the photos afterwards, but for a price. A little steep in my mind but about on par with any theme park in the US. They fed us a nice lunch at the end and then did a great job coordinating transport home. Would definitely recommend this service to travelers looking to explore mexicos natural wonder.

Very Nifty. Rio Secreto is very beautiful and a must see when visiting Mexico. My boyfriend and I went together, The caves are so beautiful and we had an excellent tour guide named Santi. I do not know if I would go again, but at least I can I have visited it. They have photographers in the caves with you that take photos for purchase. The buffet after the tour was OK. Nothing special, not much variety but there was something you could eat.

Fun experience but expensive. This tour was a bit pricey for what was delivered. The highlights: rappel 50ish feet into cave and water, swimming through underground caves. Both of these experiences were amazing. Swimming through the underground cave system was really a special experience. The lowlights: to buy all pictures was $85 USD, $50 USD for 3 pictures, or around like $29 USD for 1 picture. The provided water shoes were not the greatest quality and I would suggest bringing your own water shoes/chacos/etc, but water shoes were provided at no cost to us. The wet suits and gloves for rappelling that were provided did have a musty smell to them, and the wet suit provided did not fit a tall person above 6'3 (bummer). We were satisfied with the food at the end. Transportation provided from entrance to caves/trails was fine but the road was an un paved "country" road which we had no problem with. Overall, we were highly satisfied with experience but just cannot give this place 5 stars b/c just too many things were missed or had an opportunity to improve during the tour.

Awesome day. We had a great day! Our tour guide was very friendly and open to any questions! The place itself is really nice if you're into the jungle-type of activities and weather, and the weather was super hot so the super cold water inside the cave was not that bad.If you're into cave exploring for more then an hour with a 'dive suit' then you're good to go.Definitely ask for Santiago, he was our guide, cool guy.
Interesting and unusual trip. Excellent trip and it's not too enclosed in the caves. Beautiful to see the natural caves, not far from Tulum if your on the Riviera or staying in Playacar.

Awesome!. I didn't know if I would like this. Freezing water, claustrophobia... But I shouldn't have worried. I loved it! My husband and two teens also thought it was the best excursion ever. Carlos was great, he answered all of our questions and was super helpful. A superb tour guide. Everything that you need is provided and lunch is included, too. The beauty of the caves is staggering. The stalagmites and stalactites are mind blowing. It's an adventure. We'd recommend Rio Secreto to anyone looking to have an amazing experience.

Unusual trip for two seniors. Although both in our early 70s, we decided to take this trip because we love caves. It turned out to be an exciting and fun-filled day, despite some reluctance on our part. Once suited up with water shoes, wet suit, life jacket and lighted helmet, we spent a challenging several hours exploring the cave with our jovial guide and friendly fellow explorers. It was a stupendous, if strenuous, tour, after which we had a delicious South American buffet meal and lively conversation with our new-found friends. After purchasing a commemorative photo (to prove to our relatives and friends that we actually did it), we had a pleasant bus trip back to our hotel, where we slept soundly that night. All in all, it was a great trip, which we recommend to all, regardless of age.

AMAZING EXPERIENCE RIO SECRETO!!!!. What an Amazing Experience, My daughter and I LOVE IT!JANO was our tour guide, He is the Best!We highly recommend it. This is a once in a lifetime experience!We will do it again.

Wow!!!! Amazing!!!. What can I say but wow and Amazing!! We went today and we had an amazing time!! Our 11yr old told us she would go back and do this excursion again in a heartbeat!! Daniell E was our guide and he was so good!! He loves his job and you can tell! He really gives you an experience that will be remembered! Thank you Daniell E Mother Earth has never been put into perspective as you did today!! Much respect for you and her! You must do this excursion if you are in Cancun!!!!

Breathtaking!!. This is a once in a lifetime experience! Alfredo was the best tour guide. I was nervous about being clausterphobic, but it was so open and beautiful, that it didn't bother me at all. You feel like you are on another planet down there and it takes your breathe away. Walking down there can be difficult for some people so I would wear really good water shoes.

Fantastic . My 6 year old son and I had an amazing experience today at Rio Secret. Our guide Nico was very informative. He was also very good with the kids in our group. Made the trek through the cavern very easy.Stunning to see. Amazing to think that we were standing in a piece of ecological history.Would recommend: but caution for anyone not sure footed. Zach and I did slip and came home with few scrapes.
Rio Secreto. Amazing trip through a cave. I am a big guy so a couple of spots were a little narrow but overall no problems. It was neat swimming in the underground river. Great guide!

Best Caves . I went to Rio Secreto with my wife to celebrate our honeymoon. Was an amazing excursion. We had a great time. The tour guide was very educational and helpful guiding throughout the tour. You get to walk through and swim through this tour, some amazing rock formations and just general experience of swimming through a cave was awesome. The food at the end was decent probably a 3/5, worst part is no cameras so they kinda stress you buy their pictures at the end which were pricey. Very good tour still.

Beautiful. The caves are absolutely beautiful and stunning. Our guide Diana was awesome. Yes, you have to wear their wet suits, which have been used multiple times before. The caves are uneven and the edges can be sharp, but this is explained in detail by the guides and it is the nature of the environment. Definitely go to enjoy the beauty. My only issue is that you have to be able to swim, which was not mentioned in the information provided by our cruise.

Incredible Experience!. The excursion was absolutely phenomenal. It certainly is a once in a lifetime experience that I would recommend to anyone travelling to the Mayan Riviera. They do not allow you to bring in your own cameras, and charge lots of money for photos ($25USD for one photo, $89USD for all photos). Do lot lets this detract you from the excursion as it is a wonderful experience for you to enjoy.

What an awesome experience!. This was my first time in a cave like this and it was totally cool and awesome! Our guide led us expertly and safely through the rocky waters and past amazing displays of stalagmite and stalactite formations! I highly recommend this activity!

Beautiful experience!. The caves are beutiful the plus pakcage is not really worth it the video is boring but the other tow caves are amazing the food is not to good their and it sucks that you cant take your own pictures their pictures are not all that great.

Amazing. One of the coolest thinks we have done. My family with a 8yr old went on the cave tour and it was amazing. If you want a really neat experience I suggest this. Not good for those who can not get around well lots of uneven surface.

Amazing!. Really enjoyed this - with a guide and ten other people you walk for an hour or two through interconnecting underground caves - you are well taken care of with water shoes, a wet suit, life preserver and hard hat with a light. Accept the walking stick they offer - you will need it to keep your balance on the uneven river floor. Not for those who have trouble walking on uneven ground - or for those who need to sit down and rest. This excursion has received the National Geographic for excellence for the last 5 years. It's worth the $109 US

one goal take all your money. The cave is nice, but the price is very high for what is it, the buffet they offer is not real buffet there is actually no real choice. Then they dont let you take picture in the cave, ... for they will tell you its for security reason or any reason they found. But no its just to scam you more money at the exit at 69 USD for the picture.i go ther to keep souvenir of my way to see end enjoy this cave, the fact that i cant take my picture the way i whant the way i enjoye this verry nice place... yes its amazing. i was turn off about this no picture policy. and then the carzy price they ask for one CD of not really good picture. juste picture of me, really i can found my face every morning in the mirror. When you go to other activity you can see they put a lot of money for the attraction, Rio Secreto they found one million years old cave and charge you to go... was free for theme. the price should be better and allow us to take picture in a particular moment, few time during the visite be creative, not all about moeny, and please, creat one buffet with choice, if not call this free meal not buffet.Sorry for Rio Secreto you miss the point, you miss it when you ask so much money for picture and this policy of no pics, you miss it all. Beautiful and Informational. I loved this place not only because of the beautiful caves and cenotes, but because of the emphasis that the staff puts on preserving this natural wonder. Our tour guide, Kezia, was so knowledgable about the history of the area and the culture, that I was able to learn tons of interesting info throughout the whole experience. Highly Recommend!!

Very good!. It was such an amazing experience, though it is a bit pricey! Our guide Lara was amazing! She looked after me and bf very well, as he cannot swim and i cannot ride a bike. She arranged transport for me and we all had life jackets. She kept my bf close to her at all times for the swimming (5min swim) but he did pretty good!! Our guide knew so much and we were very impressed, she was so funny and kept the conversations going. Our group was great too, all very social and did not mind about me and bf having difficulties doing some of the activities as they were supportive and had some banter with us. The buffet lunch was nice too, only problem i have is the price of the photos. Around £55.00 we paid for a few photos... i still got them, as they were pretty cool.
Dark but good. Julian did a great tour with us during our honeymoon, we toured one of the 4 caves and it was amazing to see this natural wonder.
Amazing Tour. Far and above this is the best tour we have ever taken in Mexico. This is an amazing place and we would go again in a heartbeat.

fun times. My wife and took this tour in November 2015. It was very different then your normal tour. We still talk about the way the guide took us back. we had to swim down a narrow channel, the helmet was scraping against the cave ceiling... This is something that you could never do in the USA..... Highly recommend for adventure seekers who are not claustrophobic

Excellent Excurion. This tour was professionally run from start to finish. The tour guide (Vero) was kind and knowledgeable. The caves were fascinating. The facilities were clean and appropriate. All necessary items were provided. There were plenty of photo opportunities; however, I found the prices of the photos a bit high. $25 for one photo or $90 for all.
Amazing!!!!. Absolutely amazing. The pictures are extremely over priced so unfortunately we don't have anything from this amazing experience to show others. But truly this was awesome.

Absolutely Amazing!. We would love to do this tour again and explore more of the caves. Nico was so knowledgable and had a true passion for his career and graciously passed that information to my family. We all will cherish this tour forever and will return someday.

Amazing. This is an amazing underground cave with a river that runs through it. We were in the cave for 2 hours. It IS very physical as the bottom of the river is very unlevel and hard to walk through so if you have knee problems like I do you might want to skip this. It took me nearly a month to get over the exertion on my knees, however I DID enjoy this activity.

Amazing underground cave experience!. This was definitely an unforgettable amazing adventure! I will start out by saying this is completely underground and there are no lights or openings of any kind, besides the flashlight of the guide and your headlamp. The pics kind of made it look like there was lighting to me but that was just the flash. There are a lot of uneven surfaces and blind step ups that you have to walk through and you have to bend down to duck under some of the formations so I would highly recommend taking the walking stick they offer. The views of all of the crystal formations were incredible! Our guide was Roberto and he was very informative and gave us a great tour. The buffet after was nothing too special but was pretty tasty. Overall I would highly recommend this to anyone looking to experience a Cenote in Playa del Carmen!

Best Excursion Yet!. This excursion was much more than we expected. Rio Secreto is a natural beauty on it's own, but the extremely knowledgeable guides made the experience that much better. I would highly recommend this as an excursion for all ages!

Fun half day trip. Really enjoyed it. Good fun, must less "sanitised" than the river swim at Xplor.Be aware that although the reception for Rio Secreto is on the highway it's a 20min minibus drive on a dirt road to the actual caverns so can be a little uncomfortable.Food after the tour was simple but tasty.Guide was great but a bit disappointed to be encouraged to tip him, I know in Mexico everyone works for tips but our group of 11 had basically just given the company that runs the place a thousand dollars, it would be nice if they paid their staff a bit better.

Words cant explain!!. The experience was magical and pictures don't do this place justice! It's something you just have to experience. You just have to go..trust me. Our guide Tomas was excellent and really added to the experience!!

Beautiful excursion . My wife and I truly enjoyed this Mayan adventure. Our guide, Jano, was a cool cat. He made us laugh, shared a lot of information about the cave formation and always made sure we were safe. He really made my wife feel at ease when she felt a little claustrophobic. I recommend this trip to those who are looking for something off the beaten path and to those who are looking to connect to the areas natural beauty and not so much for those looking for an excitement filled water park experience with hundreds of people. I would leave small children behind for this one. Shuttle to and from, food, drink, shots, swim gear is all included. Can't beat it. We loved it.

Good but rip-off on photos. Tour was great. We had Lara, she did a fantastic job telling us about the caves and was very eager to keep everyone safe. Throughout the tour a photographer will take your photos as you are not allowed your own camera in. At the end they wanted 90.00 for a photo CD of everyone or 25.00 for a single photo. They refused to barter on their crazy prices. We intended on buying the photos if they were more reasonable but we're turned off and spent no money instead. After going back to our resort we had several friends ask us about the experience which were told about their photo prices and chose not to book the excursion because of this. If you make photos 10. Each or 40-45 for the CD your company would do much better.

2nd time great day. This is our second visit to this site and this time we had a different cave to explore (I think they have 3).everything is very professional they provide you with the wet suit,sea shoes,life jacket,helmet with torch,towel and a walking stick if required.The guides we have had have been very informative and good fun, to explain the experience is very hard because it is so good, even my wife who is a bit claustrophobic was OK with the trips.They provide a photographer who goes round with you taking the photos (you are not allowed to take your own pictures) and you can buy a disc at the end of the trip (we did and they are great photos) lunch was provided which was good.Go and have a great time.

My birthday excusion. I really enjoyed this excursion, we had very good guide Alan, he was very patient, considering me and best are not swimmers, he and made our experience very memorable. This was something I only seen on television, so to actual experience it was amazing.

Unforgettable experience. Out of all the excursions we experience I must say Rio Secreto won 1st place! Our guide Fernanda was amazing, she really knows a lot about the cave. If your ever in town this place is a must.
Had a great time!. This was a wonderful adventure! Alex was a great guide. The caverns were beautiful. I would definitely recommend visiting.

Paradiso cave. We thoroughly enjoyed our experience today at Rio Secreto. Our guide Romaine was very professional, knowledgable , pleasant and took great care to ensure everyone moved through the cave safely. The way it was setup was also all about protecting the environment we were moving through. The caves were absolutely magnificent. Included in the price was transport from our hotel and lunch afterwards. It was all really well organised. The only negative was the huge cost of a photo cd at $89USD!! As you were unable to take any of your own photos we felt that was a bit steep. Overall it was a fabulous experience.

You couldn't do this in USA. My older adolescent children, wife and I really enjoyed this excursion. Booked as shore excursion out of Cozumel. Pablo was a superb guide throughout. You are not allowed to take cameras or wear dangly jewelry and must rinse off prior to entering the cavern. Lockers are provided. Wet suits, water shoes, helmets with lights, and water shoes are provided- all in good condition. There is a bit of a walk through rain forest prior to reaching cavern entrance. No fixed lighting in the cavern - all light is from your helmet lights and Pablo carried a flashlight to point out things of particular interest. No rales - you walk on the uneven cave floor mostly in water. Walking sticks are also provided and good for me to have one. There are portions of the cavern passage where you must literally swim. It is a beautiful and memorable experience. Our excursion included a buffet lunch of local food. From Cozumel pier you must take a 40 minute ferry ride to mainland (caution to those prone to motion sickness) and then about 30 minutes on bus to cave site.

Best eco tour and new attraction. We booked our tour through best day tours at THE Royal, Playa del Carmen. Price was $120 but they agreed to match an online price PLUS upgraded to Rio Secreto PLUS.WOW ! We have been on tours throughout the Caribbean (20+ islands) plus the usual suspects in Mexico from Cabo to Cancun. We were EXTREMELY pleased with our small group of 6 total, led by biologist Raul. We asked him to expand the tour to include more comments on flora, fauna before and after the caves. He did and, during the lunch break, showed us recent clips from wildlife cameras (Deer hunters: think trail cameras) showing jaguars and other native wild animals. The cave experience was incredible. We saw stalactites and stalagmites galore, with much geological and paleological background. We highly recommend the tour. Do a Google search to find best rates ... they will typically price match.
Favorite Excursion of the Cruisel. Words can not describe the experience. Our guide, Alfredo, was simply THE BEST! His passion for his job made it an extraordinary, once in a lifetime experience!

Great day. Nice 1.5 hour walk , swim, crawl, and climb thru this underground water cave system . They supply you with water shoes ,wet suit, hat with miners light, and also water vest. Great as one of kind tour. A must do when you are in Riviera Maya area.

AMAZING!!!!!! MUST DO IT. This is absolutely worth every cent... We did it through Carnival. The tourist guides LOVE their jobs. We did this excursion with the ATV. There is NOTHING absolutely NOTHING to complain about. I am claustrophobic and I was not afraid or felt at risk what so ever. This river is absolutely amazing. I cannot describe the experience you will have... You MUST GOO!!!

Fantastic experience, loved it.. We booked this trip through a travel rep based at our hotel Catalonia Royal Tulum ( a staff member there called Diego recommended it ). The bus ride was approximately 30 mins from our hotel, we arrived at Rio Secreto and filled in some forms and were then put into groups, the drive to actual caves was a bit bumpy and takes a bit of time. Our guide was a young lady called Kazia, she was really knowledgeable and gave us plenty of information about the caves, Mayan people, jungle etc. Our group of 9 had all opted for the PLUS experience which involved a walk through a dry cave with a fantastic projection show on the cave walls, from here we changed into swimsuits, wet suits and helmets ( we had our own water shoes but they were available to anyone who needed them ). A locker is available for your valuables and a towel is given to you at this point to put in the locker, cameras are prohibited in the caves. We then made our way to the second cave on pedal bikes ( very hot and bumpy but good fun). We rappelled/abseiled about 45 feet into the cave, first time for me, loved it, sheeing the rest of the group's head torches pointing up at you was a bit eerie, the water was pristine and cool, appealing after the 30-32 degrees above ground. We walked through this cave, the water was only about thigh level, quite spectacular to see all the formations, Kazia explaining as you go along. A set of stairs takes you back out into the daylight, from here we cycled to another area where we had some refreshing fruit and water, got life jackets on and walked into a different section of cave. Swimming was involved a couple of times here, quite deep in places, at one point the 10 of us sat in shallow water in complete silence with all torches off, wow, you need to experience it, quite incredible. A photographer joins you throughout taking pics that can be purchased, this was probably the only negative comment, the cost was quite hefty, 1 pic $25, 2 pics $40, 3 pics $50 or about 10-12 pics for $89, we opted for 1 pic ( needed some evidence of the abseil) ...Think more people would purchase pics if they were better priced.A buffet meal was also included, the soup was great but the rest was just average. There's hammocks dotted around to relax while waiting for your return transport.Do eat before doing trip, it's a while before you have anythingDo bring $ or pesos to tip the guideDo take the cane on offer to help stabilise you, some sections can be trickyDo allow the whole day for the PLUS trip, we left at 8am and returned at 4pmDon't take cameras into the cave.Fantastic experience overall, would definitely recommend it.

Totally amazing experience. Swimming in the Cenotes was a incredible, then snorkelling with the Sea Turtles. an honour. I booked through the hotel to Snorkel in the Cenotes and then onto swim with the Sea Turtles. Truly a remarkable experience. I was well taken care of as I was on my own during the trip. I felt very safe and enjoyed it so much.

Super cool underground river exploration. A great day to explore the underworld of stalactites & stalagmites in Mexico! Who knew this existed in the jungles of Mexico?! Discovered 10 years ago, but open to the public just 8, this was a memorable activity to do while in riviera maya area. We booked the tour through our hotel. There are 2 time options to tour- we went with the noon departure-- returning @5:30. Once at the site, we listened to an intro on what to expect while on our adventure. We were then divided into groups ( language & age). Lara, our guide, was terrific! Knowledgeable&passionate.We were given water shoes, a wet suit, life jacket & helmet w/ a headlamp. Our journey began w/ a Mayan blessing-- we then went below the surface & explored the "caves"....other worldly! Buffet Lunch is included -- just okay. National geographic endorsed! ( no cameras allowed)

Great Experience! We are in love! A Must Go!. We loved the experience overall! Everything was smooth and as planned. They exceeded our expectations. Jano was our guide and he was amazing, very knowledgeable and fun! We want to go back when in the area again.Thanks guys it was awesome!

Not for the weak of knees. Rio Secreto is a wonderful adventure, where you are guided through caverns and underground caves under the watchful eye of experienced guides. We had not be told before we chose this activity how much walking on uneven terrain would be entailed. It made for some challenges for someone with a balance issue or knee/hip problems. It would have been inaccessible for anyone with mobility issues. The guide was most helpful and ensured that all returned safely above ground.The opportunity to experience this underground river system was amazing, and well worth the tired bones at the end of the day.

An after noon of fun and adventure.... My wife and I went and did the Rio Secreto tour a little while back. It was really nice. We enjoyed the beauty of the setting. The cave was spectacular. I've visited a lot of caves over the years. I've visited the cave at Great Basin National Park, the cave at Timpanogos Cave National Monument, and this cave in Mexico is COOL!!! Part of the attraction is that we were both in and out of the water wearing wet-suits. Outside of the cave in the above portion of the resort is a nice area for relaxing with hammocks and such. The changing facilities are clean and seemed relatively secure. Oh, I wouldn't put jewelry in the little wooden closet that they give each person, but it seemed OK to leave my wallet there.If I had to find something to complain about, it is that they don't allow you to take your own camera into the cave. So, you are basically forced to purchase at least one photo so that you have something to show your friends back home. And, that is what we did. We were strong and purchased a single photo so that we had something to E-mail people make them jealous. :-) Nobody would have wanted to see 20 photos of us in the cave. But a single photo is probably worth it. Just my thoughts on the subject.

Great great great cenotes . This is the best cenotes I have ever been so far. $79 is worth for doing this. It is so amazing of this cave. Tour guide is so friendly , and helpful for everything. He did a great job.. You should go this cenotes, only this one in Cancun. Highly recommend.

The Mayan Underworld. We visited this wonderful place with our friends it is stunning our guide Tomas could not do enough for us all he was very knowledgeable and very helpful. If you are not claustrophobic and can swim I would really recommend going here.

A Great Experience . We've been to many caves before, but this was our first time in a cave where you wear a wetsuit and swim through half of it. The time spent in the cave was a great time, and I would definitely recommend the experience.There were only a couple of negatives: the ride from the entrance of Rio Secreto to the cave took way too long and was not enjoyable, as the van had to drive on extremely rough terrain.Also the meal after the excursion was rushed and just OK. But hey... you aren't going there for the meal anyway.All in all, a good time, and worth the cost.

Even my wife liked it. . I have been in wild caves many many times. I like caving. My wife does not. She and I went on this trip together. She had a really good time.  Cenotes were so clean and pristine.  Tour guid did an excellent job. Water is cool but not cold. Caves are not muddy or dirty. I think I came out cleaner than I went in. Food at the end needs help. Hot sauce should be outlawed. Not even funny. Great trip.

Magnificent cave adventure. We picked up this excursion from Cozumel and rode a 45 minute ferry to the mainland. We then took a bus about 30 minutes to the location. We were then given all the gear necessary for the trip. Diana guided us through the caves which were absolutely stunning. Some areas were tight, some areas we were in deep water, and some areas were rocky and slick, so make sure this sounds like your kind of adventure. My wife and I thought it was amazing and highly recommend it. Tour guide Diana was very informative and clearly knew her stuff. After about 1.5 hours, we had an authentic buffet of Mexican foods which was actually quite tasty. After lunch we were brought back out of the jungle for about 2 hours to shop or walk the beach or whatever. This was wasted time, however. Most of us wanted to head back to Cozumel but we had to wait for the ferry and thus had no time in Cozumel. Overall the trip was fantastic but I'd recommend them bringing everyone back immediately following lunch.

Great experience for all ages. I went to Rio Secreto with my 12 year old daughter and we both had tons of fun. The place is really unusual and beautiful. Guides are knowledgeable and friendly. Couple of things to note. If you purchase a trip to Rio Secreto through one of the agencies and it includes food, the food will be mediocre at best. The transportation is decent, not ideal, since they are trying to fill the van before it departs, especially on the way back and it may take time and some commotion will happen. Pictures will be professionally done and expensive and you cannot take your own.

Amazing caves, wonderful experience!. I absolutely loved the Rio Secreto tour. Our guide, Alfredo, was fantastically informative, fun, and took very good care of us. The experience is right up my alley - a fun, and not overly difficult hike/float through an extensive cave system for about an hour and a half. The caves just go on and on - it was fun pointing the helmet flashlight down a side cavern and wondering where it went. At one point, we all turned off our lights and just floated in the darkness, which was a cool experience. At another, we spotted some fresh green shoots growing in the absolute darkness underground, to our surprise. The experience of coming out of the cool, comfortable cave into the hot, humid jungle, and seeing what a thin layer of rock and soil separated the lush jungle from the caves below was surreal. I absolutely recommend the experience.Logistically, they provided everything we needed - show up in a bathing suit but no sunscreen, insect repellants, creams, etc (they'll have you shower before going to the caves) so as not to pollute the water. They provide helmets, lights, life jackets, water shoes, and optional wetsuits (not a bad idea). There are bathrooms with small changing stalls and lockers provided. No cameras allowed, but each group is accompanied by a professional photographer with the option to buy the photos afterwards (which contain a mixture of individual shots walking through the caves, posed group shots, and occasional shots that really capture the caves themselves). The actual caves are a bumpy 10 min(? didn't really time it) van ride down dirt roads from the parking area.
Very expensive but its a different experience. Good guides and different experience. Nice food at the end.Try to bring your own diving shoes- if not - the team give you one.

Great caves. Caves are beautiful and staff is friendly and helpful. Great experience.
The only thing we did not like that after we had 2 caves and bike trip we were already tired and hungry but we had to go the the main cave for 1.5 hours trip without any snack and rest break.
Alfredo is the best guide !. Unbelievable beauty and amazing experience. Alfredo is literally living his dream and is unbelievably kind and knowledgeable about the attraction. Loved it!

Excellent information. We had Pablo as our guide through the cave to begin with. He was very knowledgeable about the caves and history of the Mayan culture. Pablo loves his job and is passionate about his job. The buffet lunch was great with a variety of food. We did the plus tour. It included a bike ride to repel in to a cave and walk through another cave to see a light show. It was worth the extra $30 USD.

Amazing one life time experience!!. Well organized trip with all the necessary mandatory equipment (helmet, special suit, etc...) furnished + food and soft drinks included.It's a one life time experience you need to do if you travel to Cancun or Mayan Riviera.

Outstanding and amazing!. This was even better than I'd hoped for. I would suggest it for anyone of almost any age. The guides (Tomas is WONDERFUL) are very attentive and careful. You do have to be able to wake, and at least float, but it's not overly strenuous. It is very difficult to describe, but check out the photos and know that you'll have your breath taken away by how unique and special this place is. They provide everything you need: wetsuit, helmet with light, water shoes, lockers, lunch, everything. Well worth the money and time.

Second time and will do again!. We first visited Rio Secreto in 2008 when tours were just beginning. This is a unique experience where you tour caverns in a wet suit with hard hat and head lamp. You not only walk through the cavers but swim in them. We had a fabulous guide, Daniele, and were impressed with his knowledge of the caverns and surrounding area. We appreciated how in tune is was with nature. It's gotten a bit more commercialized since 2008 but still a fabulous tour! We will definitely return whenever in Cancun!

Wonderful experience!. 20 minutes ride from entrance to facility.5 minute walk to mayan priest for small ritual.Than 10 minute walk to cave entrance.Inside cave what an experience thanks to our guide Victoria.No personal photos, but photographer on site.Nice liquor shot and meal after visit.Really enjoyed this.

Review. Must see. This was by far the best part of the trip. These caves are amazing. The tour guides are awesome and tell you lots about the Mayan history in the area. The guides know the layouts of the caves very well so they can navigate you through them safely. You're in the caves for about an hour and a half, so it's well worth the money. Once your tour of the caves is complete they provide lunch for you. The food is cooked by local Myans and was the best food I had on the whole trip. This is definitely a must see if you visit Playa del Carmen.

Excellent for families. My husband and I (grandparents) took our daughter, her husband and two grandchildren ages 7 and 10. I have never had a better excursion on a vacation in my life! It was fantastic. Our guide was knowledgeable and we got some great photos of the family. The lunch after was very good and I can't say enough good things about doing this!!! Very professional, very interesting, it was just an amazing experience. Would go again!!!
Wonderful experience!. I had such a great time on this tour. The guide was very informative and made the tour fun! Very relaxing! Recommend it 100%!

Not your average review!. I never finished the tour. So, I can't give you a full review. The beginning started out interesting, and fun. Our tour guide, Miguel was the kindest person. I being a 53 year old female with double knee replacements,I started to think that perhaps this wasn't exactly the right terrain for me. But Miguel held my hand to navigate the precarious trek.Suddenly,(I have been told) I had a seizure. Miguel,apparently not just a tour guide. But, highly trained for emergency situations, let into action. To make a horrifying, long story short. Miguel stayed with me through out the entire ordeal all the way to the hospital. And stayed until I was stable. I even just received an email from him. Asking how I was. I am at loss of words about this young man.So, if you are planning a trip to Rio Secreto. Rest assured you are in very good hands!!!!I am so grateful to Miguel,and his staff for saving my life!

Ncl dawn shore excursion. Having done most types of shore excursions this is something very different but was an amazing tour and is a great setup. Wetsuits and water shoes are provided and we're clean. Guides were very friendly and helpful. Lunch was included and while simple was very nice.. If there,s one shore excursion I would recommend this would be it.. Would love to spend more time here exploring the huge network of tunnels.

No snorkel or diving. Stunning natural wonder. We explored 1 of 3 xenota's and were fascinated at the history and life living underground. It was one of our highlights on the trip. However, there is NO snorkeling, diving or swimming here. Some floating. You are provided a spring suit, vest, booties, helmet and headlamp. It can be a little tricky & require some concentration navigating where you step in the water with an uneven bottom. Hint: Don't feel shy or embarrassed using a walking pole(offered where you suit up). Our guide, though new, seemed knowledgable and was enjoyable. The provided lunch was nice. Here's where I'd take 2 points away...Our young photographer, was inexperienced & horrible. Most of the pictures were blurry. Our group consisted of 8 people, and the photographer wanted $400 for a group purchase or $40 per picture!!! He was indignant when we asked for a reduced price. Also, overheard another photographer in a different group charging a lesser overall & individual price. What the what?! I hate the feeling of being ripped off. It left a poor taste in our mouth and reputation on the company. (P.s.- Our resort had pro photographers on site who edit and give you pics at $25 ea if that gives you any idea.) Remedy: though they frown on bringing your own camera, IF you have a small waterproof with a flash(necessary) or GoPro, tuck it in your vest or leg of your wetsuit and use it, I say. You paid for the trip and it's not illegal to take pictures, especially if you take responsibility of your own camera. :)Overall, the company was well organized and friendly...as long as you stay away from the photos.

Amazing Experience . My friend and I had a great time at Rio Secreto!! The caves were beautiful and out guide Mely was awesome, make sure to ask for her!! The food provided was delicious and we even got to participate in a mayan cheers! The experience is definitely worth it!
Tulum Caves. this was a great experience. Ziplining into the caves was so exciting. We also did ATVing and a tour of the Mayan ruins.

A wonderful place!. One of a kind experience! Crystal waters, National Geographic Top Ten Mayan excursions. Our tour guide, Vicky, was very knowledgeable, kind and provided the confidence and support needed specially to those that were a little afraid to go inside a cavern for the first time. Great Experience!

Rio Secreto. It was great. Our guide Tomas was knowledgeable and kind. The only thing that decreased the experience for me was the price of the pictures. Way too expensive and it was clear this was a way to gouge the tourists.

Amazing. This was an excellent adventure. The cave system is stunning. No photos really do it justice, you need to experience it first hand. Perfect vacation excursion if you are looking for some adventure of a different kind. Our guide, Julian was fun and very helpful and knowledgeable throughout the trip. The water was refreshing to swim in... perfect for the hot Mexican day. Will go back and do it again!

Fantastic. Fantastic to do as part of a trip ,the cave is pitch black and were given torches ,..you go in and before you know it you are up to your waist in water .You can take the easy way out or go with your guide the hard way on your belly . Fun day ..

Wow!! What an amazing attraction to see. Such a cool thing to experience... I only wished it was a longer tour!! Very interesting and to know that it was only discovered in 2006 makes us some of the first people to see it!

Incredible adventure. The hike and swim thru the caves was an incredible experience. I am very happy that I was able to experience this underground adventure. Highly recommend this half day adventure.

Pretty sure you won't do this at home!. This tour, as were most of the tours, was what I would consider a bit pricey. It runs about $100. That being said, it was really awesome!! Honestly it is something you would probably never do any other time. The guide, Alondra, was awesome. Her English was really good. She was funny , entertaining and very caring. She made sure we were all safe and knew what was going on ahead of time. You wear a life jacket ,a wet suit, water shoes and a helmet that are provided to you. You are also provided a locker which you keep the key to so your belongings are safe. The water was not over our heads. They say the temp of the water is 77, It sure seemed colder, but it was very warm outside so it may have just seemed that way. The tour goes through the caves with just a head lamp and the guides flashlight. This really made the trip extra special.. no electric lights. We love caves so this was riight up our alley. If you are claustrophobic this may not be for you. You cannot take your phones or cameras inside. They take a LOT of pics and then sell them to you. $25 for one , $40 for two... we didn't buy the photos. Definately worth going to as it was really was something special that you probably won't do somewhere else.

Amazing Secret River!!. By far the coolest thing I have ever done! The process to get from the ship to Rio Secreto was seamless thanks to Addy and once we got there our tour was led by Julian who was fantastic. The prices for the pictures were reasonable and there was no pressure to buy. Food was great too! Of course the caves were amazing. It's not something you can describe and the pictures do not do them justice! It's something you definitely have to experience first hand. Word of caution... They aren't kidding with needing to be fully mobile. You are often in tight areas which require you to squat, kneel, shimmy, swim and climb. Those with knee/hip/back problems may have a tough time. The road to the river is also VERY bumpy. They keep it this way on purpose to make it difficult to get to so this beautiful place isn't ruined by those not on guided tours. For those who are doing this as part of a shore excursion from a cruise ship...I do wish we didn't have to hang around Playa del Carmen after to wait for the ferry (about 2 hours). You can go back earlier on your own but you have to pay your own way ($15 for ferry and $8 taxi fare). All that is included if you wait but there isn't really much to do other than window shop in expensive, high end stores or grab a Starbucks.
fun time with friends. this place is the best! we had a cool Gide we learned a lot about the place! beautiful the water Crystal clear

Amazingly close to such natural marvels. Mexico is blessed with many limestone caves and Rio Secreto is a gem. Access into and out of the caves and along the underground rivers is very well managed both in terms of safe small groups and how well the guides represent the history of these marvels. Prepare to have all your senses enriched by the shear beauty of the stalagmites and -tites. Some cave passages are a little tight but my partner who is claustrophobic passed threw them with as much wonder and awe as all of us. The guides make this such a pleasant experience. And the Mayan meal after the tour was also great adding to the cultural enlightenment.

Absolutely Amazing - Alfredo is THE MAN!. I cant wait to go again. Alfredo, our tour guide, is one of the most passionate people I have ever met. Absolutely loves what he does. Thank you Sir! I highly recommend this excursion. Happy Sailing!

Breathtaking underground river. This was an amazing tour. and so glad we did it. This underground river was just discovered in 2006 and is millions of years old. . Our tour guides Addy and Aldondra were awesome. Both were very sweet and informative The tour supplied all equipment and towels for showers at the end and lockers for you stuff. All you need is a bathing suit. You cant wear any jewelry or take cameras. They take all the pictures and you can buy them. A hot lunch was provided afterwards.This place is so amazing !!!!! There is no light other than the helmet lights so if you are scared of the dark. don't go. It is tricky walking through the water at times but that made it more interesting and the groups are small so everyone helps each other. At times we were walking and other times we swam. At one point we laid in a circle in the water and turned off our lights....it was so dark and quiet...you just heard the water dripping...Then they flashed lights which lit up the ceiling....wow !!!!!so amazing!!!!! The views were incredible and breathtaking !!!! I Highly recommend seeing this Place....I've been in the caverns in NC and this place blows that place away !!!

WOW - this place is awesome!. Great nature reserve, amazing stalactites/stalagmites in this cave. Tour guide Pablo was informative, kind and nature conscious. tours are scheduled in such a way you don't see any other groups, so it feels like you are in a private tour. We had two seniors in our group, Pablo helped her with every turn and details, so patient!! We did the "plus" tour, means we get to rapel down to the cave, so fun!! Highly recommend this place!!

Amazing Secret River. What an amazing trip! I was more than a little scared, but once I got down into the cave and saw how beautiful it was, all my anxiety washed away. The best part was when we all floated in a circle and turned our head lamps off and basked in the absolute darkness of the cave. Our guide Veronica (Vero) was awesome!
Amazing tour. really worth going there. Amazing place and tour. better than any cenote or other underground rivers that we went

Amazing nature adventure!. As nature and travel lovers we've known caves in different parts of Mexico, but this time Río Secreto (Secret River) surprised us because it's the first tour where we see they fully respect the nature of the grotto, due to this, there's no artificial illumination, you have to visit it adapting yourself to the irregularities of the soil, going in and out of the water and taking care one of each other in your group to complete the trip.Of course, the park gives you all the necessary gear to experience the cave as lifejacket, wet suit, helmet with LED light, water shoes and a guide that gives you all the briefing before entering the cave and taking care of you all the time. You also have to shower before entering and can't use any chemical in your body to keep the cleanliness of the water. Obviously, you can't touch anything inside the cave to avoid damaging the delicate formations.Because of all this care they have, knowing this cave gives you an amazing experience, where you can see untouched the wonderful stalagmites and stalactites formed during thousands of years, enjoy the crystal clear river inside and have a glimpse of what professional cave explorers see when entering an unexplored grotto.Don't miss this experience on your next trip to Riviera Maya.

One of the best excursion that is not diving/snorkelling related in the ara!. Sort version of the review : Wow.Longer version :This excursion can seem pricey but I now believe that it is entirely worth it's price.It's a completely closed Cenote and for most of the 1.5 hours of the excursion you will be completely blown away by the stalactites and stalagmites as well as to actually see the perfectly clear water that are flowing underground.You will be away from your hotel for a half day ( I suggest going in the morning, it is less crowded), and a buffet is provided after the activity on the site.The whole feel and looks of the place is absolutely breath taking, it's impossible to fully understand unless you actually do it.I honestly don't want to say more than that because I would not want to ruin the experience, but it has been a magical moment for our group of 6.Things to note : - It is a somewhat physically demanding excursion where you will be walking on very uneven surfaces that are most of the times covered in cold water.- They provided water shoe, a head lamp and a wetsuit -The excursion is a mixture of walking and swimming-No pictures are allowed inside other than the photographer that comes along. If there is one thing that IS overpriced, it's the pictures for 90 USD for the package.

Magical. Very unique experience. Fun, not too physically demanding, but be prepared to swim, duck/crouch at times, and mild hiking. Kid friendly activity as long as your kid is comfortable in the water. Probably should be 5 or close to it at a minimum. They provide life vests, wet suits and water shoes. The age range in the group I was with was 5 to late 60s. Everyone enjoyed it.

Best part of our trip. This is the most amazing place I have ever seen. The guide we had was wonderful and very entertaining (Rudolfo). It's the only attraction I have ever gone to on vacation that I can honestly say I would go back to again and again.
You won't regret it!. Really enjoyed this tour, beautiful rock formations, crystal clear waters. Our guide Andres was really great. It was amazing!!

Awesome Excursion! . We really loved exploring the Rio Secreto Mayan Underworld. Our guide was a direct descendent of an indigenous group that grew up living in the area. His mom was an herbal, natural healer. We learned so much about the botany in the region. I had no idea how many plants were used for different ailments. It was so fascinating. They have a photographer who takes photos throughout the exploration and you can purchase the CD to take home. The colors and formations are spectacular. The groups are relatively small which we really enjoyed. It was an amazing day! The caves are incredible! Don't miss it!

Worth It. Very enjoyable not only because of the amazing setting but also because our guide, Nico, really added to the experience with his knowledge, passion and humor. Agree with the other reviewer that the constant presence of photography through the beginning bit of the tour kind of distracts from taking it all in but I suppose the demand for those photos keeps it a part of the package. We kind of wished there was a photo opportunity for when you begin to re-emerge from the cave as this was breathtaking and would have been a little less intrusive but these are minor gripes/suggestions. We had a great time and would make a point of returning for sure.

pretty. lots of walking climbing up and down the "rocks", beautiful place to see. tour guide ramon took us on a different trail away from everyone else so we were away from the crowds and commotion of everyone.

An amazing adventure. This is by and large the best tour we did during our time in Mexico. The caves are absolutely stunning and our guide Kazia was fantastic.One note, the photography turned out beautifully from the professional photographer, but it felt as if we were constantly taking photos down there. I would have liked more time to enjoy the darkness :)

Once in a lifetime experience. If you only do one think in Mexico do Rio Secreto. We did the shorter of the 2 options and are already planning on doing the longer version when we return to Mexico later this year.Our guide Beneto was just fabulous so knowledgable and an experienced cave diver so we couldn't have been in better hands.Not many places in the world you can experience swimming through cavern in the crystal cler water.

Awesome trip and guide. This visit was truly amazing. Our tour guide Alfredo made the visit come to life. If you get alfrefo, you will have a great time. He respects the caverns and brings them to life. It was a great day.

Must be seen.. Thanks Pablo (our Guide). Absolutely a beautiful natural wonder. You can't bring your camera or GoPro inside and after doing it I know why, you'll slip and kill yourself. Buy there photo.

Great escape for the day. We decided to go with the Plus tour and it was definitely worth the little extra. We were on the site for 6 hours and our guide, Danielle was great. His knowledge of the caves (his office) and love for the environment were on full display. If you're into zip lining and riding an ATV, with little concern for the environment this one isn't for you.

Not to be missed!!. This was the best excursion I had in years. Nico (our guide) was terrific full of knowledge and a great sense of humor. The guide consists of wet suit, water safety vest,helmet with a light, and water shoes. The excursion into the secret caves begin with a traditional blessing from the shaman. Entering the caves leaves one full of anticipation. The fresh water for the Yucatan peninsula is found in the cenotes that can be found throughout the area. The tour is 90 minutes long going through several grottos either on foot or "swimming" through the various pools. The caves are full of interesting lives from microscopic to fish, and to bats. I could not believe the excursion ended, it felt that it was only 5 minutes since the start. Highly recommended

NICE AWESOME EXPERIENCE. Went with friends from work at night it was a bit chilli but they give you the equipment to feel much better. Food was good, if you have problems with knees do not go or if you are scared of the darkness

One of the most memorable trips I have done. This is an environmental preserve, dedicated to preserving as much as possible of the caves that underlie the area - since many are being destroyed by new building. The journey thru the caves is amazing, and I will do this trip again this year.

My Wife's Good Idea. My wife, Jacquelyn, saw this shore excursion after we signed up for a western Caribbean cruise on the Carnival Conquest. I would have gravitated toward scuba diving but this was a rare opportunity. This cave apparently was only found in 2006.Only ten percent is open for tours. We had an invocation from a local person, complete with burning amber and then had an amazing tour through the cave which is lit only by our helmets and a couple of flashlights. It is somewhat strenuous, but a nice change from sitting around on a cruise ship. I enjoyed the liqueur, food and wildlife in the jungle area at the end.

Fun but Not for the faint of heart.... We went as a group and had a fantastic time but if you are claustrophobic or afraid of the dark, this excursion might not be for you. After getting a wet suit on, swim shoes and a hard hat with a head lamp; the knowledgable & interesting guides take you underground and through an underwater cave. Although I am in good shape, I did take a walking stick because I have a bum knee. The walk was challenging and I was glad I had the walking stick. It was a fascinating experience but there were a few tight/narrow passages that might be unnerving for some people.Overall, I would highly recommend this excursion! It was a unique, interesting and intense experience but it was also a lot of fun!

Absolutely Amazing. The only problem I have with this place is that my experience was over way too fast! This is one of the most amazing places I have ever been to and will definitely go back next time I am in the Playa Del Carmen Area!

AMAZING. These underground caves are nothing like we had ever seen before AND nothing like we expected. Our tour guide, Diana, was SO knowledge and loved her job so much. You go walking through the forest to the entrance of the underground caves where you take steps down into it. It is a combination of walking and swimming. It was definitely a workout to say the least and we were very happy that we are on the shorter side navigating through the structures. We had a younger child (I think 9-10 years old) in our group and he did great! Not sure how it would go with younger children as it was a bit challenging for me as an adult! This tour is like nothing you will ever see! AMAZING

Highlight of our trip. Absolutely recommend this trip. We were not sure about having to wear a wetsuit and a helmet (with light) but the whole experience was great. Our guide was knowledgeable (and funny). Small groups (of 10) which was nice.
Very clean, and entertaining place. The night show is a must see.. The night show was amazing with nearly 300 people performing. So, so, so amazing!!! We loved the fireball hockey.

Family visit with our kids : 3 and 6 years old. We booked this tour at our resort with Sunwing. We were disapointed. The travel agent didn 't know about this excursion because it's really unappropriate for yound kids. It should be at least 6 years old, as you have to walk a lot on rocky surfaces, and to swim in cold water. You cannot really take your kid in your arms as you need a wood stick to walk and it's rocky. We are in good shapes and our kids too. But our son cried from beginning to end. Also, you are getting fooled with pictures......you pay for the tour and you cannot even take one picture of you or the cenote....you have to buy the picture if you want a souvenir, and it cost 90$US for usb key with all the pictures, or 25$US for only one picture!!! Tour is half of day including transportation. 1h30 in the cenote. Lunch included buffet style.

Totally unique experience. My husband and I went last week and it was completely unlike anything we had ever experienced before. SO BEAUTIFUL. Our guide Tako was super knowledgeable and passionate about the site and tried his best to manage a difficult group. Overall we had a great day. PROS--great all weather activity (also good if you have a bad sunburn and need a day out of the sun)-food was delicious and authentic-preservation of the environment is obviously a big priority-not nearly as touristy or busy as many other parks in this area. small group size made it a more intimate experience-only a half day commitment -not even possible to fully communicate the natural beauty of the cavernsCONS--if your group sucks the experience is definitely tarnished-rio secreto needs to do a better job of communicating that this is a relatively physically demanding experience and isn't a great idea for small children or the elderly / injured-minimum age limit should be WAY older than 4 years old-quality of the professional photos was kind of "meh" and they were $$$$Would definitely recommend the experience to anyone interested in the environmental, historical and adventurous side of the Mayan Riviera.

WHAT A THRILL. This was a totally amazing experience and one that I would highly recommend to anyone visiting the Riviera Maya. We had booked the excursion thru the Air Transat rep at the hotel and it worked out to be $218.00 USD for 2 Adults and 1 child.You start out from the main lobby by travelling by van thru the jungle on a long windy and very bumpy road. Once you arrive at the main area, you are provided with a wetsuit, life jacket, helmet and water shoes (yes, they do provide them). From that point, it's about a 10 minute walk until you read the entrance to the underwater cenotes. It is such an incredible experience to walk and swim through pools of fresh water and look at the surrounding rock formations with date back to over 1.5 million years old. It is hard to put into words just how amazing it is to be underground but yet and no time did I ever feel the slightest bit claustrophobic.Our tour guide was Yayo and he did a fantastic job of explaining the history of the place and has an excellent knowledge on the geology of the area. He was very engaging and would highly recommend him as a guide.Once the tour is over, you hand all your kit back and then an authentic Mayan buffet lunch is provided which was quite good. The only negative comment I can leave was on the high cost of pictures. There is a photographer with every group and he takes photos of each person at different points on the tour. I would have loved to have some of the pictures, however the cost was completely unreasonable. It was $25USD for 1 picture and something like $100 for a usb stick with pics on them. No reason for charging so much. I have the memory of the tour but would have loved to have the images.

Best Excursion. Beautiful, relaxing and a must see. The experience was wonderful and unlike anything we had ever done before. They give you everything you need and you don't need to be a good swimmer. The sights were brethtaking.
