Fantastic tour. This did not feel overly commercialized and our guide Valentino was exceptional. Even though we knew there were lots of tours we felt totally private and the food buffet at the end was an added bonus.

Unbelievable experience ! . This was an excursion we took as part of our cruise -we wanted something different and not the normal beach or shopping trip. It was truly momentous and would highly recommend to anyone ! It is a beauty and experience you will not be able to find elsewhere. Our guide Hector was fantastic and reiterated several times that his one mission was to ensure we had fun, and he would take care of the rest. Hope you get the opportunity to try this!

Awesome!!. Awesome experience!! Ask to have Alfredo as your tour guide. You can truly tell that he loves his job. It was an amazing experience going along with Alfredo and having him explain everything about the Cenote to us. They offer 5 different paths that you can go through. We went through the supreme path. I would recommend using a walking stick because the ground is uneven and times and it helps you maintain your balance. If we make it back to the area with my kids we would bring them to it. After the tour they do give you a buffet style lunch with traditional Mexican food. It was better than most of the food at my resort.

once in a lifetime experience at secret river(no more secret to us anymore). On March 3rd. 2016 we had this awesome excursion. Our guide in my view probably the best one Valentino, kudos to you sir and thank you very much. He showed and explained everything in detail for the uneducated people like me. I think this is the closest you can get to mother nature. My wife and I really liked it and enjoyed it. The lunch to complement the experience very authentic. Can't thank you enough. Joe and Lupe Gonzalez

Out of the world experience. Did the "Palace" section with our guide Nunes. Guide takes good care of you. I enjoyed the swimming sections and the total dark experience. The purchase of the USB stick is worthwhile for your memories afterwards. Great FB photos for sure. Recommend this as one of your TO DO excursions in the Playa Del Carmen, MX area.

A fun trip through the caverns.. This would have easily been a five star excursion if not for the following negatives. I want to mention them up front, because everything else is going to be a glowing recommendation.First, the transportation to and from the activities was pretty poor. The ride there included picking up a couple who either stopped drinking really, really late or had already indulged in some morning drinking. Their vulgarity and the real threat of the gentleman throwing up didn't start the morning well. After watching a quick video we loaded up in vans and took a 10km or so drive down a dirt road that was more pot holes than quality road. The transportation home was also lacking. Not only did we have to go down the 10km horrible road, we had to do it with 15 people in a 15 person van. That is it for the complaints. The actual activity was one of, if not the most, exciting excursions we had while spending time in Mexico. We had the opportunity to hike through an underground waterway and see some interesting wildlife, including but not limited to a giant whip spider, a few sleeping bats, and later on, a few motmots. Our guide Raul was extremely knowledgeable and knew the latin names of all the species we asked about. This made my nerdy veterinarian girlfriend very happy. He also did an amazing job of helping along a couple of older people who should not have signed up for the tour to start with.We did the 'plus' option, which was another 20 dollars or so per person. It allowed us to take a bike ride to another cave, rappel down, and do a bit more adventuring. At the end of the tour, you had the option of (over) paying for a set of pictures (89 dollars). Despite the price, we purchased the pictures because we wanted to remember this great trip.
Amazing. We did the 2 hour tour of the caves. Our guide was very knowledgeable. Keep in mind It is not and easy tour.If you have back problems or walking problems, you might want to avoid this one.

Cave tour with Guoda. We booked a cave tour at secreto through our resort (El Dorado). It took about 30-45 minutes to get there then another 20 minute ride on a bumpy unpaved road to get to the caves. Our tour guide was Guoda. She was funny and snarky and had a genuine love and appreciation for the area and conservation in general. The cave tour was beautiful and not cold after the first 5 minutes or so. We swam out to the middle of a pool of water (size of a medium sized swimming pool and about 5 feet deep) and turned off all our lights so it was pitch black. It was really unforgettable. My wife isn't a big adventurer and was nervous about the cave hiking/swimming part but she loved it the whole time and was never nervous. There was a quick meal afterwards and then another shuttle back to the resort. It was a 8am - 1:00pm type of trip. Very nice.

This tour is amazing. Really interesting and totally, especially for anyone who has not been inside a cave...the river has a current though, and the ground is challenging to navigate. Not for those who have trouble with balance. AND bring an additional $10 for the water shoes. Best quality you'll ever find and cool looking too.

Really nice experience. This was one of the best things we did in Mexico. We waded and floated with the stream about one kilometer in an amazing cave. We had a very good guide who spoke several languages ​​fluently. We felt very safe in his company.

Beautiful caves!. We had Victor R as our tour guide, he comfortably switched from English to French when talking to us about the history of the caves. He ensured our safety, and answered all of our questions about Rio Secreto. There was some swimming involved, but we were equipped with life jackets, wet suits and helmets. This was an amazing experience, and I would recommend this tour to anyone who wants an adventure in Mexico! We weren't allowed to take photos, however there was a photographer taking professional photos of us and we were able to buy some at the end of the tour.

Family Outing. We highly recommend going on thecRio Secreto Excursion. All 6 of us left the resort at 11:00am and returned at 4:30 pm. Our tour guide, Robertto was energetic, knowledgeable and showed everyone concern over our safety manoeuvering through the cave, we had 3 other older people in our group. The buffet at the end of the excursion was excellent. We will go on another excursion on our next vacation.

Amazing legitimate caves!. Came here with my girlfriend for a morning tour and booking a pickup from our resort was super easy and a van from the company came and got us. From the gate it took about 20 minutes to get there and the road was a bit bumpy (the van in front of us had to pull over and a woman barfed).Anyway the start of the tour was good. We had to take a cold shower before donning the wet suits (pretty cold at 9 a.m.!) and we were off on the trail before we knew it.We got a blessing from a Mayan guy before entering the cave which was nice.Despite it being a cold morning, after we started going down the stairs into the cave it got pleasantly warm and after that wading or swimming in the water was totally fine.IF YOU CAN'T SWIM IT IS NOT A PROBLEM. There were three parts I think where we had to doggy paddle but the life jackets make it impossible to drown.The formations in the cave were great and I had no idea some of them even existed in nature.Anyway we had an awesome time and the lunch afterward was great.I only knock this down a star because of the photo "scam". They don't let you bring ANYTHING in including a camera. They have their photographer running around on the fringes taking pics and you get to have a look on the computers after at what she took.They wanted $20 USD for one pic on a CD (what a waste) and something like $79 USD for 10 pics on a CD. I think the highest price was $139 or something.I'm sure everyone would have bought a CD with everything on it for $20 and they probably would have made more money. We sucked it up and paid the $20 for A PICTURE to have but really the pics were not that good and MANY were blurry and unfocused. The high price and extortion for the souvenir photos left a bad taste in my mouth.However if you don't care about souvenirs and only memories and love caves, this is the tour for you!

Our second visit! . We just LOVE Rio Secreto! Again, we had a great experience with the staff who are fun, friendly and knowledgeable!! Alondra was our guide this time and she was great especially with the young kid on the tour. We plan on returning for the 3rd part of the cave that we have not done yet!

Fascinating and fun. We really enjoyed our visit to the caves. Our leader was Rrrrrual and he made sure that all of us were safe on this journey. We wore wetsuits and lifejackets and water socks and helmets with lights. There was so much to see!

Superb eco-tourism visit. We did the Rio Secreto as a cruise excursion. The van trip from Playa was 10 minutes from town and then once on property another 15 or so on a dirt road.The underground cave/river network is a natural wonder not to be missed when visiting the Yucatan peninsula. While I hear that there are other locations and differing operators, it's important to note that these are not government controlled operators and you are on private land. The Rio Secreto team lease the rights to use from the land owner and operate under a notion of preserving a natural wonder. Please respect their vision and follow their rules.Our family of four was teamed with a couple and another family of 4. You must be able to walk, hike, crouch, use stairs, float and not be claustrophobic to enjoy the hour or so adventure underground. What you see and experience is something that cannot be duplicated. You rinse off and get dressed in a provided wetsuit, watershoes, helmet with light, and PFD vest, grab a hiking stick and walk out into the jungle to one of the openings lead by an experienced guide. Climb down and enter the world of the caves and learn how they were formed, what lives in them and other phenomena. You're on a directed path climbing over formations, floating on a river (very slight current) and absorbing a side of nature very rarely seen and experienced. We had Santiago as our guide and it was clear that he was passionate about nature and his job as an advocate of preservation for this natural wonder. He was a fantastic guide.We ended with a celebration toast a light lunch and then ride back the Playa. I would strongly suggest taking this tour if you are able.

A fabulous experience. This was the most fabulous cave tour I have ever experienced. I was a little apprehensive because I am almost 70 but as long as you don't have walking problems and are not afraid of the water, you will have the time of your life. You wear a wet suit, swim shoes, life jacket and helmet (all provided) , just bring your swimsuit. You have a guide and photographer with you in the cave. The water temperature is very comfortable. This cave was just discovered a few years ago and it is so pristine you wonder if at some point admittance may be restricted or stopped. My advice is to see it before any restrictions are placed on it, I guarantee you will not be disappointed. Once out of the cave, they even provided a delicious lunch after we changed into our regular clothes. My only complaint was the cost of the pictures and while it was a huge amount of pictures that the photographer took and while they were of a very high quality, it was too expensive I thought, since you are with a group, you really don't want pictures of everyone unless you are friends or family.

Must see!!. This is an awesome tour. You get to get so up close and personal it's amazing! Our guide, Nunes, was very knowledgeable. We learned a lot about the cave and the Mayan culture. I would highly recommend Rio Secreto!

Fantastic! a #1 on your things to do list!. A fantastic experience! The kids 8 & 6 loved it and my wife and I thought it was fantastic. Our Guide was Jayo and he was extremely knowledgeable and very helpful. In the beginning they ask if you would like a walking stick. Do yourself a favor and take it! You do some walking and in some areas the stick came in handy in keeping your balance. The water is on the cooler side but they do provide you with wetsuits so it isn't to bad. If you can I would schedule the first tour of the day. You have a better chance of seeing more of the wild life and I think the wetsuits would be warmer and easier to get into! It was amazing floating through the underground crystal clear river and viewing the stalagmites and stalactites. A must see!

These caves are awesome!. This tour was great! We checked in and then drove into the jungle to the lockers and showers to get all suited up. TIP: Bring some water shoes with you (they do have some there but it is nice to just have your own). Then we went to the entrance of the caves and started the tour, the formations in there are out of this world. Our tour guide Diana was so informative and had a good sense of humour as well. At the end of the tour we all got a shot of the liqueur branded by Rio Secreto that was kind of like Sambuca with a touch of honey as a reward. The buffet lunch was very good, the Chicken and Lime Soup was my favourite! We learned a lot about the stalagmites and stalactites and it was a great experience all around.

This was an awesome experience for our group.. Our group enjoyed this excursion, our guide was very knowledgeable and ensured everyone was always comfortable. They provide wet suits, life jackets, helmets and water shoes so you are well protected and feel safe during the excursion. By sharing your experiences, you're helping travellers make better choices and plan their dream trips. Thank you!

breathtaking. We visited Rio Secreto not really knowing what to expect. We were not allowed to take in our cameras but they took pictures for us capturing all aspects of our trip. We were not prepared to pay for pictures but after seeing the beauty of the underground waterway with the stalagtites and stalagmites we could not leave without some memories of our trip. It was a wonderful journey through the cenote and beauty to be seen around every corner. A good trip for people of all ages except maybe the very young. It was one of the highlights of our first trip to Mexico.

Great visit. We had a great trip here with our guide, Andreas. We were in Playa del Carmen for about ten days, and fortunately booked this trip on the only rainy day, which didn't matter since we were underground most of the time! Water was crystal clear and refreshing. The gear they provided was good. You have to do some minor climbing around and on rocks but nothing serious. Andreas was very educational and helpful for anyone that needed help. We had a group of 8 and negotiated a fair deal on the photo CD at the end ($40/couple) I thought that was reasonable and we got photos of everyone in our group and then some 'stock' photos of the cave as well. We did not eat there as we were at an All Inclusive Resort and headed back right away. Did have a couple of shots of Xtabentún at the end, however. That's a must in Mexico! Highly recommended.

Fun and unique tour!. We loved this tour!!! The cenote is absolutely amazing and our tour guide, Fernanda, was so knowledgeable and awesome. Fernanda was also conducting research on the stalagmites so her scientific knowledge was unbeatable. We were a group mostly in our 30's and 40's and found this tour to be adventurous and fun. Be prepared for swimming, climbing, stairs and lots of ups and downs (and a long BUMPY road into the caves)! The raw beauty in the cave is amazing. I would agree with other reviews the lunch is worth skipping, but be sure to relax in the jungle hammocks after the tour.

Great experience but not for everyone. We decided to take this excursion when we heard it was only 30 minutes from our hotel. In actuality with all the pick ups at various hotels it took 1 and 1/2 hours. We went deep into a jungle and walked down into the caves. Only people very mobile should do this. We had one heavyset person that I thought was going to experience trouble and the guide said they confirmed he signed the release (?!) Our guide was great. Lunch is worth skipping and eating elsewhere.Still a great experience
Amazing!!!!!. This is definitely a must see if you are visiting nearby!!! Such a unique experience. We enjoyed our tour guide Raul. This is a lot of fun with a small group too.
Rio secreto . Awesome experience. I would recommend this place to anyone. One of the greatest places to visit. Can't wait to go back.

Simply Amazing. There were 6 of us, including 2 teenagers. 3 others joined our group so there were only 9 people on our tour. Our guide, Yayo was fabulous, you could really see how much he respected the conservation of the area. We walked and swam through the most stunning caves in a setting that was so natural, with just the light from our headlamps. This is a special place.
Excellent. Incredible views, great guides, informative tour. This is a can't miss experience. Fyi: Can't bring camera inside the caves

Don't Miss This!. If we don't go to another attraction, I won't mind, as this alone was worth our trip to Mexico! An incredible day was spent with our guide Alan. The underground river system is incredible. Wear a swimsuit under your clothes, and bring something to change into. They provide everything else that you need, including lunch. We bought all the photos they took for $89 US and they put them on a USB for us. Well worth the cost.

Underground adventure. This place is amazing. Even the teenagers loved it. Not adrenaline filled but every turn has its own beauty of nature. Felt like they cared more for the place than to make money which is a nice change

Nature At Its Finest. We did this excursion through Norwegian due to the time limits we had in Cozumel. When we exited the ship, our guide Hector met us on the dock. He gave us wrist bands and instructed us to board the ferry to Playa del Carmen. The ride takes about 35 minutes and it is quite bumpy. If you are at all prone to motion sickness, you need to pre medicate or you will join numerous fellow passengers puking. Once off the ferry, you will ride a van (in good condition) to Rio Secreto. Once there, you will be asked to rinse off before you put on your wet suit. The reason for the rinse is that they want to preserve the cleanliness of the cave water so they want you to wash off any potential contaminants such as bug spray, sunblock, etc... (in other words, don't apply of of those before you go). Once you have your wet suit (you will want it because the water is probably around 70 degrees), you will be given a life jacket and helmet with light, both mandatory. Once everyone is ready, you will go on a short hike with your guide (we had Raul who was fabulous). Prior to entering the cave, you will participate in a Mayan prayer, then on to the adventure. It is quite simply a beautiful cave. We have been in caves before but the addition of the water aspect provides a whole new dimension that is simply breathtaking.Things to know:1. You will need water shoes, which you can buy there for $10 (the same cheap ones you can get at any Walmart or Target during the summer). If you want better ones, we got Columbia Rainmakers before our trip.2. Do not bring a camera as they are not allowed for safety reasons. Before I entered the cave, I thought that rule might be in place just so they can make money off photographs. However, after venturing through the cave, I realize why they want visitors to focus on taking their next step rather than on taking pictures. Yes, the photos are expensive ($89) but they're not Disney expensive. 3. You will be in water 95% of the time. Most of the time will be spent walking through water but there are 3 areas where you will have to swim a little.4. You need to be able to see in low light and to be able to walk on uneven surfaces. This does not mean you need to gave 20/20 vision or be an athlete but because of the relative darkness other than the light on everyone's helmet and various step off and step ups, not everyone can do this tour.5. The tour takes about 60-90 minutes.Once the tour was done, we hiked back to the general area where we got changed. We then had a complimentary lunch with drinks, all of which I would characterize as authentic. Once we were done with lunch, we boarded the van back to the docks. We had some time to walk around before boarding the ferry.I would absolutely recommend Rio Secreto as a must-do activity when you are in Playa del Carmen or Cozumel. The caves are astounding and the activity is fun. I wish we could have gone through more of the caves.

Underground Marvel. Hi everyone! We visited Rio Secreto in 2015 and we were amazed at the beauty of this place. First let me say that all equipment is furnished ( Helmet,wetsuit,walking stick. etc.) I do recommend the walking stick to help keep your balance, its is slippery at some places.Cameras are not permitted which I thing is good because you can concentrated more on the beauty of this place, to listen better to your quide, you wont delay the group etc. The staff wil take pictures and you can purchased them at the end, and well worth it. I wont even try to describe the visual buffet because I could not do it justice.Our quide and camera man were A+++.I recommend this place.

Something truly unique. First of all, if you are going on this excursion from a cruise boat, as we did, be prepared for the 45 minute ferry ride each way from Cozumel which can be, and often is, quite rough. One in our party is motion sensitive and we sought a pharmacy and Dramamine for her before the return trip. Our tour coordinator, Angel, was very well organized, explained things clearly to our group and prepared us for the 30 minute or so ride to the preserve in which the cenote is situated. That, too, is a bumpy ride once you are off the highway and on the preserve's unpaved, cratered road. Totally worth the rocky ride though. Tomas was our guide once at their base. Groups of no more than 12 each have a guide and are assisted in getting outfitted for the event. Once you have your helmet, wetsuit, life vest, walking stick and water shoes you are ready to go. Lockers are there for your clothing and items like jewelry, cameras and phones, as none are permitted in the caves. A short hike to a cave entrance and you begin walking through the cave. The walking stick is helpful as it is very uneven and at times narrow between rock formations, which you are asked not to touch. Great effort is made to preserve the integrity of this lovely place. Most of the time is spent walking, though there is some swimming. The cave's exit is narrow and not for the claustrophobic.A photographer takes lots of pictures available for purchase throughout your time in the cave. We thought they were worth buying.It was a great experience and one I wish our 11 year old grandson had come along for, as he would have enjoyed it. While not a grueling outing, one does need to do a fair amount of walking over very uneven terrain and some climbing of stairs, so it would not be something for someone truly infirm. I am in my 60s and not especially fit and did just fine. The ages in our group ranged from 20s to 60s.

Great experience.but pictures too expensive. 4 of us took the cave tour at Rio Secreto. We are all in our 60's and fairly fit. It is definitely not for anyone who has balance or mobility issues, but great for those who can manage. First there is a video and a lecture on preserving the delicate ecology. Then you are taken for 20 minutes along a very bumpy road to the cave entrance. There you are given a wetsuit, helmet with light, and lifejacket and offered a walking stick (take it, you will need it), a cold shower and a Mayan purification. Then you are taken in groups of about 10 people with a guide in your own language for about 1/2 mile through the cave. There is no prepared path or lighting, and the way is uneven and underwater for some parts. It is an adventure. The cave is beautiful, and it is actually quite a spiritual experience. Our guide was Alondra. She knew her stuff, and was funny and smart. I struggled a bit at first because I have an inner ear difficulty that affects my balance. I found her helpful, but a bit brusque and I felt a bit demeaned by her attitude. But overall the tour was great. The tour included lunch which was OK. Cameras are not allowed. A photographer accompanies the tour and takes pictures which they try to sell you at the end of the tour. They cost $89.00 US for the set. We didn't purchase them, feeling the price was just too much. I don't think anyone from our group purchased the set, though a few people bought individual pictures for $25.00 They might sell more pictures if they didn't charge so much. We are told the money goes toward conservation.

Amazing Experience!!!. Was in Mexico for my sister's wedding and a group of us took an excursion to Rio Secreto. Our guide, Andres, took us to some of the deepest parts of the caves and gave us an amazing history of the area and how the caves were discovered. He waited patiently for anyone who fell behind and gave tips on how best to float through the low roof sections. I would recommend this trip to anyone of any age if traveling in the Playa De Carmen area.

Amazing!. My wife and I went on this excursion this week and were both amazed. She was hesitant about the tour when I signed us up for it, but afterwards she agrees with me its the best excursion we have ever been on. The caves and formations are beautiful, pictures do not do them any justice. You must see in person.Our tour guide Jana was passionate about his job. His knowledge and passion made the tour perfect.
Do it!. This was a great tour! Carlos was our guide and he was knowledgeable, patient and flexible.Do the upgrade to rappelling, bikes and more.You will love this tour!

Awesome underground river, but a bit of preparation to get there. First off the underground river, in the limestone encrusted caves was wonderful. The adventure paddling through areas of water sometimes greater than 6 feet was energizing. The stalactites and stalagmites at points with sparkling crystals was beautiful and the immensity of the caves they had formed over millions of years was humbling. Finally, our guide (Lara) was not only knowledgable but you could see her passion for the caves and wonders above and within it. Definitely go if you want to see something you may never see again.This is find for kids 10 and up. We had a 10 year old from another family and our 13 year old girl. The both did fine and had a great time.The tour provided all the gear needed for the trek through the caves including a helmet with light.The tour ended with a celebration of Mayan Alcohol and a decent meal.There are also many photographs taken that are available for purchase on USB. It was a little pricey but it also included stock photos from the area.I would caution that if you are someone who does not have strong legs or good balance this is probably not for you. The ground varies quite a bit and you are carrying the weight of a water soaked wet suit, and helmet. Some people in our party got a few scrapes just from incidental contact gong through the water and bumping into jutting stalagmites.Other notes of interest are... The road from the main entrance to the entrance to the cave is bad and long. The bus that took us in had to stop, start, and veer to avoid or limit the impact of the potholes in the wide sandy road. The preparation took us a while. This included a movie about the site, changing into bathing suits, lockering belongings, acquisition of wetsuit, helmet, water shoes, and walking stick. This was made chaotic by at least 4 groups coming at the same time speaking 3 languages.Everything factored in the trip through the cave was a memory worth having.

Really Awesome!. I did the Plus Tour a few days ago. While this tour was fun, it's probably worth just doing the basic 3 hour tour which takes you right to the underground pool. The Plus tour consisted of an introduction, a tour of a dry cave, a tour of a cave with water that was to our waist, which we repelled into, a bike ride to the cave we repelled into, and the best and final part, exploring the cave with the underground river and pool. Most of the tour guides, if not all speak more than one language, so groups are set up with one guide, who then may take a group of people who are from 2 different countries. For example, people who just speak English are paired up with people who speak German or Russian. In our case we had a group of 6 people, 4 Russian speakers and my husband and myself who speak English. The drawback is that my husband and I had a LOT of down time while the guide explained things to the Russian people. This was the only down side. While we loved our Guide, it felt like it took twice as long to explain things in Russian than English. That being said, it was a great day. PS. Food for lunch was "eh". And loved our guides perspective on Nature, the Mayans and Life itself.

Very interesting, not for clumsy people!. This was a very cool tour - you put on a wet suit and a hard hat and go into the caves and cenotes. It is very uneven terrain and if you happen to be a tad clumsy (like I am!) it's not that easy to keep your balance. That being said - I would do the tour again if given the opportunity. The guide was knowledgeable and very helpful. She actually realized that this wasn't easy for me and helped me throughout the tour!You see stalagmites and stalagtites etc, neat rock formations, fish etc. Very interesting and fun! It is a half day tour so a good one to do if you don't want to be away from your resort for a full day.

Great Tour in 2013 going back in march 2016 !!!!!. My wife and i did this tour back in 2013 while on a cruise. We enjoyed it so much we are doing it again this march while we are in cozumel. The lunch was very good, pictures were aittle pricey so we didnt buy any , i think we will this trip. No cameras permitted in the cave back then. The guide was very informative. I cant say enough about the tour its just worth it!!!!

Fantastic Cave Tour. Took this tour with my family last week and it was by far the highlight of our trip. The caves are beautiful and our guide (Alondra) was simply fantastic. We have caved frequently with our two boys (now 15 and 17 years old) and we all agreed that these caves our now a new favorite. Simply cannot describe how tranquil and amazing it is to float through these living caves in the crystal clear water. Very much appreciate that they take care with this wonderful natural resource and that preservation is such a part of the mission. If you have time, take the extended tour (rappelling into a cave and a walk through a 'dry cave' - It's a longer day but so, so worth it. As other reviewers have said, the buffet lunch at the end is authentic and delicious, make sure to try the Hibiscus tea, it's a new family favorite. Would go back in a heartbeat and will do so on our next trip to Cancun!

Do Not Miss!. We did this tour today and loved it! We were expecting something simple but were impressed. First, the operation is very well organized. As you arrive you are put into a small group. We were 11. I think they are all about that size. We were assigned to Alfredo. You are put in a van and take a pretty long drive. Once you arrive you are given a locker. Everyone get water shoes, a wetsuit, helmet and a life vest. You should also take a walking stick. Trust me here. Everyone takes a mandatory shower. Next it's a pretty long walk to the cave opening. Before entering a shaman does a little prayer and burns incense. The caves are incredible. The formations are not to be believed. It's like entering another world. At times you walk, at times you wade, at times you float. It's not easy so you have to go slowly. This is where the stick comes in because you're not supposed to touch the formations. Alfredo was a fabulous guide. He was genuinely concerned about our welfare, constantly asking if we were okay. His enthusiasm was contagious - it was clear that he loves his job and was thrilled to be sharing the caves with us. Don't miss Rio Secreto if you are in the area.

An experience of a lifetime. This is a spectacular natural caving experience! They are very well organized to move a large number of people through the area yet are still able to provide an experience that makes one feel that you are a select group of people experiencing this natural wonder that starts with an authentic Mayan welcome that was pretty cool. Victor was our guide, he spoke good English, his reverence and respect for his country’s natural environment was evident as was his knowledge of the geology and environment of his country. He was very patient and respectful of the participants who were not well suited to some of the physical aspects of this trek, but we benefited from the slow and steady pace he adopted to accommodate them as we were at the back have so had the opportunity to take in the amazing cave formations around us which were truly amazing. The stalactites, stalagmites, columns and cascades are incredible and Victor pointed out different formations and explained the process of how they were formed. I would recommend that you definitely be able to navigate uneven footing (be steady on your feet) and be able to step over and through rock formations that you can’t necessarily see in the water along with the ability to swim (at least dog paddle) as you will have to swim about 275 meters in the river depending on the route (they have 6 different routes that depends on the number of groups in the cave and the conditions in the cave system as the water level changes based on the amount of rain the area receives ). The water is not as cold as the prep showers (whoa that was cold!) The life vests and wet suits along with water shoes (if you didn’t bring your own) keep you warm enough. They provide helmets with lights on them and the guides have underwater flashlights. The water is very clear but depending on where you are in the group line up can become murky underfoot as it is very fine sand at the bottom. You cannot take any waterproof camera or GoPro equipment into the cave - a photographer comes along with your group and the pictures taken are very well done and beautiful, they have chosen the best spots to take your photo which they offer you to purchase on a CD (it is a money making operation after all). They have lockers to store your clothes, shoes,valuables, etc and they offer towels if you don’t bring your own. The staff are all very pleasant and are eager to make your experience amazing.There are change rooms and washrooms that are clean and modern (not primitive), after you exit the cave and change you can purchase the pictures taken in the cave. They also serve a light lunch in an open air dining area that is very nice, don’t expect gourmet food it’s basic , so if you are a picky eater then best that you eat before you arrive. We were on an excursion from a cruise ship, so we didn’t have an opportunity to use the bicycles we saw to explore the trail system, if you are able take that in as well but heed the warnings to stay on the paths as there are poisonous plants in the forested area.

Excellent Excursion. I arrived at Rio Secreto thinking we might do a bit of walking and spend most of the time swimming in the caves - well, read ahead before going folks! It's quite a lot of 'walking/climbing/ducking/helping the people in front and behind you' hiking in up to waist deep water. For me it was great fun, but there were a couple in my group that perhaps weren't as suited for that strenuous of an excursion. The drive into Rio Secreto was on a long dirt road with a lot of holes - be prepared for a bumpy ride. Upon arrival we were given wet shoes, wet suits to wear over our bathing suits, life jackets and helmets with flashlights. We had been told to bring sneakers, but not sure why unless you were staying the day and walking around the grounds extensively. Our tour was just a part day. We had a short walk to the caves, participated in a Mayan ceremony before entering and began the hike. There were a few spots where the photographers took group photos (note: you cannot take your own camera) and there was a spot or two where it was deep enough for us to swim before hiking out and back to the lockers. Our guide (I think his name was Julian?) was AWESOME! Very funny and informative. Great personality for doing tours. We had the buffet after our tour - I'm a picky eater, so I didn't eat much but for those wanting to try some Mexican dishes it would be great. You could also buy snacks, some souvenirs and your photos before leaving. Would definitely recommend it to anyone who has not been inside caves before! Beautiful to see! For those with troubles walking or that are perhaps a bit claustrophobic, maybe call ahead to discuss suitability.

Beautiful caves, wonderful experience!. My wife and I visited Rio Secreto on one of our cruise excursions. This place was beautiful. We were able to explore the caves and float down the underground river. Our tour guide, Santiago, did a great job teaching us about the caves.

truly an unforgetable experience. unlike cave tours in the USA, which are like herding cattle through, we had just 4 adults and a child in our group, and 90% of the time, couldnt even see or hear any other people.

Coolest Cenote Ever... 35 km of connected underwater caves. Hike, swim, float through several different caves. They provided wet suits, booties, and helmets. Our guide Nadia was outstanding. Really worthwhile.

Awesome but not a spectator sport!. An immersion experience for sure! I'm a 69 year-old grandma and reasonably physically fit. This underground adventure was a bit taxing but, since we were in a small group of eight on our tour, we were able to help each other through some unsure footing. Jorge, our guide was great - knowledgeable and supportive. This is the best off-shore adventure I've ever experienced. I especially appreciate that this whole adventure is geared toward preserving this ecologically sensitive and sacred spot.

Not for everyone.. Our travel coordinator made it sound like anyone could do this. The brochure says 4 yrs and up. There is no way I would take a child or someone that isn't fit or pregnant. There is a lot of slippery climbing and the rocky bottom makes it very hard to walk. Very cold too. We made the most of it and were glad we had the experience because it was awesome to see. Roberto our guide was great and never gave up on the very slow people in our group. The rocky bus ride in was horrible. Not what we were expecting on this excursion. Would I do this again, no way. You do work up an appetite for the buffet at the end though.

Great interesting excursion.. Just like almost everything in Mexico if you ask for a bargain you often will get it. We told our Tour Guide at the hotel we were going to book with a competitor and he gave us 50% off the second ticket. The tour was worth it. Great lunch and a great tour. The ride in was long but we had a Cowboy driver on the way out and he made it fun and cut the time in half !!
Very good experience. explore the caves of rio secreto with knowledgeable guides. Amazing pool down 70 feet underground. Best not be claustrophobic.

Very interesting. Thought the ad was for rappelling but not included. Beware of the purified water as both my son and I got sick from drinking it. The tour itself was amazing and sitting in pool 70 ft below ground. Would recommend minus the water.

Group fun!! Must do . Some in our group were nervous about doing a nature trip like this. We all left the adventure learning much and excited to talk about what we had done. The tour guide was incredible and funny and so knowledgeable about the underground river. I would say that this is a must do. We had a rainy day and booked this last minute for a group of 11 and many left saying that it was the best excursion of our trip!!

Amazing!. One of the best excursions I have ever been on. Be warned that they don't tell you in advance of booking that upon arrival you will switch vans and be transported by a second van an additional 20 minutes along a very very awful bumpy dirt road that leads back to the entrance for this. It is such a bad road that one girl actually got "sick" to her stomach and had to get out of the van along side the road. The ride is not for weak stomachs. However, if you can take the ride to get there its an amazing experience. Its just beautiful. They do not allow you to take any cameras but force you to pose for pictures and purchase only what they take. The photos are very expensive. I did purchase one picture and it was well worth it because it was so amazing. I didn't need all the others with the entire group, etc. Just me and my husband in one amazing shot was fine. Our guide was Andres and he was awesome. They provide a lunch afterward which is sufficient. Nothing extravagant but decent. Then be prepared that once you eat you have that terrible ride back through the crater dirt road 20 plus minutes to the exit where the main road is.

best adventure tour in cancun - 06th feb-2016-Neeta, Canada. Rio secreto is best adventure, Alondra our guide was a real 'mother' of our family, she was awesome mother, took care of each of 10 family members. Tour underground was great which cannot be explained in writing must visit to view the formations, Alondra very knowledge and full of information answered all our questions, No rush to complete the tour, takes enough time to visit and explain the formation.There were 2 members on the family who were not able to swim the last lag, where Alondra helped them swim and made it very comfortable to complete the tour. Without our 'mother' Alondra help this trip was very comfortable, I would suggest to visit this place once in life, and Alondra as your guide will be bonus.Pictures take by JJ photographer was great, worth the money, it is expensive as that's the only way to have our memories live. No choice but pay the price.Lastly if visiting cancun, this place is must to visit, it takes half day tour and worth the price.

Loved it!. This was an awesome adventure! It was alittle more difficult then expected. The cave was beautiful,we did the supremo trip. It was like being the first explores in the cave to see its beauty. Julio was our guide & he was great. Hopefully you will be lucky to get him on our tour. We recommend taking the walking sticks they provide with you. The stick was very helpful in the cave. There was lunch after & that was good. This is definite must to do excursion.

Breathtaking experience. The sights and experiences of this secret cavern were so awesome! Lu, our tour guide, carefully guided us while providing such helpful information and unforgettable experiences! This is definitely an attraction that I will bring my children to when they are a little older and are capable of climbing and maneuvering through the formations without jeopardizing these hidden treasures! The moments caught by the photographer, Charlie, were so special!

Amazing Secret River. The views and experience was great. Our guide, Alondro, was terrific and very knowledgeable and made the trip special and relaxing and funny. Past reviews have said that the water was cold - I don't know where they come from, but the water was 75 degrees which is not cold in New England. The life vest and wet suit made the excursion easy for anyone to experience. Whether you are young or not so young, it can be done by all who can walk on uneven surfaces and it is breathtaking!I would highly recommend it to anyone - I was on a cruise excursion - but anyone from a hotel or anywhere can enjoy this excursion."Incredible".We visited in January 2016.

Very good, more difficult than anticipated. First, our guide Alondra was exceptional. She was wonderful to our youngest son who was cold and a bit scared through the tour, as well as another woman who had some stability issues. This tour is very physically demanding. The water is cold and the cave floor is difficult to navigate. It was a great and amazing tour. We really enjoyed it, and recommend it for people who are fit and adventurous.

Incredible. Such a hidden gem. No touristy but ecologically breathtaking. Untouched,pristine,the most unbelievable limestone formations,colors,hidden treasures. Can be tricking navigating the path or cave tour,take the walking stick to keep your balance,no need to be afraid of closed spaces,looks as if it goes on forever. Our guide Raul,was very informative and vested in the work that is being done at this site:i.e.: tracking wild Jaguars documentary. Will return,next time for an extended tour,hope this relic remains as untouched and perfect as they try to keep it.
Very Cool!. This was a very great excursion that I would highly recommend if you are looking for a cave swim. Tako was our tour guide and he was very informative and made the excursion fun for all.

Truly, an amazing life experience!!!!!!!!. Going to Mexico was my first trip away from Canada, we went to Coba, swam with the dolphins, and went to Rio Secreto! Rio Secreto has to the the highlight of my trip, for sure! Not only because of the scenery, or the fact that I was in a wicket cool underground cave, but because the people were simply the best. The locals were very nice, and greeted you like you were one of their own, and not like a common tourist! Also, the leader and tour guide of the group made this trip a fantastic experience! Andreas was a very knowledgeable tour guide, he knew the history, the lay out, and let me swim everywhere lol!! If you're going to the Playa area this is a must!! ASK FOR ANDREAS! :D

Best Attraction in the Playa area. This is like the best kept secret around. It was only "found" in 2006 and they only started giving tours in 2008 so it's like no one knows about it. Basically you're "spelunking" or exploring caves in the water. The wetsuit is a must as is the vest they give you, they also provide water shoes which you have to have. But the tour is really awe inspiring. Try to get RAUL as the guide he was fantastic, great personality, speaks excellent English, really loves what he does and it shows. We paid $79 a person on 5th Av. for the tour. You might be able to negotiate it a little more but I don't think I was a dime at that price. It took us about 5 hours from when we left the hotel until we returned. They also include a decent lunch buffet for the price.

Don't miss this trip!. The caves are amazing, gorgeous and the staff and tour guides are absolutely terrific. Especially Miguel who was our guide. We happened to get there at mid day and we had our own private tour! It's truly a wonderful adventure and an unforgettable experience!

Go Go Go!!!. What an amazing tour! We arrived and were given a sheet of paper that said our guide would be Alfredo =) (that smiley face was on the top of the page). We were all joking that Alfredo had better look like the smiley face when we met him - and that smiley face was very accurate! When we arrived at the caves we were met by Alfredo - with a big smile on his face. (side note: it is a 15 minute ride in a large van on a dirt road with LOTS of pot holes - some people may feel a little car sick)You could just tell that he loved his job. He gave us a short intro, then we got changed, showered and set up with equipment before we went down into the cave. There were only 8 of us in the group. There are several different entrances, so it's only one group at a time in each section. You don't see or hear any other groups.The caves themselves are a different world! Absolutely gorgeous. There was a photographer that follows the group, and takes pictures of the couples/groups throughout that you can purchase at the end. Alfredo told us a lot of information about the caves, and since we were up front closest to him, we asked a bunch of questions. Alfredo was educated in Texas, and later left his job as a forensic psychologist to come and work in the caves - and it shows how much he loves his job. Thanks so much Alfredo, we won't ever forget this tour!

Everyone was amazed and loved it!. Denisse, the tour guide was really excellent. We sent a group of all different ages and they had a blast. We would highly recommend this to anyone and a special thanks to Denisse for making it such a fun and memorable activity!!!!From your friends at Herrick!

wow. we had n amazing tin on out secret river tour!! our guide was so helpful to one of my family members need an extra hand as well as 2 from our group could not swim well. I loved all of the information we received on our trip. my only dislike was that we were told we could take our underwater camera online and when we booked our excursion but when we got there they said no outside cameras and that we had to purchase our photos from their photographer. we did but they were not cheap.

One excursion you have to do. This excursion was one of the best I have ever taken. Absolutely awesome! They offer two different tours. One is just a tour of the under ground river which is fantastic but if you take the Reo Secreto plus you get to ride pedal bikes to a spot in the jungle where you rappel down into an underground cavern and a short walk back to the bikes and back where you started to take the river tour. If you are able to I would definitely take the Plus package no one in our group had rappelled before and we all did fine. They were very helpful. The only negative I could say about this tour is that you are not allowed to take a camera with you they say the bright light has negative affect on the stalagmites but there is a photographer that follows the tour taking lots of pictures that you can buy on a CD at the end of your tour. The price per picture is 25.00 US or you can purchase the whole CD for I think around 80.00. I did purchase one photo and the quality is quite good. Again this is one excursion you have to do while in the area.

Everyone loved it. Our group was very diverse and thanks to Ro everyone had the best time! My cousin and I picked this excursion based off the TripAdvisor reviews and it was everyone's favorite. We made a fun game of trying to high five on the bumpy roads. Then you get suited up and go to the shaman and he blesses you before you go in the cave. The water is cold, which is why you have a wetsuit and you'll forget about the cold. The pictures are $25 per photo or $75 for the whole disk which has amazing professional landscape photos also, about the same price as other places photos but after seeing the photos on the disk we had to get it. However Ro did make the trip, he was so knowledgeable, friendly and helpful to those who had trouble getting around. A few people in our group have booked this trip many times and loved it. I am going to do the same when back in Cancun! Oh and the lunch was good too!

Secret river. Secret adventure. One of our most memorable moments in Playa Del Carmen. This place is truly magical ! Unforgettable experience. Water shoes, wet suit, helmet and lockers are provided. Towels and showers too. Bring a change of dry clothes and if you can, snacks and water which you can keep in locker. The lunch was "one star" and water and beer costs money so it's nice to have your own. Do not wear jewelry. Cameras are not allowed. Tips are appreciated by guides so bring some cash

Special experience!. A trip to this region of Mexico would not be complete with our experiencing a cenote, an underground river. Rio Secreto was recommended by the hotel tour company as being one of the better ones to experience. Our pick up was on time, but what should have taken 30 minutes ended up taking over an hour. We were the first of three stops for pick up and traffic in Playa del Carmen is terrible. At the last hotel, the person didn't even show up. By the time we got to Rio Secreto we were a bit wary. We waited at the welcome area to see if more people would show up and luckily for us, only one did so we had a small group pf five for our tour. The van took us 7 km into the jungle on a dirt road that sits atop the caves. Clearly, this organization is intent on preserving what is natural and that was really impressive. We had an excellent guide, Carine, who prepared us for our underground tour with wet suits, water shoes and helmets. I suggest you take the walking stick. We didn't and the floor but we saw how it helped the others in our group. We descended into the cave and stood in awe of the solitude and beauty. Stalagmites and stalactites everywhere, crystal clear water and two million years of history around you. Carine guided us up and down, at times walking, at times swimming. A photographer accompanied us and took some photos, which we did not end up buying. The memories are stuck in our minds and that was plenty for us, especially with the price of their photo packages. After the caves, we reemerged for a shot of their local liquor and then into dry clothes for lunch in the jungle, which was simple but very tasty. Our trip back to the hotel was much faster and we were happy to have a couple of hours of sun to enjoy after such a special experience. I did provide the feedback about the long trip to Rio Secreto to the driver as well as the hotel tour company, so hopefully others can benefit from that.

Amazing underground adventure. This was the highlight of my cruise excursions! What an amazing, informative and unique adventure. The water was cold, but you have a short sleeve wetsuit which helps. To see and learn about the Mayans use of the underground river, as well as the discovery was very interesting, and there's nothing like laying on your back in the water in TOTAL darkness! You wade ankle deep, waist deep, and a couple of times you are swimming (dog paddle) along the river through amazing rock and limestone formations - highly recommended for anyone not afraid of water, close spaces or the dark :)

Breathtaking Highlight. This was the highlight of our trip to Cancun. A rare sight (Rio Secreto means "Secret River"). We entered through a cenote and travelled through an underground river. We were dressed in a wetsuit, water shoes, a life jacket and a helmut with a headlamp. That headlamp was our only light source. What followed were breathtaking scenes at every turn. Stalactites and stalagmites, crystallized tree roots and a view of untouched natural beauty that has been in development for thousands of years. We were followed by a cameraman who took photos of our excursion and hosted by a knowledgeable guide. I was impressed by the staff's sincere desire to preserve this incredible place. I think anyone who comes to Cancun and is looking for an out of this world experience would be remiss to miss out on this,. If you're staying at a resort - this excursion includes pick up and drop off as well as a free lunch. No need for sunblock on this one.

Have a GRIN on my BUs face from the beginning to end. We love the Rio secreto tour!! We live Andre, he s the tall guy that's from Spain I think. He s totally awesome! Our driver was Jose Luis (yep just like that Spanish version of "Jerry Springer") Jose Luis! Jose luis! The drive was pretty nice and pro driver. The tour was AMAZING!!! The caves are beautiful, plus the water is Crystal clear!! Our photographer which is also named Andre is pretty cool, he definitely took great shots! Andre Our tour guide was informative, and he s pretty funny! We live him lots! The pictures are great but you gotta see it to believe it. I booked this tour through carnival cruise surprising my BF and he was totally amazed and shock how nice the tour was. We wouldn't mind going back again to see the other route. Thanks for all the staff and the great food at the end. Keep the good job Andre, Andre 2, and Jose luis. The ride from COZUMEL to mainland is not that easy, but it's a good journey to amazing secret rivers ;))

Underground caves . This was a wonderful experience and would recommend it to all comers. Our guide was amazing and new everything about the nature of the caves and there origin. The caves and the waters were amazing and a must see for anyone who likes exploring.

Excellent experience. We absolutely loved our visit to Rio Secreto. It was exciting, educational, and stunningly beautiful. This is not an easy walk in the park. Participants should be able to walk on very uneven surfaces, be comfortable in the water and in some very tight spaces, and be willing to spend a good 1.5 hours underground. Our guide was terrific, keeping track of everyone and ensuring we could all hear and see her at all times. Not an easy task! Absolutely fabulous. I totally understand that they don't allow anything to be brought into the caves in order to keep them pristine. No cameras are allowed. Yes, the pictures are not inexpensive but if you divide the cost between a couple of adults or more, then it can be very reasonable. The pictures are on a CD so you can make as many copies as you want of any photo or send them electronically. They are also very high quality. The only part of the tour that was not perhaps as high a standard as I had expected was the food. It was fine but not well presented, all dishes were chipped or cracked and the people working at the food station did not seem interested in the guests. Our guide, however, remained with us and explained the food, directed us to drinks and organized a table for our group. We loved that our guide met us at the bus and stayed with us the whole time until putting us back on the bus. Our guide, Vero was terrific and her positive attitude and enthusiasm was incredible.

The Most Fun You Can Have in a Wet Suit, Life Jacket and Miner's Helmet. Rio Secreto (the secret river) is not like other underground cave tours that you may have taken. For one thing there is a river running through it, and most of the tour has you in the river. Secondly, and perhaps more important, the people who operate the tours have a great deal of respect for the environment. So there are no easy paths cut through the rocks, no handrails and no lights (more about that later). But don't be put off by this stuff; please - keep reading - the place is amazing.The other thing that the people who operate the tours have respect for is the culture of the indigenous Mayan people; and so the tour started (after viewing a short informational video) with a blessing from a Mayan priest. We were then issued wet suits, life jackets, a miner's helmet with a lamp and a walking stick and led to the mouth of the cave.We turned on our helmets lights and started into the cave accompanied by our guide and a photographer. I was initially disappointed that there were no cameras allowed, but soon realized that I needed to direct my full attention to the cave, even if I had taken a camera I wouldn't have taken any pictures.The tour itself was incredible. I could go on for pages about the rock formations, but the moment that will stay with me for the rest of my life is when we were floating down the river and the guide told us to turn off our helmet lights. The absolute darkness was almost palpable. It might sound corny; but between the silence, the darkness and the weightlessness of floating in a life jacket, the only way to describe the experience is mystical. I understood the reverence that the Mayans felt towards the cave.As incredible as it was, the tour is not for everyone. I have bad knees, and I'm not as young as I used to be. If I knew what I know now before I went on the tour, I probably would have taken a pass. But our guide, Lara, was amazing. She was knowledgeable, professional, friendly and incredibly patient. Because of Lara I had an amazing time, I'm glad that I went.So if you don't have any issues with tight spaces or uneven terrain, visiting the Rio Secreto will be the highlight of your vacation.

Rio secreto wonderful experience. Absolutely breathtaking,wonderful guide,and a little surprise during the end of cave visit.
I recommend this to everyone,
Don't miss this one. Probably one of the coolest most unique things we have ever done! Our guide Fernanda was friendly, fun and gave a lot of interesting info about this beautiful and amazing place.

Aewsome Experience!!!. My boyfriend and I did this excursion last week and had a fabulous time!!!!! It was unbelievable the beauty of the caves. I was a tiny bit nervous about it at first but really for no reason. The service and our guide was awesome. A truly once in a lifetime experience!!! My only complaint was that the pictures to purchase were VERY expensive!!!!!!

Amazing!. We recently did a tour of this underground river and it was a "must do" excursion. Andries was our tour guide. He was very welcoming and extremely knowledgable and friendly. We would definitely recommend this excursion to anyone visiting Playa del Carmen.

Must visit. This is an underground river system with incredible limestone statice and stalagmite formations. It is an eco park where you are not allowed to use any chemicals on your body,must shower before the tour and not touch the formations. It is somewhat rugged. First is an~4mile ride over a rutted dirt road into the site. Then you descend down into the river with your wetsuit, life vest and helmet [all provided]. You need to be in decent shape, have reasonably good balance (the river bottom and narrow areas can be very uneven and Boulder strewn. A few places are too deep to walk so you have to swim a few hundred feet. Some places are so uneven that you float on your back and use your hands on the bottom to propel yourself. There are 3 different passages one can take depending on your guide. The tour is about an hour and one half. It is well worth the visit. The lunch is nothing to write home about and the Photo Shots ARE A HUGE RIPPOFF. You can't take picture so a photographer accompanies you and shoots some great shots but at the end the prices they want to charge for even one is nothing but thievery. No one in our group would buy any, they were annoyed.

Incredible experience, a must go!. This was an amazing experience where you get to see the underground of the caves while swimming. Amazing views and the information provided by guides is excellent. The tour lasts about 2 hours, you start walking and end up swimming. I do not recommend if you are claustrophobic.Water is cold but they provide water shoes and a wet suit.Excellent activity if you like nature.

STUNNING!. This place was beautiful. I cant get over how amazing the view was from down there as well as how dark it was.We opted to do the extra private tour of the above ground cave after and it was just as amazing and beautiful as underground.make sure you bring a bathing suit and towel.Overall a great excursion.ps. the pictures they take are just plain better i suggest you put money aside for them.

Amazing experience and great guide. We took our 2 boys for a day's adventure in the cenotes and were were blown away with the amazing caves at Secreto. We did the "plus" version which included a "dry" cave for about an hour, then a rappel into a wet cave which was amazing and finished with a few hours exploring an amazing cave. We couldn't believe how big and vast these caves were, certainly a must see for anyone!!What was equally amazing was our host "Carlos". In our group (no group bigger than 10 which was amazing) there was 2 families each with kids ranging 4-9 and he was amazing with all of them! He was so personable, well informed and amazing with the kids. I was so impressed with his care and attention to our kids as well as the depth of his knowledge. He was with us the whole time and was always 100% engaged and passion about sharing his knowledge. A true pleasure.

So Nice we went Twice!. This is the second time that my brother and I have signed up to tour Rio Secreto and it was definitely worth the return trip! The natural wonder of the jungle, the caves and the clear, warm underground river was too much to pass on. Our guide Julian and photographer Carla made the trip fun and educational. We found the people who go on these excursions are all fun and look out for each other and by the end of the tour we all had lots in common. The tour starts with a 7km drive into the jungle over bumpy potholes roads but that just adds to the experience. Once there we divide into smaller groups, get changed into our swimsuits and water shoes. After a cold outdoor shower, we are provided with wetsuits, helmets with a light and flotation vests. A short hike later we are given a blessing by a Mayan shaman. Too cool! The first view of the cave entrance and the stairwell down is breathtaking! Not long after we are walking in water, venturing deeper and deeper underground. The formations you see are absolutely other worldly and floating and swimming in that clear, warm pure water definitely adds to it. The guides make the most with the few lights we carry into the caverns and when the lights are shut off it is blacker than anything you have ever experienced. The first time we came (last year) the group had to hold hands, this time it was better...we we given walking sticks and got to walk on our own...be sure to get a longer one! At least shoulder height, it helps to feel the slight drops in steps in the water. Mine was too short and I had to bend over to get my balance. The hike is very safe but I suppose one should be in moderate shape and agile as to not stumble into the walls and formations. The path is defined by string to keep people from damaging fragile areas and care is taken to advise everyone not to touch the rock because the oils in our skin will stop the formation process of the stalagmites. We were only underground for about an hour and a half but it seemed way longer. It does take some energy out of you so a lunch was a welcome sight. We had signed up for the tour plus which meant we went back underground a second time after lunch. This time we got to ride some sketchy but fun mountain bikes down the a couple of km to a different area, rappel down 25 feet into another cave, hiked and swam a while, biked back to the first site. By this time it was just my brother and I and a bunch of guides and the photographer. It was like a personal tour! So much fun! We had one final cave to enter, and it was a dry one so we got changed into our regular clothes. It was spectacular as well, we ended our tour with a film and light show projected on the rock walls. The tour Plus was worth the extra bucks! We heard some complaints about the cost of the photographs, but for us it was fine.They were professionally done, burned on a disk and we also bought 3 t-shirts for $109US. I would highly recommend this tour, it is quite an experience and the people were first rate!
Stunning Beauty.. Rio Secreto is an unparalelled natural gem. A must-see. Our guide, Jano, was a wealth of information, fun and care for us. Definitely worth it!

Must experience. We visited 2 days ago. Our guide Julian was friendly, funny and very knowledgeable. The subterranean river and series of cenotes are quite exquisite. There was a young girl (about 8) in our group so it is family friendly. The tour was about 2 hrs with a lunch at the end. The photos were beautiful and reasonably priced. This was a spiritual and educational experience. Add it to your list of places to visit.

Best Part of Our Trip. Rio Secreto was by far the very best part of our Christmas trip to Mexico. We had 6 in our family from 18-59 yrs old. We all loved every moment of our adventure! If you're anywhere near this area you MUST experience it!

Diego is a great guide. The caves are beautiful, Diego helped us navigate them and told about the formations and some of the ecosystem that lives inside. The water is cold, but not unbearable, and they give you a wet suit, helmet and wet shoes. After about 2 hours of exploration, we got a shot of a special alcohol, some food, and a chance to look at the pictures they took while we were down there. The trek is not hard, but there are some tricky spots in the cave; however, Diego was there to point the way. The facility is nice and well run. It was a great time.

Extremely difficult for someone with R.A. - but WORTH IT. This was hands down my best experience in Mexico. I didn't mention that I had R.A. (systemic rheumatoid arthritis) to the guide because I'm stubborn, I didn't want to be dissuaded, and I want to do as much as I can while I can. So now you can learn from my experience. The trek in by bus from gate to entrance is only a few kilometres, but it's on the worst roads I've never imagined. I'm sure there are trucking roads on the hillsides of Bolivian mountains that are better than this one, and there are tv shows on how treacherous those are. The trek inside the caves is long and often difficult for someone with R.A.; up and over, a bit of climbing here and there, nowhere to sit down and rest, and it's a long way, but the guide does stop to tell you about your surroundings. And then you get to swim in the cool waters underground and it's totally worth it. Everything is so quiet and peaceful, and I just felt grateful that I was there to experience it. But then you have to climb out and up some stairs with your heavy wetsuit on - eat some really great food - then take that cursed road back to the gate. I don't know if I would do it again, only because I really paid for it physically later. If someone had told me how difficult it really was, I wouldn't have done it. I went in 100% committed to getting through it on my own, and I don't know if there is any other exit along the way, so keep that in mind. Just loved it.

Amazing and Unique Adventure. I heard about this excursion just as I arrived in Cancun. This was a one-of-a-kind experience. The caves were beautiful inside. The trek was completely safe, although I was hesitant at first. The entire process is very professionally done, from shuttling you back and forth from the caves to helping you with your helmet, flashlight, and water suit to lunch and picture viewing afterwards. I had an unforgettable experience and Diego was an AWESOME guide. He was extremely knowledgeable, fun, and had a passion for cave diving. I highly recommend.

Amazing experience of a lifetime!!. I booked this through Royal Caribbean on our cruise and I wasn't sure quite what to expect but...WOW!!! The underground cave and river is amazing and from the moment we arrived, our tour guide Andres was outstanding. He was very friendly, knowledgeable and made us aware of what to expect before we went down into the cave. All of your gear is included (wet suit, helmet with headlight, life vest, water shoes and towels). I absolutely loved our visit and the beauty of this place is surreal. From the stalactites and stalagmites to the Mayan history of the area, this place makes you feel like you are living an Indiana Jones adventure. Andres spoke very good English and he knows a ton of information about the history of this place. Plus he's also hilarious and funny!If you are visiting the Yucatan Peninsula of Mexico, be sure to visit this place and make sure you ask for Andres as your guide!

Breathtaking! You must visit!. My husband and I joined eight other tourists on this stunning excursion to Rio Secreto (not far from Playa del Carmen, Mexico). We couldn't wait to get inside and see this underground world. As we entered we saw jagged stalactites and stalagmites as we waded through the river. Our amazing guide, Julio, guided us through the marked path. At one point, we were all asked to lie on our backs in the water and turn off our headlamps. We laid there in utter darkness for around one minute, hearing nothing but the dripping of water from the stalactites. This excursion is worth every penny.

A Must See!!!!. First a Big thanks to Jacqueline Villa at Best Day Travel for suggesting the excursion! We have been to Playa del Carmen 8 or 10 times, have snorkeled in the Cenotes but not of this compares to the tour of Rio Secreto! What a great time and an amazing place. You have no worries about tight spaces. The entire tour is in open caverns. The scenery is breathtaking!!!! The tour guides really make the excursion!
Very Interesting!. This was a really cool place to visit. Our tour guide was great. A fun and educational excursion. Very close if you are staying Playa Del Carmen. It was a good 1/2 day trip for us.

Rio Secreto - Andres O'Hara 👍. This was an absolutely amazing experience and our travel guide, Andrès O'Hara was top notch!! He was so educated on the caves, very interesting to listen to and lots of fun!! This was a wonderful experience and Andrès definitely helped make that happen!

Amazing Tour, Great Guides Good Food. Amazing tour with a great guide. They really look out for you and make sure that you are safe and enjoying yourself. Was educational but also adventurous. The lunch at the end of the tour was also very good. I definitely recommend doing this tour. Also, we had a private event in the dry caves one night and it is a spectacular venue. Be warned though there is at least a 30 minute ride down a bumpy dirt road to get there so be aware of that.

Tour of a life time. My wife and I went to Rio Secreto a few years ago while staying in Playa del Carmen. I had read about it online and it was a newer atteaction at the time. When we booked the tour with Bookit the gentleman taking our reservation confused me on the time the tour bus would pick us up. He first said it would be 9:00am and then said 8:00. We booked the tour days in advance. The morning of the tour we went and had breakfast and thought we had plenty of time to meet the bus in front ofthe hotel. Well when we got back to our room there was a message that the bus was waiting for us. We made a mad dash for the front of the hotel that was a good 1/4 mile through the jungle. When we got there, the driver was patiently waiting for us with guests from other resorts. We apologized to the driver and the other guests. I thought we had until 9:00 but it was 8:00. This was the only glitch of the trip. And I'm soo glad they waited for us and didn't leave us. The caves are amazing and this was the neatest thing I've ever done. Our guide was really a great guide. I think his name was Pablo. One of the things he did was take us into one of the caverns rooms and shut off the lights. We were in about 15' of water. We laid back, closed our eyes and listened to the sounds of the cave. It was so relaxing. Much like an isolation chamber. After this experience was over, started our ascent up out of the cave. Pablo said the room and trail we were taking was called the womb and the birth canal. The reason was by this time we had been in the cave alittle over an hour. Our senses had been dulled due to a constant temperture in the cave and very little smells. As we ascended he said to really pay attention to our senses. First thing I noticed was the temperature change. Next the smells of the tropical flowers, vegatation and the Mayan lunch that was waiting for us. Then the brightness of the outside light. He compared this to a baby that is being born and experiencing these senses for the first time. It was awesome....I loved ever minute. Definitely The Tour of a Lifetime.

Perfect for a rainy day. We heard about this place from some fellow tourists at our hotel. It was raining one day so we decided to book at the last minute. They were very accommodating about last minute bookings. Our tour guide, Carlos, was amazing! They was a 50m section of the save that was quite narrow- I freaked out and Carlos was amazing and distracted me and calmed me down!! Carlos remembered all our names and made us feel like a family! The only downside was that you can't take your own photos and the cost to buy the photos is US$50! Which for an Australian is a lot of money! The buffet lunch was spectacular either. Other than that it is a must see!

3rd times a charm for more 😝. Every chance I'm in Playa Del Carmen you will know that I'm going to Rio Secreto. It's one of those life time experiences that you want to keep on experiencing especially when every time I go back it's a different trail each time. Seeking knowledge with sense of Adventure? This is the place! Ever wanted to feel like an Indiana Jones? This is the place! Want to enjoy a moment in time? Rio Secreto is the place They will provide you with all the necessary equipment and provide lunch too. No need to bring towels, no need to bring your water slippers. Just bring your thirst for knowledge, being one with nature with the sense of adventure. If you are lucky, ask Alfredo who is very knowledgable, passionate and knows his craft

Underground caves and rivers. Stalactites & stalagmites, a beautiful underground labyrinth of crystal and mineral formations with a river runs through it:)Jano (sp? pronounced Hano) was an excellent guide; all-around very informative, friendly, and helpful. Got some great photos although the flash drive was a little pricey.

:: What an amazing experience! ::. I have to say, I was a little scared at first to go down the cave, get into the water... But was I surprised! Our guide was very informative, funny, patient, answered all of our questions and "concerns" and made sure everyone was OK during the tour. You're fully equipped with helmet & a light, vests, wetsuits... Everything is super safe and well organized. We learned a bit about the Mayan culture.And well, when I was down there I was truly amazed, and so glad I got to be there, such a beautiful place!. Totally recommend it! One of the best tours I've ever been to.

Excellent Guide, Beautiful Cave/River. We toured Rio Secreto with Alfredo as our guide. We chose the 'plus' experience and loved the rappel into the cave, along with the bike riding and the excellent buffet in the jungle. We especially enjoyed having our own personal tour. It was great to escape to the quiet of nature for a day in this amazing place!
Best tour ever. I go to Cancun every year and always do a few tours. This one will forever be with me. It was so great. You really get a feel for the culture and people

Amazing Caves, Excellent guide!. Booked this as an excursion from Princess cruise and this was my favourite of the whole trip. River caves with beautiful stalactites and stalagmites, clear, clean water and some wildlife too! Our guide, Jorge, was friendly, informative, well trained and patient with our group, helping anyone who needed it. Really enjoyed walking through the cave, around the formations, in and out of the water. The equipment kept us warm while walking and swimming. Excellent snack afterwards, more like a lunch, food was good but watch out for the green salsa! It is not guacamole!! The only damper on my experience was at the end. A photographer goes with your group, as cameras are not allowed during the trip, and takes photos while on the tour. At the end, there are young men who show you the photos with the intention of selling you copies or packages. it was not well communicated what was necessary to order photos if you want them, and I could not order them in time when I was ready to leave. I felt that I was not paid attention to or assisted, and ended up having to order on the internet later. Frustrating, however other than that, the trip was amazing.
