A great experience!. In contrast to the other tours available at the riviera this one us outstanding! Don't missunderstand me, I mean this in a very particular way. The information the guides provide is no talltale, it is 100% accurate. I have always been deeply interested in geology and I can tell you they've got their facts straight. There is a mayan guy with them that does some sort of ritual previous to starting the tour, this also looks legit. (Not like the guys playing mayas at some other tours, if you know what I mean) This tour opperator shiwa respect to nature and local culture and traditions, by not treating them like some sort of circus-like attraction.Now, let's talk about the food. It is not the typical "foreign-tourist targeted" kind of stuff. It's cooked by locals and it is extremelly delicious, though the dinnig area doesn't look that impresive.You cannot miss this tour!

Great Cave/River Hike. My wife and I wanted to do something adventurous that wasn't zip-lining and were suggested Rio Secreto. It was an amazing experience. When you get there, after a brief welcoming video you meet your guide, get your water shoes, life vest, hard hat with light, and wet suit. You take about an hour walk and swim through the incredible cave. It was one of the most tranquil and beautiful part of our trip. Our guide Julio was the best (for English speaking tours). He was kind, helpful, funny, and just a great person. He taught us so much about the caves and it's significance to Mayan culture. If you are in the area, by yourself, with a loved one, or even with kids, Rio Secreto is a must.

Absolutely Amazing!. This is one of the best tours that I have ever done! I am somewhat familiar with the Mayan genesis story in the Popol Vuh and had heard of Xibalba but I never thought that I would have the opportunity to come and see a gateway to Xibalba. Xibalba is the Mayan underworld. This nature preserve is about 0.5 hour away from Playa del Carmen. I came here with my wife, who has RA, and my 11 year old son and my teenage sister. Our guides name was Julio Caesar or JC. JC was very professional and informative along every step of the tour. All of the guides spoke English very well. Upon arrival we were greeted and given a brief overview of the "cenote" and what to expect. The word cenote comes from Yucatec Maya "dzonot" or "ts'onot" meaning "well". We had an opportunity to use the restroom first which my wife and son were very appreciative of after our bumby taxi ride out. Rio Secreto provided us with lockers and padlocks for all of our stuff. They do not allow you to bring ANYTHING into the cenote including cameras. They do have a photographer that is with each group and stops you for pictures throughout the tour. The photography is the only gripe I have about this tour. I wish the photographer would have taken better pictures. Nobody in my group of 9 bought more than one picture. My family bought only one group photo just to commemorate the day, others didn't buy any. We received our included water socks, then it was off for a fresh spring shower to rinse off all the oils and chemicals on your body. Do yourself and the nature preserve a favor and don't wear any sunblock, deodorant, or bug repellent before you come here, its all going to get washed off anyway before you can enter the cenote. We all then we sized for our wet suits. JC was on the money for sizing my whole family first try. After getting our wet suits on an we were given life jackets and helmets with head lamps. The wet suits are actually spring suits or shortys, short sleeve and shorts style. The life jackets are a ski style versus the dorky orange one we all wore as kids. ;p and the helmets are actually petzls climbing helmets. They have definitely invested in some good gear. We then walked a short distance down a very well maintained trail to where a Mayan ah-pul-yaah, the “disease thrower” had to first bless us before our entrance into the cenote. This blessing is not about your or my religion but the respect of another cultures reverence for this place. The Maya would not enter before being blessed and neither will you. After the blessing it was a short distance more to the stairs leading down into the cenote.The water in the cenote is crystal clear and cold. I will say it again the water is cold, but worth every minute of it. Through out the tour you will go from walking to wading, swimming to squating. You will experience complete and TOTAL darkness. There are many tripping hazards and chances to test your helmet if your not paying attention. If you are comfortable with these movements, experiences, and environments then get ready for one of the most unforgettable experiences of your life. What else should you expect from the Mayan Underworld. After the tour was over we toasted with a Mayan drink called Xtabentún, which is an anise and feremented honey liqueur. They then provided an assortment of traditional Mayan meals to choose from with fresh hot tortillas. I loved the soup! After lunch we lounged in one of the 20 hammocks that they have strung up all over waiting for our taxi ride back to the city.Pro Tips: 1. I did see someone in another group with a GoPro4 on his wrist. I know the reason they don't allow cameras is so nothing has a chance of getting lost but also so they can charge you for the photos at the end. The wrist attachment should eliminate the chance of losing the camera.2. When doing the swimming portion put your feet out in front of you and use your arms to swim, like your swimming through rapids. I like to keep one leg straight out and the other bent at a 45* at the knee. There are many stalagmites under the water surface that you can not see. Your bare skin against the rock surface.... you won't be happy. 3. Take your time! Watch your step there are many stalagmites on the path and you will trip or at least bang a toe at some point. 4. The pictures are $75USD for the whole disk. At that price I would ask the photographer to take some extra pictures of your group, I wish that I would have had more pictures that I liked.5. The revenue generated by the tours and photography packages go to help fund the nature preserve, the guides live off of your tips!! Show some love!!

Fun half day trip!. My husband and I were in Mexico for our honeymoon and are adventure people so we didn't want to lay around the whole trip. I booked three excursions, one from each of the top companies on trip advisor. Rio Secreto was gorgeous and a fun half day adventure for those who don't want to lose the whole day. Since it is mainly underground I would wait until a rainy day to go-- we went on a sunny day and had rain three of the next 5 days. I was surprised at how uneven the ground was and tricky to navigate it was. There was a 60 year ish lady in our group who really struggled. There are times when you drop three feet; sometimes you are fully submerged and other times you are not in water at all. I will say our other two excursions had cenotes and while they weren't pitch black, we got the general idea so this was a little bit overkill. If you aren't doing another excursion then this will be great! So just make sure you aren't doing duplicates.

Amazing Caves, Great Service. You can't miss this tour! The Caves are simply amazing and the service is too. Our guide Andrés made the experience fun and interesting while keeping us safe and engaged. You can't bring your own camera thou, and the pictures they sell are quite expensive, other than that: a great experience. tip: grab the walking stick!

Amazing!. This place is beautiful! Our guide Andres was so attentive and knowledgeable. I went with my Mom and she (well both of us at times) needed quite a bit of assistance. He was so patient and did such a great job of keeping us all together and helping those of us in need. At the same time he was still able to give all of the details and history. He spoke well and was so patient and friendly. This made our experience much better than it could have been otherwise. I highly recommend this tour. Even though it was quite a challenge for us in particular it was so amazing to see!

Amazing and unique experience. We did this excursion from the Norwegian Dawn cruise ship from Cozumel. After a 45-minute ferry ride we were escorted by our guide Tomas and other staff to the Rio Secreto in a minivan, about a half hour drive. Our guide Tomas was excellent, giving information about the area and region, sharing about himself, and cracking jokes. The caves are a tourist attraction but it is out in the middle of nowhere so does not feel too commercialized. We went out in groups of 8 after getting all our equipment. The tour was a perfect combination of adventurous, fun, educational, and safe. We learned a lot and got some exercise. Lunch afterward was also excellent. I agree with some other customers that it is a pity the pictures cost so much. They wouldn't let my husband take his camera, and they charge 79$ for the photos. Usually on activities like this we expect to be able to buy the photos for much less. Otherwise it was a great excursion!

Awesome. This was a truly awesome experience I wouldn't be able to string enough words together to really explain how awesome this isJust do it, just go and do it. It will be expensive, you will need to be blessed and you will not even be allowed to take pictures. Heck you can't even pee in these watersBut imagine the earth itself sculpted into glorious shapes simply by water flowAnd no human interference for hundreds of thousands of yearsImagine what that might look like (see pic below)Now go and see it for yourself!!!!

Fabulous!. We had an amazing time. The guide was extremely knowledgeable, spoke excellent English, and was safety conscious. We took the "plus" option and enjoyed rapeling into a cave, a fabulous light show and a walk through a cave as well as swimming and walking through the water in a cave. Everything was provided that was needed.

STUNNING! . This excursion is an awesome immersion into the Mayan culture. Our guide Kasaya was INCREDIBLE. You learn about the jungle, history, culture, how to speak a few lines of Mayan, and not to forget the actual river tour! I'll never forget being 60ft underground in something that is 2.5million years old - absolutely stunning. This is not an adventure packed type of activity. It's learning and culture immersion.

Beautiful experience. The walk through the caves is a sight to see. Make sure to take the walking stick, it really helps. Also make sure your helmet is tight enough. The guide was great and lots of pictures were taken which you can purchase at the end of the tour. Lunch was really good, definitely worth the trip.

Walk and swim through an underground cavern!. One of the better ship tours I have done. Took the ferry from Cozumel to Playa del Carmen and then a ~ 45 minute ride to the caverns. We put on wetsuits, life vests, and helmets with lights and made the short walk to the caverns. Our guide (Jorge) was excellent. He was very informative and guided us every step of the way. You walk through the caverns which are filled with water. Mostly around 3 feet (1 meter) deep although part of the time it's deeper than that and you do have to swim for 10-15 minutes but with a life vest you are really just floating and paddling. I'm not a great swimmer but had no issues. The cavern is beautiful inside and Jorge did a great job showing us around his "office". Highly recommend this tour.

Coolest adventure I've had in Mexico. We took this excursion as a last minute trip on New Years eve and it was the highlight of my trip! Our guide, who was a woman from Montreal but whose name i sadly cannot remember... was fantastic. Our group was a mix of children, 2 elderly women, and adults and could have been very complicated but she made it simple and easy for everyone. She offered great information about the cenote and interacted well with everyone. Towards the end when the water becomes deep she even helped one woman float through the rest of the tour, guiding us, explaining the things we were seeing, and floating the woman along as we went. It lent a fun and carefree atmosphere to a dark and mysterious cave experience making it even more enjoyable. The cave and river are amazing. Everything is so beautiful down there. It's been well preserved and they work hard to keep things as natural as possible. We were able to see and experience things that not everyone has ever seen and at the end we were able to go through a very small, very deep part of the cave that both entranced and terrified me at times. But I was able to complete it and left with a sense of accomplishment I'd never had before. You can really step out of your comfort zone here if you want to and learn about and explore a part of the world you might not see again. As a side note: you are provided with a wet suit, life vest, and safety hat. They will also provide you with water shoes if you forget yours. (bring your own if you can - they fit better) They also provide you with a towel and lunch and drinks at the end. The wetsuits are not attractice but luckily there are no mirrors when you put them on so you don't know that you may or may not look like a pregnant Sea Lion until you review the photos later. They have a professional photographer accompany the tour because no cameras or items that can be lost in the cave are allowed. It's a preserve and I'm ok with this. I also think its a great way for them to make money. The photos of the cave were excellent. The photos of me were not... but that's because of the wet suit. Not our cool photographer. He did an excellent job!! Another note: It's a bit of a journey to the cave. You take a shuttle into the jungle and then get dressed in your self esteem negating wet suits and then walk through the jungle a bit until you reach the cave. Also, our tour was about 2 hours long so it can be strenuous if you have leg, back, or hip issues. they have cool walking sticks and i highly recommend them just to give you some support while trying to maneuver through the cave in low light and unsteady footing at times. It's not slippery though, as pointed out by our awesome guide, there is no photosynthesis so no slippery algae or anything like that. But, sometimes a step is deeper than you expect or a rock is in your way that you don't expect. If you do anything at all - take this tour!! It was the best!!

Beautiful!. We took a collectivo from Playa del Carmen to get here and asked the driver to drop us of at Rio Secreto. The tour is good and the caves are beautiful! The 'walk' was just long enough, you have to swim short distances too sometimes. They take a lot of pictures and they didn't turn out good at all, plus they're really expensive.

Stunning sights with a once in a lifetime experience. My daughter found this excursion prior to going down to Mexico. We researched it on Tripadvisor and thought it was a must to see/do. We were not disappointed. I attended with two of my adult daughters and it was great. Scenery with the stalagmites and stalactites was like an Indiana Jones movie. Crawling, walking, sliding, and swimming through the passages makes you feel like a kid again. Victor our guide was excellent!!!! He is multi-lingual and rotated various groups to the front to ensure everyone had time/access to his knowledge. From the beginning when you repel into the sinkhole to the end when crawling out of the underground river it is truly an unforgettable life experience. The meal provided was also excellent, Authentic Mexican.

Wow! (Just don't get your hopes up for pictures.). This is a MUST-DO attraction if you are in this area. It is not for the novice, as there are no hand-rails, the footing is slick and sometimes difficult, and you have to be vigilant of sharp rocks, but this was the highlight of my family's trip! I do wish we could either take our own pictures or they weren't so expensive - they wanted over $140 for the pictures they took!

Great but transport is a let down. The tour is great but the food and transfer arrangements are poor. Food not labeled abd the return transfer took 2 hours for a 45 min trip. Would suggest to make your own way there either by cab or bus.

An amazing natural cave experience. Rio Secreto is a gorgeous natural cave system about 5 minutes outside of Playa del Carmen. The caves are natural- unlit, with no "easy" passages through. We had a group of 8, with 2 folks who'd had some knee and ankle issues, and our guide, Alina, did a fantastic job of pacing the group to accommodate everyone. Our only negative feedback is with the photographer- flash photos in the dark don't do much to enhance one's ability to see/balance in the dark.The meal afterward was simple, but tasty.We paid $59US per person, took the shuttle from our resort (Princess Yucatan) to Playa, and the public bus there and back. It saved us about $60US vs pack up at the hotel, and gave us a little time to putter around the town.

Wonderful tour, if overpriced. Rio Secreto is a marvelous discovery, a few kilometers of the world's longest underground river. It is not cheap (about $80USD), but it is quite memorable, a feast of stalactites and stalagmites. They provide you with a wetsuit and miner's helmet. The tourguides are quite knowledgeable, and you can schedule your tour with one who speaks English. Some reviewers refer to it as "Bucket List". I would not quite call it that, but it's cool as hell, and kids love it. The one negative is that you cannot take photos, and they charge another $80 for the CD of the photos their professional photographer takes -- nobody buys it, so I thin they need a margin-pricing MBA to explain to them that they'd sell 200 per day at $15, and only 2 or 3 per day at $80, but hey, they charge what they charge, and you can show your friends Google Images of the caves instead of succumbing to their extortion. It's about 5 minutes south of Playa on the 307. Highly recommended.

Underwater caves...Amazing!. This was such a fun excursion and would recommend it to anyone! Relatively moderate of a trip physically, just look out for those underwater rocks because they will get you right in the shin! We had a blast and I would totally do it again!

Best visit in Mexixo, must see.... Yes after long discussion we finally agree to see this place, it's awesome experience to all of us, our guide Mr. Jano was fantasticAnd very knowledgeable.He help our crew nicely.Must see this place, it's worth to visit,

Real eco-adventure. This is an amazing tour. Rio Secreto is a scenic, natural cave in the jungle. The staff is knowledgeable and totally in control of the logistics to make the adventure easy and enjoyable.

A Must-see in Playa del Carmen!. Rio Secreto is an incredible place, we've been there 3 times and will go again when we take our next vacation to Mexico! Our guide this time was Alex Rios and he was quite friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. The underground river and cave system is beautiful and serene. The cave is intentionally kept "primitive" to maintain the natural beauty and ecosystem, so there are no easy routes through the cave like you'd find in the U.S. The cave has rocks, stalagmites, etc. you must navigate around and pay close attention to your foot placement, etc. For that reason they do not allow anyone with poor ankles, knees, etc. but if you are in reasonably good health and can walk unaided it's a don't-miss if visiting the Playa del Carmen area.

Best Excursion from our Cruise. The Amazing Secret River excursion from our Holland America Western Caribbean cruise was arguably the best excursion from our entire cruise. Shortie wetsuits, life jackets, water shoes, walking sticks (very useful) and towels were all provided. We changed, took a shower and then walked to an area where we had a short Mayan ceremony and then proceeded to the underground cave. A photographer was provided as we were not allowed to take in any photographic equipment (including GoPros). It ended up being fine as we needed both of our hands most of the time anyway as the footing was pretty uneven most of the way. The cost of the photos is pretty steep ($10 per photo or $135 for the USB of all photos), but our guy got many great shots. Our guide, Diego, was very knowledgable and did a great job. We spent about an hour and a half in the cave itself. For those who are claustrophobic, there really weren't any tight spots until the end when we had to swim/float through an area with a very low ceiling. My 72 year-old in-laws came along and really enjoyed the whole experience - although they did need assistance at some points when climbing up or getting into lower pools. We were a little chilled by the end, but warmed up quickly when we got back to the surface. After changing we had a locally prepared meal that was quite good.

Great caving experience. We thoroughly enjoyed our adventure through Rio Secreto. The guide Raul was pleasant and informative. We learned about stalactites and stalagmites as we walked and swam through this cave system. Headlights, lifejackets, and wetsuits were provided. I would suggest to bring your own watershoes as we did. The experience of turning off our headlamps and being in total darkness heightened the senses and was very memorable.

Had a great time. We went in a small group of about 8 people. The caves were amazing and awe inspiring and very respectful of the Mayan culture. Our tour guide Julio was very funny informative and entertaining. He spoke excellent English , Italian and of course Spanish. I would recommend this to any one looking for an authentic and intimate experience.

Christmas holiday. I would like to thank all the staff at Rio playa blanca in lanzarote, as I and my family has amazing time ,Christmas dinner was outstanding .very clean and tidy hotel , ten minutes walk from hotel to beach and shop ,will been back again from Andrews and Theobald family

Amazing experience for the family!. We did not know what to expect from these underground rivers that were recommended by Las Villas Akumal. It was about a 20 min taxi ride from the hotel. When we arrived, we were a little concerned by the amount of people there. However, Rio Secreto very efficiently divided people into small groups for the van ride and cave tour. Our guide Romain, did a wonderful job guiding us on the bilingual tour and ensuring our little guy (5 yo) was safe and happy. The secret river was incredible...truly a once in a lifetime experience! We were pleasantly surprised by the buffet lunch that followed. When trying the salsa...proceed with caution! The only drawback is that there is no way to take personal pictures. The company has a photographer that follows the group and takes lots of pictures. One picture is $25 and the whole set is $79. We chose a pic, but forgot to pick it up, so no family picture for us. : (

A unique, small group tour . This was a great tour overall. Such a unique and special experience. Our tour guide (Lu) was very sweet, engaging, and helpful to the older guests that needed assistance. They don't advertise how "active" this trip is as it requires some pretty decent walking / balancing on rocks in the river (for us it was just fine, but more elderly visitors should be warned)! We loved the atmosphere and calm of the underground river. Food was basic but very good. I would have given 5 stars if not for the RIDICULOUS price for photos. We would have loved to buy, but for $80 (for a CD) or $25 (for 1 photo) the quality of photos wasn't worth it. Such a shame. It was a bit of a "downer" after such a nice trip to the caverns...would have been nice to end on a high note.

DON'T GO! (keep the caves pristine). OK, OK, if you must go you'll have a wonderful small-group adventure, see amazing things, learn interesting facts, meet knowledgeable guides (ours put a scorpion on his hand); but then you'll tell everyone and it'll get crowded (like the Crystal Caves in Belize) and not as much fun. We spent about 1.5 hrs in the cave. Apparently there's a longer 6 hour tour, which would be quite an adventure and I'd love to do. Our visit was an excursion from Norwegian Cruise Lines, and was one of the highlights of the cruise. It's the real deal!

A beautiful visit. This tour is a memorable experience where you walk on an underground river. The beautiful formations and transition from green jungle to total darkeness are very impressive. What I liked the most was that the caverns were not illuminated, the only source of light were the lanterns in our helmets. There was even a moment where we turned off the lights and were submerged in total darkness and silence. The only negatives are the buffet, which is not really varied, and the price of the photos, which is extremely high.

Spectacular Experience . We were on a Celebrity cruise in December and decided to visit Rio Secreto on an excursion in Cozumel. It was beyond a spectacular experience because of our tour guide Julio. He was wonderful. He had so much passion and interest in the caves and the river. He was extremely knowledgeable. He was caring too . He loved his work and it showed. He made the entire experience so much better. The caves are amazing. The scenery is just mind boggling. And it was truly enhanced because of Julio and his love for the secret river and its caves. When you are in Cozumel you can visit the beach.....but you will be missing a once in a lifetime experience if you don't join Julio and see this unbelievable place.

Tour was great, transportation not so much. Our guide was great and made the tour so fun! It was really unique and something we have never done before. The ride to get there was terrible. The road is so bumpy and full of pot holes. The drivers have to weave all over the road to get there and it was not a short ride once inside Rio Secreto. Also at the end, we had to wait over an hour for other guests whose hotels were near ours for a ride back. They started their tours way after us and it was frustrating to have to wait so long when all we wanted to do was go back. The guide took the group on another tour to a walking cave to help with the wait, but it was still an inconvenience, especially with how much you pay to go there.

2nd time visiting and hope to go again. This is our second visit to Rio Secreto--having last visited in 2012 when they had 2 "Paths" thru the cave. Now we are told there are at least 3 paths with more on the way. You are fitted up in knee length wet suits, helmets with lights, and water shoes and enter the cave in small groups--Our group was 8. Remembering how slippery the cave is inside--we chose a walking stick this time and were glad of it. The path thru the cave consists of walking on land, walking in the water, and some swimming. The cave formations are breathtaking--but it's the experience of swimming in this crystal clear water which is so exciting. There are plenty of opportunities to step in holes, slip, and slide so don't do this tour unless you have decent balance and are able to stoop, climb and reach. My one slip and fall was luckily in the water (it turned out to be a spectacular cannon-ball type of fall). The exit to the particular path we were on was tricky to navigate--we basically had to back float--keeping the top of the cave a safe 2 inches from our faces. Not a tour for anyone with claustrophobia. This tour is definitely not to be missed.After the tour--there is a complimentary shot of Mayan Tequila as well as lunch. They have clean bathrooms and a changing facility.

Awesome experience. Make sure to include rio secreto in your trip to anywhere in the riviera maya area or cancun. It's simply an amazing experience. Our guide was a lot of fun and the journey in the caves was a perfect adventure. the equipment provided was very good and the drink after the tour is just amazing. Don't expect much from the lunch buffet though.Our only complaints is the ripoff for pictures; It's understandable to not be allowed to take your camera inside, but 25$ for just one picture on a CD is not exactly how we wanted to end our visit.

Amazing Experience not to be missed. This place is amazing. One our best excursions ever! It's an underground passage way with spring waters to wade, float and walk through while viewing stalactites and stalagmites and other formations. It was only recently discovered (by accident) in the last 8 years. Our guide, Alondra, was hysterical and informative. We highly recommend asking for her by name. She was the best guide at the adventure. The excursion starts with a short video about the location, followed by a short walk to get your gear (wet suit, life jacket, water socks and helmet with attached light, all,included in the price). You then get a locked looker for your valuables and then head by a short walk in small groups of 6-10 to the site, after stopping for a brief ceremony (5 minutes) before heading down into the site. You then walk, crawl a little, wade, float and climb underground about 1/2 mile through the site. It's an amazing experience and well worth a visit. No cameras are allowed as they sell pictures at the end of the excursion, taken by a photographer who accompanies you on the excursion. Don't miss this, and remember to ask for Alondra!

Interesting tour of flooded cave system. The walk and swim through the cave system was a bit tricky and a few of us scratched up our knees and shins. But it was worth it. Lu was an excellent tour guide. Lu and the attraction coordinators did a great job of explaining the tour arrangements and how the caves are formed. They also made sure that we were fed and got back to our shuttle bus.

Experience The Tranquility. It is not the first cave I went but definitely one of the best. The guide was very helpful and informative. The cave was amazing and some part was quite slippery. Make sure you watch your steps. The best part was when we laying on our backs and enjoying the swimming in the refreshing cave water. Definitely recommend this as part of cancun trip. Did not do the one with the lights. Maybe would be even better.

Amazing!. The guide was great, friendly and informative. The group was small. There were only 10 people in my group and 5 were from my family. It felt great to romp and swim through the cave. We saw bats and spiders. I tripped once, because I was eager to see the bats, but my guide found a fresh aloe plant as soon as we got out of the cave and ripped of the tip to rub on my bloody knee. Lunch was buffet style- all you could eat, and delicious!! It was very simple to travel with them because they provided lockers and keys and a changing area. The helmets, flashlights and wetsuits were all good quality. They took pictures for us and sold them at the end. The licorice liquor to warm up was amazing. I was fond of the pet coati at the wet suit office!

Breathtaking. This excursion is a once in a lifetime experience. Words cannot describe the wonders of this attraction. Mother Natures finest work first hand. Our tour guide was Victor. Victor had a great sense of humor, spoke good English, was very informative, and communicated very well to the group for our safety while navigating through the caves.Thank You Victor!!!

Amazing experience. Rio Secreto ,is an awesome experience near Playa Del Carmen.It is a natural reserve of Stalactites and Stalagmites that one sees while swimming or walking through the river.Our guide Benito was great!The CD of pictures is a bit pricy, but some of the shots taken were memorable.Quality of wet suits , shoes ...and the lunch after the excursion was nice!

Amazing . Amazing and tranquil experience. Never have done something like that before in my life. However, be aware of the pictures rip off at the end. They dont allow you to bring any water cameras in and instead charge you 25 dollars!! Per picture or 109 dollars for pics plus souvenirs. Dont buy the xtabentún liquor there. Its 25 bucks! you can get it for 12 bucks on 5th avenue.

Río Secreto is a hidden gem worth exploring. Río Secreto is a Natural Reserve of stunning Underground River with thousands of dramatic stalactites and stalagmites. It's quite beautiful, but a challenge to balance/walk in the cave. Our guide is the no-nonsense, witty Guoda from Ukraine. She is knowledgeable and passionate about the preservation of Río Secreto. We learn a great deal from her.

Great experience! . There were 8 of us in my family. Two are children of ages 6 and 7. Andres was a wonderful guide. He is very knowledgeable. He made it fun, informative and safe throughout our tour. Definitely recommend visiting Rio Secreto and definitely like to visit again.
Amazing. Went here solo but it was a beautiful experience. Guide was very knowledgeable. We swam in the caves, the water was crystal clear. Definitely a one time visit.

WOW. I've been in caves before but never with water that you float in. Amazing. They won't let you bring cameras so you have to buy the cd for $79. A rip off but you get some great pics of your group! This was one of the coolest sites I have seen around the world!!!Only complaint is they wouldn't let you bring your camera.

A great experience!. Rio Secreto was a highlight of our vacation and I would happily go back to do one of the other trails though the caves! Andrés was a great guide. He obviously knew a lot about the caves and could answer any question, at the same time he gave us plenty of time to admire the caves and enjoy their beauty. The pictures at the end were a little bit expensive, but personally I thought it was great that you couldn't bring your own camera. This way we didn't have to wait for everyone posing and taking pictures, and got to spend more time exploring. Transport to and from the hotel was on time, and the van was in good condition.

top 1 in Playa!. Best experience ever. We were a large group and our guide was a fantastic Argentine girl. She knew a lot about the place and talked about it's history and all. We booked through the hotel and the didn't tell us we had 2 options. One is to enter Rio Secreto and have a one hour and a half tour. The other is to bike the the entrance, descend in rappel and make the tour. Could be interesting. Rio Secreto PLUS. In any case the price also includes lunch, which is a buffet, nothing fancy but it;s good. The only bad thing is the photographs. The place is amazing and you definitely want to take pictures but nothing is allowed inside. No earrings, watches and much less cameras. Our photographer was a nice woman but half the pictures are out of focus, plus if you want a single picture they charge 400 Pesos with is like 23 US. An absolute JOKE! You can buy all os them for 1200. But half of them out of focus.... That is why I'm NOT giving Rio Secreto 5 stars.

Rio Secreto underground caves. We had a spectacular tour at the Rio Secrete underground caves. Our guide Andres was amazing, very knowledgable and took extra care with our children (ages 6 to 13). I would highly recommend this tour to anyone no matter your age. We were a group of 11 and everyone had a terrific time. Our guide took us on the Happiness trail and it was a truely wonderful site to see and experience. We want to go back to go through other routes. We would definitely ask for Andres to be our guide again. Helmets, wet suits and water shoes were all included as well as a great lunch that served some excellent local cuisine. Timing is three to fours hours. Our tour was at 1pm and was perfect.

awesome excursion. We were a group of 11 and our guide, Andres was the best. He was very knowledgeable, enthusiastic and overall great to have around. He took care of the younger kids, making sure they got through the caves with no issues. The excursion was great, it is one of those that you must do to complete your trip.

Awesome!!! Would go back. We got a great tour. Andres was excellent with our family group of 11. This is a must see tour. You will not regret it. Thank you. Our children (5 of them) between ages of 6 to 13 were well taken care of going through the caves!

Cave People. Rio Secreto is a unique way to tour Mexico and get some brilliant culture at the same time. Our guide was Diego and he is knowledgeable and hilarious; traits I'm finding in almost every Mexican I meet.Here's the gist: you descend into a natural cave, formed over millions of years (or for you religious folk, formed by God 5000 years ago, wink wink) and learn about geology, Mexico, and Mayan culture. You clambour, wade, and swim within the Earth, experiencing nature. Pretty freakin' awesome. There are some tight spaces to navigate and if you're scared of swimming maybe reconsider, but even then they are so accommodating and it's just so damn cool that Rio Secreto is a perfect place for you to conquer your fears. Before going into the cave you are given the option of bringing along a walking stick. DO IT! Not only will it help you climb along the uneven cavern floor, it will come in handy when you have to fight off the hordes of subterranean cave people.

Breathtaking scene . It is a wonderful tour, breathtaking scene inside the cave, the cave is well protected, no electricity inside, you only rely on the light on the helmet. It is a unique experience to walk through the cave in the water. Tour guider will lead you go through the cave, our tour guide is Valentino, very funny and knowledge guy. Camera is not allowed in the cave, I think it is for safety, but a photographer will take pics for everyone, after the tour, you can buy one pic for USD25, or all the pics in a disc for USD79.

A surreal experience!!. Beyond words to explain,such an experience with our experienced,entertaining and super nice guide,Alfredo!! you have no worries,I was a bit anxious,and curious what to expect,but Alfredo made it all so .....all worthwhile.We were tantalized with how beautiful the undergoriund world down there with the amazing stalactytes and stalagmytes so alive! I'll never forget this adventure.

Fantastic. Great afternoon here, not for those who are claustrophobic. Absolutely beautiful caves which where only discovered a few years ago. Group sizes are small so best to book in advance to take in this activity. Great staff who show patience when taking through the caves. Recommend that you take a walking cane to help balance while walking through these caves to prevent damage to the stalagmites and stalagtites.

Maybe not for everyone. After reading the many enthusiastic reviews of this attraction I decided to book a tour, but did not find it nearly as great as many others. Ever been to a cave before? Well, it's like that except being wet most of the time. After being dropped off at the entrance by a taxi we filled out some paperwork and were then placed into vans for a fairly bumpy ~15 minute ride to a facility close to the cave entrance where you are provided with special shoes, a wetsuit, lifejacket, helmet with light, locker to store your stuff and a guide. You then wade (mostly), swim (a bit) and walk (a bit) through the cave system for 1.5 hours, stopping for pictures taken by an accompanying photographer and information from the guide about cave system and Mayan culture. Then you head back to change clothes, buy photos if you want and eat a pretty decent buffet lunch (soup, rice, pasta, scrambled eggs, fruit). The whole operation is very well organized and the staff, as typified by our excellent guide Diana, is quite friendly. How much you enjoy this attraction will probably vary from person to person. If you've never been to a cave before, or are a cave enthusiast, this may be a cool and interesting way to experience it. But if you've been to a number caves before (I've been to Sung Sot in Vietnam and Waitomo Caves in New Zealand), this one may not seem all that exceptional, unless swimming your way through some semi-brisk ("refreshing" is the glass half-full way of looking at it) water underground sounds like something you'd really be into. I'll also add that at one point during the tour everyone floats together with zero illumination -- it's absolutely pitch black. While a number of reviewers found it really interesting as it heightened one's other senses, I couldn't wait for it to be over -- that's just me.So, in summary, I'd just say this is probably a case of everyone having their own unique preferences. My sister who went with me on the tour found it "pretty cool" while I was less enthusiastic. Maybe you'd love this attraction or maybe you'd wish you'd just stayed on the beach. At $79/pop for the entrance, just make sure to think it over before booking.

Sacred River!. Had a great time at the Rio Secreto! Our guide was friendly and knowledgeable about everything "underground". We got to choose from the pictures they took and they put them on a CD for us, did not need to buy all of them! Road was bumpy to get back to the entrance but tolerable, they could put some money into it but unless done right would just wash away anyway! Okay lunch, but it could have been a little more tourist friendly and by that I mean I had no idea what I was eating? Would have liked some tacos, nachos or something recognizable! VERY eco friendly which is nice to see in a place that usually doesn't seem to care if the future generations are able to enjoy in the future! Highly recommend, you wear wet suits, water shoes and helmets, which are all provided. Water is cold but you get used to it rather quickly. Some places over your head but you have a big life jacket on and no one needs to know how to swim. Loved it when ALL the lights were turned off! GO---you will love it, kids too!

Mayan Underground. Pleasantly surprised. Starts with an "Indiana Jones" Adventure down the bumpy road to the site. Once all "geared up" our very knowledgable guide, Alejandro (Alex) took us through the Cenote, describing the history, geology and ecology. We had all been through caves in the USA and Europe but nothing like this. With wet and dry sections it required nimble feet and a good amount of wading that added to the adventure. Loved the swimming section and the special experience near the end. Never felt the presence of other groups. The assigned guide stays with your group the entire tour including making sure you're outfitted, safe through the cave, cleaned up, fed and of course given the chance to buy your photos (no personal cameras permitted). The photo package is probably the only negative of the whole event. We were a group of 8 (our two families of 4) and should have been offered a single package, not be required to buy two packages just to get everyone's picture. The package is expensive enough without having to buy a second. It is a nice compilation of your tour and stock cave photos (123 pics). All in all a great experience and a nice break from the sun and surf.

Great tour, horrible customer service. Today my girlfriend and I had the pleasure of visiting the Rio Secreto cave system attraction. We had a great time exploring the caves with our comedic and knowledgeable tour guide Andres. Along the way - a photographer comes along and takes photos at various intervals. At the end of the tour a family was curious to know what the cost was for photos taken, and our guide was reluctant to divulge that info - we soon discovered the reason for this hesitation. Turns out if you want a single photo on a CD that costs $25USD, meanwhile a CD with all the photos can be attained for a low-low price of $70 (or $60 or $50USD - this changed several times throughout the conversations I had.) Needless to say no photos were able to be purchased at the advertised price. My advice for those considering the Rio Secreto is to ignore the on-tour photographer unless you have more money than you know what to do with. Otherwise we had an enjoyable experience that was unfortunately ruined by the irrationally high prices at exit.

Go! You won't regret it!. This was the best excursion we have ever done. We've been to Tulum, Xel-Ha and a couple other small excursions, but this was the best one. We had a great guide Juano (Alex). He was so relaxed, confident and knowledgeable. It made the excursion that much better. It was raining the day we went, so it was perfect to be 60 feet below the surface. Each cave and underground river has unique features. We repelled down into the second cave, which was exciting and something new. There is a cool light show in the final cave as well. If you go, make sure you get the "Plus" package so you can have the option to see all three caves. Otherwise, you just have the first cave. The whole excursion was about 5 hours long. It is well worth the time and money!

Hidden secret !. We did this excursion by ourself, last July 2015..... whàt a gem ! Quiet, no massive invasion of crowds, fantastic personal guide, authentical, affordable, etc. etc. In a few words : do some research before and discover this hidden secret.

A Natural Wonder. Spectacular!! Great experience. They provide the equipment you'll need plus a guide. Ours was Carine and she was fantastic, friendly and very safety conscious. She spoke several languages & took her time to answer question and help us to enjoy the experience. The time flew by. Yes, they don't allow you to bring your own camera however this is probably a good thing as you could inadvertently hurt yourself trying to get that perfect shot. We bought the package and don't regret it. How often can you traverse 90 feet underground and swim in a freshwater cave??
Wow. The best thing we have ever done. Absolutely amazing. Great buffet.. The sights of this newly discovered cave will give you goosebumps thinking about many many years down the road.

Unbeschreiblich schön . A tour trough Rio Segreto was an absolutely amazing event! I haven't seen anything comoarable like this before. Down there you explore a magical world. We just were thrilled by those wonderful nature buildings. Viktor R. was the perfect guide. He explained everything great, spoke a fantastic English and was so compitent and nice!

Lots of fun. Although the "road" to rio secreto is a painfully slow and rough experience the actual adventure in the cave was a lot of fun. A bit physically challenging for the young and old as you often can't see where you are stepping but it was a fantastic beautiful experience

Great time. Every one in our group enjoyed this tour! I would highly recommend it. The cave was beautiful and the swimming in the underground river was a memory maker! Our guide was great and so was the buffet. The only down side is you are not allowed to bring your personal camera into the cave and pictures are $25.00 a piece.

Awesome Experience! . This was a fantastic tour! We had an amazing time.... Walking through the caves was cool... But swimming in the caves was freaking awesome! Put guide Andrés was fantastic. He was patient and humorous... Knowledgeable and told us just enough information without lecturing. He gets a 10! My one complaint and that is why I gave this tour a four rather than five star rating is that they do not allow photos on the tour and the photos they try to sell you are way overpriced... That said. I would still recommend this fantastic tour

DO THIS! Even if you don't want to do anything. So we came to Cancun to unwind and chill at the Westin Lagunamar with absolutely no excursions on our minds, heart or desire. Somehow we found out about this preserve and since I am an adventurer at heart it sounded very unique. It is truly a NATIONAL TREASURE that Mexico should take the greatest care to preserve. However the world knows that most likely will not happen. Thank goodness some private and savvy individuals have already done this by setting up the park. I am not a cave explorer by any means however the natural beauty of the different crystal formations, the sheer immensity of this underground treasure and the crystal clear waters will amaze your senses. Our guide Valentino took special care to explain the history and significance if this natural phenomenon that provides 20% of the entire countries water supply. I was wondering why the tap water at the hotel tasted so good.... it is supplied from here. I hope that the government of Mexico cherishes this blessing and cares for it for future generations. You are not allowed to take any pictures while in the underground river... probably for safety reasons... you can easily trip and gash your head open with the many formations that are everywhere. I bought the book at the end which captures the beauty of this sacred place. This is a tour you should do if you only do one tour your entire trip. It is not extremely strenuous but does require that you pay attention to your footings the entire time. If you are a total couch potatoe this tour might be a bit of a workout for you, however for the vast majority it should be a nice walk/ez hike.

Excellent experience . Visited on a cruise ship shore excursion. The ride out is very bumpy, but worth the bouncing. We went on one of the 1.5 hour tours and loved it. Does require lots of walking on uneven and often submerged terrain. All equipment provided, including optional walking stick. Depending on water level when you go, you may be walking through water up to neck - deep or swimming. Julio is an amazing tour guide and takes time to explain the scientific and cultural meanings of the site. For the more fit and adventurous, there's a 5 hr tour that includes biking to remote center and repelling down into the caverns.

AMAZING. This is one of the best excursions I've ever done!!! Andres was the best guide!! The caves are just amazing! The water can be cold but the wetsuit helps. Can be a bit dangerous walking but used the walking stick so it helped a great deal.

Awesome excusion - If you are looking for something different to do!. If you are looking for something different to do, this is it! We took this excursion from the Celebrity Eclipse on 12/16/15. The travel was smooth (30 minute ferry, 20 minute van ride). Once you get suited up in your wetsuit, water shoes, life vest and helmet there is a short hike to the entrance to the caves. Our guide, Andres, was fantastic. We toured the Palaces cave where there is a lot of water to go through. It was fantastic! I thought I would be slightly claustrophobic but had no problems at all. Just truly amazed at everything you see. The buffet lunch was delicious. I would highly recommend this excursion to anyone looking for an adventure to remember.

A wonderful unforgettable experience!. We read many things about this place but it came nothing near to what it was to experience it. The caves were breathtaking and to top it off, our guide Andres shared his great knowledge and expertise making it way more interesting and enjoyable. We would definitely recommend this place to anyone traveling to Mexico. Guides like Andres make these trips much more special.
Excellent attraction. We had a wonderful experience. Our tour guide Nadia was excellent and provided great guidance and information on the tour. Would recommend to everyone.
In the underground. It is a very mystical place, you can see how the stalactites are formed it is quiet and dark. You are all equipped when you get there: wet suit, life vest, forehead lamp...

Once in a life time experience. This was the best excursion i have done on my cruise of the Caribbean. It was amazing, the tour guide julio was fun and helped all of us get to know each other and make the experience the best it could be.

Amazing Adventure!. This excursion is a once in a lifetime adventure. The cave itself is beautiful and then add the river and it is breathtaking. You have to be in fairly good shape as there is a lot of walking over uneven terrain and occasional squatting. I highly recommend using the walking stick for balance since they do not want you to touch anything in the cave. There is also a fairly short walk to the cave entrance and stairs you have to descend. They provide you with a wet suit, water shoes (although if you have your own water shoes I would recommend you wear them), helmet with a light, and a life jacket. There is swimming involved, but if you can dog paddle that is sufficient. No cameras are allowed but you are followed the entire time by a photographer so at the end of the tour you have the option to purchase pictures. I purchased the CD which not only had our pictures but other pictures taken inside the cave. The time spent in the cave is an hour and a half. We were then provided with an excellent buffet style lunch with drinks. This was an excursion taken from a cruise ship so I don't know if food is always provided.

Natural wonder, worth the trip!. First of all, I love natural attractions that haven't been overly tampered with and I avoid crowds. This was perfect for me! The tours are done in groups of 10 and well paced, so that you don't connect with, or hear, any other groups. The 15 minute ride up to the river is the road from hell, with massive potholes, which our driver skillfully dodged, but that entailed a LOT of swerving. If you get motion sick, be prepared! The trip through the river is varied and very uneven, as one reviewer complained. It is a NATURAL wonder, so they haven't hacked away rock formations for the convenience of tourists - it was splendid! The water level varied from non existent, to deep enough that we had to swim. I'm a weak swimmer, but with a mandatory life jacket, I had no problem at all. My guide Diana, made numerous stops, explaining the formations and natural fauna. There was an opportunity to handle some broken stalactites and stalagmites - otherwise, it was hands off! Natural body oils discolor them over time and touching them can cause fissures that weaken them. I would definitely not take children who are unruly, have difficulty staying focused or tend not to listen (just sayin'!)Yes, there were the obligatory pictures taken by the photographer and they're costly, but I'm glad they don't allow tourists to take pictures. The constant flashing of cameras would have detracted greatly from the experience. Resolution on the personal pictures that I purchased was a bit grainy.Diana regularly warned us of areas that were challenging and helped group members (me specifically!) if they were having trouble navigating. There are 3 different routes that can be taken, so I would definitely take this trip again! It was an unforgettable experience and the highlight of my trip to Mexico!

A great day!. This trip was one of the best excursions I have taken on vacation! Thank you Andres!We learned alot and had a fun day. The underground cenotes are amazing! I have to admit, I was a bit hesitant to make this trip, but I am so glad I did.

Great Family Adventure!. If you want a change from sunny beach you can plunge into this clear and cool water of underground fresh water system. It's a well organized, guided adventure with history background, fun story telling and hands on experience. You are provided with all equipment needed and lunch buffet. I would say kids from 6 years old up will enjoy it greatly. While I have seen under little kids, it was too much for my 4 year old girl. My 6 year old boy, however, had lots of fun!

Awesome Experience. This NATURAL underground river/cave excursion was one of those experiences that you'll remember forever! Our guide, Alex, was excellent. He was so informative, funny, helpful, thoughtful and spiritual!!!! I'm 63 and have had spine surgeries, but am fairly mobile. It was just enough of a challenge for me - that I felt proud I accomplished it. Well worth the money! So happy I was able to share this with my two grown granddaughters. They loved it too. Alex is the best!!!!!

Wow!. What an amazing experience! Swimming in the cenote and learning about the formation of the cenote and the Mayan beliefs is an experience that everyone should take. Our guide Tomas was fantastic, he was very patient and so informative on many topics of the cenotes, and the Mayan culture that when our tour time was up we weren't ready to leave yet.

Great potential, but could have been better. Overall the site is very cool, but we felt that the lack of engagement and the guide going through the motions took away from the trip. WE had little time to stop and enjoy the caverns and features because we continued to march on to the next photo location. After a photos is done, it's off the next photo spot. The photos themselves are way over priced at $79USD, which is almost the cost of admission! It could have been better - our friends had rave reviews - so clearly your experience is as good as your guide. Allowing time to appreciate the natural beauty of the site would have certainly gone a long way.

Don't keep Rio Secreto a secret. Somewhere tucked away in the Yucatan is Rio Secreto. I went on this ecotour and it was wonderful. It is an underwater cave that is filled with jaw-dropping eco views of stalactite and stalagmite formations. Every twist and turn brought a new nature/Mayan-inspired marvel. The tour guide, Miguel, was patient and his stories made the tour even more fascinating. At the end was a buffet lunch with authentic Yucatan-inspired cuisine. I must stress that you be extremely fit. Prior to entering the cave is a hike along rough terrain and once in the cave, the walking requires one to dodge rocks. There is swimming and, even though you wear a life vest, you must be able to swim. But, you must be fit so if you're not, you will find this overwhelming. The other issue is the picture taking. You cannot take your camera (that is understandable) and there is a professional photographer who goes on the tour to take pictures. At the end, you are charged $79.95 for a disk, which features many on the tour as well as individual shots. I opted to buy two of my own shots rather than shell out $80.00. Including the transportation there and the entrance fee, you spend upwards of $130. Add the photos and you're at over $210…if you get the full package. Overall, I enjoyed this eco-adventure but would have liked to know about the financial obligations upfront. Also, you do not want to do this on your own. You MUST have a guide!

Best family excursion. From ages 6 to 60+, our crew loved Rio Secreto! I highly recommend this as a half-day trip. The ride to the caves was a bit bumpy, but it was worth it. The guides were friendly and entertaining.

Pablo was fantastic!. We had the opportunity to visit and had a great time! Pablo was our guide and was fantastic. He really added to the experience by letting us know how spiritual the Mayans considered these caves, which enhanced our visit. It's a crazy drive from the check-in to the actual cave area but an adventure. Cold shower before getting on your wetsuit to remove any lotions, etc (not good for the cave) so don't bother putting any sunscreen on before you go! Short walk through the jungle to get there and then walking and swimming in the caves. We saw a few bats and even a fish or two! Fun time - highly recommend this!

Rio Secreto. Amazing experience! Going underground into a cenote (sink hole) and into a cavern with a river running through it. We swam in the river as we marvelled at the stalagetites and stalagmites, the fish, the bats, the insects. Great tour guide, Valentino. They take very good care of you in the caves and I felt very safe. Ended with a wonderful buffet. Don't miss this one

Not for the faint of heart. This is the real deal. You put on a wet suit, a life vest and a helmet with a light attached to it. You go into a small part of this massive cave system, and are guided through the cavern along a set path. You will climb, walk, and swim throughout the tour. Andrés shared his knowledge, and passion with us. This was a great experience, and worth doing if you are somewhat fit. Photographers will take your pictures and offer them for sale at the end of the tour too. Lunch was provided with our package, and it was tasty. The habanero salsa was spicy :)

Incredible and beautiful experience!!. My husband and I signed up for this attraction as one of our cruise excursions. It was by far one of the best excursions that we have ever done. Our guide Andre was funny, friendly and very knowledgeable. It was well organized from beginning to end including the lunch served after and the chance to lay in hammocks and relax. Would do this again in a heartbeat!!

Stunning!. An excellent experience traveling the underground river and the caves. The natural beauty of the caves is stunning! So pristine and peaceful. Our guide, Eduardo, was excellent. He was extremely knowledgeable and did a great job of sharing information. My wife and I are so glad that we took this tour.

Once of a life time experience. Something I will always remember! Very unique! The experience was more physical than I thought (climbing up and down rocks) but our guide and other tour members helped us get through it. The lunch wasn't much....pasta, rice, fruit, juice, and soup. Not a real lunch. I was expecting tacos or something with some protein.

Amazing Experience. We were lucky and only had 4 people in our group plus Lara our guide. Lara was amazing. You could tell she was very passionate about her job and it made the experience even that much better. It is pricey compared to other excursions in the area and the CD they sell cost $89 US but it was one of those things that I thought was a once in a lifetime opportunity and the pictures turned out really nice so we decided to buy it. They have 3 different spots in the river system where you can go down and do tours. I think the one we did was called Palais or something like that. I thought this was a once in a lifetime experience, however, my husband wants to return next time we go to Mexico so he can down and explore one of the other areas. The free buffet that's included wasn't anything special however the tortilla soup was pretty yummy.
Rio Secreto Cenotes Excursion. A truly unique experience. The guides were friendly, gregarious, and very informative. The excursion was well run and good fun!

Awesome! . This was an excellent tour and Rio Secreto caves/underground river were amazing! One of the best experiences ever! Tour was great and the local cuisine buffet was really good. The road to get to the caves was quite bumpy, but all in all a fantastic day!

A great experience. While on our honeymoon, my wife and I decided to visit Rio Secreto. The person that helped us book it was happy we already knew we wanted to do it and that he didn't have to "push" it. He said often times people don't know about it and don't realize what they are missing out on.Our guide for the river was Julio. He was awesome. You could tell he really enjoyed what he did.The cave took about an hour and a half to get through and we saw some bats, a few spiders, and some very cool subterranean structures. It was fascinating to learn about the importance of places similar to this one to the Mayan people and what they thought the various things meant.I highly recommend visiting this place if you take a trip to that area of Mexico. You will get a once in a lifetime experience and your money helps go to preserving and exploring more of the cave.

Cool experience. If you get tired of the beach, the sun, and the heat this is a great cool, dark experience. You walk down steps to below ground level then explore a network of caves by wading and swimming. Our guide, Julio, was very knowledgable, enthusiastic, and fun. A unique experience for sure.

If there is one thing you do when in the area, THIS IS IT. The tour guide, Alan was excellent! We were lucky to have a small group only 4 people so it felt like a personal tour of the cave. The road into the cave is very rough but its worth the ride. The only draw back was that they had lots of rain the weeks prior so we couldn't go all the way through. We had to turn back as the cave exit was fully under water but not much the tour can do about that!! They pick you up at your resort and drop you back with a meal and a 2 hour tour underground all included.They have various levels and when i go back to the area I will defiantly be doing a more adventurous guided tour.

Fantastic experience. The experience of a lifetime! Due to the changing water levels the tour can be quite different depending on when you take it. Our guide was very friendly and knowledgable. We (accidentally) chose the 'Plus' option which meant our tour was about an hour longer and we got to ride bicycles to a cave and then rappel into it before wading our way out before starting the regular tour. It was totally worth it though. The rappel was so much fun and i will always remember it.

Amazing sights. What a pleasant surprise. We signed up for the tour because we were told this one was done in smaller groups instead of being part of a herd of tourist. The first portion of the tour involved approximately 10 individuals where we put on wetsuits, life jackets and ventured into Rio Secreto. The sights were beautiful. Diego, our tour guide couldn't have been nicer, more knowledgeable or accommodating. It's refreshing to find a tour guide that appreciates the sights and sounds and isn't just going through the motion of getting tourists in and out. He was a true delight. We signed up for the under advertised Plus package (only 2 of the 10 continued on with the tour) which included repelling into a cenote and walking through another underground cave. We would highly recommend doing the Plus portion. It's not something you can do everyday...well maybe Diego can. Lucky him.

Mexico's hidden secret. We went on the privilege tour which took nearly 3 hours and included an excellent lunch.The operation here is exceptional and caves beyond description . Any one visiting should go here.One special word of note was our guide Alfredo, this guy looked after us like kings and his pure passion and enthusiasm for his job was totally infectious. This particular privilege tour was indeed a privilege in the company of Alfredo.

Amazing exploration of underground rivers. More or less a textbook example of eco-tourism. This activity brings you underground and lead you through an underground river, and teach you a couple things about Yucatan’s natural water supplies and Mayan heritage.

Incredible Natural Attraction. After a bumpy ride in from the main road, our guide took us on an amazing underground journey. I had done the cave swimming at Xplor previously and thought this would be similar. I was very wrong - this was much more natural, less commercialized, more extensive. These caves are absolutely amazing and the vast majority of what you see is totally natural, unmodified by people, including that fact that there is no permanent lighting (the photo was taken with a very bright flash). Our guide Alfredo was incredibly knowledgable and very entertaining. We did the Plus Tour, which included a repel into a cave, and it was totally worth the extra money. Of all the Riviera Maya area attractions I've visited, I would recommend Rio Secreto the highest.
Wow!. Had a great time exploring those caves. We went to Harrison's Caves in the past, in Barbados, and they were nice. But being able to swim and walk through those was a unique experience.

Great Experience. We recently went to Rio Secreto when staying outside Playa del Carmen. It was my first cenote, and I wanted to experience one with a guided tour. I really enjoyed this, the cenote was beautiful, the tour guide was excellent, and the experience well worth it!

Rio Secreto awesomeness!. Awesome tour with an awesome guide! Ask for Andrés Vidau O'Hara if you ever go hes the best! Lots of information and super friendly with everyone. The place is just amazing it is defenetly a must see if you go to Cancun Mexico. The food was also very good.
Amazing time at Rio Secreto!. We had an amazing time at Rio Secreto!! Alondra was our tour guide andand she was super funny, taught us so much!! Highly recommend!!

Rio Secreto tour. Andres made our trip amazing!!! He took care of our little boys and joked and laughed the entire time! He also took care of my diabetic daughter when she got a low blood sugar! He made the cave so much better than it already was! Cave was beautiful, food was great, but Andres made the trip! Definitely a must see attraction...request Andres as your tour guide!

Amazing Rivers. We took an excursion offered from our Hotel, We had an international tour guide that was very informative on the history& the sacred rituals. She had a great personality and made sure we were all aware of the safety aspects during the trek. She also mentioned the respect to the environment and asked that we do not touch any of the stalagmites & the stalactites that we would be seeing. The hike through the 750 meter cave can be a bit slippery, so water shoes and a walking stick was supplied to all. The history and the outstanding scenery was beautiful.
Rio secreto. Loved every minute of it. Andre was our guide and he was just amazing. Kids loved it. My wife and I had a wonderful time. Absolutely a must. Rare experience.

Very cool but not for the old or young. We visited with our 4 year old children (minimum age allowed) and extremely fit 70 year old parents. Although it could have ben great for us (a couple in our 30s), it was inappropriate for both the kids and our parents. This place is best for people from probably 7 to 60. Despite reading through the website and other people's reviews, it was not clear how technical some of the cave exploration would be. Yes, they give you a walking stick (anyone over 50ish or so should definitely take the stick), but there are several areas that require technical angling of your body and skilled footwork that our little kids and parents could not do on their own. There was constant hand holding and slipping. 4 people drew blood slipping on the slippery limestone. If you've ever visited cenotes before, this is totally different. You aren't just floating with flippers on when you visit Rio Secreto. Here, you are actively exploring caves with extremely uneven ground. The experience was fantastic, but unfortunately in our case the beauty and wonder of the experience was overshadowed by the fact that 4 of the 6 of us had a very difficult time maneuvering through the caves. Also, the photos were horrible. Since we couldn't bring our camera in (which is a great policy), I was hopeful that the photographer would take good photos. The photos taken of our group were really disappointing. They were blurry and taken with basically no skill. Door to door, the visit was about 6 hours and definitely could have been made shorter into 4.5 or 5 hours if there wasn't so much waiting around.

Breathaking and incredible experience!. A new favorite! Went with 16 year old son to this amazing place - very gracious hosts and our guide Lara was so wonderful and funny, she took really good care of us. She really loves her work and it shows! Cave is so incredibly beautiful and I felt honored to experience. Moderately Strenuous...with a few very big steps and some places are slippery. Take the shoes they have- mine did not have enough traction and I really needed help in a few spots - l was so greatful for our photographer and guide as they made even the more challenging parts fun. This is a natural cave which means no "paths", and no handholds since it is a living cave site. Take the walking stick and wear the shoes provided!Not a tour for cranky children and kids need to be able to appreciate how they can damage CENTURIES of growth if they touch...I only recommend for older children who can really appreciate the awesome beauty. We had a really great group, and the sacredness of the site was felt by all. Will carry the memory of this treasured place with me - awe inspiring and worthy of the few minor aches the next day!

Journey to the Center of the Earth. We booked this tour a couple of hours before and found the reservationist to be very helpful - $65 dollars. The weather was very windy so where better to go but under ground. We arrived and thought we were at the caves but no, they take you in a van through the jungle (about 20 minutes) to the entrance of the caves. Rio Secreto supplies you with water shoes, life vest, helmet with head lamp, and a wet suit. I think our guide was Carlos and he was very good. The caves were amazing and swimming in them was an awesome experience - especially when all the lights were off and it was pitch black - you wait for your eyes to adjust but that doesn't happen because there is no light coming from anywhere. The stalactites and stalagmites were amazing - incredible formations! I highly recommend this tour which is perfect for non beach or non pool day.

Amazing Caving. We booked the shore excursion months ahead of our cruise date. The cruise ship does not doc at the city. You have to take a ferry for about 45 mins to the doc. There were 2 Rio Secreto guides waiting to take us by van to the cave They do advise that it is a bumpy ride. The Tour guide Fernando, did not talk the whole way which I thought was a little upsetting, he was on his phone the whole ride. Once we arrived to the Rio Secreto we were met with our tour guide Fernanda. She is very informative in answering questions and just providing the history of the Underground heaven. We were on a time block but Fernanda asked if we wanted to take longer in the cave and we all agreed to see more. I absolutely loved this excursion. The pictures on the Excursion do not do justice, It is a must see in person, this is a once in a lifetime experience that I will never forget. You are provided with a wet suit, life jacket and helmet with a head lamp There is a few parts that are deep where you need to swim but the water is refreshing, not cold at all. You will be happy choosing this excursion.
This is a WOW!. This is another planet, such a beautiful place, easy tour, stunning, breath taking... I have no words. In love with Río Secreto.

Underground hapiness. An amazing journey inside an underground river. An outstanding guide Benito so joyfull and has attention to details. You will learn alot and be pleased from begining to end! Again thank Benito for an outstanding afternoon.

add this to your bucket list!. This is something everyone should experience... pictures just do not completely capture how amazing this is. All the guides were super friendly and spoke multiple languages to ensure everyone was getting the details of the tour. As tour prices go, this was reasonable but you need to take money as picture package is really hard to turn down and the guides do not get paid a lot for the wonderful job they do (we found out they are only paid $35.00/day so they really rely on tips)

Fun, Off-the-Beaten-Path Adventure!. My husband and I booked this as a shore excursion through our recent cruise with Princess. Unfortunately, this makes my review a little different in regards to booking and transport, but hopefully this helps someone! Rio Secreto staff picked us up in three vans at the pier in Playa del Carmen, and took us to the site. I was still feeling a little seasick from the ferry when they arrived, but the driver was accommodating and let me sit in the front seat. The drive from the pier was about 20-25 minutes, with about half of it over very bumpy roads. In spite of the terrain, the drivers were very careful, drove slowly, and clearly were very familiar with the route. When we arrived, we were introduced to our guide, Victor, who fitted each of us with a wetsuit, life vest, and helmet with a head lamp. Victor was a great guide; very knowledgeable and personable! (Also very gracious with me as I needed to take a moment to finish getting my bearings from being sick!) Our guide did a great job of managing time during our tour and explaining that the more time we took on the tour, the more rushed we would be changing, cleaning up, and eating before being shuttled back to the pier. The tour itself was an unforgettable, once-in-a-lifetime experience!! There is a bit of walking and a bit of swimming on the route that we took. The river system was discovered not long ago, so they are still mapping it out. To date, they have a total of 15 miles mapped out in three different routes that they alternate taking people through. Although it is dark, the headlamps provide ample light and at no point are you placed in a position that would require "squeezing" through. The formations on the ceilings above and the walls are unbelievable! The water of the river is crystal clear and felt quite refreshing without being cold. I really don't have words to properly describe it....it simply must be seen to comprehend. After our tour, we had ample time to change clothes, have a delicious buffet lunch of true, homemade Mexican food,(soup, rice, chicken, pasta, taco makings, and fruit) and relax in the hammocks. My only complaint of the experience is that since you are not allowed to bring any cameras into the cave (including water-proof or underwater cameras) if you would like a photographic momento of your tour, you have to buy their disc. We did, and the photos on it are wonderful, high-quality photos taken by the professional photographer who accompanied our tour and some scenery and wildlife from the surrounding jungle. However, I do wish that it could be produced at a slightly lower cost. Overall, this is a fantastic experience that should not be missed!!!

Well worth it!. Was not expecting this to be as interesting or as challenging. The entrance and set up seemed a little disorganized, but once we got together with our guide Nunes, things changed. Entering the cave system it was a true adventure with lots of wading, swimming and beautiful cave formations. It's a 500 m through the cave which takes about 1.5 hours, with a lunch afterwards. Well worth the entrance fee.

Don't Miss It. We originally didn't have this on our list of must do's but decided to do it on a windy, cloudy day instead of snorkeling. We were so glad we did! This tour should be on everyone's list of things to do. The staff was professional, prepared and the pictures they took and we purchased afterwards were great. Victor, our guide, was knowledgable, courteous, friendly and added lots of value to an already great day. Thanks Victor and rio secreto staff! Don't miss this tour!

Great experience, difficult to compare. We visited Rio Secreto this November. We took 2 weeks vacations at Riviera Maya and book this by phone in advance (15% dsct this way). It is very close to Playa del Carmen (10 min driving). The organization of the welcome area is outstanding, good services, explanations, etc. After the introduction you board a van for 25 minutes to reach the excursion area. What you experience in the excursion is difficult to compare with any other tour: you visit an underground cave complex to discover the "secret river", you see stalactites, stalagmites also small mollusk if you have avid eyes and swim in this marvelous environment. The tour includes a buffet lunch after which is very basic (but not enough to reduce one star to the whole experience). Then for US$55 you can buy a CD with the pictures a pro photographer took of you during the whole excursion (which I found very worth because you cannot bring your camera inside the cave). All together an experience that we will remember during the years to come.

Great Honeymoon Outing. My husband and I just finished our tour of Rio Secreto as one of our two planned excursions on our honeymoon. We were thrilled with our tour. Andres, our tour guide, was amazing.
