He was very friendly, spoke excellent English, knew a lot about the cave, and was able to take us places not every group gets to go because our group was very quick moving through the caves and because the water was very high that day. Our photographer, Jose, was also very good, following us along the way to take pictures of each couple. The lunch we were given was delicious! We loved the chicken tortilla soup and the cactus! We even got to take a shot of a local liquor with out group. We had a great experience at Rio Secreto. The only downsides we saw were the price of the pictures and the VERY bumpy drive to the cave entrance. I get car sick pretty easily, and the bumpy 7 km drive into the jungle was pretty terrible. Once we got there, everything was fantastic. I don't know if it is possible for them to pave that road, but it would have made the experience more pleasant. As for the pictures, we would have liked to buy all of our pictures, but they were too expensive. We did buy two to remember our honeymoon, but I don't think we would have bought any of it were a regular vacation trip.

Must to do in Playa. Secret river is the best underground experience you can get in Playa Del Carmen. Well... besides diving in cenotes..Anyway, very exciting and breathtaking tour it is. There are 3 different routes u can take and the water level changes too so it is different adventure for anybody thinking to return. I was lucky enough to do 2 of their routes. 2nd time water level was higher hence we had to swim more. We swam in a long strait kinda hallway looking way. Out of this world... must to do.Not everybody dares to do it. Would you?

Absolutely amazing! . My husband and i went to Rio Secreto on a recommendation from a friend and it was worth every penny! The caves are spectacular and Benito was an excellent guide that clesrly has a passion for what he does. The ride into the caves is long and bumpy, so be aware if you get car sick easily. The food was okay, but the remarkable adventure certainly made up for it. Definitely take a walking stick when they offer it to you as they don't want you touching the cave walls aside from certain areas where balance is needed. I'm claustrophobic and didn't have issues at all, you always feel safe and the caves are a wonder of nature! So worth it!!!

A MUST DO TRIP!! 😊 . We absolutely loved this excursion! When you go you need to ask for Diego !! Diego was our tour guide and he was very nice and full of info!! The caverns are absolutely beautiful and is a once in a life time experience! !!

Really cool. My husband and I did this excursion on a whim and it was the highlight of our trip. It was so cool to swim in this ancient cave and learn about this part of the world. Our guide Rodolfo was great and allowed us to swim around in the cave (as long as we were respectful of the environment). I highly recommend this excursion. Probably not great for little kids who are on the more timid side as they might get scared in some parts.

Awesome. This was WAY better than we thought it would be! Not touristy at all (except selling you pictures) and loads of fun. We dove in cenotes in Mexico before, but this was BETTER. Hurry and go before we (humans) mess it up! I'm not sure they'd even let you do this in the States, so it's a special trip. We'd go again tomorrow.

Fascinating and fun day. Loved every minute of Rio Secreto. The tour combined adventure, beauty, and education in a perfect package. My group's guide, Ro, was very funny and very knowledgeable about all aspects of the experience: culture, history, geology, caving in general, the Rio Secreto caves specifically... He encouraged questions and discussion and was very good-humored even with some of the more philosophically demanding questions of the Orthodox Jews in our group. I thought it was kind of funny that our group was half English-speaking and half Spanish-speaking, since it meant that Ro had to say everything twice, but he switched back and forth with ease and aplomb and I found it sort of entertaining.

Great Tour led by Raul!. This was a great tour. Everything you need is provided as part of the fee (wet suit & helmet/light) You need water shoes or you can purchase at a reasonable price. When the walking stick is offered, TAKE IT & USE IT! Raul, our tour guide was very informative, He gave just a lesson about the caves, The history of the caves and and the ecosystem. He was attentive to the whole group and to anyone who needed more assistance. We had a small and fun group who went on this adventure together. We swam and waded thorough the cave system and it lasted for 90 odd minutes. The cave floor is uneven but the water boots are perfect and stop the slip. I certainly recommend the tour!!The price of the photos is a little high.

Amazing!. Absolutely beautiful to see this underground river system Had a wonderful time exploring and rappelling into the river. Thank you Pablo for being a great tour guide. Only wish we could have taken our own photos or that photos were cheaper!

The best excursion we've made.. Superb. Our tour guide Nunes from Angola was excellent, entertaining, charming, knowledgeable and very experienced.The whole organisation was very well structured from the wet suits and gear to the small groups walking, climbing,swimming together through this most spectacular cavern that varied from a majestic opera house to a crystal clear pools. Do see this if you have the opportunity, you wont be dissapointed.

Deep under the jungle.. I wasn't sure what to expect here but was pleasantly surprised and amazed by what I experienced. The views above ground are only surpassed by the experience of climbing into a sinkhole and exploring the tunnels and rivers under the jungle above.

Beautiful. It's a long bumpy road to get to the caves, but well worth it. It's something that I have never seen and glad that I was able to experience it with my wife and 2 kids. All of us used the optional walking sticks, and I don't know how people do without it. Our guide was great (forget her name but it began with an "A"). She did a great job speaking English and Russian for another group that was with us. Please tip your guide.I would give it 5 stars, but they wanted to charge us $79 for a couple photos. I'm bummed that I don't have any photos from underground. (you cannot bring your own camera down).

Cool. I am not a fan of caves or small spaces but hubby talked me into this while I was a little nervous during the excursion it was amazing to see. Nunes our tour guide was amazing and really knew his stuff. Explained how it all came to be and how stalagtites, stalagmites are formed. Was fun.......

Beautiful, but upset.. We visited Rio Secreto a few weeks ago, what an amazing, beautiful place.We decided to take the tour of the caves, paid the $250 tour fee, and also wanted to capture the experience with the photo package. So we paid the $160 for the photo package and upon arrival home from vacation couldn't wait to put the flash drive provided with photos from Rio Secreto into our computer. Once opening the file, we realized there WERE ABSOLUTELY ZERO photos on the drive. We contacted Rio Secreto, 3 times, to customer service, and the photographers. We haven't heard back from them, and still have no photos. What an expensive let down.

Breathtakingly Beautiful. This is a once in a lifetime experience. When we descended into Rio Secreto, it felt otherworldly. Words can't express how gorgeous this underground dreamland is. One does have to be rather fit to do the package that includes repelling down 60ft and then crawling through numerous tiny spaces. I tend to get claustrophobic, but I was so in awe of my surroundings that it was enough to keep my mind off the sections that required me to belly crawl through. I would recommend this trip to all adventure seekers.
great trip !. this was an amazing trip. the time Carine spent with us explaining and letting us bask in the beauty of the caves was great! I would do it all again in a heart beat !

The best and most natural place. This adventure was the best part of our trip to Cancun. The secreto and the trip into the caves in the water was just wonderful. We were concerned about being claustrophobic, also about the water being too cold, but none of those things were true, it was just an absolutely lovely place. Our guide was wonderful. Just one suggestion that we have to make is, when you were offered the walking stick, take it. If you go to Cancun, don't miss this adventure.

Cave excursion . We went to the caves and it was Amazing! Best part of our raining trip. Diego was our guide and he was wonderful. Very knowledgeable and loves what he is doing! Pictures were to expensive... other than that a great tour!

Excellent . We had the pleasure of having Alondra as our guide. She was fabulous, very entertaining, knowledgable and safe. She exceeded her duties with an outstanding approval from my girlfriend and I. Seeing the underground caves was amazing.A side note, the photography was far too expensive so we did not purchase any photos. This was not a criticism to our photographer, Charlie, who also did an amazing job.Would highly recommend to anyone visiting the area.

Fun caves and crystal clear water!. This tour was really fabulous. Everything you need is provided as part of the fee. Jorge our tour guide was perfect. He gave just the right amount of information about the caves, the history of the caves and how pure the water is. He was attentive to the whole group. We had a small and fun group who went on this adventure together. We swam and waded thorough the cave system and it lasted for 90 odd minutes. The cave floor is uneven but the water boots are perfect and stop the slip. I certainly recommend the tour!!The only down side was the price of the photos (no option but to get professional ones). It is a shame this isn't included.

Amazing family experience. While on our family vacation ( Ages 14, 7, and 5 ), we decided to take an excursion to Rio Secreto. I was a little nervous at first because my daughter is only 5, but after showing her some pictures and reassuring her we would be ok I decided to book our family of 5. Upon arrival, we met our guide Alina. She was terrific, knowledgeable, funny and super helpful; my daughter took to her right away. We were showered and suited up quickly, and then led to the opening of the cave where we were met by an elder for a spirit blessing. I found this to be a wonderful preset to our total experience. Once in the cave, Alina took my daughters hand and had her lead the small group of 9 through the cave and rivers. We were all amazed with every inch of the cave. It was a magical experience that even my 5 year old enjoyed. We saw tiny creatures (mostly spiders), we licked some stalagmites, and we even put baby sand from the rivers all over our faces for a free facial. ( which by the way is a MUST DO !! Our skin was glowing) Once we emerged from the cave we were stripped to our suits and taken to enjoy a traditional Mayan buffet which was delicious. I found the experience enjoyable for all ages and it truly was a once in a lifetime experience.
Excellent for a Rainy day (or any other). Beautiful trip to bring a smile to your face during a rainy day!Excellent guide and cool scenery! Real value for our money.

A Once in a Lifetime Experience..... I've been to Cancun/Mayan Riviera many times but this was the first time I've been to the Rio Secreto excursion. Without a doubt, this was the Best excursion I have been on. Our guide, Andrés, through the Caves was knowledgeable and congenial which makes for an even better experience. I will definitely go back to venture through the other 2 routes through the Caves when given the opportunity.

Amazing caves. This was my family's first vacation to Playa del Carmen and Rio Secreto. We were very impressed with the caves and our tour guide. Alex was very friendly and knowledgeable about the caves and surrounding area. Also a great rainy day activity. I will be doing this excursion again. Highly recommended!

Educational and serene experience. We went during an unusual (at least according to my veteran cruise friends) rainy day, My mood was already a bit down from the lack of sunlight throughout all the stopovers. But It quickly turned around when we finally got to the base of all the tours. Our tour guide, Alfredo, was very passionate about the caves of the Yucatan Peninsula, and was happy to share with us what he sees daily. For free, they provided us with lockers for our stuff since we couldn't bring anything but the clothes we had on. They also provided us with required water shoes, life vests, and helmets with a light affixed to it. Wetsuits and walking sticks are optional; I'd recommend the wetsuits since the water underground is a bit cool, and the walking sticks are to help with the changing terrain.For about 1hr30mins to 2 hours, Alfredo took us down to a part of a cave. The experience was both educational (learning about the geography of the peninsula and the religious significance to the local Mayan population) and relaxing as the caves have no sound apart from the ones humans make.After the tour they fed us with their local cuisine, with assorted spicy condiments that are actually spicy. Tropical fruits And drinks from local plants round out the healthy dining experience. Picky eaters might not want to do this if the range of foods eaten is narrow.Photographs are taken by an employee of the company and can be bought after the tour. Cameras are not allowed in the cave tour, no matter if they're water proof or not.

Behave in the cave. Rio Secreto was discovered in 2006, so it's a "new" attraction considering it's several millions of years old. The tour requires a wet suit water shoes. It's an amazing place. It's considered by Natl. Geographic to be THE best eco-tour in all of the Yucatan. The tour guide, Rodolfo, was from France, so spoke to the Spanish-speaking and English speaking group with a charming accent. He was very knowledgeable about the cave's geological makeup, explaining the various chemical components of stalactite and stalagmite formation.This is not for anyone seeking a relaxing stroll. The water changes depth many times so that you may be standing in a few inches one minute, and two steps later you plunge into full swimming mode, treading in deep water. But, it's great fun. The food at this Mayan village is also quite good and is included in the cost of the tour.

Awesome Cave Exploration . Admittedly I wasn't thinking this was going to be good. But it was a fantastic trip. We were lucky to have only a small group (4) and a brilliant guide (Alex S.) who really knew the caves and all their secrets.It is amazing how close you get to the formations and it really feels like another world. Probably the best tour I did in Cancun and I will do it again next time I am here.

Amazing cave tour with swim. We came to Mexico on a cruise and it was raining. We thought the day was going to be a bust but the rain actually enhanced our tour and made it an excellent day! We took a rather long boat and car ride to get to the Secret River but once we arrived and got geared up our guide, Alfredo, took us on a short scenic hike through the woods to the cave. They offer a wet suit to keep you warm. Take them up on the offer. Also be sure and get a walking stick from the guide because it comes in very handy. On the way he told us about the Mayans and gave us other fun facts. Once we got to the cave we began walking and got into the slightly cold water. The wet suit made this a very comfortable experience. Without it I would have been a bit chilly. You will walk and swim through crystal clear water while looking at amazing rock formations and learning about the geology and history of the caves. The tour is long do you get your money's worth. After the tour they provide authentic Mexican style lunch. There is not any American food so if you are a picky eater you might be disappointed but the food was good though.The only negative I give them is that they do not allow cameras in the cave. They say this is for safety reasons and it does kind of make sense because there were areas where we slipped. They have their own photographer though and will sell you photos. The photos are really expensive though. $25 each or $79 for a CD with all of them. One final note: As with all yours in the islands you are expected to tip your guide.

The guide Chac Alex was fantastic. It was a little bit of a physical challenge but unbelievable experience. Have never done anything like that and our guide was the very best. He was knowledgeable kind and had a peaceful spiritual nature about him

Awesome sauce. This was very fun and very doable by most tourists. Our guide was fun and informative the snack at the end was good, So was the beer lol. This is a good half day excursion and the price was reasonable. I certainly would recommend this for someone looking for something different. I know I have'nt gone into an underwater cave before How about you?

Really Awesome - stop reading and book it!. Its an incredible experience. All the guides were knowledgeable and new the terrain very well. Julio was particularly awesome. This is the real deal: part swim, part hike... all CAVE! They have a half day tour that picks you up at noon and drops you off at 5pm, and includes a meal. YOU MUST DO IT!

Best excursion ever!!. I was scheduled to take this tour on Tuesday, Oct 27, but was unable to make it due to illness. I assumed I would have to accept the loss, but rec'd a call from Rio Secreto asking me what day I'd like to re-schedule for. Amazing customer Service.I took the tour on Thursday, Oct 29 and was blown away by this location. My tour group was only 3 people and out guide Julian was fantastic. He has a passion for this location and it showed. He was extremely knowledgeable and took great care of us.This is more than just a guided tour. It is completely interactive and requires quite a bit of physical activity. We hiked thru caved, swam in the underground river biked from one cave to another and repelled into the cave. There was a tasty lunch thrown in the middle to replace all the burned calories.Do yourself a favor and take this tour. It's beautiful beyond belief and you'll see things you may never see again. One quick tip, book it online at the Rio Secreto website and you save $20 (American).

Amazing, but not for the faint of heart!. My boyfriend and I carefully chose to do this excursion while on our Western Caribbean cruise this past week. We have been in underground caverns before, but this is totally something else! We carefully chose how to use our time, and I couldn't be happier that we did this one. The excursion involved getting us onto a ferry boat that took us to Playa Del Carmen (the ferry ride was really nice, and the people working on it were so accommodating!). It took us about 35 minutes to get there and then a 30 minute (bumpy, but fun) ride into the jungle. Everyone from "Rio Secreto" from the start to finish were very informative, nice and polite. Very good service and information. We were never left wondering "what now?" When we arrived, they supplied everything you would need (wet suit, water shoes, etc.). We met our tour guide, Nunes, who was awesome! He had a way of speaking about the caves and the Mayan culture that made you really feel informed and respectful of the land you were exploring. We went down into the cave. Our group, a small 6 people, decided to use the "hand hold" method to get through. The other choice were walking sticks. I can see how that might be helpful for a large group. The hand-hold method made us all have a very unified and teamwork feel to the excursion---which I loved! We were required to help the person behind us, letting them know about dips in the rocks, ledges, etc. The absolute best parts were teh ones where you would lunge into the water, and swim your way through. Totally cool and unique. Nunes, our guide, was patient, and helped us all through the tricky parts. The water was a bit higher for our excursion because of recent weather. This made some parts of the excursion thrilling to say the least (we had to swim under some rocks---ahhh!!!!!). I left feeling like I had conquered something special, and connected with those around me---and with nature. I always felt safe and taken care of as well. After the tour through the caves we had a small buffet of traditional Mexican food. It was simplistic and perfect after what we had just went through. We were all able to sit at the table and talk about what we had just experienced. After the buffet, we were able to purchase pictures if you'd like (no cameras allowed---which is totally understandable considering its a nature preserve). Photo cost $25, but it was totally worth it, in my opinion. We also tipped our guide, which I think is definitely appropriate. You put your trust and safety into a good guide and I think that's worth some extra "thanks". I will never forget my experience at Rio Secreto and would recommend this excursion for anyone who likes adventure and exploration. Definitely NOT for people who aren't comfortable swimming, having claustrophobia, and/or the clumsy (the rocks can be sharp, and if not careful, you could hurt yourself).
Bucket list minus one. Awesome experience with an awesome guide Dianna. This by itself is worth a trip to Mexico. The river wasn't discovered until 2006.

Amazing experience!. My wife and I loved our tour of the caves. Our guide, Andres was awesome. We would definitely recommend this tour for the adventurous ones. It is a unique experience. They provide you with everything you need (Wetsuit, water shoes, helmet with lamp, towel and food) Don't worry if you dont know how to swim, a life vest is provided for you and the guides will assist you getting through the water. A photographer comes along and takes photos of everyone to be purchased afterwards.

So glad we went!. We are in Playa del Carmen with our daughter and her husband. Our daughter suggested we go on this excursion. It was something she had read about and on her "bucket list". One of my phobias --and I have a few-- is closed in areas and especially underground! Yikes! Seriously thought of just lounging by the pool and skipping the visit. My family really encouraged me to go and with some meds on backup-- I went ! First of all, the ride in is quite long and very bumpy. I was getting carsick and thought this was such a mistake. When we arrived to our destination we were instructed to take showers- ugh- put on some wet suits, water shoes, life vest and helmets with a light. My heart was pounding so quickly I thought I was going to either have a heartache vomit or both! We had a Mayan blessing and I thought I'd be going to another life. When we got to the entrance of the cave, my daughter, husband and son in law saw my face and thought-- there's no way!! If you are claustrophobic I'm sure you can pick up my anxiety level. Our guide Diego was instrumental in getting me through this journey. He was like a sage that talked me off the ledge and it turned out to be an amazing experience. Not only in the beauty of the natural surroundings but facing and conquering one of my major fears! Can't believe I did it and it was magical! Thank you Diego! Some room for improvements--- buffet-- please no! Eat a good breakfast and skip the buffet! Hard sale for the photos and you can not take in cameras. Overall such a great experience!

Astonishing! Worth every penny!. We have been to caves all over the world and this cave/cenote is amazing. It's pricey, but worth every penny. Tip your guide! Ours -- Alex -- was amazing. Take the walking stick they offer -- its for feeling your way in the submerged parts of the cave. When we were there water level was high and the walking stick was essential. You go in small groups of 10. The formations are pristine -- there is very little "breakage" of the cave formations from thoughtless people, perhaps because this cave/cenote has not been open to public for long and access is in small groups. Great rainy day activity (you are underground!) A must see!! Its unfortunate photos are so expensive, but once you get down there you understand why you cannot bring your own camera or anything else for that matter. Leave all your jewelry in safe at hotel. Lockers are provided for your clothes, etc. Wear a swimsuit and water shoes (water shoes are provided if you wear flip flops). We had a 1 pm reservation, arriving at 12:30 and were not finished until nearly 5 pm (traditional Mayan food provided at end of tour).

Absolutely beautiful and unique experience. My mom and I went on this tour during our cruise stop in Cozumel. The tour was incredible and definitely a unique and amazing experience. The caves were stunning and we felt like we were in an Indiana Jones movie while exploring them. Although the caves are dark, the lights that the tour guides have, along with your head lamps really provide a good bit of light. We were a little scared about swimming in the water before the trip, but once we were there and saw how clear it was, we dove right in. It was also surprisingly not very cold. It warns you that this is not for ppl who have claustrophobia, so that also made me nervous, as I have a little bit of that, but the spaces were large and did not make me feel uncomfortable at all! The footing can be a little difficult, even though you have a walking stick because you cant hold on the the sides of the rocks to stabilize yourself, but our guide- Alaina was really good about helping ppl when they needed it. She was also very knowledgeable, fun and interesting! She definitely helped to make the experience a great one. They provided you with all the equipment you need for the adventure. As many others mentioned, there is a photographer that follows you around to take photos. These were very expensive to purchase at the end of the tour- $79.99 for the whole disc, but you can bargain with the guys selling the photos and usually get them down a good bit. We and the others on our tour got them down to $50 for the whole disc. Still a lot, but the photos are incredible and definitely worth having. Overall a really amazing experience that I would highly recommend!

Unique!. This is indeed a very unique tour! I was initially hesitant because I don't know how to swim, but with the life vest and help from our guide who tugged me along in the deep sections, I made it through just fine. The tour by itself is over an hour or so, but give sufficient time to watch the orientation and wear the appropriate gear which they provide. The water was cool, but not uncomfortable. The caves are really beautiful and unique. Enjoyed it thoroughly. After the tour they have a good buffet lunch included. The only downside is that they don't allow you to take your own pictures, and have to pay if to get them taken by a photographer. Overall, we enjoyed ourselves.

Fantastic experience. I went there last week with my daughter and it was excellent. Our guide Raul, was excellent and was really included our daughter in everything. I would recommend this for anyone who is looking at an afternoon away from resort and wants to try something totaly different. My daughter is 10 and thought it was incredible. The pictures on the site are fantastic but do not do the place justice. 100% recommend it and would go again.

Great experience. I highly recommend this tour. Very interesting and worth the trip. Our tour guide Andres was very knowledgeable and gave everyone a fantastic overview of Rio Secreto and its history. After the tour we were treated with a delicious authentic lunch. I have visited caverns before but not quite like this one. If you choose to go look for Andres as your tour guide. You will have a blast.

Just as Amazing the Second Time!. We went to Rio Secreto a couple of years ago, and based on how much we enjoyed it, we returned with our friends. We took a cab from our hotel near PDC, and made arrangements for him to return to pick us up when we were finished. Rio Secreto is nothing like you have ever seen! We took a different route this time but proved to be just as amazing. Our guide, Carlos, was very knowledgable and had a great sense of humor! One person in our group did not know how to swim and was a little uneasy at first but he calmly guided her through the deeper waters. The lunch provided is pretty good, too! A beautiful and unique experience not to be missed!

Just brilliant. Today we visited the nature reserve where we floated / swan through the clear waters of the underground river. Andrés was a fantastic, knowledgable guide and ensure at all times that we were all safe. A day to remember!!

Mindblowing experience. My husband really wanted to do the cenotes and I was a little apprehensive. I'm not claustrophobic but had never done anything like this before so had my doubts about doing it. This tour was recommended to us by the concierge at our hotel, it was pouring with rain and they said this was a really good "indoor" activity to do. It cost about $100 each which I thought was reasonable as all the wetsuits, wet shoes, helmets and lunch were included. When we got there we were taken to the cenote on a dirt track full of flooded pot holes deep into the jungle. This ride took about 20 minutes and I have to say I was pretty scared!Once we got there, there were changing facilities and lockers, we were given the gear and got changed. By then I realised I had to get on with it and by the time we got into the cenote although I was nervous I started to get into it.We were in a group of 10 and we had a tour guide as well as a photographer following us. Our tour guide rocked! He was so friendly and knowledgeable I felt instantly at ease. Going into the cenotes was an incredible experience and I loved every minute of it. The water was pretty cold, there were some dry bits some wet bits, some shallow bits some deep bits. All of it was fun. We were shown how to walk to avoid falling over or scratching ourselves or stepping on a sharp rock. The entire experience was very relaxing with beautiful views inside the cenote. Our guide also explained how they were found, why they were there and how the formations happen. The entire tour took about 1.5-2 hours.Afterwards we were given a mezcal reception as well as lunch and a chance to view the photos. The photos were still on the pricey side but reasonable compared to other attractions we had done in the area.This cenote is just outside Playa del Carmen and I'd highly recommend to anyone staying in this area.

Best part of the cruise trip . Last week I went on a cruise with my family and this excursion caught my eye. I'm glad to go because it was so much fun and our tour guide Raul P. was a pleasure. His enthusiasm made our tour more enjoyable. I would want to go again since the cruise had a timeline of our trip.

Perfect for a Rainy (or any) Day!. Huge surprise. Expected a cheesy, touristy attraction and found a treasure, just about 15 minutes or so south of Playa del Carmen. A bit of an adventure, with supplied spring wetsuit, helmet, water shoes and a walking stick, all important to descend into a cavern, 75 feet or so underground, wading and floating in a natural underground river on about a 1-1/2 kilometer hike through cathedral-like spaces, lighted only by headlamps and the guide's flashlight with a group of 10 people, maximum. Fantastic and unusual stalactite and stalagmite formations, many variations of other natural sculpting formed over many centuries, and interesting to get to. Park right off the highway at the National Park entrance, pay your admission and ride about 5km across a dirt road to the welcome center and cavern entrance. A nice, locally typical indigenous meal is included in your admission, and after 3 hours or so, it will be greatly appreciated! Very knowledgeable guides, albeit a bit preachy about this natural treasure and ecology in general. A unique and meaningful experience.

Amazing is an understatement. Rio Secreto has proven to be an incredible experience. Our guide, Alfredo, is extremely knowledgeable of the caverns and is well versed in explaining the different formations we were seeing. His years of experience not only made our trip downwards extremely safe but incredibly fun !!!Big Big Thumbs Up !!!

Beautiful underwater mayan preserve. Great day trip out to this beautiful underwater preserve. It costs approx me $98 usd (we booked from our hotel) and we picked up in the morning. Commute to the preserve took approx 30min from our hotel (off 5th ave) playa de carmen and after intro and getting geared up we hit the trek into the underwood (mayan belief). The tour group was small (8-10 per group) and our guide Lara was terrific. The experience is very safe, all the equipment you'll need to enjoy the experience is provided and a visual treat. They don't allow any camera's (iphone, gopro) except if you have an underwater camera as they want you to purchase their own photos as a cameraman is on route every step of the way. Pictures are expensive ($35 for 2 or $79 for entire CD) which has over 30 pics of the whole journey. Amazing experience to swim in pitch dark caves and see the stalactites. Very safe even for weak swimmers. Would def recommend a must do if in Playa de carmen.

amazing and tough!!. loved this attraction and have never seen anything like it. i was surprised how uneven the trail is and not being in shape makes it a tough trek but worth it! don't leave without the walking stick for your trek, as the guide said no one ever regretted taking the walking stick with them and after traversing the underground terrain i know why!! lol!! diana was our guide and she was great as was her photographer who helped me learn the best way to walk the trail. the fireworks they show you in the dark was sooo amazing!! def worth going!! then a nice buffet after and a shot!! pic's were worth the price and the four of us bought them all and shared! was about $75 for the disc which is able to be copied!

If You Do One Tour in Cancun, Do This One!. From start to finish, this tour was outstanding. My friend and I were fortunate enough to join a group of Canadians (God bless you, Canada, and your ridiculously polite and charming citizens). The caves are amazing, and the knowledge and presentation of information from the tour guide (Raul, I believe) was top notch. We had one woman in the group who was claustrophobic. The guide alleviated her fears at the beginning and then had her follow right behind him the whole time (you go through the caves single file). He checked on her frequently and gently joked with her throughout the trip.The caves are stunning, and the tour is a combination of traversing rocks and swimming. By all means, take a walking stick. I had read reviews recommending it, and so I grabbed one right away and then everyone else did too. Not one person was sorry they did.After the tour, they give you a lovely meal and a little time to hang out in hammocks while you wait for your van to bring you back to your hotel.Can't recommend this tour enough.

Awesome!. Husband and I signed up for Rio Secreto not know 100% what we were in for. It was amazing! I was originally looking for an open cenote that I could jump into and snorkel a bit but this was much more interesting. We had a small group (three couples) and an amazing guide, Miguel. He was funny and very knowledgable. He answered all of our questions even before we had to ask ;) One moment he turned off the light and we floated in the water for a minute of mediation. It was a surreal and refreshing experience. The trek through felt much faster than it was. I believe we were down there for 1.5 hours. Afterwards we are lead to a 'gift-shop' where they offer you to buy photos of your adventure. Very neat as the photographer followed you throughout the trip so you could click through it when you got out. But, like most touristy things in Mexico, the price of the photos were too much for us so we decided to just stick with our amazing memories! The lunch was great! Make sure you try the horchata with your meal, delicious... Would recommend to anyone who is willing!

Amazing Experience!. My husband and I were on our honeymoon and usually don't do a ton of excursions as we are more lazy vacationers. We saw the brochure at our hotel and thought this looked like a great experience swimming through the underground caves. It was amazing! The history of the caves and the Mayans and how the formations were formed was so interesting. Our guide Diego was great and answered all of our questions. He did a fabulous job. Food was provided and was the best Mexican food we had our whole trip! Authentic Mexican dishes that were so delicious. Would recommend Rio Secreto to anyone who is looking for a once in a lifetime experience.

Amazing! Truly one of a kind experience. My husband and I are not typically the type to follow the herds of people behind a man holding a lollipop sign, but we decided on this excursion based on advise from a coworker who went a few years ago that we would give it a try. This shore excursion is well organized and worth every dollar. All equipment ie. Wet suits, water shoes, helmets with lights and towels provided. Lockers also provided at no additional cost. They take your pictures throughout the cave adventure. You are provided a lunch at the conclusion. You stay with your guide throughout the day which kept everything very well organized. Groups are 8 people, also excellent. We found this to also be a calm and relaxing experience. When we went it had rained through the day so water levels were higher in the caves. Our guide gave us different options, easy or more challenging referring to the degree of restricted space we had to use to exit the caves. We all agreed to up it to a level 3. So for those with some claustrophobic issues, stick to the basic level 0 or 1 because we barely made it through with our noses above water and our knees at our chest. Your knees and elbows might get bumped and scratched but it's only minor. The peace and beauty you'll discover underground is absolutely stunning. Like nothing we have ever experienced. Regardless of the weather outside, this excursion will not be affected. Just know, there's a 35min ferry ride to get to the location, at least there was for us coming from a cruise ship. So if you suffer from motion sickness or if the weather is inclement have some gravol on hand .... You'll be happy you did.

What a unique experience!. Truly wonderful experience walking/swimming through the caves. Carlos was an amazing guide who was very caring and concerned for those who were less agile and/or could not swim and provided really good explanations to the formations inside the caves. The place provides shoes, wet suit, life vest and helmet for you, so just wear your bathing suit underneath and you are all set to go. They don't allow cameras, because there is a photographer accompanying the group and you will have to pay to purchase the pictures at the end. We knew about this before we went and hence were mentally prepared to pay for overpriced pictures. So we set our minds to just buy one for memory sake. Just think about it this way. You are paying for them to continue running tours in a sustainable manner instead of having huge organisations coming in to tear down the place. My husband and I had a lot of fun and will recommend that you book a trip there too!

Not to be Missed!!. This was our 4th visit to the Mayan Riviera and, even though we do many excursions, we had never been to Rio Secreto. Upon high recommendation from our tour representative, we decided to go. Words cannot even describe our experience. Our guide Andres was fantastic! He took the time to explain everything in both Spanish for the others in our group and English. He was very knowledgeable about every aspect of this magical place and made sure each of us came away with an incredible experience. Rio Secreto is one of those places that you will never forget. It is a full experience that touches your mind, body and soul. You will see things that you can't even begin to describe to those that haven't been. It is one of those things that should be on everyone's bucket list. Truly amazing!!

Amazing Time. Diago was a wonderful tour guide! He was extremely knowledgable and friendly. I would recommend visiting Rio Secreto to anyone in the area. The included lunch exceeded my expectations! It was delicious. Very fun experience.

Beautiful Journey to the Center of the Earth. This is one of the best attractions we have ever done. We went in 2013 and then took all of my employees back October 2015. They were in Awwww! Definitely recommend this tour. And Benito is an awesome tour guide. Request him for your tour.

Honeymoon. This experience was amazing! Our guide, Eduardo was great, very easy going knowledgeable. He was able to answer all questions and assist those who don't speak Spanish! Well worth the trip. Thanks Eduardo! !

Simply Beautiful! Breath Taking!. During fall break my 11 year old son and I "journeyed" the underground water caves. It was absolutely one of the most beautiful places I've seen. The journey can be a bit challenging. As it is dark and the pavement uneven. Best to use one of the suggested walking sticks. They supply you with a wet suit and shoes if need be. My suggestion is to wear your own water shoes. Our guide - Alex, was the best! Very knowledgable, helpful and passionate about the environment. What we appreciated most was his genuine laugh when things were just simply funny. He encouraged the group to work together as a team and did an outstanding job telling us the history of the caves. Lastly, Alex is trilingual. He spoke French to my son, English to me and Spanish to a few others, without ever demonstrating signs of exhaustion. The lunch buffet was wonderful. I am not one who enjoys buffets, but was pleasantly surprised by the quality and taste of the food. This is a "must stop" while in Cancun.

Fabulous adventure - except for the photograph prices!!. The trip was tremendous fun! it's not something that you do every day, so well worth the time & effort. Our guide, Diana was great. She took the time to help out some of us that found the clambering over submerged rocks a bit difficult, and added some fun with her sense of humour! Our nimble photographer was also very helpful in this capacity and helped out whenever she could.All in all, a great half day trip out - & would definitely do it again.The only downside to this trip was the ridiculous price that they wanted for the photos - $79 (£50!!!) for 25 digital photos is totally unreasonable. $20 is closer to the mark if they want to sell more of those! Due to this, we did not buy them & so have NO photographic memories of this trip as they would not let us take our own cameras.It's a shame that greed spoilt this otherwise very good trip for us.Unless there is a 'legal' reason not to take your camera - take your own.

Best Trip ever. Rio secreto is a local place to go under the cenotes from Playa del Carmen quintana roo mexico. The staff is real carefull to the visitants and they love theire work. My guide was this russian guy who speak couple diferent idioms. Just wonderfull

Not something you see everyday. We had our tour with Andres and he was great. Andres was super informative he made sure that we all stayed together and knew where all the obstacles were in the water. Rio Secreto is definitely worth seeing as it's not something that you can experience all the time. I do recommend that you leave any of your jewellery at your hotel before you go as they want you to take off ALL your jewellery and leave it in lockers. We were on our honeymoon and didn't know this and I refused to take off my wedding ring so that is frowned upon. They didn't make me take it off which I'm grateful for but I would have left it in the hotel had I known that. Also you can't take your camera into the cave with you so if you want any pictures of your experience you have to purchase them.

Great learning experience. Amazing views in the cave, the beautiful stalagmites and stalactites and crystal clear water are amazing. Our visit was made better because our tour guide Andres was full of knowledge and could answer any question the group had, he was lighthearted and down to earth. Well worth it!

Very interesting and beautiful.... What a fascinating tour and something you probably can't do anywhere else in world. It has only been open to the public since 2008 after being discovered in 2006. There are apparently three caves - make note if you are claustrophobic as the cave we went in got quite tight and we had to squeeze through, under water which was a little stressful. The tour guides are SUPER nice and helpful. The lunch after was really good. I didn't like that we couldn't bring cameras in as we purchased two photos (for $30) but I really would have liked to have been able to take my own pictures (would need a water-proof camera - maybe they can sell them). Note that this is a live cave and there are bats flying around. The scenery is just stunning, however, and the tour is very fun. Would highly recommend.

Spelling bounding majestic . Words can't describe the beauty and tranquility of this place. We decided to do the cave tour and our guide was very informative as well as always checking if we are ok. He would take his time explaining in English and Spanish what each part of the cave is about. His priority was safety and enjoyment ensuring that we never had a dull moment.

Simply Amazing!. My wife and I have been on many different excursions over the years but this is BY FAR the best one ever! Amazing scenery, professional guides and staff, top notch lunch. They had it all! Carlos was also the best tour guide I've ever had. He was so caring and considerate of every last detail. My highest recommendation!

The secret underground river. Carlos took us on a spectacular tour of the caverns. He knew so much about the formation types. It was just the best. One thing I recommend, when the guide suggests the walking stick- take it. It makes the tour so much easier to look around and enjoy. After the tour a wonderful buffet is offered that is full of tropical delights.

Amazing tour!. We took this tour using Best Day travel. Our tour included are the required gear to and was very smooth. The tour was spectacular! The guide will customize the tour for your group depending on comfort levels. Our group was able to soldier up and go through a very small cave area with water almost up the the ceiling. We had a diverse group of all ages and everyone had a great time. Our guide was fantastic.I would highly recommend this tour.

Amazing Adventure!. Diana was our tour guide and did a great job at leading us through the cave while being very friendly, fun, and informative. The cave itself was a once-in-a-lifetime experience, climbing, swimming, and trekking through a pitch black cave. I would definitely recommend this to anyone traveling in or near Cozumel, Cancun, or Playa del Carmen.

Amazing and Beautiful. Alan was our tour guide and he was extremely informative. Other reviews are correct in saying that the terrain can be a little tricky sometimes but if you use the walking stick they provide or walk with a partner it's great. We had a blast! I recommended it to everyone I saw on the rest of our vacation.

Love the tour guide and the nature!!. English speaking tour guide Alex is very knowledgeable,one of the tourist asked him thousands of questionable questions and he got it all done!and Alex is funny,talkative,attentive.he will try to dig the best of the river out for you to enjoy the whole trip,the bugs,the bat,the leave in the river...etc.never knew what stalactites and stalagmites are until the tour,feels like just attended a class of an earth and love the earth even more.so peaceful down thereand it's totally safe for a family trip.

Should be one of the wonders of the world. This is the second time I've visited Rio Secreto. We saw something different and yet a lot of the same. It's the best kept secret anywhere. I highly recommend it for anyone. Families, business retreats, singles

Gorgeous cave and Diego is your guide!!. I happen to love caves, but even if you have never been in a cave, you can do this safely with family and have the time of your lives. You are truly in a hidden marvel - as long as you can walk on an uneven surface which is a bit slippery you will do fine. Diego was our wonderful guide and he suggested that we use the wooden walking sticks - and he was right - they help you gauge distance when you are walking in water. You do get to float a bit which is fun - you are in wet suits with life jackets so you are totally safe. And Diego ensures your safety and enjoyment. A spectacular time - do it! From Cozumel you take the Ferry to Playa del Carmen. From there is it a short cab ride. The total tour takes about 3 1/2 hours with a delicious meal included.

Caves. Wonderful , so peaceful, clean and food was great. I met some really awesome people in my group, that are now are friends. The tour guide speaks like a 100 languages, very nice. Be respectful to the Gods. They are serious about keeping it all natural. I was kinda scared at first but they made me overlook that. Open your mind to adventure.

Wonderous!. The tour was the highlight of our vacation. We've visited caves in the past but none are as beautiful as this one. Our guide, Carlos, was the best! He was knowledgeable about the geology and biology of the cave and need to protect this beautiful resource. He was very safety conscious and patient with all of us, especially with one in our group that has balance and back issues. He is the best!

Great tour for the fleet footed. Great tour, great information, great guide. The terrain was tough for some one who doesn't exercise. Dianna was our tour guide and she was very accommodating for some of our group members that needed extra time to walk the terrain.

Best tour in Riviera Maya. It was truly a mind-blowing experience to see a river under a jungle. Our guide Carlos showed amazing spots and he was very knowledgeable about the mayan culure as well as how rio secreto was formed. He guided us(a group of 10) in a very safe manner.I would definitely come back to see this again!

Amazing place. This is a series of stalactites and stalagmites caves, mostly flooded with cold water.They provide with all the required equipment, from rubber shoes to helmets with torchlight.A very friendly staff that makes it a wonderful day.The only drawback... they charge extremely high prices for the pictures of you...

An uplifting experience within natural surroundings. I loved this activity! The caves were absolutely beautiful and our tour guide (Daniele I think) made the experience even more enjoyable as he was very knowledgeable and genuinely seemed to care about the caves and surrounding areas. The experience did not feel too commercial and I left feeling very serene. Everything was very well thought. They separated us into groups of eight and provided us with wet suits (make sure you have swimwear to wear underneath!), life jackets and water shoes. There are bathrooms next to the lockers which you can use before you enter the cave and when you come back out you are provided with a towel. I booked this tour directly through the website to include transportation. I wouldn’t necessarily recommend the transportation considering the length of time it took compared to the distance of the caves from our hotel. Also the photos were very expensive in my opinion. I wouldn’t recommend this to anyone who is afraid of the dark or possibly has trouble walking. But for everyone else it is a must!

Great adventure!!. Adam took us on a unforgettable tour!!! Thank you so much!! We ask for a more in depth adventure and we got one. The location is beautiful and you do not feel like you are at a popular attraction which makes it much more intimate.

What An Amazing Day. Our guide was friendly and very knowledgeable. The caves were wonderful and swimming so far underground was remarkable. There were a few people in our tour who couldn't swim, but they were able to stay up with the group.

The best tour guide ever. I want to thank our tour guide Diana for helping thru the tour I am disable and she made sure I had a great experience and she was amazing and very patient and help me thru the caves. You need more tour guides like Diana thank you for an amazing timeTom licata

Great experience. Rio Secreto takes you underground, exploring the caves and underground river system of the Yucatan PeninsulaOur guide Alondra was fantastic, the tour moved at a good pace and it was an amazing experience exploring the dark caves and underworld beneath the jungle. Lunch was included in admission price, and was excellent.Change rooms were good, lockers were provided to store valuables and reef shoes are provided for the tour if you don't have your own. Loved this tour, very unique experience.

A must see in Quintana Roo!. Rio Secreto is very cool! I love caves! Rio Secreto is an underwater river so not only are you spelunking, but you also get to swim at times. The guides are very informative and respective of the environment.

Amazing experience!. An experience not to be missed. They provide everything needed, including lunch. Be prepared to get wet, but the sights are worth it. You will get water shoes so you don't slip or hurt your feet; a wetsuit to keep you warm in the cool water and helmets with headlamps to protect your head from banging a rock and light your way. An experience not many people get to have in their lifetime.
Secret River worth it!!. Great experience...not sure if you can request guide for tour, but Alex was amazing. Spoke Spanish, French, and English. Wouldn't recommend if you have bad knees/ankles.

A definite bucket list item. My husband and I just finished the awesome tour with Rio Secreto. Well worth the cost. This is something that is a definite must if you are in Riviera Maya. We had a very informative and friendly guide Alondra. Will definetly return again.

Amazing underground adventure!!!. An amazing underground natural adventure. They will provide you with everything you need: from helmet and wetsuit to the water shoes and lunch afterwards. It is an incredible experience that is well worthy, so if you are visiting the Riviera Maya an excellent and amazing natural adventure. You may find underground rivers at other places (not sure if natural) but the experience at Río Secreto is unique, you won't be disappointed.

Beautiful Emotional Experience Unforgettable. My wife and I just visited this amazing treasure of the world. I have to say I am extremely happy we decided to visit this rather than Ek Balam for the simple reason of it being too hot outside. To be honest i would never visit something like this but i read cool water in a cave and we were there.. The guide Alex S. was incredible he spoke fluent English and French. The group i was with wasnt exactly the fittest Alex ensure every member was safe and make it through this amazing wonder. His delivery and knowledge matches that of a young scholar. The features of the cave were simply amazing. The only downside is the pricy photo option $80 us. I suggest offering a lower price to have the files emailed to guest. This way you will have no cost in burning a cd and you will access people email maybe use as another source of income sharing events and fund drives. Overall it was incredible.

The best underground journey ever!. We wanted to have a trip that was cool and in nature. Rio Secreto was perfect. Benito was our guide into the cavernous underground river and it was an awesome experience. They provided everything you needed from the helmet and wetsuit to the water shoes and lunch afterwards. Our guide was so fascinating; he knew everything about the river and made it so interesting. The beauty is beyond compare and the actual trek was amazing. We do caves everywhere we travel but we have never been down in the river and walked amoung the stone formations. My husband does not swim but Benito made sure his "limousine" float was safe and pleasant. It is a must go...especially if a hot day trip to the pyramids is too much for you!

The most Amazing Cave experience!. This was a one of the most amazing excursions I've ever been on. We had a great guide, the cenote was surreal and calm. Bring aqua shoes, aqua socks will work as well, but there was some minor rock climbing. The guide took special care to help us along the way, calling out drops, and protruding rocks. The views were breath taking and the water was so clear. It was a welcome bit during the hot summer days.

Awesome!. The word "awesome" gets way over used, but this time it is accurate. A truly unique experience. Very professional yet relaxed, Alex is a great guide/host. Very personable, knowledgeable, charming yet humble. Even the meal at the end was great. I would definitely recommend this trip to anyone in the area.

Natural beauty and awesome experience. This is fantastic! Natural underground river and caves that is cool and interesting. We wanted cool and natural for our trip and this was amazing! The guide's name was Benito and he was filled with history and interesting information. He gave my non-swimming husband the "limosine" pull through the last swimming area of the cave to make our day a memorable experience. The local meal was an added bonus! Don't miss it.... it will be memorable and worth the half a day to experience it!

My day at Rio Secreto. . Had a good time. It was a relaxing day making your way through the cenote. Andrés made the experience all the more pleasurable with his insight and his personality. All in all a great day.

Beautiful Wonder. Amazing experience. Highly recommend to see an absolute wonder of the world, underground cenote rivers.You can't take your own camera, and the guide has someone come along to take photos you can purchase at the end.
Dark, cold water, fun!!!!!. All you need is a bathing suit and a few hours. Wet suit, water shoes, towel and provided. Interesting walking/floating tour.

Natures art work. A 45 minute boat ride from Cozumel to the mainland followed by a 20 minute AC van ride we arrived at Rio Secreto an underground masterpiece created by mother nature. Our guide, Evalina, was an extremely knowledgeable and most pleasant person you could have ever asked for. Along with her photographer we had the most enjoyable experience, wading our way thru the towering / hanging stalactites and stalagmites while Anna took photo's and Evalina explain the history and described each structure. Following our underground tour we were treated to a Mayan/ Mexican lunch which was out of this world, fantastic hot sauce. What an experience.

Underwater Paraside. Never thought a cave trip will be this awesome. I was awestruck by the limestone formation along with the stunning underground river. Try to allocate atleast half a day for this attraction. Photos will be taken by a professional photographer and it's worth to purchase them after the tour. Wet suits will be provided and traditions will be followed before the tour begins.

Wow! What a gem. A must do when in Cancun. We didn't know about Rio Secreto until we were a few days into our trip. And boy, are we glad that our travel agent (Thomas More) recommended it.We had 4 adults and two young children (5 & 7). It was amazing! Our guide, Tako (Ta-k-o) was fantastic. He let our 7 year old son help with any of the explanation stops & help with the flashlight and also allowed him the be right on his heels when moving through the cavern. Tako did this, and the entire presentation with a smile on his face. He was extremely knowledgeable and very passionate. I helped our 5 year old over some of the more difficult parts, but with adult helping, any 5 year old would make it through the tour just fine.The beauty & wonder of Rio Secreto cannot be overstated. You MUST make this a stop while you're in Cancun. Honestly, we enjoyed this much more as a family than Tulum. We will certainly come back again & recommend Rio Secreto to anyone headed to Cancun.

Life Changing Experience. I caution that if you are claustrophobic there is a chance you may have issues here. That being said this was a life changing expedition for me. From the Mayan ceremony/blessing prior to entering the cave system to the amazing, knowledgeable guide to the shot of Xtabentun you receive once you have departed the underworld. I cannot wait to go back and bring more friends and family.
Perfect excursion for a rainy day. Tour guides were knowledgeable, the caves were spectacular and seem to have a commitment to preserving this natural beauty.

Amazing experience. The best experience of my life. Please bring a swimming suit and extra clothes. The wet suit is provided. You will be asked to take a shower before putting on the wet suit. Clear and proper instructions are provided. Andres our guide was very nice, very well knowledgeable of the caves, made everyone feel comfortable. There is swimming involved but if you know how to swim its fine as the guide can help you. The photographer took amazing pictures. Food is provided and it was very good. Its best to get the excursion with transportation.

Rio Secreto Cenote - a must see, a great experience!. I've seen quite a few caves in my life, but this one is really amazing, because of wonderful stalactites and stalagmites but also because the way this tour is organized, I'd say perfect. They provide you with wetsuit, life vest, special shoes and hardhat with headlamp, because you have to walk 700 meters along the cave, in water (sometimes the water comes under your chin while the stalactites touch with your helmet). A guide who speaks perfect English and a photographer accompanied us (because we were not allowed with our own cameras!). In the end they sell you (for only 99 USD!!!) a CD with about 30 pictures (showing you and your group in the underground) and about 20 pictures which you can find on the internet, also. In my opinion, there should have been more pictures with the wonders of the caves. After the tour, the lunch (which was included): very poor, I don't recommend it. Any way, I still consider this adventure a must.

Absolute must for Cancun. Our guide was Fer....a very friendly, passionate local. She was very knowledgable and had a lovely demeanour about her when she explained the history of tye caves. All equipment is provided and the Included local lunch is yummy. it's a short and easy excursion and the experience is breath taking.

One of a kind experience!. We booked a last minute tour on a rainy day (great use of a rainy day since the tour is underground!) and really enjoyed our tour. The caves were awesome - a one of a kind experience! Our tour guide, Evelyn, was very knowledgeable!

INCREDIBLE AND WELL WORTH THE MONEY!!. UNBELIEVABLE is all I can say!!! A true gem that is a must-do when visiting the Yucatan Peninsula. The entire operation is slick and very well done! Our guide Alondra was sensational. She has a mixture of Spanish and English speaking guests and she conversed in both languages the whole time. She was knowledgeable and friendly. Aside from that, the caves themselves are just gorgeous. It was really cool heading into the underground and it was quite overwhelming to the point I felt a little emotional and blessed to be amongst this amazing piece of nature. It was a nice surprise at the end of the tour to receive a lovely lunch which was really really nice and it also included drinks too.A piece of advice, once you arrive to check-in, you then are taken down a dirt road 7km into the jungle to where the cave starts. The road is bumpy and windy so if you get car sick, jump in the front to save you from feeling sick.Also just pay for the entrance as you will save yourself almost $30USD if you make your own way there. Its only 10minutes from Playa del Carmen and you can catch a local bus from the ADO terminal on 5th ave (the main street in town), direct to the entrance of Rio Secreto for 15pesos (approx $1USD).The other thing is photography is not allowed within the cave, so if you want photos budget for the photos that they take whilst in the caves. The are expensive but they are great HD quality. A really enjoyable day and a MUST-DO!!!

Awesome and then some!!!. I am so happy that we chose to visit Rio Secreto on our recent visit to Playa del Carmen, Mexico. It was a once in a lifetime experience to see this amazing underground river. Our guide Andres was excellent. Good sense of humor and veryknowledgeable about the environment that he was showing us. Coolest part of the adventure: being underground and turning all our headlamps off at the same time. We were able to sit in the darkness and listen to the dripping water and think about the millions of years that it took for these limestone structures to be formed. My husband and I give this adventure two thumbs up.

Rio Secreto - Interesting Cave Experience. Our family of three took this tour in July. We really enjoyed it as it was a real adventure. We got to spend a long time exploring the cavern. It will do a lot of walking and moving up and down rocks as you go through the cave. The water was cold, but not unbearable. They provided scuba suits in case you can't handle the water temperature. Our favorite part was when we were in deep water and we all held hands and turned out our lights. it was so dark that it didn't matter whether your eyes were closed or not. Unknowingly, we paid for the "plus" experience and got to see repel down to an additional cave and see a light show in another cave. We probably wouldn't recommend the "Plus" part of the experience.

Fantastic family outing!. This was a family excursion (8 adults (28-59), 2 kids (10 & 12). We were outfitted in wet suits, water shoes (or you can bring your own), a life jacket and a hard hat with headlamp. Secure lockers were provided for our personal belongings. After a short walk down a path through the jungle we entered the underground river. You'll walk over and around various rock formations in different levels of water. Walking sticks were optional for anyone with balance issues. Most of it is walking through water but there were a few times when the water is over the head and some paddling was required. Being able to swim was not mandatory. It is challenging enough that some senior citizens might have a problem with this excursion. The natural formations with stalactites and stalagmites was very interesting and beautiful. Our tour guide, Yayo.was very knowledgeable and shared a lot of history and information. A photographer came along on our tour and took a lot of pictures. The excursion included a delicious buffet lunch of rice, beans, eggs, tortillas, awesome salsa, drink. The photos offered on a CD are rather pricey but because there were so many of us we justified purchasing the CD for $79. They don't pressure you to purchase them. I would highly recommend this excursion if you're looking for a new adventure!

Natural Wonder. My husband and I visited Rio Secreto while in Cancun for vacation. We booked this trip as a suggestion from the concierge at our hotel. We had an hour bus ride to the site. The actual bus was super nice. Rio Secreto was amazing and something we have never seen before. The company was very careful to keep it as untouched as possible (shower ahead of time, not touching the cave, etc). Our guide was Andres and he was wonderful. He taught us a lot about the history, caves, stalagmites, etc. The photographer also did a nice job. It was helpful to not have to worry about taking pictures throughout our exploration so that we could enjoy the experience more. We were gone from around 8:30-4:00 or so. Bring your own water shoes if you have them. They will provide them used if you would like, but some are not in the best shape. This is not an activity for an elderly person, someone who is not quick on their feet or someone that is claustrophobic. The terrain is a little tough at times (swim, walk, duck, crawl, step up and down, etc). The staff was phenomenal and I can't say enough positive things about our experience. It will be a fabulous memory that we will always have!! Even after our visit, I decided I wanted more photos than I ordered and they communicated with me and fulfilled my request. HAPPY CUSTOMERS!

Pretty amazing. These caves are absolutely beautiful! What an awesome experience I had! The staff was great, our tour guide was Lalo and he was awesome! Very passionate about the caves and was very knowledgable. The caves are completely dark, but you do have a headlamp, so you can still see pretty good. I wish I could have spend all day swimming and exploring in there. One thing I wish they would allow are cameras..they have a photographer that takes pics, but the pictures are so expensive, basically the cost of ad,is soon for all the pics...and to be honest I didn't feel the amount of pictures you get on the cd was a lot for the cost...because I did want pics of the memories I "caved" in and bought them. They say a portion also goes to preserve the area..the reason why I did not give it the full 5 stars was because of the cost of pictures. Other than that, it was pretty awesome.

Awesome experience!. Diego is a wonderful, sweet and very smart guide! He knows everything about the cenote and takes very good care of his tourists.We spent almost 2 hours down there and had a wonderful lunch after. The food was great and Diego was sweet enough to give my husband a treat for our anniversary!

Felt like I was in the pages of National Geographic. This was an amazing excursion. Though it was physically demanding at times, the information provided was insightful and the whole experience was breathtaking. Our guide, Andres, was very knowledgeable and extremely dedicated to making the tour as pleasurable and easy as possible. I was very impressed with how he catered to each of the tour-takers needs. Thanks for a great time!

Wonderful secret to experience...... Amazin cenote tour walking and swimming in underground cavern full of stalctites and stalagmites. Surreal Experience. Must to do in Mexico.driveable from cancun or chincen itza. They have 3 routes types depending on your interest and capability. Easy Medium and Difficult. We took 2hrs difficult route for less time since we were travelling from cruise.I heard the the difficult one is around 5 hrs.The tour comes with tourguide and photographer. The photographer was terrible. She took awful pictures. I really wished to complain the management for these photographers. I was so keen in buying the photo set for $79. But she took really bad pictures. So please do not except much from thier proffessional photographers.

Mystical . Coming here was one of my best decisions during my stay in Playa del Carmen. The guide was really funny, the groups are very small so you can appreciate everything better; but the best part is the place itself, so calm, beautiful and quiet that makes you forget about the world for a bit. Make space in your agenda to visit Río Secreto.

Fantastic. Had a wonderful time snorkeling. Very nice excursion! Polite and eventful. We went to Turtle Beach and the two Cenotes! They provided us with properly fitted equipment, served us snacks and a sit down lunch. So pleased.
a wonderful time. enjoyed our trip to Rio Secreto enormously! Carlos was our guide - he was very informative and a wonderful guide. Learnt heaps! Thank you!

Rio Secreto - great!. Visited with my husband and daughter - our second time visiting a cenote but it's such a unique site that it felt like a revelation. Our guide Andres was teriffic - very espectful of both the site and our experience. Did the tour with another family of three, and we all had a great time together even though we had never met before. The experience of floating in the dark then seeing the overhead formations by flash was something none of us will ever forget. My only complaint is not being allowed to bring a camera as the packaged photos are very expensive. I understand the explanation that people tend to hurt theslves/trip if they're taking photos the entie time, but it is a shame (perhaps this could be controlled by having designated photo stops?). Overall a great day and we were all glad we came. One of the highlights of our week on the Riviera Maya!

Natural Cave Experience. Newer natural cave. Explored/ swam through it. Saw bats, fishes, shrimps. Guides and Photographer very helpful. Food was very good.Not allow to bring camera. pictures expensive.

Beautiful place to go. There are so many things here for young and old to do; swimming through the caves, animal petting zoo, beach. At the end of the day they have a fantastic show that tells us how their culture has evolved to today. They have statues on the way in ( be careful, they move LOL ). Also, if you don't want to stay for a whole day, there are buses that take you back and forth to your resort for nothing. Just keep your park ticket to get in when you come back. Try it out, it's a lot of fun.

Beautiful, Unique Natural Experience. This was a really fantastic experience -- my boyfriend and I enjoyed it immensely. The caves are really fantastic and the journey is unlike anything I've done in the "nature excursions" category. The tour guide, Alondra, was very knowledgeable, very friendly, and took good care of the group. Our one complaint was that the English explanations seemed shorter than those given in Spanish (we know enough Spanish to know that certain things were left out).

"Great Wonder of the World". We visited Rio Secreto on August 13 while vacationing in Playa Del Carmen. This excursion was one of the most amazing experiences ever! Upon arrival, myself, my husband, and 2 teenage sons met Andres, who was to be our guide in exploring this little piece of heaven. Once we donned our wet suits and safety gear, we were ready to begin our journey through this beautiful underground river. Before entering the cave you take part in a traditional Mayan ceremony-which is basically a blessing for your safe entrance and return out of the caves. Our guide, Andres was awesome!!! Our group consisted of only the four of us, so he spent extra time pointing out all the different types of stalactites and stalagmites along the way. He was very knowledgeable and you could tell he really loved and valued his job. The caves are truly spectacular and so peaceful. Turning off our lights for those few minutes was a magical and enlightening experience. Since our hotel was pretty close to this tour, our price was $99 USD. Lunch is included and is delicious. Beer was available for purchase but not included. As I said earlier, this was an amazing experience and I highly recommend it!! So, next time you are in Playa Del Carmen, make time to visit this truly remarkable place. Oh and ask for Andres for your guide!!

Tako! Best Guide Ever!. Went here with another couple and had they most amazing experience ever! Our guide, Tako, was awesome! You could tell he loved his job and it showed throughout the entire tour. Have to give him some props because he had to speak Spanish, French and English during the tour. We were a fun, mixed group! But he was a champ and could instantly switch from one language to the next with a snap of the fingers. Great job Tako and keep up the amazing tour guide skills! As far as the natural cave exploration...it is beyond beautiful and surreal. One of the neatest natural beauties I have ever laid eyes on. A bonus, aside from all of the cave sights, the water is cold--as in you wear a wetsuit, but it feels so glorious after being in the hot Mexican sun. I recommended this to several of our other friends who had gotten there after us but leaving later than us---it was a definite must do! Everyone should venture to this newly discovered cave and experience some natural beauty. One thing they did not say is at the last part of the cave tour, before you start making your way back up the stairs, it gets pretty tight---the cave is just inches above your head while the water is at your shoulders and you only have a few inches of room on each side also. I had to tell myself just to keep walking and breath to make it through....in the end though I'm still glad I got to have this experience!

Breathtaking. We visited Rio Secreto on the 17th August and it was amazing. The best experience of our whole 10 day holiday in Mexico. Upon arrival, myself and my 2 sons were joined up with another family of 5 and our guide was Raul T. We had a short bumpy ride to the cave where we were equipped with wet suits, helmets and life vests. Before entering the cave we took part in a traditional Mayan ceremony which the children really enjoyed. Then our underground adventure began. Wading through the water and swimming through beautiful underground caves with our fantastic and knowledgeable guide will never be forgotten. Raul T was helpful, friendly and caring and was concerned for our enjoyment and safety. He could answer all our questions as well as telling us all we needed to know to fully appreciate our experience. The moment where we switched off all our lights and the event that followed will stay with us forever - but I won't spoil it!As the underground adventure ended I have never been so disappointed to see daylight. We were given a complimentary shot of Rio Secreto liqueur and as this was an all inclusive trip, lunch was then available. It was wonderful, tasty food - thank you.I purchased the photo package with Photo CD, book and bottle of liqueur. Quite expensive at $119 USD but I wanted to never forget this trip. Rio Secreto was the most fabulous experience and I would highly recommend it.

A Must See!. My fiancé and I went on an excursion to the secret river caves. Our guide Miguel was beyond excellent. We had so much fun walking and swimming through the cave. I highly recommend this to anyone qho visits this area.

Awesome experience!!. My wife and I went on a tour here as a shore excursion from our cruise ship and have to say it was an amazing experience! Great for couples, singles or a family it truly shouldn't be missed. We started with a walk through the dense jungle (on a track of course) and then approach a Mayan spiritual chief who blesses us before we descend into the Mayan underworld as they say. The cave we enter is simply breathtaking and the waters a cool yet a refreshing change from the stifling Mexican heat. Our guide Alex was a champ! He knew so much and was so passionate about these sacred lands which really added to the experience. Lastly the food at the end was typical Mexican (no not Taco Bell), delicious! Highly recommend for anyone wanting an expertly run tour and for those wanting a bit of adventure.

Fantastic cenote.. Amazing time walking and swimming through the underwater cenote. Thoroughly enjoyed our time there. Life preservers are provided. The brief cold shower in the beginning will wake you up!

It's okay. To begin with, rio secreto es very beautiful!! But, you must keep in mind that you may not get to see what you expect like in photos, because of the reason that it is dark and all you have is your helmet light, which doesnt give much light either!
