However i must say, our tour guide julian was the best!! Be sure to go with julian, he'll definitely make it a fun ride !! What was most disappointing was that the photographer was a bit annoy !! You cant take pictures of the cave itself, only he can!! If we would have known that before i dont know if we would have gone! In addition, the photo he sells are extremely expensive and not worth it

Absolutely Amazing!. We visited Rio Secreto on August 20, and we would definitely do it again. It really is a unique experience to wade and swim through the caves with nothing but your headgear lamp to light the way. And big props to Carlos, who I know is reading his own press. What a guy! He is knowledgeable, entertaining, and really knows his way around the cave system. We can’t say enough good things about Rio Secreto or Carlos. He’ll learn your name before the excursion into the caves even begins, and he knows who you are throughout. He took great care to ensure everyone was able to navigate around the various roots, rocks, steep inclines, etc.After quite some time in the “refreshing” water of the caves, there is a nice buffet lunch awaiting, along with a hammock area, and a photo center where you can choose to purchase individual shots or a CD of all the photos. I have no doubt that all of the guides at Rio Secreto are capable and competent, but when we return to see some different areas of the caves, we’ll request Carlos to show us around this magical sanctuary once again.
Highly reccomend this tour. Julio our guide was Fantastic, very knowledgeable and helpful the entire time. We really enjoyed our family excursion and was the highlight of our cruise.

Loved Rio Secreto . If you do not see anything else in Cancun you do NOT want to miss this. This was an amazing place and once in a lifetime experience. Do the whole package if you can as it is so worth it. Francis was our guide and he was awesome. Very knowledgeable and funny. He will make you press on with confidence. Even when I fell off a bike Francis ensured I would still get to where I need to go and not miss anything. I will definitely go back. DON'T MISS THIS PLACE!!!

Absolutely amazing!. If you want to explore a cave and feel like you're in another world, this is the place to go! Raul was our guide and he was wonderful! Exploring the cave and swimming through it is one of the most exhilarating experiences we've had. Everyone was so friendly. The staff is well trained for everything. I ended up having a heat stroke which just happened to come to a head while at Rio Secreto but had been coming on for a few days since we went to Mexico in August, and the staff was right there to my rescue. Thank you to everyone who helped me. This place is top notch!

Great Experience!. Rio Secreto is a beautiful place - great for an adventure for a teenager. I have a 15-year-old son. Loved the tour, and the experience was terrific. Thank you to guide Nunes, who showed us a great time and most importantly, kept everyone safe. Absolutely terrific customer service and attention to detail. Thank you Nunes and Rio Secreto for a great day - we will definitely be back!!
Add this to your to do list.. This is a must see/do if you haven't been! Alan our guide was amazing!! Loved the cool, refreshing fresh water and history of this place.

Amazing, Amazing experience!!!!!!!. We went to Rio Secreto last week while on vacation with our two 12 year old sons. What a hidden gem!!! We purchased the plus option that added to our cents also rappelling, bike riding and a little light show in the caverns. Our tour guide Nunes was excellent!!! He was so knowledgeable and provided us with awesome personalized tour of this beautiful underground river. This excursion was by far our favorite, most unique excursion we have ever done and we do travel a lot for vacation and business. This experience exceeds 5 stars for sure!!!!!

Worth every penny. This tour was one of the highlights of our visit to Mexico. I was a little put-off by the fact that you could not take your own pictures, but am glad that I did not take my camera into this place. I suppose if you had a GoPro camera it might be different, but you really want to have your hands free as you walk/wade/swim through these underground caverns. In the end my wife and I purchased the very pricey photo package and were completely satisfied with the quality.Our guide was knowledgeable and enthusiastic throughout the entire tour and I feel that we left having learned a great deal about the geology of the area as well as some of the environmental concerns.The meal at the end was not the greatest, but it wasn't meant to take the place of a resort style buffet... rice, beans, salad and soupOf the three excursions we saw in the Yucatan, this is the one I'd recommend to friends.

Great Experience, Would Do it Again. We arrived by tourist bus, which was pulled over by the federal police across the road from the entrance. The attraction sent a new bus to get us while the drive dealt with the police. There is an introduction video explaining the tour. You are then packed into another van, and driven to the site, which is about 20 minutes down some extremely bumpy roads. Then you are outfitted with a lifejacket, a helmet, a head lamp, and an optional wet suit. If you don't bring water shoes they will sell them to you. They are an absolute must. The cave network has a few entrances and exits, so I guess the tour guides have the discretion to decide where you will go in, and where you will come out. An affiliated photographer goes with you, no photos or videos allowed otherwise. It is 1.5 to 2 hours in the caves, which are remarkable. A few pauses for photos, and one planned "romantic" opportunity that might be uncomfortable if you are not travelling with family or romantic partners. No opportunity to explore on your own except the 30 seconds they are taking photos of other couples. You are on your feet wading most of the time, swimming a small portion. You will stub your toes on something. The grip on the floor even under the water is just fine. The problem is not being able to see all the stalegmites and other coral formations under the water that you are about to step on or off of. Take their warnings seriously.When the tour is done, back to unkit, a celebratory shot of their branded liquor, then into the photo booth to order photos at $25 a shot. The lunch buffet is not fantastic, but you don't leave hungry.Our guide's name was Carlos. He was knowledgeable, and thoughtful about the needs of the different guests in navigating the terrain.

A Hidden Gem. Breath-taking tour as well as highly educational. Our guide, Benito, proved to be both a gentleman and a scholar. Lovely little meal included after your cave excursion. Price for photos was rather steep... $25 for one photo!

Amazing experience . We went to Rio Secreto yesterday and had a fantastic time. Our tour guide Andrés Vidau had a great sense of humour and was very knowledgable about the cave and its history. During the tour he was very thoughtful and made sure to help everyone in the group when they needed assistance. The cave was amazing and a once in a lifetime experience! We would highly recommend it to anyone staying in Mexico.

Another Famous Rio!!!. My wife chose this activity as she has got her adventurous head on now she has had a knee replacement done.....no stopping her now!!! We were met after the admissions booth by a Rio Secreto rep and went through the paperwork and signed our waivers...gulp lol. Then we boarded a mini bus which took us on a 20 mins bumpy drive into the jungle to where the experience really begins.We were introduced to our guide, a lovely enthusiastic italian guy called Danielle who's energy was infectious!! We showered and fitted with wetsuits, reef shoes, life vest and helmet. Then the adventure began.You start with a 10 minute walk to meet the local shamen who gives a quick blessing, to allow you to safely enter the caves without angering the gods (who knows but an enjoyable thing to witness) then onto the cave.You enter via some very steep steps, and into the cave you go. The route we took started with some walking and paddling, the water being very refreshing and you'll be thankful of the wetsuit, and eventually became deeper to the point of being chest deep in some places, which is great fun. All the while you are surrounded by the amazing caves, stalagtites and stalagmites, creatures and catfish in the water, amazing. Danielle was superb in his explanation of the cave system and its formation and was very passionate about its conservation. At one point he got us to lie down in the water while he said a blessing, and then switched off all the lights which was peaceful and a strange but great experience. The photographer fired her flash which lit up the stalagtites and the image remained in the retina....beautiful.After the cave walk has finished, you are invited to the photograph rooms and shown the pictures which you can purchase. At $80 they are expensive, but part of the money goes towards the conservation of the caves, so ultimately they are worth purchasing.Food comes next...not the best meal you'll eat but great after a few hours of adventure.All in all a great experience, which was enjoyed by all my family and well worth the money.

Awesome Adventure. Rio Secreto was better than I ever imagined. The caves are breathtaking but the best part was the education we got during the tour. Our tour guide was Raul P. He was passionate and informative. We learned about Mayan culture and the jungle ecosystem of the Yucatan Peninsula. Out teenagers loved it as well. This is a great tour for families.

Wonderful jourey though underground river with excellent guide. They take you out by van to a cave that goes underground to a river. They give you wetsuits, and guide you through pristine underground waters with stalactites, stalagmites, tiny water creatures living in the pure water, and more. The guides are professional naturalists and/or geologists. Before you go in, you are blessed by a native shaman and given permission to go into the sacred site. It was a wonderful, and exhilarating experience out of the hot, hot sun.
Rio Secreto!. Gear up & explore! Amazing adventure! See breathtaking stalagmites & stalactites centuries old as you hike through underground caves. Once in a lifetime experience!

Breathtaking. Tour guides were so friendly and explained everything about the cave as we went through. The walk in the caves is steep and sometime rocky I would say it is not suitable for people who need assistance walking. The expierence is a once in a life time view so I recommend to see at least once.

Underground Adventure . My wife and I visited Rio Secreto as part of a Carnival Cruise excursion on are first port call. You have to know whether you are part of a cruise or visiting on your own it is touristy but still a lot of fun, just remember they don't want you to take stuff into the caverns so take as little as possible with you. No pictures allowed they will furnish a photographer. You must be comfortable with water, underground, and the darkness to really enjoy this.

Amazing experience for the entire family. Rio secreto was amazing. Our tour guide was Julio. He was a wealth of information. From start to finish I recommend this trip to families visiting Mexico! My kids loved it. It was a mix a history and fun. It was a once in a lifetime experience.
excellent underground caverns. This trip was really fun and the guides were awesome. We learned a lot about the geology of the area. I only wish it was longer.

Refreshing . Rio Secreto - The Underground River It is a link of natural grottos with high in minerals fresh water and beautiful formations of stalactites, stalactites, columns and gnats. On arrival a wristband will be given by the driver and a briefing with a waver form will be given. Groups of about 10 will be formed (according to the language spoken) before boarding a mini bus which takes tourists 7km into the jungle to the cave area.There a tour guide will meet each group. After a funky communal shower wetsuits, water shoes, life vests and helmets will be given. Also, walking stick will be provided (and I strongly recommend that you take it, as it proved to be very useful).After about 5min walk through the jungle and a traditional Mayan blessing, caves can be entered and one of three routes will be taken. The caves are about 26 meters under the sea level, 30 km long and pitch dark. Wading through the water, claiming up, descending through rough terrain, swimming over might not be for everyone but the absolute unity with nature takes everyones breath away.The underground tour takes about 1hr 30min and is followed by a hearty meal and purchase of the official photographs, as individual cameras are NOT PERMITTED.The whole experience lasts about 3hrs.Be prepared for team work, hard work, amazement, joy and beauty.

an amazing trip - i will never forget. I always wanted to go there and finally i did it..this is a magic place and it is hard to find the perfect words. If you have the chance to go there, don`t miss it !!!!!!!!!!!!! you will not regret it ! I recommend to buy the fotos CD at the end of the day because those picture are just incredible !
Family birthday celebration. This is a must do! You may never experience something like this again. Our grandkids were ages 7 through 16 and every one of them loved this excursion.

Very cool!. My husband and I went on this tour as a cruise excursion. It was incredible! I've been in cave systems before, but never ones that you could swim through. The only complaint that I had was that we weren't allowed to bring any sort of camera into the caves and the pictures were very expensive (1 digital photo=$25, a disk of photos=$80) so, unfortunately we have no pictures from this fantastic and beautiful experience.

Amazing experience. Amazing experience, have to see it at least once in your lifetime. Like nothing else. Julian was our guide through this experience and like Alina on the Tulum Akumal tour, he's a pro and made the experience even more enjoyable

Great tour, great way to cool off. I have done this activity three times with people of all ages and thoroughly enjoyed it.
The staff are friendly and knowledgeable and the caves are extraordinary.
From swimming to crawling you will experience everything the underground world of the Yucatan peninsula has to offer, if you don't want to cave dive.
Highly recommended way to spend half a day

Amazing, unique place on earth. This underground river is amazing. Pristine and closed off to the rest of the world, it is still being discovered. The charges are a bit pricey but not unaffordable for the average visitor. The experience is unique and out of this world. There are few other places in the world offering the same amenities as Rio Secreto. Our female Russian guide was great as well, she spoke fluent English and was knowledgeable about the underground river.

Just an altogether amazing experience!. We visited on 5th August. My son is 5 and confident in the water but I was concerned being in the dark might be a bit much. It wasn't . The Guide Benito was fabulous although our party of 10 was half French the guide was in both languages. This have us a little extra time to wonder at the sights. The only negative I would say is the photos. Expensive and the quality of some weren't brilliant and the service to get them rather disorganised. But overall GO! It's amazing!!

Incredibile experience. The Rio Secreto tour is simply amazing! My husband Max and I were so fascinated! The underground river with the caves are unique! The staff (our super guide was Alondra) is very experienced and nice! The tour is about 70 us dollar each but everything is included, the equipment, the bus and also the buffet lunch at the end of the tour! Definetively something to do if you love to explore nature! No pics inside (that was a pity) but there is a photographer that does pics for you! :) TOP!!

Wonderful visit to the underground river system.. This place was amazing! They provide everything you need to enter the cave and to be comfortable as possible. I brought my own water shoes, highly recommended because a good fit is necessary. I opted out of the wet suit, but the rest of my group didn't. The life jacket covered my upper body so I was ok. The guide was very knowledgeable and bilingual. Although I think he spoke Spanish more, so we may have missed a little bit. The cave itself was amazing, the tour company does everything they can to preserve it too. The cost high I thought at $79, that doesn't include transfers...I had my own rental car.

Highly Recommended!. My wife and I travelled to the Mayan Riviera in August 2015. We had never heard of this attraction, but we have been to Xel-ha twice before and wanted to do something different. The tour operator at our hotel recommended it, and what sold us on it was a wonderful photographer we met at one of our dinners. He said it was the best thing he had done in his own country.We were picked up right from our hotel by a very professional driver. A short drive later, and you spend about 15 minutes filling out forms and being assigned a guide. Back into vans for a the drive to the river. At this point you are given a wet suit, helmet and life vest. You also must wear water shoes, bring your own if you have them. Diana was our guide and she was amazing. She walked us through the jungle for about 5 minutes to the entrance to the river. Before we descended, she said, 'Now you'll see why I love my job so much'. Instantly you're in the cave, entering the cool water and surrounded by miraculous sights. It's dark of course, but never gives you a scary or creepy feeling. Everyone has lights on their helmet, and the guide has a flashlight as well. Diana was giving the tour in Spanish and English, and passed along amazing information. It was a remarkable tour, natural, fantastic, beautiful. I would do it again if I could. The walk/wade/swim takes about 90 minutes. Everything is interesting. So much to see. Our group was in awe the whole time. Swimming close to the stalactites was great. A photographer is along of course, and you pose for a number of photos that you have the chance to buy later. There is an expensive $120 package, all photos on a disc for $70, or one photo for $25 - that's all we needed.Lunch is tortillas and stews, with juice. Good but not great. But you don't do this tour for the food! Highly recommended!

Great day trip!. Wonderful walking/swimming cave tour! Went with two other couples. Is appropriate for children if they are able to walk well on their own and are not afraid of the dark.You are provided with an experience guide, wet suit, water shoes and helmet with light (as well as a locker and lunch after). The walking is uneven, and takes some balancing ability. They provide walking sticks if you need one, which I would recommend if you have any trouble walking or with balance. Very cool caves with a lot to look at. They take pictures for you that you can purchase at the end. We did not since there were not that many of us and the price was very high. Very informative guides, Andres was great!

Awesome Experience all around. Evelyn was our tour guide and she was great. All of the staff was very accommodating. The tour was incredible as was the included food afterwards! Would definitely recommend this attraction to anybody visiting the area.

Go Do This!. Wow - please take the time to do this cave exploration. Once you arrive, get tickets you are asked to sit and watch a video then you are divided into groups based on your primary language. You are then shuttled for a bumpy 15 min van ride into the jungles. Way into the jungle! Once there you will get your locker, put on your shoes, shower, put on wet suite, helmet and vest. next you walk 5 min into the jungle and are blessed by a Mayan priest. Once you enter the caves you will be in there for 1.5 hours but the time flies. You see all sorts of amazing rock formations, a few small creatures (not scary) and get to swim in crystal clear fresh water. Exit up and out, another 5 min walk through jungle. Get the photo package ($80 USD but worth it) You are served a buffet of local food and then back on the van to the entrance. Plan on 3 hours at minimum for this tour.Note: when walking through the caves you are not allowed to touch the walls or rocks. The floor is very uneven so be mindful of this. If you have balance issues take the walking stick when it is offered. Note: We are glad we did not take the grandparents (in their late 70's) as the terrain would have been too difficult. Kids thought this was the best trip ever! I have to agree.

Power Up with Gonzo. Last month my wife and two children ages 13 and 14 did the underground river tour. Our guide was Gonzo, no not the one from the muppets. Gonzo the "great" was in fact wonderful!!! First, he is extremely knowledgable about everything in the area, especially the underground caverns and rivers known as Cenotes. We all had a great time. This is a unique and fun excursion for the entire family. The only people I would not recommend this would be for the elderly or anyone who has issues with their footing as once and a while walking on the rocks in the water can be taxing and test your balance. Otherwise the the caves are beautiful and the water is crystal clear. Gonzo knows everything one could possible know about all the stalactites etc. and all the other things and creatures that you will find in the caves. He is very passionate about his work and fun to be with. He is just the kind of guide that you want to be with on this type of excursion. He will also fill your head with all kinds of interesting information regarding the Cenotes in Mexico. I highly recommend Rio Secreto to anyone looking for a really different and fun excursion. Also, after the tour there is a pretty good meal that awaits you but stay away from the really hot sauce unless that is your cup of tea. Also, be careful as at the end of your tour Gonzo will be looking to push shots of green anisette and honey on you. It is great stuff for the adults but be careful or he may drink you under the table. Also, buy the disk with all the pictures that are taken, it is a better value over buying individual pictures. Overall this excursion is a lot of fun, extremely unique and something you and your children will not soon forget. Thank you again Gonzo for a great time and "power up" dude, also sorry the review is a little late but better late than never.

Beautiful. I had a fantastic time at Rio Secreto! The caves are beautiful, and the staff very knowledgeable, welcoming, and friendly. There were a few times during the tour when our guide had us all turn out our headlamps and enjoy the serenity of floating underground in perfect darkness and near silence. Go! It's located just south of downtown Cancún, and accessible by bus.
awesone trip. Amazing trip fantastic guide but the only downside was the ridiculous price for photographs.You could not take your own.

Great experience. The underground caves are definitely worth experiencing. Diego was our guide and he did very well. My only complaint is the cost of the pictures ($80 is really gouging), but the experience is still worth it; this was probably the coolest thing we did while staying in Cozumel.

Fun times. Took this tour with 2 of my friends as a shore excursion with Carnival. Our guide was Alex. He was sweet, knowledgeable, and professional. He went above and beyond to make sure everyone had a good time. My friend even slipped and fell (minor scrape). He went into EMT mode quickly. Thx Alex!! We never felt unsafe though. Oh.. the danger of sorry water shoes!! I even enjoyed the notoriously bumpy ride thru the jungle. Part of the ambiance. .. The cave was beautiful and the water refreshing. I have been in alot of caves. But, not to swim . Was an unbelievable experience. The "snack" offered was a full-blown buffet. Was delicious by-the-way. Try the hibicus tea.

Amazing experience!. We highly recommend this trip! We did the plus (?) and it was an all-day excursion. Rappelling underground. Biking (easy ride) through the jungle. Learning about the mayan history. And, of course, the *amazing* underground river. The dry cave is a little odd - there is a laser light show about evolution and the history of language... why? But that was the only thing that was kind of strange amidst all the natural beauty. We LOVED this. Definitely go! It is great they are serious about preserving the nature so you must shower every time you go underground and NO TOUCHING the stalagtites as it damages them. Photos are a little $$ but.. happy to contribute to conserving this amazing piece of history and nature.

Rio Secreto is an awesome experience. From the time we were picked up at the dock to travel to the Cave site everything was porfessionally orchestrated. The drive to the cave was short and rural on a dirt road. Once there we were put into groups of 9 end given a wet suit, helmet w/Light, water shoes, and a walking stick. Everything looked in new or great condition. After a overview, and blessing from a Chaman, we were lead by Alina who was so good with helping us with every step of the way. The time with her was awesome. Her knowledge and enthusiasam is the best. The water in the cave was cool and safe. We had a great lunch, and also brought back pictures taken inside the cave. This is a trip of a lifetime, for just about any age group.

Excellent--challenging--Alina is a great tour guide. This was really great. but it was definitely challenging, so be ready to exert yourself. But my 4 1/2 yr old went, and I was able to help him through just fine. Very cool experience. Amazing really. Tip: Alina (sp?-- she's the Russian expat) was our guide, and she was really great. Highly recommend her in particular.

Amazing Secret River - on Carnival Cruise. This was an excellent excursion!! My husband and I enjoyed it very much. We had a fabulous tour guide, Raffull, who gave great information along the way and was patient and kind when participants weren't as quick among the route as he was ;) I would definitely recommend this for anyone who is in the area. A great lunch was included and they provide a photographer so you are able to bring back memories from your experience.

Caves . After looking at the flyers we thought it would be a fun day swimming in caves with the nieces (5&7), Booked it. After a bumpy ride and I mean a bumpy ride to the entrance, we got kitted up in wetsuits, helmets etc. (the guy who sold it said we could just wear swimming consumes and our own shoes) we walked down to the caves, we had to be blessed before going in, nothing religious. We then entered the caves. Our guide was Alondra, was amazing her knowledge was fantastic and she helped my nieces through the caves. Her English was really good too. Had pictures taken all the way round. At the end food was provided which was good too. Not what we expected but was an amazing experience. Would definitely recommend.
Super Fun!. Went with my family and we loved it! Our guide, Andres, was fun and friendly, entertaining from the beginning to the end. I definitely recommend it!

AMAZING CAVE !!. We took this tour as a gift of being a member of Palladium Travel Club. This was our first trip to Cancun or Mexico. we didn't expect this Amazing Tour. The whole tour was excellent. We got to Rio Secreto by bus and from there, we watched the video of what to expect. Our tour guy is Alan, he is very very nice, has a good sense of humor too . He is very patience toward me since I was the only non-swimmer in our group. He guilded me through and I am very grateful toward him, so guys, if you are non-swimmers like me, don't be discourage , the tour guild will help you. But like I mentioned before, it is a must to see if you are going vacationing in Maya Reveira, Cancun.

Coolest thing EVER!!!. Our family took the River Cave tour with Diego. I am claustrophobic but did it with ease thanks to our awesome guide. Probably the coolest thing I have ever done in my life. Would highly recommend to anyone. The staff were pleasant and we had a wonderful meal after finishing our two hour trip through the caves that involved some walking, swimming, and vieiwng of the beautiful sites mother nature has created.

Incredible!. This was my second visit to Playa. I'm so happy my husband and I decided to take this tour. The cave was amazing and the guide was full of information. I especially enjoyed swimming through the cave. I would recommend this adventure to everyone!

The Best Activity of our Holiday. Our family of 6 loved this activity. Our guide, Corinne, was knowledgeable and enthusiastic and enhanced our experience. To begin with we watched a video explaining the background to the caves and their discovery. We then travelled in a van for quite some time until reaching the caves. Once there, we put on our wetsuits and booties and left everything else in lockers. Walking to the caves we were blessed by a local and given permission to enter. We were on a private tour so the caves were quiet and peaceful and so beautifully lit. Some of the time we were dry, whilst other times we walked or swam through the crystal clear water. At no time did it feel claustrophobic. It was a stunning experience, like nothing else we have done before. We had a photographer travelling with us the whole time. Personal cameras are not allowed in the caves so it is definitely worth buying the photo package, you definitely want a reminder of this magical experience. Everyone in our family, from the 11 year old to the parents absolutely loved this. Make sure you include this activity in your holiday itinerary.

Fantastic Excursion that you won't forget. My son and I decided to do this on our last trip to Cozumel. We were not disappointed. This is probably one of the best excursions that we've ever done. All the beautiful pictures that you see are not just marketing ads. It is really that amazing! The only thing I did not care for was the driver of the van that took us there. He drove a little too fast. If you want a memorable experience, you definitely need to do this.

Amazing Experience. This was as amazing experience. Exploring the cenote was fascinating. Our tour guide really loves what he does and he taught us so much about anything & everything he could. After the tour we even had a nice buffet lunch that was included. Tips for the tour: I highly suggest that everyone gets a walking stick for the cenote (they offer them to you before starting the tour). I didn't get one thinking it would be annoying to hold and swim with, but I regretted it after. It is not a flat surface so it makes it a little difficult to walk. The stick really helps you keep your balance. They also offer you a wetsuit and water shoes for the tour. Take the wetsuit because the water is a bit cold.

Beautiful Mexico!!. Río secreto is a great way of encountering a beautiful, unique, natural setting in the Mayan Riviera. The underground river is full of breathtaking views and the experience is highly recommended.Carlos, our tour guide was easy to trust and follow.A great experience for those who want much more than a simple resort experience.

Rio Secreto. Great place! It was one time life experience!!! I bought the tour on Viator website, it was about 2 hours drive from Cancun, but when you arrive you forget about the long drive. I dont think you can experience anything like this any where else. Highly recomended! Only disadvantage of the tour that you cannot take your camera or phone with you underground, so you have to buy pictures from them.
Great tour. Great experience at the Rio Secreto! Our tour guide, Andres C. was amazing! He made the tour really fun and made sure we were taken care of. Can't wait for our next visit.

We loved this experience!. First of all, you can read a whole lot of reviews here about the non-cave details of this tour. The long, bumpy ride there, the time spent preparing (we did not watch a video), the time spent eating pretty good but simple food, the time spent with the entrance ceremony or the Mayan champagne at the end. But the real reason to come here is to see this cave - an amazing natural wonder unlike anything I've ever seen. So if I had to put up with all the surrounding events to get there, it was worth it to see this amazing place. Our guide, Carlos, was knowledgeable, laid-back but very professional and funny. He made the tour so informative and interesting, and was great with the 3 kids (ages 7-10) on this tour. I just couldn't believe the beauty of this place. Carlos said there are many different tour routes, so keep in mind that what you read about in these reviews may not apply to your tour. For instance, we didn't rappel or crawl through tight spaces. And we did swim. A lot. Many places were over our heads and we were allowed to actually dive into the pools headfirst. The water was so clear and turquoise and the formations were so beautiful. Very otherworldly. We have toured several other cave systems including Mammoth Cave (many times) and I just kept thinking - the NPS would never let us do this! It was rough terrain under the water and easy to slip. No handrails or smooth trails.Our kids loved it, as did we.The reason I give this tour 4 stars instead of 5 is because of the photo pitch. My husband said, "this was like a bunch of posed picture-taking with a tour in the middle." Which is almost accurate. They made us pose for various pictures during the tour which got really tiresome after a while. I didn't mind so much because it was just so beautiful to stand in there, no matter what! My favorite part of the tour was when we stopped under a huge formation of stalactites. Carlos had our family groups hold hands in circles in the total darkness and reminded us that families are the most important thing. It really was a special moment even though that might sound cheesy... And then the photographer took pictures under the formation and the flash made it look just like fireworks! A really cool effect. Anyway, if you're interested in beautiful wonders, go see it.

It's no Sectro this place is amazing!. I decided to visit Rio Secreto and my tour guide Carlos was so nice and helpful and great company! He helped in anyway possible to make my visit as comfy as possible and if you want entertainment then I would recommend him to everyone who wants a tour here and the sights I must say are incredible!!Don't be crazy and miss out!

Awesome sightseeing, plus excellent views!!. We recently just visited “Rio Secreto” the experience is something which went above and beyond my wildest expectations. If you are looking for an excellent way in getting to know the real Riviera Maya?. Then do not hesitate, do yourself a favor and book yourself a trip excursion!! A big shout out to our charming tour guide Carlos. This guy definitely knows and loves what he does; if you want to be taken care of properly then he’s your man!! We will definitely come back again! Tell all of our friends and family. I love you Mexico!

Take the Stick!. They offer you a walking stick at the beginning of the tour, Take It!... have a good time. You dont even have to worry about getting good pictures... because they do it! Lunch is Included
Very cool!. This was our first time at a Cenote and it was awesome. Not crouded or touristy. Francis is a great tour guide, very informative, kind and funny. Prices are reasonable. Well worth it!

FABULOUS!. This was one of the most spectacular tours we've ever done! Great for hot days! Francis was our guide and he was fabulous and very knowledgeable. Let me first say I do not recommend this for little kids. It is almost impossible to carry a child through this cave. There is a rough hike to the cave and inside the cave (though there are different sections that the guide will pick for the tour) it is NOT recommended for non-swimmers or people who have difficulty walking, or are very out of shape. Luckily we are average size, don't have children, and know how to swim. This is not recommended for very tall or very short. individuals Meaning anyone over 6'2" will find it difficult to bend over and get through the low ceiling caves---trust me! Also for short stature individuals less that 5' will have difficulty wading through the lower water areas. The water is high in many parts of the cave contrary to the advertising. My husband and I both had a little anxiety, but we pushed through it. Those who are claustrophobic may find this too much--you may want to reconsider as there are some really tight squeezes through crawl spaces in the cave--not by knees but having to bend over. I have major back problems and did okay. I can see where little kids will be scared to go in. Do not let the pictures fool you...it is PITCH black. The lighting that you see on the pictures comes from the photographer taking pictures. The only light you'll have is from your helmet. Francis made us feel very safe, and was so entertaining and friendly---he was GREAT! Also you are NOT allowed to take pictures and EVERYONE was very upset about this. You are pushed to buy their pictures--some where blurry and quite frankly who wants to purchase pictures of everyone in the tour? Many people in our tour just refused to buy pictures out of spite--we included. It's ridiculous! TIPS FOR THE OWNERS: Here is a GREAT idea, why not just charge people to bring a camera? This way people can take their own pictures and then feel more comfortable purchasing a picture. You would make FAR more money. We brought this up, and we were told that they used to allow for pictures, but people would spend so much time taking pictures and not watching where they were going (again this is VERY rugged terrain) and people would fall an have accidents. Solution? Just tell people there will be times when the guide stops to take pictures. On the tour the photographer will stop, and the guide, to take everyone's picture. You wait in line to have your photo taken. So, during this time, while people are waiting for pictures, just allow them to take pictures on their own, or use their GO PROs! Problem solved! I guarantee people will without a doubt purchase a picture as well. If not, you still receive your money for the camera charged to people bring their own cameras--a win-win for EVERYONE! OR just charge a little extra for the tour and guarantee everyone one picture of themselves or their family---problem solved again. This way people don't feel like they are being cheated---the contrary, they will actually feel like they are getting a deal! I spend several years in marketing for a successful firm, so I KNOW what I'm talking about. Try it--you will see a much happier group, and you will generate even MORE money! Offer two packages: one a bit more expensive with guaranteed photo of yourself. Second: BOY camera with additional charge, and still have the option of purchasing more pictures. Simple. I should charge you for this consultation :-) We charged our clients $120/hr for consulting! Aw, you're getting it for free! Doesn't that make you feel like your getting a deal? Now, let your guests feel like they are receiving one too! :-) Also, I advise bringing your own water shoes or rock/water shoes. The give you some but they are pretty old and nasty. You can also purchase some if you'd like at their store.Oh, I forgot, someone mentioned the food was some burrito and beans lunch that wasn't filling. I have to say our lunch was GREAT! Soft drinks or water are an additional charge, but they have water and juice for free at the table--which is what we did. The food was some rice, chicken and sauce, pasta with cheese, tortillas, fresh guacamole, chips, and fruit. It was VERY tasty and we enjoyed the company of others. After all if your complaining about the food, the highlight of the trip is the cave--not the food. But again, I thought it was delicious so did the rest of our group--we were pleasantly surprised! :-)Overall great trip HIGHLY RECOMMEND--maybe you can request Francis--he's a gem! Happy journey and be safe!

Majestic!!. This was so peaceful, informative and fun. Our tour guide was really friendly and very helpful. The equipment is given to you and they recommend using a wooden stick to help balance as your walk and swim through the caves. We used the stick along with everyone else in the group and had a pleasure able experience with no scrapes or cuts. The cave had bats and small fish here and there. They really try to preserve the integrity of the caves which is nice. At one point we turned all out lights out and mediated in the DARK. All you can hear are water droplets which was peaceful and eye opening to see how dark and quiet the caves would be unoccupied. The water was so beautiful and so were the roots in the caves along with the coral and other structures that formed inside. We bought the pictures that the photographer took along the way. It is expensive but it is worth it since you can't take your own pictures. The staff were very friendly and lunch was really good! We Layed on the hammocks provided after lunch and the day overall is a wonderful experience.
exciting underground tour. We went on the "Rio Secreto basico" - trip: swimming and hiking in the cave was great, one of the most extraordinary adventures so far.

Enchanting Subterranean Yucatan. A friendly safe driver picked us up from our resort. An excellent guide stayed with us throughout our time at the site. The schedule was carefully planned. Rappel specialists were extremely professional and helpful. We felt totally confident in the equipment and security measures. The caverns and the underground river were magical. I have been to Cancun several times; this experience was a highlight among many great memories.

Very cool place! Plan to do it again!. This is one of the coolest natural features I've ever seen. Beautiful caves, crystal clear water, all sorts of geological features that you just don't see above ground. Also, this particular site has not been modified or commercialized. When you are down there, the only evidence of human presence is a string along the wall. Only one or two small things that indicate people have ever even been there. Most of the time, you are seeing it as it was when it was discovered. I understand there are other underground cave attractions in the area, but they have been modified to allow easier access for more visitors. Rio Secreto also offers and private tour lasting four or five hours, I think, for just a few people. We plan to do that on a future trip.Can't say enough good about this place. Might be difficult for someone who has unsure footing or a hard time getting around. Non-swimmers should be fine as long as they aren't scared of the water, and can otherwise get around ok. There are a couple spots that are kinda close quarters, but I didn't see that anyone in our group had any problems. Maybe not a good idea if you are extremely claustrophobic.Included lunch buffet was not bad.

Can't believe I waited so long to go!. Having lived in the area for years, I always said I wanted to go to Rio Secreto but never got round to it. Well that's changed now and it was everything I had hoped it would be! We did the new fuller tour which included not only the underground caves but also the bikes, rappeling into the caves and a light and sound show. The main Rio Secreto experience and the rappeling were definitely my favourite parts.I have seen underground caverns before but nothing like this one. The knowledge of the guide coupled with the stunning surroundings really takes your breath away.The guy that assigns the wetsuits should seriously be a personal shopper. It is impressive that he can just look at someone and know exactly the size and model of wetsuit that will fit to perfection!The lunch buffet was absolutely delicious as was the flavoured water offered during the meal.We went in a large group so it was just us on the tour and that made it even more special however I wouldn't hesitate to go back if there were less people that wanted to go! Now I've been once I can't wait to go back again!

Amazing Experience. We took this tour after searching the Internet at home for an underground cave. I called and pre-booked and saved 15%. Raul was our guide and he was excellent. He loves his job and it shows. He is knowledgeable and took great care of us. The trip took 1/2 day and includes lunch. We bought a photo even though it was $25. We wanted to capture our experience. I would recommend this excursion.

Amazing Amazing once in a lifetime!!!. This is a must. Well worth the price of admission. This is an untouched treasure that is hidden from the norm. I went with a group of 13. The experience is jawdropping. This was my first underground cave tour and nothing will compare. Tour guides are very patient especially with kids. Water is refreshing...bit cool on a hot humid day but this is expecting since its all fresh water underground. Its safe to drink and in fact 20% of Mexicos reserve comes from Rio Secreto. After the tour, you get fed some good food. Soda, chips and beer are extra. Picture CD is only $60USD and if you want a USB its an extra $10USD. I thought it was fair since you have a photographer that comes along with the group. Roughly 133 pictures. Nice!!!!
Beautiful experience. Beautiful enchanting crystal caves. Our guide Alondra was awsome, I really suggest this half day tour to everyone in Playa!

Very Profesional Intresting Cool on a Hot Day. We have been to the Rivia several times this was our first trip to Rio Secreto. The tour was amazing and the guides very informative. In our group one person had never spent much time around water and was very apperhensive about floating (with life jacket) and our guide was amazing at calming and reassuring and did what I thought a very professional job to make sure everyone had a great experience. The Caves/Caverns were absolutly amazing formations as well it was refreashing nice tour on a hot day.
Rio Secreto experience. Daniele was a great guide, he explained everything with great accuracy. The experience was fun and magical! Thanks so much!!!

Must visit, BIG WOW. From the first moment you arrive to rio secreto the fun begins.The guide accompanies you give a brief explanation on the siteThe reality is much more beautiful and impressive then the images in the Web siteIt is highly recommended

Not worth the money! . Ok.. I'm all for an amazing adventure and seeing nature at its finest, however this was nothing like what I experienced. It was very made up and seemed completely rehearsed.. The guide, Alana was not enthusiastic or excited at all which was a major downer considering we paid $215 for the experience I may have enjoyed the beauty of the cave if I had a tour guide that seemed a little happier to be doing what she was doing. Also, it's absolutely ridiculous that they sop you for photo ops every 10 minutes in the cave, another way that they ruined what should have been a natural experience. No cameras are allowed, but $100 cash is allowed to pay for the photos they take! Lastly, they should mention that there are portions of deep water and plan out having an extra guide for those who cannot swim and are uncomfortable even with a life vest and there were quiet a few. Myself and a few others walked (unsafely) along the side of the cave with the camera man! To be honest, the guide seemed annoyed that we were taking a bit longer and wouldn't swim with everyone else.Overall, I would do it again because the cave is a memorable part of nature that I won't have the opportunity to see anywhere else, but definitely with a different guide. Cudo's to the camera man, Juan for helping us through the cave!

Well worth it. First this is a strenous excursion! If you are not able to walk on uneven dry ground you will NOT be able to do this. Getting to the cave is a 15 minute walk through the forest and then down a very steep narrow cut out steps. If you can do this then you still have to deal with very uneven paths through water. Our guide, Alina, was awesome! She had so much great info and never got exasperated when she had to wait for someone to catch up and she was so informative about the cavern system. The formations are still alive and gorgeous! I love the fact that the owners are keeping the tourists from touching the formations and limiting the number allowed in. The equipment is good quality and works just like you expect. The wetsuits are perfect for the 72 degree water in the cave. There is not a lot of swimming, more if you are on the short side like me, but most of the water is walkable. The food we had for lunch was a nice treat since we were only expecting a snack and drink. The photos are not too pricey but they are $79 for the whole package. The ladies at the photo shop do NOT like to take cash. They refused a $100 bill from us for our photos because one corner was curled, so we were not able to get any of our photos since we don't like to use a CC card in unfamiliar venues. My husband was able to use that same bill to buy 2 beers next door. Just one of the quirks in Mexico. We did this tour as an excusion from a Carnival cruise and we felt that we paid fairly for the great day we had.

A must-see!. Rio Secreto was definitely one of the highlights of our recent trip to the Mayan Riviera. On arrival, we watched a video on the caves and ecosystem. We were then organized into groups of ten and were led to a changing area, where we changed into our swim wear and were given lockers to store any valuables. We were given towels, wetsuits, life vests, water shoes and a hard hat with a headlamp. We also opted for the option of taking a stick with us, which we found useful for helping us maintain our balance in the underground caves, especially as the caves are pitch black and the only light came from our headlamps.Once we were ready, our guide Epco led us along a path to an area where we received a special blessing from a Mayan shaman, and then we continued on to the caves. We were fortunate to have Epco as our guide ~ apart from having a wonderful sense of humour, he was also extremely knowledgeable about the ecosystem and history of the caves. We also had a great photographer follow us on our tour as we were not allowed to take any photos. After the tour, we bought the package, even though we found it somewhat pricey at US$69.The underground cave is absolutely amazing! Epco led us deep inside the cave, where we walked and swam through a route that showed us the most beautiful stalactites and stalagmites. We stopped along the way to take photos and learn more about the ecosystem from Epco. Even though there was a portion of the tour that required us to climb a little and swim, we never felt that it was unmanageable, and Epco was careful to ensure that our group was comfortable and safe during the tour. We were in the cave for just over an hour ~ and it was a wonderful experience!After the tour, we changed back into our clothes and had a drink and snack before selecting our photo package.If you decide to do only one tour, we would recommend Rio Secreto. From start to finish, it was interesting and fun, and we highly commend the professionalism of the guides and rest of the employees.

Fun excursion on a rainy day.. I will immediaty give two thumbs up to Julian, our wonderful and patient guide. He really made us all feel safe in a cave and my 7 year old daughter had tons of fun in that water. I thought the dark wet cave would terrify her but had the opposite affect. Julian took us on a family adventure on a rainy day in playa del carmen. We were on our 2nd day of non-stop rain and husband and daughter were both getting depressed stuck in our hotel room. Rio Secreto saved us from yet another gloomy afternoon and offered a cool, safe and exciting activity which lasted about 3.5 hours from beginning to end. We got wetsuits, watershoes, life jackets and helmets with lights. After our cave excursion we got to change into dry clothes and got to enjoy a nice warm lunch. And let me not forget our SHOT for being so brave!!! The only reason i did not rate them 5 is because the ridiculous pricing of the pictures at the end. That part is a little bit frustrating as you spent good money to do this so there should not be this crazy offer of $80 to purchase a cd of pics that are not just of your family but of everyone in your group....or the more ridiculous offer of 1 pic for $25....but i did get that...after all i wanted at least one to remember the fun day.

Just breathtaking!. We went in April 2015 as a group if three adults. The caves are amazing. The water is so crystal clear. It was a little shocking to see the number of bats, but they are benign and really stayed far from us. The groups were small and well spaced. It was a little disappointing that they made us share underwater flashlights. We are going again in December, with kids, and will be requesting additional flashlights. Overall, a great trip and highly recommended!
Awesome. This is a true cave system, complete with stalactites, stalagmites, bats, etc. What a completely cool and awesome place. Imagine Xcaret, but not man-made.

The best excursion in Riviera Maya. Rio Secreto is a wonderful excursion site just 5 minutes south from Playa del Carmen (right after the police stop). I normally only like open cenotes and was very sceptic of this closed underground one, but the tour was so well explained, led and conducted that it turned out to be one of the best I´ve done!

A must see !!!. This was one of the highlights of our trip , we had an amazing tour guide and i was a little nervous as i wouldn't be the strongest swimmer and worried about how deep it might get in the cave, but with my life jacket i was perfectly fine, my other half is a real water baby and this was his heaven !! I felt completely safe at all times and was so blown away by what i saw i forgot i was even frightened going in. If you are in mexico you need to do this , it is bucket list worthy dont miss out. The only down side was we could not take photographs or gopro inside the cave. We stayed in mexico in 2013 but it will not allow me to chose that date.

Let Rudolph Lead The Way!. Actually his name was Rudolpho; a very engaged and intelligent guide for our group of ten through a 1.6 mile trek in the Rio Secreto. More primitive than Xcarrat but far less commercially cultivated, this tour allows you to witness the geological wonders that span thousands of years......and you are RIGHT THERE! See it, touch it, learn from it and witness it first hand as Rudolpho, in his heavy French accent, explains to you exactly what you are seeing. It is a physical journey and not for the timid. There are multiple areas of uneven underground terrain but you are provided with safety gear and a competent guide to avoid an harm. If you want a Disney-like journey in an underground river got to Xcarrat. If you want the REAL THING....go to Rio Secreto! You will be amazed and what nature has provided.

I felt I was in a National Geographic Documentary.. Our guide, Rudolpho, was great! His respect for the environment was evident in his explanations throughout the tour and the awe with which he showcased the highlights. Be advised that there are mosquitos in the jungle, and that everyone has to rinse off before they put on a wetsuit, hardhat, life vest, and water shoes. That being said, the cave is worth braving the mosquitos - especially since there are no pests inside the cave. It is positively dreamy!

AMAZING!! A Must See!. This was an amazing excursion! From the beginning to the end - I loved it! Everyone was very professional and kind. The tour was beautiful and made for an amazing day. They provide you with the wet suit and water shoes and all the necessary things for our day. Prior to entering you must take a shower. Lockers are available for your personal items. You are assigned with a wonderful guide that takes you through the cave and waters and explains the history of this beautiful place. The caves are unbelievable and beautiful. There is a photographer that follows you and takes pictures of your visit as no cameras are allowed. They are a little pricey but I purchased one as a memento, they put it on a CD. After our tour we were treated to their own liquor tasting and a lunch. The liquor is also available to purchase and I did buy a bottle as well to bring home to the states.

Amazing Secret River. Our tour guide Julio was amazing and conducted the tour with such incredible passion. The entire tour was one of the best I have ever been on. This excursion was part of our Carnival Cruise and all of us in our group were amazed when we were through. We got some of the most incredible pictures of our group taken by one of the local photographers. This is one tour you won't want to miss!

A great experience . Rio Secreto was a lot of fun! The caves are very interesting. They provide you with all of the gear you need -water shoes, wet suit and head lamp! Our guide Alina was very knowledgeable!

Best Underground Adventure. This experience was the highlight of our trip. Our six year old son loved it. I've been to Xel-Ha, Xcaret and different cenotes, Rio Secreto is definitively my new favorite. The tour is very well organized, the services and guides very professional. The tour includes all equipment, photographer inside the underground river (digital photos not included) and a meal.

Unique, amazing experience-one of my favorite EVER!. Our tour guide, Julio, was simply incredibly. Basically, you walk & swim through a HUGE bunch of cenotes (sink holes filled with water) underground. It's unbelievable! I've never seen anything like it and we felt priviledged to participate in it. I've done a bunch of cool things in my life but this was so different. I highly recommend it. We took our 10 year old daughter who loved it too. It's definitely a full day event so be prepared for a full day. We thought the jungle would be hot but much to our delight, it wasn't! Ask for Julio (father to a little 2 year old girl). He is extraordinary & has such passion for his work! Please bring a decent amount of money to tip the tour guides as that is how they earn their living. You'll also want money to tip the drivers to and from Rio Secreto.

Unique experience. We found this tour via Viator and it stated the tour is around 7 hours but it turned out was not and was around 5 hrs instead. Our pick up at the hotel was 7:40am and got to the park around 8am but we were told that our group has not arrived yet and would not be here for another 20mins. The underground cave tour is amazing and it was around 1 1/2 hour. There are areas are quite deep and swimming does come in handy. The guide would help you if you are not good in swimming.The included lunch was not good at all; basically was some bean; veggie and tortilla; no meat available.
Amazing cave experience. We thoroughly enjoyed this experience. More strenuous then in u.s. But worth it! You get to walk through stalagmites and stalagmites

Highlight of my vacation. This was my first caving experience and it was definitely a highlight of my vacation. Upon arrival, my group was greeted by the friendly staff. Multiple tours were running at the same time, but they split us up into small groups (less than 10 each) so it felt like we had a private tour. Jorge, our guide was excellent. He explained the importance of showering before entering the caves to help preserve the fragile ecosystem. After suiting up, we took a short hike through the jungle (yes, there are mosquitoes, but it's a relatively quick hike). A local Mayan blessed us prior to entering the cave. Jorge ensured that we all felt comfortable throughout our journey. The kids in our group (as young as 7 years old) reveled in the experience just as much as the adults. We scooted, climbed, crouched, waded, and floated. Nothing too strenuous but one should be in good physical health and unafraid of floating neck deep in water through small spaces. Jorge pointed out large cavernous spiders, bats, and shrimp. My favorite part of the tour was when he had us turn off our headlamps and sit in meditative silence for a minute. Once our ears adjusted, we could hear drops of water traveling from the stalactites into the pools of water. It was awesome! To end our tour, we were provided with a delicious buffet of local food. Everything was tasty, especially the fresh made corn tortillas and cactus salad.I'd also like to point out how professional the staff is at Rio Secreto. Jorge was very informative and eager to share his "office" with us. You can really tell how passionate he is about his job. At the very end, you have the option to purchase photos. For the price of this tour, it would be nice to include 1 photo. However, a photographer accompanies each group and takes some really beautiful shots. I wanted to make sure I tipped our guide and shuttle drivers, so I didn't have enough cash to purchase photos. After I left, I emailed Rio Secreto. Ramon was very accommodating and gave me a great deal on photos which I happily purchased through PayPal. If you've snorkeled and ziplined in Cancun already, I highly recommend caving next!

One of my favorite experiences ever!. I have been wanting to come here for years and so glad I did! I came with my husband, brother and parents (both over 70!!). My mother is slightly claustrophobic, so we were a bit worried about her...but no need...she was a warrior!! We arrived for the last tour of the day...the 2pm tour. After a brief synopsis of the place, you are driven 7 km to the site by the caves. You are instructed to get in your bathing suits and then given wet shoes. It is up to you if you want to wear the wet suit (which is two pieces). You can opt out of it completely or wear one of the two pieces. All of us wore the entire suit...the bottom part is like shorts...not long pants. We then walked a bit on a trail and engaged in a purification ritual. Our fabulous (and I mean fabulous) guide Alina then took us to the cave entrance and told us what to expect inside the cave. My father (79 years) was a bit nervous...but Alina basically held his hand the whole way and he did very well and had a great time! My mom mostly navigated by herself and did so incredibly well!! The cave is amazing! There are dry spots and then there are areas where you are in the water. I loved the parts in the water...especially toward the end when you had to swim (or float) for a bit. The scenery with stalagtites and stalagmites was stunning and we had fun taking pictures at various intervals with our photographer Arturo. We even got to see a bat flying around...something I have always wanted to see but never have in the many other caves I have visited! The entire time in the cave is about 1.5 to 2 hours after which you change back into your dry clothing and head to the included buffet before driving back to the entrance. I purchased my tickets a few weeks in advance, so I got 25% off the regular price. It was an amazing experience for all of us and I'd go again in a heartbeat!!

Best adventure ever!. We (two 50-something women) booked a day tour at Rio Secreto during our Mexican vacation and it was a most wonderful adventure. The Plus package included a dry cave tour, biking, rappeling, lunch, water and juices, and a wet cave swim tour. It was a beautiful break from the stifling heat and humidity we had endured everywhere else.. Our guide was Lalo, short for Eduardo, and he was very knowledgeable, kind and patient, helping us through some difficult parts. All the staff were considerate. Master, our tour photographer, provided excellent photos which we are glad we purchased even though they were a bit pricey. You can not take your own camera with you on the activities. I would do this again in a heartbeat.

A fantastic adventure underground. My wife and I booked an 11:00 am tour on a Monday in early June, 2015. There was another English speaking couple and one Spanish speaking individual in our small group. We booked and paid in advance over the phone (which was somewhat slow), but check-in that morning was smooth. We were asked to arrive by 10:30 but were probably 5 minutes late and that wasn’t a problem. After a short video explaining the rules, we boarded a minibus for a 20-minute ride to the site of the cave entrance. There we put our street clothes into lockers, showered, and got helmets and life vests (both required). You should bring your own water shoes, if you have them, as you will otherwise need to buy some (I think they were $10 US). Wet suits are optional; we didn't wear them and didn't regret that decision. There are 3 routes through the caves used by Rio Secreto and our guide took us on the one called "Supreme". This route is about 1.5 km in length. It involves some walking on dry ground, lots wading through ankle or knee high water, and a little swimming. My wife doesn't know how to swim, but since she had on a life vest, I was able to assist her through the deep sections. We probably spent about 2 hours underground. The accompanying professional photographer takes lots of pictures and will ask each member of the party to pose at various points. At the end, you will view the photos and be able to buy them for $70 or so. That was too expensive for us, but they did not pressure us. Our guide spoke very good English and was knowledgeable about the ecosystem and history of the caves. After the tour, you change and have a buffet lunch in their pavilion. We had a few minutes to hang out in their hammocks before the ride back to the parking lot. Overall, the experience was awesome and we were both very glad that we did it. It felt like we were really spelunking, as the caves have no fixed lighting system (but everybody's helmet has its own light).

Fantastic Excursion. Our decision to visit Rio Secreto was very last minute as I can't swim. This ecological wonder is the best kept secret. You travel through the jungle and are met up by very knowledgeable, trained and friendly staff. You are suited into a wet suit, lifejacket, water shoes, walking stick and a helmet. You pass a Scharman who passes smoke over your head to keep the spirits away. Then you go DOWN into the caves. It takes your breathe away. For the next 90 minutes you explore the magnificent wonders of the caves. A photographer follows your group and takes stunning pictures. When the water got deep our fabulous guide Evelyn took my feet and gently pulled me through. Our guide was passionate about what she does, having done over a thousand tours. She is a wonderful story teller and extremely helpful to all. Try to keep closer to the front of the line as it's easier to hear all directions given. Amazing, would do it again in a heartbeat. Food is included in your admission.

Amazing!. I have to say this place was one of the highlights of my trip.you start of with a 2 minute orientation and they take you on a van for 10-15 drive to get your lockers and wet suits, you will meet your guide there, once you are ready to go you do a small walk to get to the cave area, just before you dive in you do a small ritual to ask the Mayan underworld God xilbalba to let you go in and out safe! Crystal clear fresh water with beautiful rock formations from top to bottom, the water was clear and you are able to see the small blind fishes, we got to see bats a crab and a weird looking spider, half of the tour is walking in water, I recommend bringing a stick that they provide if you like, It will guide you were to step, remember this place is pitch black with no light other than your headlamp a bit hard to see at times, Our guide was Julian and he was very nice and informative, he spoke English, Spanish and Portuguese, we had a good tour group, Once is time to swim the guide will tell you to leave your sticks in a rock and dive in, The water was cold but the wet suits warm you up, once you start swimming your body warms up, we swam in caves and we were able to enjoy the beautiful stalagmites and stalactites. I would totally recommend this tour for anyone.

Nice Trip. Rio Secreto was a great half day excursion. on our arrival we were split into groups where we were taken to get our wet suits, water shoes and life jacket. Once we were all kitted out we made our way towards to caves and stopped to be blessed by the Mayan gods and ask to enter. Once inside there was a mixture of walking and swimming with water being a various depths. at one point we were told to switch off our lights and be silent for a minute. you might think you just there in the dark, but to be floating, in complete silence and in the pitch dark i found it quite relaxing.If your someone who isn't that keen on the dark, afraid of water or has trouble walking i would probably not suggest this trip is for you. However if you can cope with all that, then go for it. its not a full day, but is still a great experience.

Second time and better. This is the second time visiting and they expanded to three more "real authentic natural" caves. Not your tourist trap locale. This is real life for these people and if you like caves and water come here. Swim through a cave and finish with a fifty foot repel down into one. Raful and Raphael were fantastic guides. Don't bring anything but a swim suit. Everything else is provided. Photos as well!

A must see. Absolutely amazing, stunning , awesome, beautiful.It was more costly than some of the other cenotes , but worth every cent. The colours inside were spectacular , being able to walk through and swim inside was incredible. The staff were bilingual . A must do.

Unbelievable experience. Words cannot the express the beauty of this place..!! It is definitely a must! It was discover on 2007 i think so it is well preserved! Our guide was super nice and knowledgeable! Would recommend this place 100%!!!

Very special. We went on the recommendation of our rep and are so glad we did. You start at a reception with a brief film about the caves and then are transferred along a pretty bumpy road. This is where you get all your equipment, water shoes are provided. Our guide, Carlos, then took us on a quick walk to be blessed by a Mayan priest before you enter. Now the caves. WOW!! They really are something else. Beautiful. You are taken on a tour of approx 1hour 30 around the caves. Sometimes having to swim in crystal clear waters. There really are some beautiful areas that look somewhat 'other worldly'. All very beautiful and something that can only be seen to be truly appreciatedFood afterwards was nice. Nothing special but nice non the less. I also wanted to mention our guide, Carlos, he was absolutely superb. You can tell he really loves what he does and was very knowledgable. I would request he was my guide if I am lucky enough to return.

Fantastic excursion. We decided to take this tour because the weather forecast was rain for the day and we had a 10 year old who would have been complaining of boredom. First off, the weather has no impact on the tour because it's underground through a cave/cenote system. The system is about 34km, but you cover about 1km, taking a couple of hours. You walk/swim through the caverns while the guide (we had Francis) tells you everything you need to know and so many more interesting facts. My 10 year old is nervous about everything and this was dark, at times very compact, and in many water sections she was floating (more due to the lifejacket), but Francis made her feel safe and comfortable and she really enjoyed it as did we. So many facinating sights and absolutely beautiful scenes. Without his help at making her at ease we might not have had the wonderful experience we did. In total, with guide, their were eight people so the trip went at a smooth pace, he let us know about every nook and cranny as we approached so there were no injury issues, and everyone had a great time.If you are looking for a little adventure with a stunning natural backdrop and people working hard to ensure you enjoy, do yourself a favour and take this trip.
Loved It. Wear GOOD water shoes. Wear the wetsuit. The lunch is not robust and you have to purchase pop and drinks.

This should be on your bucket list. (However read on). A very profesional operation. One of the best experiences we had in Cancun area. It was surreal going into another world. A bit rough walking in places. DO NOT GO IF YOUR UNSTEADY ON YOUR FEET. There are some places you could really hurt yourself badly if you fell. They offer a walking stick, i'm unsure if I would recomend it. As sometime later you will bob through some underground rivers like a cork and I think having the stick may take away from this liberating experience. There are SOME places that are a tight squeeze and you have to duck your head underwater to get under a low ceiling. If you CAN"T easily bend down and touch your toes….it may pay to ask if there is an easier walk to go on! Unsure if I would say this is suitable for ALL children it is a dark cave system after all.However for anyone else able bodied, this is a must do.They do have a photographer follow you're tour group and you pose for pictures, this will be your ONLY source of photo's. They charge you about $79 or so for a CD. Don't be stubborn and dismiss this,... consider it an additional part of the experience. it does also include some generic photos of the caves etc.There is a reasonable meal at the end and they supply all necessary equipment. You can buy your own wet shoes to use on the tour and take with you for $10.All in all I would rate this as the number 1 attraction of the area.

Totally worth it!. I'm SO glad we took this tour! Our guide was excellent (Lalo) and the place itself was magnificent! I'm so glad we took the time to leave our hotel and see Rio Secreto. It made our trip to Mexico that much better. I recommend that anyone go see this!

Natural Underground Wonder. We did this excursion. It was amazing. They provide wet suits, water shoes and walking stick. They start with a Mayan ritual which you do not have to partake in. Then the journey starts. There will be walking, swimming and a little climbing. Definitely one of my favorite tours. We have tour guide Fabian he was great. They also provide lunch. I have to say it was probably the best excursion lunch we had.

The most amazing experience!. I would definitely go again. It's the experience of a life time. I've never seen anything like it. The guide was extremely experienced and enthusiastic. The underground cave was gorgeous. Very safe, very beautiful. My 5 year old will never forget the experience but neither will my 14 year old nor I.

Underground Thrill. You 1st are given safety equipment such as a hardhat, wet suit and walking cane if needed. A guide takes you into the entrance to the cave where the river is located. You're given instructions what you can and cannot do while in the cave and river. It takes approximately 45 min to an hour, which you spend walking in and out of the river and numerous sections of the cave. Some sections are very shallow and others require you to jump into the water. The temperature of the water is around 60 degrees. Upon emerging from the river and cave you turn in all your equipment and sit down for a great Mayan meal. A great time for refreshing yourself and filling up. Highly recommend going early in the day.

Miguel was wonderful - what a great day. I loved this excursion we did. It as a beautiful day and such an interesting place untouched. It as a great trip but does require a lot of walking on unsteady surfaces so please be aware. You will wear a wetsuit which is really needed. Great for a rainy day as it is underground.Miguel was our guide last week and he was wonderful. We had a great time and he made my day by recognizing my birthday. He helped my daughter a lot who is ten. Thank you Miguel

WOW !. You go 100 feet underground in a cave that is mostly an underground river - paper so pure you can drink it - our guide Lalo was so very informed and nice and the lunch after was delicious, I have never had lime soup!

Great excursion from carnival cruise ship. very informative and fun. Great experience and excellent tour guide Carlos.. Great tourist attraction, very informative about the caves and the Mayan history and traditions. Our tour guide Carlos was very informative and fun. Would suggest asking for Carlos as the tour guide!

Best experience of my life. This was one of the greatest experiences of my life. My husband and I booked this as one of our cruise excursions, and I am so glad he convinced me to do this. The ride to the site is a bit rough because the road isn't paved. Our driver to the site was cautious, but our driver on the way back seemed to hit every bump and pothole in the road.Once we got the site, we met our guide, Julio. He was the best. You could tell that he truly loved his job and was passionate about preserving the area and its beauty as well as the traditions of the Mayans. After we changed, locked up our belongings in the lockers provided, and showered (just to rinse off chemicals in order to preserve the water) we were fitted for gear. This included water shoes and wet suits (they allow you to use your own if you have it) as well as helmets and life jackets. You then walk down the path where you are blessed by a Mayan priest. Next is the best part - the cave! Seeing the formations, swimming in the cool water, and climbing through the cavern is one of the best things I've ever done in my life. I've seen the caverns and Ruby Falls in Tennessee, but this is so much better! You don't feel as though you are just walking through a tourist attraction with thousands of people - you get to go with a small group and really experience nature. My husband and I would not only recommend this trip, we hope we have the opportunity to do it again. And I will certainly ask for Julio to be our guide!

Great experience but.... My score comes as an average of 2 components. For the underground river experience I would score a 5 as it is really great. However when you get out and see the photos they pretend to charge you 79 USD which is as much as the entrance and clearly a rip off. They pretend to convince people that it is to stay independent from government funding but if that was the reason then they should charge more for the entrance. In any case this was a let down

Breath taking!. Absolutely phenominal place. Its a great adventure for the whole family and not to mention, you get to learn about the unique history about the caves. Sounds a bit nerdy, but it was actually really cool! The waters were beautiful and you get to swim and take a look at some amazing sights that not too many people will get to see in their lifetime. For what we got (the tour, the equipment, the provided ride from our hotel, the meal, and a chance to hang out in the jungle area with hammocks), definitely worth the price. I had no problem with buying pictures because A. It was an experience I wanted to capture and keep with me for a very long time, B. The photographer did a great job, C. In return it actually helps keep the caves safe from attempts to build highways over it and destroy it as there aren't any protection laws against it. The photos are worth it in my opinion. However, if it seems to pricy for others, at least the experience will last you for a lifetime and might even be worth a second visit to explore more of the cave since there are different routes.
