Fresh. Interesting. Varied. Plentiful. The buses were comfortable enough for the jungle ride. This is a rather low key ecological angle adventure-not the thrill ride variety.

MORE than expected. The trip from beginning to end was great and included a lunch. They provided a lunch as well after the cave tour. the caves and experience was beyond my expectations. Would go and experience this again.

Mind blowing stalagmites and stalactites. If you have never been to this type of an underground cave river, be ready to get you mind blown. The scenes are beyond words and photos don't to justice to how it looks once you're there. The price for photos - $79 is bit high, though, I was able to negotiate it to $60 (high, but reasonable).

Just a cheating, a swindle, a disappointment. I cannot understand the high opinion of this attraction here in TripAdvisor. Rio Secreto is clearly a cheating for tourists. I think it was $60 all the time it was just a walk inside the caves, with really nice neopreno suits, but just that, A WALK to see the caves. There are no animals, nothing. Oh yes, they made an "spiritual ritual" before entering following some maya traditions... I am sorry, this was extremely disappointing and extremely expensive. Food at the end has no quality at all and during the ENTIRE TIME they are just trying to sell you really expensive pictures inside the cave... A swindle made for super wealthy tourists going with organized group trips.

Absolutely Amazing Secret River..... We are avid cruisers, and have done many, many excursions over the years. This is, without a doubt, one of the best excursions we have ever done! We booked the excursion through Carnival (we normally don't book through the chi, but because there was a ferry and lengthy van ride involved, we thought it would be easier to leave it up to them).Our guide, Alfredo, was amazing. He was so passionate about sharing this experience with us, it really added to the trip. One thing this company does really, really well, is stagger small groups (8) so that you feel like you are literally the only people there. You can't bring a camera into the caves with you, and if you want memories, you can purchase either a thumb drive ($79USD) or a DVD ($59USD isn). We were aware of this ahead of time, and planned on the extra expense. Very worth it!!! you get pictures of your group, as well as some breathtaking "stock" photos of the caves and local plant and wild life. Lunch was included... an amazing authentic Mexican buffet... we were stuffed! I would highly recommend this trip to anyone, and would definitely spend the money to do it again.

Amazing!!!. It was extremely beautiful! I have rheumatoid arthritis and hAve a hard time with my knees, but our guide Mauricio was patient and just wonderful at helping me walk through and showing me how to step so it would be easier. He was extremely friendly, funny and made this tour the best part of our trip! Would definitely return!

Best excursion ever!. Based on other reviews,I booked this excursion online for my cruise on the Carnival Glory on 8/30/2014. I was traveling alone and was looking for excursions within my capabilities that I had never taken before. I cannot say enough wonderful things about this excursion! Of everything I booked on this cruise, this was the priciest, but was definitely the one I will remember for a lifetime! They provide you with a wet suit, water shoes, a life jacket, a walking stick, and a lighted helmet. Of note, you cannot take cameras or sunglasses into the ceynote, but there is a photographer who will accompany your tour and will take a lot of photos for sale at the end. Not cheap ($25 apiece), but I bought the CD for $79 and basically have an album of our tour. They also provide you with a private, secure locker for your possessions. There are apparently 3 different routes through this ceynote, and the route we took was called the Supremo. Our guide was Alina, and she was very skilled getting us though the caverns, pools, and rivers, and her knowledge of the history of the natural wonder only added to the adventure. You aren't required to wear the wet suit, but after an hour in the water you will definitely be chilled and I highly recommend you wear one. I loved, loved, loved this tour! I have been to Cozumel many times and have done many things there, but this is hands-down my favorite. After your time in the ceynote you will be provided with what they refer to as a snack, but it's really a full-blown lunch and was very good The shots of some sort of Mexican liquor they provided at the end didn't hurt either. The only downside for me was that I was alone and this was mostly couples who helped each other through some of the more difficult areas. Fortunately Alina took it upon herself to assist me whenever needed. You will not be disappointed when you spend the money on this trip.

Unbelievable! !!. My husband and and I visited for our 10th wedding anniversary and were were completely blown away!!! We were with a group of ten, so it was very personal. Paulo, our guide was awesome. You learn about the geology and the importance of the river to the Myans as you weave your way through the cave. You will If you are looking for a once in a lifetime expirence, you will find it here.

Very Interesting!. This was a very fun and interesting excursion. I was worried that my mild claustrophobia would get the best of me, but it wasn't small and cramped through the cave like I thought it would be. The guide was very knowledgeable and informed us about the stalagmites and stalagtites and how they form. They provide their own photographer and the pictures turn out very nice - they are just horribly overpriced. The wetsuits, lifejackets, and helmets are all very good, but you should bring your own water shoes. They do provide them, but they are not in great shape and mine had holes in the toe region which allowed water to get into the shoe and thus my food slid a lot making it hard to walk. You need good, tight water shoes because there are a lot of rock formations and you will surely cut yourself or fall if your shoes do not fit properly. The lunch provided after the excursion was very good. Overall, this excursion was worth the price I paid which was $97 per person and included transporation from our resort, the tour, equipement needed for the tour, lunch, and transportation back to our resort.

AMAZING EXPIERENCE. Wow! This was an amazing couple of hours and by far my favorite part of my trip to Cancun. The staff was truly knowledgeable, Eco-friendly, and safe. My favorite part... finding out that well over half of my admission fee goes to the preservation of the caves and the land they are found in. Do yourself a favor and make this a part of your trip to the Yucatan.

Close-by. This was a great excursion to an underwater cave and cenote. Our guide, Mauricio was very knowledgeable and seemed to love what he did. The food they serve after the tour was FANTASTIC... worlds better than what we had to eat at our resort.

An experience like no-other!. Much like the other reviewers below, we found Rio Secreto a superb experience. Not as glitzy and touristy as XCaret and XelHa, but a true natural unspoiled experience. They take the utmost in precautions to protect the environment and enhance your experience. Our French tour guide took the time to explain everything we saw in very good English. The underground waters were tranquil and a nice temperature (about the same as the ocean water). The formations were spectacular and unspoiled. Our route was about 1 Kilometer through the cave (apparently there are three different routes) and it took a couple hours to trek through it. Amazement at every turn. Its pitch black inside the caves, so the helmet lamp becomes your best friend. They give you all the necessary gear and equipment. Our group was pretty small only 5, so that was a treat as the guide could explain more. After completion of the journey, a nice drink, a shot of Mayan Ouzo and a nice light lunch buffet. We bought the CD with all the photos (a photographer will follow you through the caves but he takes a different route to preposition himself, so you don't feel like he's behind you the whole trip). Photos are superb and worth the money. Once you are finished make sure you tip your guide as they will also help you with your meal and getting you back to your transportation - we tipped $20US because the guide was superb and he went out of his way to help with our 8 year old in the caves. Great experience!

The Secret is out, It's Fantastic.. Without a doubt one of the best experiences ever. My wife and I did this as an excursion on a Carnival Cruise. I was a little hesitant because I float like a bag of rocks and there is some swimming involved. I'm very glad I went anyway. After changing into your swimsuit in the large bathroom changing area at the sight, and locking your belongings into a secure locker, we took an outdoor shower to clean all the chemicals off our bodies in order to preserve the purity of the water underground. Each participant wads then outfitted with a wet suit to wear over our swimsuits, water shoes, and a miners hardhat with a light mounted with it. Next we were purified in a short Mayan ritual to prepare you for entrance to the other world. We took a short hike through the jungle to the entrance to the underground world. Then the real adventure began. Our guide Carlos lead us on our descent into the underground. For the next hour and a half we walked, descended, swam, waded and climbed through an amazing array of passageways and caverns. I only had to swim three times, and each one was the distance of a small pool. I actually enjoyed it once I was certain I could not sink. At several points our guide paused to explain the fish, and amazing formations found throughout the caverns. I don't want to give everything away, but It was a truly wonderful experience. During the entire journey we had our own photographer constantly documenting our trip. After our ascent back to the surface, we changed back in to our original clothes and shared a drink of Mayan Champagne, a drink made of fermented honey and anise. It is tasty and potent, We then proceeded to a display room where we were able to view slideshows of our trip. They offer several options for pictures and merchandise you may purchase. No pressure, just a description of what is available, if you do decide to purchase anything they take your order and prepare it while you are on to your next stop which is a meal of fresh local Mexican food which is included in the excursion. One special note, my wife has Celiac disease and MUST eat Gluten-Free. She was able to eat a full meal and only 1 single item was not gluten free. If your have any doubts or concerns, simple explain to you guide what you cannot eat and he can verify which foods are safe. All the guides speak English very well and if you speak English and/or Spanish you should have no problems communicating. After eating I paid for our photos. They accept both cash and card, so no issues with payment. At the end of the trip we were transported back to our pickup point at the Ferry landing in the same air- conditioned vans that transported us to Rio Secreto. It is about a 15 minute drive through town and the jungle. The preserve is located right next to Xcaret. I cannot recommend this enough. If you want something truly unique this is it.

Amazing. Amazing experience and our guide Alina was so good. One word of warning I can't swim that well at all and although you get life jackets you do really need to be confident in water as there is a swim at the end. Thank you so much to Alina for helping me.

Amazing. The tour was better than expected. We booked our tour from the Marriott CasaMagna which included transportation from Cancun and felt it was priced fairly at 95 USD. Once we arrived we were divided up into smaller tour groups, ours had only 7 people. Carlos was our tour guide and he very much enjoyed his job, he was always checking with us to make sure we were doing good and asking if we have questions. The company provided all the needed equipment, along with lunch. We spent about 2 hours inside the caves, this was the first time being in a cave system and everyone in the group felt completely safe. The water was crystal clear and we were able to see a few small catfish swimming around. The stalactites and stalagmites are amazing and made for a magical day. We did have a photographer with us for the entire tour, the photo were great and turned out much better than I anticipated. However, the price of the photos were way to expensive, so we passed. Had it been a bit more reasonable we would have purchased the disk. O'well, we still have our memories. I would highly recommend this tour

Great time in the cave!. We took the cave tour today and were very pleased. Carlos was our guide and he was awesome. He made sure that everyone was happy during the tour and had a great sense of humor. We were down under in the cave for an hour and a half and the time flew by. He was well informed and seemed to love his job as a tour guide. Yes, I have seen people complain about the price of pictures but it's a once in a lifetime thing so suck it up and buy the DVD.. The tour was well worth the money and they served an excellent buffet afterwards.

just excelent !! thank s to Raul who was our guide !! amazing underground caves.Ma julia and family.. an experience incredible for me and my family....guide s were always avail to show this amazing place and explain what s significant is keepthis natural reserve in the future.

NOT allowed to take photos.. Upon arrival we were told we would NOT be permitted to take our camera into the caves. Honestly it left such a bad taste in my mouth that I really didn't enjoy the visit like I should have. I felt VERY ripped off to have to pay $79 USD for a low res CD of pix they took of us. There are very few photos and I felt taken advantage of. That being said the cave was interesting, and beautiful.
Magical. This experience was incredible, loved every second. They are amazing underground caves that are looked after very well. The photos are quite expensive, bring money,

A beautifully overpriced cave.... If you have been to a cave and have seen stalctites and stalgmites, the admission fee ($USD 77 USD or $MXN1,000) is very steep for what it is. In the intro video they tell you that they donate a "significant portion" of the admission fee for the preservation of the cave. When I asked what is the significant portion, they referred me to the administrative office. For a company that claims to be promoting values of "honesty" they should be transparent with their customers about their value proposition. However, they market a trip to Rio Secreto as if it is comparable to going to the moon. Clear exaggeration. In the intro video they tell you you will see jaguars on the way to the cave. I spoke to the guide and he said in his 9 years working there he has not seen a single jaguar. Marketing! They market the experience as one that you need to have once in your lifetime. Yes, because you will not come back to pay the astronomical price again.Rio Secreto is a relatively recent discovery made a tourist attraction relying heavily on skewed marketing. The cave system itself is very impressive with its stalactites and stalgmites. The water inside the cave is crystal clear and it is a great experience if you have never been to a cave. They also overcharge for the photos ($USD 30 per person) or $USD135 for groups. They don't allow you to take your camera inside the cave. Even though they have a professional photographer they try to get you through the cave faster, more people, more money. They don't advertise the price of the photos upfront because they don't want to scare you away from the place. If you have the option go to the cenotes in the area do that or go to Xplor and you will see a cave and plus you will get to do more activities for couple of more dollars.

AMAZING. The Rio Secret tour was amazing. On the middle on of the Jungle, you will never find something nicer to do. 15 min away from Playa Del Carmen you have to do it. Ask for Alfredo your tour guide he super nice and will teach you a lot.

Great find. Went to Rio Secreto two days ago. My wife, daughter, son & me. Wife was the one who want to do something like this, but in Julie fashion got herself terrified even before getting into the cave. I give a lot of thanks to our guide, Luis, who got her calm and made the whole experience possible. It was a unforgettable adventure. Cost was $79USD per person. They usually do groups of 10, but we got lucky as the last group of the day ans had the tour with just the four of us.This is not an amusement park like the many that start with the letter X. This is the real deal, an underground river cave system. If you want a slice of nature in all its glory I highly recommend this place.

Breathtaking!!. This was a place I will never forget! 70 feet underground in a beautiful cenote with stalagmites and roots hanging down from the roof. It was amazing. The water was clear and refreshing in the cave. They provide everything you need for this adventure. If you don't like sharing shoes you may want to bring your own water shoes. The guide was very nice and informative. I brought my two boys aged 9 and 5 and they liked it but did find the water a bit cold. I loved everything about this experience and would highly recommend it. Just a not bring your credit card because you can't take your own pics and to purchase the ones they take of you starts at $40 USD. But worth it for the gorgeous place and great pics they take!

Breath taking!. The views were absolutely outstanding! The fact that it is a nature preserve makes you feel all the wonders of the magical place. The tour guy, Pablo, went above and beyond! He was passionate and really cares about his job. He was informative and patient. We had a memeber in the group that was elderly and he took her under his wing through the whole tour under the ground. The sites were absolutely magical. The only bad thing is the price of the pictures 150$ is wayyyy too much money to pay. Specially if you have a small group. Since there are no cameras allowed, one is almost obligated into getting the pictures, or walk out empty handed. Besides that, food was good, and it was a unique experience.

The best cenote of the Yucatan peninsula.. This is an excursion who everyone will enjoy. When you're thinking of visiting a cenote, this is the one to go to.The guides know everything there is to know about cenotes and the history of them.The equipment needed is provided at Rio Secreto. Also, the transportation from the entrance to the actual cenote is included.There are different routes which are not difficult to go through. If there are any obstacles on your way, your guide will tell you and point it out. If you do experience any trouble, he or she will help you.A photographer will also join you on your experience and take some nice pictures of you and your group. To take a single picture is, in my opinion, very expensive. This costs 25 dollars. When you take the whole package, it becomes a better deal, but hey, not everyone looks good in every picture... This is maybe something they should look into, lowering the price per photo.After your tour, you can enjoy a nice Mexican liquor and get a lunch afterwards. Any drinks you want to get (besides water and... Apple juice or ice tea or something that looks and tastes like that) you have to pay for though.This is a nice way to fill up your day and a unique experience.It's one of the first excursions I would recommend.

Truly Amazing and Magical. Really. If you like adventure and gorgeous views, you must do this. It can be a little tricky going so be sure to wear water shoes (or they will give them to you there) and make sure you're pretty sure footed. I had an injured ankle from a previous injury and there were a couple of spots where my foot was not as steady as I would have liked. Was totally worth it though. Small groups of 10 people. Very natural and beautiful. Delicious lunch after.

Nice but agree with others CD is horribly overpriced!. This was definitely a once in a lifetime experience. Caves were gorgeous and tour guide verynice. I suggest bringing your own wet suit and water shoes if possible. This is an all dayaffair from your cruise stop until back. Can be tiring. The bumpy ride to the caves was notas bad as I expected.Sorry but other reviewers are right. CD is terribly overpriced and expensive. Be aware youwill get some pictures from your group but alot are stock pictures they put in to be fillers. Alsoit is dark very dark. All those pretty pictures you see are flash photography. Do not go inexpecting to see all the these beautiful colors and lights.Once was enough.

Wonderful Tour!. My husband had done this tour on a previous trip to the area, so when it was offered on our cruise we booked it. Our tour guide Gonzo was wonderful, very informative and very patient with travelers that were a bit nervous. The caves are amazing and the cool waters inside the caves are a welcome reprieve from the hot summer days. We purchased the pictures, even though they were a little pricey, as they provide a once in a lifetime memory. The changing facility is also very clean and they offer the convenience of storage lockers to store your valuables. Would definitely recommend this tour!

Amazing experience. Our family went on this excursion during our cruise stop in Cozumel. It was an all day excursion because getting from the ship to rio secreto took some time (40 minute boat ride then another 25 minutes by minibus). Don't be discouraged by this. It was well worth the time and effort. Our guide was Gonzo. If you can get him as your guide you are very lucky. He was so knowledgable about the caves and underground rivers and made it so interesting and fun. The tour in the caves is about 1 1/2 hours. It is a once in a lifetime experience. The tour is about $109/pp and it included a buffet meal afterwards. The facilities are clean and they provide you with what you need. The only negative is that you cannot bring your own camera which is understandable. They have their own photographer and you can purchase your pictures at the end. I felt they were a little overpriced but it helps to keep the place running so we bought them anyway. Overall, I would recommend this to most but not young children (8 and under). Request Gonzo if you can!!

Rio Secreto. Even though I was expecting a more awe-inspiring experience - this was still an excellent tour. I was expecting more only because I hoped for some huge cathedral size caves. Nothing that big but it was still a one of kind experience. Don't miss this one. Very highly recommended.

Expensive but a very nice tour and gorgeous caves!. Read other reviews. This was expensive and one main drawback is that you aren't allowed to take pictures. They try to sell you their pictures for a ridiculously high price (higher than the price of the tour). In my opinion, it is not worth it to buy the pictures. Still, if you are fine with spending money (which you probably are if you are in this area), this tour will be worth it. Our guide was great, they picked us up from our hotel, provided us with all the equipment needed, and even fed us a tasty meal afterwards. The caves were as beautiful as it gets, and the whole experience was comfortable. If you are a low-budget penny pinching traveler, do not come, but if you are a fancy pants, or even a regular traveler willing to splurge a little, this will NOT disappoint!

Incredible Experience. Rio Secreto was beyond our wildest expectations. The caves were so beautiful and incredible. The tour guide, Paulo was so knowledgeable and passionate about his job. He gave us so many details about the caves and the natural habitats of the critters in the caves. The pictures taken were great and provided at a reasonable cost. This shore excursion was all inclusive with no surprise costs. It included the ride from the port to the caves, wetsuits, water shoes, life vests, helmet and lockers. After the tour we were given towels to dry off and a taste of the culture. Lunch provided was tasty and the suroundings were beautiful. Hammocks to take a quick nap in as well. This was by far our most treasured shore excursion! Thank you to the team at this beautiful natural site. We hope it stays as untouched as it is for all to enjoy!

Amazing underground river. We were in Playa Del Carmen for a wedding and only had 3 days to spend in town. My host highly recommended the Rio Secreto so I decided to visit with my 10 year old. The tour was amazing. The guides were efficient and prices were reasonable (between me and my daughter it was $100, combined). The entire visit took 4 hours, which includes about 60 minutes of prep and travel, 90 hours of time spent in the cave and underground river, and another 90 minutes for changing and lunch. Our guide Alina was really amazing. She was very professional and always made sure that safety came first. Half of our group were children under 10 and at no time did we feel unsafe, even though we were in a river deep underground. Even swimming in water as deep as 3-4 meters the kids had a great time. The only negative aspect of the trip was the cost of the photos. They don't allow any camera or video taping except through the tour's own camera person. The photo CD came out to $79 USD, which I thought was a bit pricey for 25-30 digital photos. But over all the tour and the food is a great value for a family outing.

Awesome adventure well worth your time!. This is a great half day trip and well worth every penny. We were picked up from our hotel having booked this online whilst we were in Mexico (worth booking direct online rather though your hotel rep as it works out quite a bit cheaper). The day started by being greeted by friendly staff and a quick video about the Cenotes and caves. It's then a short drive into the jungle to the Cenotes site. You are then kitted out with wet suit, shoes and helmet. We were in a small group of 6. Our guide was great, really enthusiastic and obviously keen for us all to have a great time. A short walk through the jungle brought us to the entrance of the sink hole and we descended. What came next absolutely blew me away! The cave system is absolutely awe inspiring,beautiful and captivating. The combination of walking, wading and swimming through the caves was really exciting, and all the while the guide was reassuring and telling us fascinating facts about the cave system its formation, the wildlife etc. we were below ground for over an hour and it whipped by. I was truly captivated and loved every minute and was gutted when the experience came to an end. A short walk back through the jungle and a reasonable lunch awaited us. The caves are an unforgettable experience. The only gripe would be the price of the photos, you cannot take cameras into the caves understandably but your accompanied by a photographer, they have capitalised on this and the photos although not bad are too expensive, working out at about £40 for a cd of around 30 photos. A shame, we would be happy to buy photos but not at that price. We walked away with no photos but great memories of the day

Beautiful river. This river is definitely a beautiful place to visit. It is a fun and educative activity for the entire family. It is very leisurely and slow paced making it doable for people of all ages. The view under the cave is spectacular and our tour guide Nico was very funny and full of information you could definitely see that he was passionate about his job. They have tour guides who speak different languages and the buffet at the end was good. I do suggest they should offer more of a variety in the food but nonetheless it was a great experience.

Wow!. What a fun family activity! One of the most beautiful Natural sites in the World. This place is magnificent and the staff is incredibly helpful and friendly. It could truly be the 9th Wonder of the World!

Best excursion in Riviera Maya!. Trip exceeded all expectations! Our guide Victor was so knowledgeable and passionate. The galleries of rock formations were stunning. Excursion of a lifetime exploring this cave system. Unforgettable adventure!

Something different for hot days!. LOVED THIS! Underground exploration, finding out about the culture as well as the science behind this caves, and it is relaxing and fun. You get a wet suit which helps with the cold water. As well, lunch is included! Our guide, Yayo, knew so much and could answer everything we had asked. We bought the pictures which were extremely cheap compared to other places. My only complaint is they will not let you bring a GoPro with you so that you HAVE to buy the pictures.

Top Rating without question. This is a beautiful natural attraction! Every inch of this place is fascinating, and I didn't want to blink for fear of missing something. The tour guide, Rene, clearly loved his job and did a fantastic job of transferring his passion to us. They take care of everything, so just bring your sense of adventure.

Explore the deep dark caves!. AMAZING! Carina was our guide (witty, knowledgeable, kind, enthusiastic and passionate). From the moment we stepped off the bus, we knew we were going to have an amazing time! Touring the caves was phenomenal, and experience I will never forget. Everything was so well planned. All you need is your bathing suit, they take care of everything else (wet suit, towels, lockers, water shoes, lunch). If you have your own water shoes, bring them (I'm not a fan of wearing other people's shoes!). A highlight of my trip to Mexico this month!

Enjoyable excursion. The formations in the caves are amazing and beautiful. The tour guide was very knowledgeable, however, started explaining things before everyone in the group were together. He was from France and spoke fairly good English, but had to really listen closely in order to process all information given. You are given hard hats with lights on them (otherwise caves are dark)-- guide has flashlight also. I found myself looking at my feet so as not to fall with the uneven ground and only looked around when standing still, so I probably missed out on a lot of cool formations. You are not allowed to take your own cameras- even if they are waterproof -- they have a photographer assigned to each group to take pictures along the way -- my guess is this is so they can make additional monies on selling overpriced CD photos. It was an enjoyable adventure, however was not a WOW adventure or a "must see" for me.

Beautiful caves, beware the bleach. The cave is gorgeous, of course. It's definitely expensive and you feel very much like sheep, herded from one point to the next. Food was incredibly mediocre and they want you to buy your pictures. The guide was great. So passionate about his job and a pleasure to be around. Don't go on the bilingual tour, if you can avoid it. It wasn't terrible, but it could have been better. My real beef is with the gear. It is doused in bleach. It stinks of bleach and mildew. I thought it was just stinky after being cleaned with bleach - it isn't. They make a big deal about keeping the water free from environmental pollutants and make you shower first, but send you in the water in wetsuits and life vests absolutely dripping with bleach. After turning in the gear and drying off, I threw my clothes on over a slightly damp swimsuit. When I got back, the bleach had seeped from my damp suit and had ruined my clothes. Bathing suit, shirt, and shorts are completely bleach stained and ruined. Not cool. We spent $160 US, plus taxi ride there and back (another $400 pesos), plus tip. Add the cost of my ruined clothes and it just wasn't worth it. To top it off, there was no warning whatsoever, so those with sensitive skin or who like their clothes, beware.

fantastic advdnture. We really enjoyed our trip to Rio Secreto, tour was awesome and our guide seemed to know a lot about the area and the cave system we went into. It was a lot of fun and we got some really nice pictures out of it. If you like caves and learning about the area this is a great trip :)

Awesome place to go on a rainy day!. We had a few rainy days to find something to do and went to El Rio Secreto. What an awesome experience!!! The guides were great, the prices were not outrageous like other places, and it was great for the whole family. My 8 and 10 year olds had a blast. They outfitted you with everything you needed. Wet suits, water shoes, helmets etc... Would definitely recommend this place to families of all ages.

Beautiful caves! Great tour....a bit too much emphasis on Photo CD. This is a beautiful set of caves and underground rivers. Our very informative tour guide did a great job despite the fact that he was given two English speakers (us) and 8 Spanish speakers. He had lots of great information to share.. The operation is extremely well organized, including the ability to get picked up at your hotel or condo even if it is a bit out of the way. Equipment ( shorty wetsuit, life jacket, water shoes and helmet with lamp) is provided at no extra cost, and a quick shower is requested to minimize chemicals from bodies and hair getting into the water. Lockers are also provided. Once you are in the caves, you never see another group, which is extremely nice. The tour itself if very informative and fun. There is a professional photographer along on the tour, and I feel there is a bit too much emphasis on posing for pictures...although they are well done. There is a nice buffet lunch afterwards I would give the experience FIVE stars if not for the photo CD emphasis. Definitely worth going.

Superb cenote!. Really good place to discover cenote! Our guide Julian was incredible as he really knows his stuff. Good explanations, many things he did to make us fell real good in cenote, guide us to many places and make us discover this wonder. Ask for him and satisfaction guaranteed! Went there early and we were a small group of 5. Thanks for the tour!

Underground serenity. Take nothing with you (except some money to purchase pics and souvenirs)! Everything, including lunch, towels, clean wetsuit/shoes/equipment is provided for you. The underground caves are beautiful, the guides are patient, helpful and knowledgable, and the water is a brilliantly refreshing break from the Mexican sun. This is a must-see.
simply amazing. well worth the price , cenotes are safe and very well organized , went with my wife and two boys of 4 and 6.

Paulo, the Brazilian guide made pur experience heavenly. While traveling to Mexico from Canada, we visited Rio secreto on july 30, 2014 and Paulo enhanced the experience by giving friendly, highly professional and scientific explanations. He is fully bilingual (portuguese and english) and knowledgeable about the Mayan culture and natural phenomenen taking place in the cave. He is very patient with tourists, has very good understanding and application of customer service. He helped everyone in the group to have a wonderful experience. We Will recommend the tour to friends and family mainly because of Paulo and his great professionalism.

a hidden gem. rio secreto is a beautiful maze of caves with stunning views. our guide, alfredo , helped our small group of 12 navigate with ease. this is a tour where you are suited up in a wetsuit and a life vest with a lighted helmet and you are underground for almost two hours on very rocky terrain and often submerged in water. alfredo answered every question and encouraged us along the whole way. he was so knowledgable and the perfect tour guide. if you are able, you should definitely go, it was a once in a lifetime experience. they give you a beautiful lunch after which i admit i was scared to eat because i had only tried food from my hotel, but i braved it and it was very yummy and very safe to eat. you are not allowed to take anything in to the cave but they send a photographer with you so that you can purchase pictures after. there were other excursions we wanted to do but we didn't want tot ravel 3-4 hours from our hotel so rio secret was perfect, it was only a little over an hour from the main hotel strip in cacncun.

What an amazing place!. Visited Rio Secreto as an excursion off our Princess cruise. There was a bit of trepidation on my part as I am a non swimmer and I heard there was a section of the cave that you had to swim through. The trip was unbelievably fabulous. The tour was extremely well organized:everything from getting the necessary equipment to the lovely lunch that was provided. The caves were spectacular and we learned so much about formations within,the creatures that inhabit the caves and the history surrounding the caves. I cannot say enough about our guide PAUL. He was knowledgeable, had a great sense of humor and helped me transverse the water, putting my fears to rest. He stayed with our group from the moment we stepped off the van until we returned back. This place is a must for anyone who visits Playa de Carmen!,,,,,

Amazing!. As with any travel aboard I was a bit hesitant to book this but since our cruise company recommended it, I didn't see how I could go wrong and boy am I glad I did! It is a pricey excursion but it is well worth it! I had read posts on it and thought well many are recommending it, it must be good and it was. I was with a 10 year and thought she wouldn't enjoy it but she did and that was just the icing on the cake. I always like to go on vacations that leave her with a memory of a lifetime and this was certainly accomplished with this trip. They do not let you bring cameras into the cave system, even if they are waterproof. They do take pictures from the beginning of the tour and all awhile you're in the cave but you guessed it, you have to pay for them. The CD they sell is worth the price because you can take something back with you. Be prepared to get wet and be in tight and dark quarters but it won't matter because it'll be a great time. They do provide you food at the end of the tour, a buffet type which was pretty descent. if you're going from a cruise liner, eat a descent breakfast on the ship and you should be good. Best experience in Playa del Carmen!

Stunning Caves. Rio Secreto specializes in preservation, whereas other companies have used dynamite to make it easily accessible for tourists to visit while damaging the natural caves.Most hotels can book this trip for you, but if you book directly you can usually find a discount. There on-line customer service/chat feature was EXCELLENT!!!!They require you t arrive 30 minutes prior to complete paperwork and watch the orientation video. Since there are people from all over the world that visit, we had to watch the video 3 times in 3 different languages. After we were shuffled into the shuttles that take you about 20 minutes away to the cenote.You will be greeted by your tour guide who will get you set up with a locker, water shoes, an outdoor group shower, wetsuit, life jacket and helmet. The wetsuits and other gear are very wet and very smelly. (They get one dip is some kind of cleaning solution when you turn them in, but they still smell of sweat and mold). Also it recommends wearing a bathing suit underneath, I actually recommend wearing a rashguard/neoprene shirt as I actually got a rash from the wetsuit where my bare back made contact with the not so clean wetsuit.After gearing up they take you on a 5 minute hike to the cenote. The underwater caves are beautiful and breathtaking. We were on a bilingual tour, which if I ever come back, I will request a non-bilingual trip. He has to say everything twice and it takes twice as long, now this wouldn't be a problem if he wasn't rushing us along. If you fall more than a couple of steps behind, the guide will yell at you, so just try to hurry along and stay with the group, even though you are trying not slip and fall or run into the rocks underwater. Also for some reason our guide had 3 English speaking people in the front of the line, 4 French, and then us 2 English speaking people in the back, so while walking in line, he would speak to the English speakers, but we were way in the back and had not reached the stopping points yet, so we couldn't hear what he was saying. Then he would translate to French for the French people, and we would never understand what he saying.They will not let you bring in your own camera, even if it is waterproof, one it would really hold up the group and two, they want to charge you $79 (yes, that is US dollars, not pesos) for the photographs they take, yes, that was more than the admission price!!!!Lunch is provided, it was a variety of Mexican dishes/buffet, it was okay at best.After lunch we had a whole 5 minutes to chill in the hammocks, before they herded us back into the shuttle to head back to the check in area.This tour does offer three different tours, so you can revisit and take another route.I was not very fond of the tour guide or the tour itself as were seemed to be rushed, but I would return to these caves because they are amazing and beautiful; however, I might consider a different tour company.
Amazing!!. I was there on July 21st and I must say this is one of the most impressive and majestic places I've seen. The staff is great, specially our guide Julio.

Gorgeous. Linda was our tour guide. Having small groups go at a time works well. We received an excellent tour and enjoyed it. Going at 11 AM worked well. By the time you finish the tour and eat there is little to no time before you are back in the van and going back home. The food is ok at best. I would have rather gone back to the hotel once we finished with the tour but that is not how they operate. The caves were cool to see and cool to the touch. The helmet is definitely needed b/c there are plenty of opportunities for you to hit your head and the wet suit feels great when floating in the river. It is quite cool. Loved it!!!

Beautiful. First of all our guide Phillip was fantastic! He was so knowledgeable about the Rio Secreto that any fears or hesitation about going into the cave was gone immediately. The water was cool and crystal clear. The stalagmites and stalagtites were amazing

Do not miss Rio Secreto!. The guided tour is impressive. An underground crystal -clear river, running through a cave with amazing formations. Unique experience to say the least. The food is a basic uninspired buffet, but we did not go for the food. You will not be disappointed. Not for small children/babies

Once in a lifetime experience. What a wonderful excursion. This is not disneyland, and for that I love it even more. Where else can you submerse yourself in 2million year old surroundings. Rodolfo our French guide was very informative, our group was half English and half French and he made it understandable for all of us. If you are claustrophobic this is not for you. The clear water, the caves, the stalagmites, the stalagtites.....breathtaking. You cant bring a camera, which I was a little disappointed as I had a waterproof one just for that excursion, but you dont have time/focus to take photos. You have a "paparazzi" who takes plenty of individual/couple (make sure you smile :)) and you purchase at the end of the tour for $75USD, they give you a hardcopy disc. Well worth it and takes the pressure off. We brought our own water shoes which I recommend as you will have to rent theirs. And not a skimpy swimsuit as you'll be in a wetsuit anyway. Water was perfectly cool, nice for the hot weather up above. I would say we were down there for an hour and a half? Totally lost track of time. I would absolutely do this again as there are 3 different routes. The lunch after was also quite yummy, soup, chicken, tamales, rice, green beans. Water and Jamaica drinks included. Even the tour bus driver was entertaining and gave great information about the towns we drove through while dropping other guests off at their hotels. Plan on this taking up most of the day, the front desk said we'd be back by 12:30pm and we didnt get back until 4:15pm. Cant wait to go back one day.

What an awesome experience in an underground river!!!. This was a definite highlight on our cruise- the excursion on the Amazing Secret River adventure, aka, Rio Secreto. You receive all the "gear" you need including water shoes, a wetsuit, a lifejacket, and a helmet with headlamp. You can even select a walking stick to use (a must). The guide was excellent and very informative. We came with a group of 50, but they split us up into smaller groups of 10 persons. There are actually several different trails you can take once inside the cave so you could come back several times with different experiences each time. You will get to walk through the cave, wade through the river, and even swim (float) in some parts of the secret river. Everywhere you look it is amazing with stalactites and stalagmites and other formations everywhere!The only down side to this is stated by others before and that is you cannot (due to safety) take your own camera inside. There is a Rio Secreto photographer that follows your group everywhere and will take pictures during the exploration. Afterwards, they will show you all the photos and try to sell them to you- 1 photo for $25 or all of them for $79. It is expensive, but a decision you have to make.There is a small buffet at the end after changing clothes of rice, beans, chicken, chips, salsa, fruit, water, etc. Drinks are extra if you want them. While waiting to return to hotel or cruise, there are lots of nice and comfortable hammocks to rest in- use them!There was also a small shuttle van that took us to and from Rio Secreto with excellent drivers. Overall, I would definitely go again. Enjoy Rio Secreto!

Rio Secreto - Amazing Secret River Tour in Playa Del Carmen. Upon leaving our cruise ship in Cozumel, we were quickly loaded onto a boat ride for Playa Del Carmen. The ride lasted about 45 minutes and then we were driven by van to the Amazing Secret River entrance. We were fitted with wetsuits and helmets and headed through a small hike to the cave entrance. The cave itself was beyond beautiful, and our guide, Nunes, was very knowledgeable and fun. The whole tour lasted about an hour and a half. We celebrated after exiting with a shot of anise liquor and then enjoyed a delicious Mexican buffet. We weren't allowed to bring our own cameras and the photos taken by another guide cost $25 a piece, or $79 for a full CD. After returning to the Playa Del Carmen port, we had 40 minutes to shop while waiting for the boat to return us to Cozumel. Honestly, this was a huge disappointment. We would have much rather spent that 40 minutes in Cozumel shopping. The boat returning us to Cozumel left us with no time to souvenir shop as all the port stores had closed and we were rushed to our cruise ship for departure. We enjoyed the tour but probably won't do it again.

Do not miss! Amazing!! Loved it!. We visit the Rio Secreto when we went on a cruise, at first I thought it was a bit expensive, but it was worth it!! Our guide Raul was fun and knowledgeable. My children, 8 and 11, were afraid of going on a cave at first, but they loved so much that they complained when Raul said it had ended.It is a beautiful place! Amazing experience! The whole tour was very well planned. The facility is very well kept! The food they serve after the tour is fresh, simple and delicious! I would do it again to go on the other route.

Amazing activity, but expensive pictures. The caves look just like the ones in the pictures on their website. You get to spend about 1 1/2 hours hiking and swimming through the cave and they take pictures all the way. If we wanted to buy the 15 or so pictures of us on a CD they wanted $79 or you could pick 1 photo for $25 US dollars. They do not let you bring your own camera even if it's waterproof. Since we thought that was way to high for a few photos we didn't buy them and I don't have anything to post here. There is a buffet at the end which had some good food- tamales, chicken, soup, salsa, etc. There is a cafe at the gate, but they only have snacks and sandwiches so I wouldn't advise coming on an empty stomach as it will be 2 1/2 until you get to the buffet.

Rio Secreto.....Mexico. This was AMAZING !!!!! this is a "must" if you enjoy adventure...we went in a family group.....ages around 50...and the "guide" was very helpfully......the only thing I recommended is to take with you your own shoes (unsleppery shoes , the ones for beach).......

AMAZING!!!. Our family had a fantastic time viewing and experiencing the caves of Rio Secreto. The caves were spectacular and we really appreciated that they're trying to preserve it naturally. Our guide was Jorge and he was very knowledgable and a lot of fun. He loved to give us as much information as possible. The Mayan cuisine was great and even our picky eaters, age 10 & 12, really enjoyed their food. If you're in the Mayan Riviera please do not miss this true treasure! Thank you to Jorge and also our photographer who took amazing shots!!!

Beautiful - not to be missed. Once in a lifetime opportunity - and suitable for almost all levels of ability - the guide was great - he helped out one woman who was afraid to go - the caves were spectacular.
Amazing, for the second time. My second time in rio secreto: as amazing as the first.Benito was a great guide.Our four kids age 5-17 enjoyed the experience.Will definitly go again.
Excellent. Great tour my son(6) and I did this tour. Breathe taking views, Raul our guide was amazing (funny and knowledgeable). Lots of fun

Outstanding. Facilities are new and modern. Personal safety equipment supplied by the vendor was new, comfortable and CLEAN. Guide knowledgable and sensitive to visitors needs. Food, included with the tour, from a buffet, served after the tour was real, prepared by locals, served hot with satisfaction.There are no words that can describe the Cave, wonderful, inspiring and mind blowing for the young and the young of heart.

Great excursion. The excursion is, as they say there, not an amusement park but a visit to a secret world in the jungle. It is a bumpy 4 km trek into the jungle and then you suit up and have an even bumpier walk and swim into the cenote. There is a short Mayan ceremony that reminds you that this is a journey into their underworld but it is not a hellacious place rather a beautiful wonderland of limestone roots water and stalagmites. You emerge and they give you some delicious Mayan honey liquor and then lunch. All and all a nice adventure.

An amazing trip to the underground rivers. This was one of the best excursions that I have ever done -- it was so amazing to travel through an underground cave and swim in the river. It was so beautiful and peaceful. An experience not to be missed!!!

Experience for the life time. This tour was the highlight of my family trip to cancun. Very friendly staff and the guide is very knowlegeable for all the question that is related to the underground river and Mayan history. The underground river is natural preservation and thus the visitors weren't allowed to bring their personal cameras and other belongings(lockers, helmet, towels and wet suits are provided). They do, however, has assigned photographer for each group to take photos for you to be purchased at the end of the tour. The food was great and it was also included in the tour. Swimming through the underground river and witness the formation of the cave, fish and bats is something out of this world. I highly recommend it to whoever interested in the wild life and explorers. Note: It is not recommended to people who has walking problems, little children and those who suffers from the clautrophobia. The ground is very uneven and the wrong steps could definitely cut/scratch your legs.

This will be a life long memory for our family!. This is an incredible place and operation! Our guide Raul made it special with his knowledge of caves and science and illustrations using scenes and quotes from Hollywood movies. He took special care to keep everyone in our group safe. The food afterward was very good as well. Budget to buy the disc of photos because they are good and worth it. Thanks Raul!
Great tour. If you like a nice ,quiet, adventure tour this the one.You go through a subterranea river with no lights but the one in your helmet.

Amazing experience!. We chose this excursion while on the Disney Fantasy and it exceeded our expectations. There were seven of us and a additional family of three plus a guide and photographer. This was our 7th Disney cruise and perhaps the best excursion we have ever taken. You need to be in fairly good condition to easily navigate the caves. My husband and I are in our early 50's and we had no problem. Our children in their teens and early 20's loved it as well. It is every bit as beautiful as the pictures on the internet show. It goes on for what feels like forever. The bonus is the buffet lunch at the end that is quite good. We also purchased the pictures, shirts, hats and liquor package. I'd highly recommend this tour, you will not be disappointed.

Amazing Day Trip. The tour was absolutely amazing thanks to our tour guide, Niko. Throughout the entire 1.5 hr tour, he helped us scale each area and obstacle while keeping up with his enjoyable guided tour. From moment one, he truly made us feel like we were his first and last tour ever. Definitely the VIP treatment. I recommend that you have good balance because there are portions of the the tour that require stability climbing on and over rock formations without the aid of holding on at some portions. Thankfully they outfit you with helmets and aqua shoes. AND REMEMBER AS NIKO SAID, "THE WATER IS "REFRESHING"." While the photos are nice, the option to bring in your own waterproof camera should be an option. The pictures are pretty decent but the price can be steep so be prepared in advance ($50+) for a photo CD.  The ride to the Rio Secreto can be a little "bumpy" through the dirt paths but it's well worth the journey at the end. As our driver called the ride, a "Mayan Massage". It definitely is one so don't eat a heavy meal before or afterward. Overall, a 5 star experience. Definitely one not to miss!Thanks again to Niko for an amazing day in the caves of Rio Secreto on the Yucatan Peninsula!

A Truly Unique Experience. If you like the adventure type tours, this is it. The staff is great, and the memories will last you a lifetime. The buffet at the end of the tour is a good extra too. They "Do not allow cameras" in the caves but do sell photo packages at the end, a bit pricey but worth it for the memories. If your visiting Cozumel on any sort of trip, this in one spot you want to stop and explore!

A unique type of tour well worth it!. What a neat and different experience this was! I have been in caverns before but never in the water or so far into a cave. The groups are kept to about 10 people so you can stay close together and several languages were offered. The water was cool but not cold and the wetsuit and lifejacket make it comfortable. For the majority of the time you walk through shin high water and need to watch your step. I have a bad knee but was able to make it through no problem. There are portions where you swim/glide through the deeper waters and there are bats, a few fish and many stalactite and stalagmite formations. One of the best moments in the tour is when we turned off our headlamps and let the feeling of absolute darkness sink in. The lunch at the end of the tour was hot and good local faire. Our tour guide, Galo, was very knowledgeable and caring to ensure every tourist felt safe and was getting the full experience, He went above and beyond his daily duties to take are of everyone making sure they had the right equipment, plenty of food and extras while our group waited for the rest of our bus to complete their tour.

Best Side Trip Choice. I visited Rio Secreto last week with 13 of my family members. We ranged in ages from 5 years old to 86 and everywhere in between. Our trip far exceeded any of our expectations! We were warmly greeted by staff and taken to put on wetsuits and gear. Our group was split into two and my 86 year old Grandma was in one group and my five year old cousin was in another so the guides would be able to assist them both separately. Jorge was our guide and his knowledge and passion for the caves shined through the entire tour. We could tell he loved what he did and truly cared about preserving this beautiful cave. I have traveled the world, and Rio Secreto was by far one of the best side trips I have ever taken. The beauty and tranquility that lies within the cave is absolutely breathtaking and anyone that is considering this tour, should do it...you will not regret it! The swimming was great and at times over our heads, which was so cool (life jackets are worn)!! When taking this tour, make sure you stop and look at all around you and realize how old this underground world is. The only light on the tour is from the helmets worn, which is plenty when you're in the cave. I found myself looking all around and amazed at all of the spots Jorge took us through! While cameras are not allowed on the tour, there is a photographer that captures pictures along the way...yes, the pictures are expensive, but then again, how often do you have the opportunity to swim in a cave? We purchased the pictures on a disc and are so glad that we did. My 86 year old Grandma became nervous when she entered the cave, but Jorge assisted her the ENTIRE time. He was AMAZING with her and helped her feel safe and she had a FANTASTIC time!! If it weren't for his thoughtful assistance, she would have had a difficult time on the tour, but Jorge was great. Rio Secreto is a world wonder and should not be missed when visiting Riviera Maya.

It's a cavern.... Having a good experience visiting a site heavily depends on 3 main factors:Your interests, your expectations, and who you're with. I wasn't overly impressed with this site, but I kept my opinion to myself as I observed that the group I was in, as well as 2 groups who had already finished the tour before us, were raving about it. So here are my thoughts to help you decide for yourself. PROs:- this is a good cavern tour. Whether or not you go as an individual or in a tour group, the tour provides an on-site guide and high quality equipment (wetsuit, watershoes, helmet with lamp)-Tours are offered in English or Spanish (separate groups saves the time of translating)-groups are limited to around 7 people -The guide explains all about stalagtites, stalagmites, and the importance of the caverns in nature and to the Mayans- you walk through underground caverns and wade through water up to neck deep. It is dark and you must pick your way through carefully. For me, this was a plus. More adventurous. However, if you are older or not sure-footed, this is not the tour for you. (See cons)- a simple buffet meal is included at the end of the tour. I thought the food was good.CONS:- I thought it was pricey for a cavern tour.Walk-in entrance is $80 US, but you have to factor in the guide, meal, and equipment.  But I've been on a few cavern tours, so if you haven't, you'll really enjoy this one. - The tour can be challenging for those who are older, don't see well, or have any walking or balance issues. There are steep staircases, rocky inclines with dirt and gravel, slippery and rocky cavern floors with irregular rock formations jutting out of and under the milky cavern water. A woman in her late 60s was having trouble negotiating the trek and was quite winded on the return. The tour is doable for everyone. Kids will have few problems. The guide can help those who are having difficulty, in - or out of - the water. But you should know what you're getting into. What is fun for some can be intimidating for others. - I thought the tour inside the cavern was kinda brief. It's 3.5 hours, but about the first 15 min is spent driving to the starting point, then 30-45 min changing and putting on wetsuits and equipment, and then 30 min at the end taking OFF said equipment and changing, and another 30+ minutes at the end, eating. That leaves about 30-45 minutes actually inside the cavern. - There are no pictures or video allowed. You can buy a package of professional-quality photos they take inside the cavern, but of course, they're expensive. $80 US. I was thinking of buying them, so I purposely staged several pics that the photographer got a big kick out of, yet when I was looking through the photos at the end, only a few of them were included. I didn't buy the package. If one of my pics shows up on their next brochure, I will epitomize the typical American and sue. (At least for the cost of my admission). To sum up, I thought it was a decent cavern tour considering the quality of the equipment, etc. I was a bit disillusioned by the reference to the site as a cenote. While it IS a cenote, there is no swimming involved. It's a shallow-water walking tour. So for me, it was about expectations. But you decide. Hope this helps. Happy travels!
Awesome, highly recommend. Julio was our guide and he was passionate, knowledgable and really made it an experience that you would remember. One of two of my favorite excursions we have ever done.

Well worth it !. We booked the 1:30pm tour. Our tour guide was very knowledgeable and courteous. The underground water was cold so wearing the wet suit was a perfect idea. It was amazing walking, swimming, and treading water in the dark cave with our headlights on. After the tour there was a buffet waiting and it was pretty good. Highly recommended !

Carlos is awesome!. Rio Secreto was the perfect excursion during our cruise stop in Mexico. We took a rocky 35 minute ferry ride from Cozumel to Playa Del Carmen. From there we took a 25 minute van ride to the location. The last 10-15 minutes of the ride was very bumpy due to unpaved roads but no biggie! The facilities are very clean and nice. The caves are amazing, so beautiful and interesting. Best of all was our tour guide CARLOS! He was friendly, knowledgable, funny, and helpful! Thank you Carlos for making it a memorable day!You need cash for pictures. $25 for one on a CD, $75 for CD with all pictures taken during your time in the cave plus additional professional pictures of the caves, or $100 for CD with your choice of souvenirs.

Lots of fun and worth every peso!. Organized and well thought out. Logistically, the tour begins with a 10 minute informational video, then a 5 minute van ride into the jungle to another location where you shower and are fitted with equipment. Even though they tried to squeeze my size 10 (US) body into an XS wetsuit (which was never gonna happen) they had a suit for me and even my husband who is a US size 52 suit (all shoulders!).The trek underground is at least an hour long and mostly wading through 3 feet or so of water. There were 2 spots that required some level of swimming or at least using your arms to paddle while the life jacket keeps you afloat for 10-20 feet. You definitely feel like you're on an adventure! They also serve a decent meal after the tour that included soup, chicken pibil, rice, beans, salad, fruit and drinks. A nice bonus and welcomed after all that trekking through the jungle, trying to swim with a lifejacket and trying to stay upright while walking over rocks in the water. There was a Mexican woman in our group who was doing this tour for the 3rd time and I can see why. There are apparently different paths and levels of difficulty. I would go again.

What a gem!!. While on a tour of Chichen Itza, we asked our tour guide if there were any local sites we should see. He recommended Rio Secreto, and I could not be more grateful that he did!! It is a tour of the underground rivers! They ask you to take nothing with you that could contaminate the water, and no sunscreen! Won't need it! Wear a bathing suit/water clothes. They suit you up in a wet suit, water shoes, a life jacket and a hardhat with a headlamp. The shaman purifies you in a ceremony before you enter the cenote. Your guide leads your group through the caves, pointing out beautiful features and history. In some spots, the water is only ankle deep, in some places you swim through, in still others, you need to push yourself through small openings on your back (not for the claustrophobic!). They have a photographer who moves with your group and takes photos you can purchase at the end. This was an amazing experience our whole family enjoyed and still talks about with excitement!
Beautiful. It was really really beautiful, but the equipment they give you (helmets) spell really bad. An amazing experience in overall.

can't-miss attraction!. Rio Secreto was SO much fun! For anyone who enjoys the outdoors, this is a must-see if you are visiting Playa del Carmen. It is truly a beautiful natural wonder, and is so different than anything I've ever seen before. Our tour guide Raul was so nice, interesting, and full of great information! The food they served after the tour was really delicious as well, and was the perfect way to end the day before heading back to our resort.

Rio Secreto. What a beautiful experience!! It is amazing what is underground. This adventure is not for anyone who is claustrophobic. The guide was excellent and timed his rate of travel so that everyone was comfortable. Would not recommend this for anyone who has difficulty walking.Lunch is included.

Very interesting. This is. Very unique experience. We had a fantastic guide and the staff was so helpful. Would not recommend to someone who is claustrophobic but definitely for someone who likes a different adventure.

Under ground caves. Really good trip to see stalactites / stalagmites don't have to be a swimmer as your given a life jacket... Really good info from the guide... Please be very careful right at the very end I tripped and sprained my ankle not there fault but mine :((

Amazing place. It was really worth it to spend half day in this awesome natural park! Magic underground caves and sink holes and the best people working there. Our guide Rodrigo was super funny and he answered all our questions. They are really experienced and its a MUST if you come near this area!!

Amazing Tour of Rio Secreto. We usually don't book ship tours and prefer independent tours but this one was excellent! We were split into small groups of ten and our group was guided by Carlos. He did a wonderful job of guiding us safely through the caverns and river while providing much commentary and insight during the tour. Carlos made sure everyone was taken care of while we ventured on the most difficult of the three available tours. It truly was an amazing experience to see the magnificent stalactites and stalagmites forming. We would have liked to have taken photos but we understand why it isn't allowed. With this in mind, bring money - $25 for a single photo, $99+ for packages including souvenirs. We gave the photo staff member our email but he never emailed info to us. My husband contacted Rio Secreto and Ramon Hernandez set up a PayPal request so that we could receive all of our photos and the Rio Secreto Galleria of photos. Ramon was of great assistance!We all agreed it was the best excursion experience which also included a very tasty Mayan lunch. We highly recommend this tour!!

Spectacular and unspoiled. As this was newly discovered only a couple of years ago, this is one amazing experience. Our guide Julian was entertaining and very reassuring. However, you do need some flexibility to navigate the trail within the cenote. If you have any kind of mobility issues, please do not attend this outing as it will be far too difficult. Also, if you are claustrophobic any of the cenotes would not be pleasurable. We loved it so much that we plan to return to explore the other underground river systems.

If You Want More Of An Adventure This Is It!. This was a cruise excursion for my daughters and I (ages 13 and 10) who I figured might like something more along the lines of "Journey to the Center of the Earth". I nailed it with this choice, even though beaches and sun are more of our thing.Still, you'll swim. Not the whole way, but definitely at certain points. At other points it's wading, and sometimes walking. And, without our lights, it would be totally dark. This might be frightening for a very small child. Also, if an individual has ambulatory difficulties, it might not be entirely comfortable walking over rocky and wet places. But, all of that is what makes it a cool and interesting experience! DEFINITELY more exciting than the great Luray Caverns in Virginia, or even the many beautiful caves in southwest Australia!You'll wear (and you need to) a shorty wet-suit, and hard-had with light. This is your chance to experience caves that were only relatively recently discovered, and not quite established old tourist sites. On that note, I've got to say that this excursion edged out the other stops on our Disney cruise for one big reason: Groups are taken in relatively small numbers, and you're not so much another body in a parade of cattle. It made the experience much more memorable.Also, the buffet at the end was great! More like eating authentic Mexican food than what most Americans experience.

sectacture. the is about half a day trip great guides good equipment very helpful know and explain how this hole system work . you cannot take pictures your self at first i was p..o.d then . once you see and think about why you are happy to get the cd. with pictures of you in these settings

Great place to beat the heat. We had a great time at Rio Secreto. June in the Yucatan is hot and humid - 90F with high humidity, but this was a great way to stay cool. Luis was our guide - very knowledgeable and kept everyone interested, comfortable and safe. Agree with others comments on the road conditions, Mayan ritual and photo prices, but we had a terrific time at an attraction that is off the beaten track.
Great experience. The reviews are all true. We had a fabulous time. This was a cruise ship excursion for us so it took a ferry ride and a van trip to get there but was well worth it.

Cool experience. Very neat experience. The Mayan "prayer" in the beginning was a bit cheesy. The caves are very neat to see and swim through. You don't have to wear the wetsuit but I highly recommend it! The only negative is the negotiating for the pictures at the end. We ended up splitting it with our group (one person took the disk and sent dropbox links to everyone) for $100 total so $10/person. One note- the drive there is quite bumpy so if you get motion sickness be aware! You turn off the main road and think you are there but there is still a 30 minute drive on a very bumpy dirt road ahead of you!

A life experience!!. If you come to Mayan Riviera you cannot miss this fabulous expedition. It exceeds everyone expectations. Small groups. Great guides. Meditation underground is just amazing!! This is my favourite excursion in the whole peninsula :)
awesome caves. The whole experience was wonderful. Paulo was a fabulous guide. What a beautiful place to visit and the boys (age 6 and 7) loved it as well.

Intimate, Adventurous. So glad we did this. It far exceeded my expectations. The tour guide was very intelligent and made the whole experience fun and exciting. They only take you in groups of 10 or less (ours had 6!) and you're down in the cenote learning all about it for hours. It was truly magical. It's also environmentally conscious and they even test the ph levels in the cenote water from time to time to see if there is any destruction going on. This was a beautiful experience and I'm so happy this tour exists

One of my favorite attractions here!. I have done a lot of activities in this area of Mexico, and anything that involves underground swimming is my favorite! It's a beautiful site, the guides are very dedicated and knowledgeable, there are several different cave paths, so you can go back many times and see different areas, and the food is actually really good. We had a blast! I would say using the provided walking stick (optional) was actually very helpful. I usually don't like to carry things around with me needlessly, but I was thankful I took one. The wetsuit was actually not necessary, and I wished I had passed on that one. I actually got hot in it and would have enjoyed the refreshing water more without it.

Outstanding and Authentic. My husband and I took the Rio Secreto Shore Excursion while on the Carnival Conquest. You will be travelling by bus in a foreign country, so keep in mind that road rules are almost non existent, but as long as you have an adventurous spirit you will be fine. Our bus driver was obviously experienced and I wasn't nervous at all. The second part of the bus ride is just as others have mentioned, it is very bumpy but we found it only enhanced the adventure. Once we got to Rio Secreto we were met by our guide Gonzo and he was FANTASTIC. He was very knowledgeable, funny and obviously passionate about his job and his heritage. He explained all of the rules first, and no, you are not allowed to take cameras, but despite what others have said, it is not so that you will be forced to buy the photos they take throughout the tour, it is because you will need both hands at all time to maneuver through the caves. The caves and river were mind blowing. Gonzo took the time to explain the formations, how each of them came to be and even gave us approximate ages for some of them. He explained the water and why it is so clear and even how the water travels to the caves, and then from the caves to the ocean. Gonzo also spoke with us about the ancient Mayan's and their attachment to the cave systems. The tour itself is about an hour and a half, and you will spend about 60% of your time in water of varying depths. This tour requires some physical exertion and you need to be steady on your feet and not afraid of enclosed spaces. Lunch afterwards is fantastic. It is authentic, flavorful and they let you go back for seconds - and you will because it is just that good. Beware of the 'green sauce' it is hotter than anything you can imagine. Even though Gonzo warned us, a couple in our group tried it and were unable to communicate for a good little while :o). This was by far the most outstanding part of our entire vacation and I highly recommend it to anyone who wants a big adventure and something they will remember for the rest of their lives. Thank you Rio Secreto and a huge thank you go Gonzo! Russ and Taryn.

Great excursion . We had a very enjoyable experience. Would have liked to be able to bring our camera or at least have a better priced photo purchase option. No complaints otherwise. Tour guide Mauricio was fantastic! Highly recommend requesting him. Extremely knowledgable and very friendly. Memorized the names of the six of us in the group within minutes and talked to us as friends, not tourists throughout the entire experience. Facilities were very nice and we really appreciated the solid attempt to keep the cavern as pristine as possible throughout the tours. I am a caver of 20 years and have been in countless caves, but was still impressed with Rio Secreto. A little pricey but would still recommend the experience.

Rio Secreto - What an adventure :). It was our first time in Cancun and we wanted to do something special to discover the nature of this beautiful area. When we arrived we were told that all other tour members cancelled and therefore we had the pleasure to receive a private tour. Our tour guide was Nico, a very nice and very knowledgeable guy, who made our tour so special and personal. After receiving a wet suite and helmets, we walked a little bit through the jungle before arriving at the impressive entrance of the caves. Every step was followed by a personal photographer. Inside of the caves there was a lot to discover. We enjoyed the beautiful views of the cave, the floating in the clear water and all the interesting details about the flora and fauna of the caves. Nico gave us a very detailed explanation of everything and answered all our questions. After our one and a half hour tour we walked back to the starting point, where a delicious local lunch was waiting for us. Of course we bought all the nice pictures as a souvenir and if we come back to Cancun, this tour would be definitely something we would love to do again, since there are five different caves to discover.

Rio Secreto is amazing!. If you are in the area take this excursion you won't be disappointed. The staff are wonderful and the caves are amazing. Beautiful setting in the jungle with clean restrooms and lunch is included as well as wetsuits and water shoes. It's a half day tour so you'll still have time for the beach.

Amazing. Luis was our guide very knowledgeable. The caves were so incredible. We loved every minute of the tour. The photos at the end were pricey but you have to buy them. $70 for all $25 for 1. I know they take a lot and put them together quickly. We were on a cruise and it was an old day tour. I wish we had a little time near the port but we didn't. Book this tour you will love it.
Awesome. This was an amazing adventure! We learned a lot about the Mayan culture, our guide was very knowledgeable and interesting. This was a hands on excursion, we loved it !! It's a must see

This is a must!. Our guide, Luis, made this so incredibly fun, entertaining and educational. He had such a sense of humor as well. This is such an incredible piece of nature that I will recommend anyone to see this. The food for our lunch was very good as well. Yes, it does stink that we couldn't wear mosquito spray which they love me, but I do understand not wearing anything before contaminating the water. I suggest putting some on when you finish and change before lunch. My husband and I went in the the expensive photo package and then just cut the cost in half. It was roughly $98USD. Once you get in the entrance, the drive to the cave and back is rough, but to be expected on a non-paved road. Overall, this was such a memorable experience and I am so glad we did it. Thanks to Luis, again, for making this experience the best!

Don't miss this excursion!. Amazing does not describe the beauty of this place! We were looking to explore the underground caves in Cozumel but could not find one that was easy to reach from our cruise ship and that fit in the time frame that we had before having to re-board the ship. Super friendly and knowledgeable staff, our tour guide Niko was the best! Ask for him, he is informative, funny, and really took the time to explain the history of the cavern. In addition, he was unhurried and wanted to be sure every guest was comfortable and at ease with traveling the cave. Lunch served after the tour was really nice, very authentic and tasty. The pictures they took though were not very good and way overpriced so I skipped that. But, overall a tremendous experience that should not be missed!

Amazing adventure with Carlos the best tour guide ever!!. Took my husband here for our anniversary and it was the best gift I have ever given him. The photos don't do it justice. It has to be seen in person. We almost skipped it to scuba dive and I am so glad we didn't. It was a once in a lifetime experience.
