An awe inspiring experience. Rio Secreto is a magical underground world where mother nature has created the most exquisite sculptures of limestone. The bumpy ride to the caves is a fun journey through natural jungle. They take care to preserve the site by not paving the road so the water purity is not contaminated. They also ask you not to wear sunscreen and you will have to shower before going into the cave. Our guide Paulo was very knowledgeable and his reverence and respect for this sacred place was appreciated. He made the journey special because he was just as taken with the place as we were even though he sees it everyday twice a day. I felt like a time traveller as we explored the wonderous sites that have taken thousands and thousands of years to create. What we saw is unchanged from what the Mayan people saw thousands of years ago as it takes several thousand years just to build an inch of stalactites.It was great to have the photographer along to take pictures as they don't allow cameras in the caves. Our 21 and 25 boys were not keen on going but felt they had a real adventure and were stoked that they went.It is a good value and an unforgetable journey.
Rio Secreto. The caves was something you just have to experience ! Ones in a lifetime thing, you won't regret if you go on this adventure.

A rare privilege to experience!. 1) Put on the wet suit. 2) Put on your life jacket. 3) Put on the helmet with headlamp. 4) Climb down the steps into one of the greatest experiences you will ever have 60 feet below the surface of the earth! Our small group was led and taught by Alfredo, a true lover of his job. His respect and knowledge of what we were experiencing was something that will stay with me for a very long time. Thank you, Alfredo for sharing with us. The van ride back to the site was something similar to a roller coaster ride. Word of advice, better buckle your seat belt.Please take the time during your vacation to visit Rio Secreto to share this wonder. Lunch is included in your visit and they take photos for purchase.

Another remarkable journey underground!. We had always wanted to visit this place and finally got to. What an amazing adventure! Our tour guide was Benito and he was great. I absolutely love the caves/caverns, stallactites/stallagmites. It is really an awesome adventure. How this can be so beautiful and all underground is beyond ones imagination. The ride back to the cave is a roller coaster so if you get queasy don't sit in the back of the van. It is only a half day adventure so you still have beach time left after leaving here. The food was good and the Anise liquor was something new for us to taste.
Great Day. This was a great choice for us, didn't take the whole day but it was great food and a bit of culture

Great experience, worth every penny. I visited Rio Secreto in December coming from Akumal, which was great because we took the collectivo over to save a few bucks. We were assigned Paulo as our tour guide and he was fantastic. He was very friendly and went out of his way to make sure everyone was comfortable and having fun. I would recommend this trip to all active teens and adults.
back to nature. Dressed in a wet suit and miner's helmet you are guided through a fairyland undergroung experience. This truly was a secret river.

A life-changing experience!. This was one of the BEST excursions we did in Mexicoo Our whole family enjoyed it -- including our 10 year old son and 13 year old daughter. ..Alfredo was our guide, and he was amazing -- knowledgeable and friendly and passionate about what he does. It was fascinating and exciting. Thanks so much Alfredo!!

One of a kind Tour. This tour is amazing. The staff was wonderful and very informative. The caves are beautiful, full of beautiful formations. The only lighting is from your helmets and from the tour guides flashlight and at one point we shut all the lights off and we are in complete darkness and it is really cool. I highly recommend this tour.

Must See!. This adventure is amazing! The guide teaches you so much about the cave system and is patient. The groups are small (there was a total of 9 in our tour) so you get personal service - which sounds strange for a cave, but let me explain. I'm not a very good swimmer - in fact - I am afraid of deep water. I have always been ok with a life jacket, but I had some issues in the deep water in the cave - probably the combination of a dark cave, strangers around me, and deep water :) The guide let me hold on to her life jacket and she actually pulled me through the water - above the call of duty! I have always been a hiker and have hiked in and out of many, many caves around the world, but this one was different. Many cave sites have lights inside - this one didn't. Other than the guides flashlight and the head lamps from the hard hats, it was all natural in there. To be a tourist attraction - they have done an EXCELLENT job of keeping it natural. The cost of admission inlcudes everything you need and you get a free locker to keep your belongings in. You can't take your own pictures, but they take photos for you. They are expensive, but it is such an amazing place that you really need those photo memories. There are 3 packages. $99 gets you all your photos (and whoever you are traveling with) and some professional photos of the cave itself plus 2 tee shirts and a bottle of Mayan alcohol. $69 (the option I took) gets you the same photos as the $99 package - just not shirts or alcohol. $25 gets you ONE photo on a CD. As many cave systems as I have been in, I found myself getting a little panic stricken in this one - but I did hold it together. I think it was the fact it is so dark and you will climb into some tight places. They do have a staff member that will escort you back out while the group goes on if you need it and just knowing I could leave anytime I wanted to was enough to keep me going. This excursion is well worth the cost. You will not be disappointed. Even if you feel sometimes get those panic like feelings give this one a try anyway. It will be one of my most cherished memories. I just did this 2 days ago and I would love to do it again!
Cool. Great Experience--walk & wade through undergroud chambers full of natural formations. Great natural experience.

Walking, wading and swimming underground.. Our experienced guide Pablo has a passion for his work and this site. With the wet suit and life-vest it is not necessary to swim, just a few minutes of dog-paddle, as helmut and light have to stay dry. The limestone formations are viewed close up, different than other tours by boat or just plain walking.

Best Excursion. One of the best excursions we have ever done. Loved the underwater cave program they do and the staff are so friendly and helpful. They know a lot about the caves and are very passionate about keeping them clean and preserved. Fun experience and well worth the money. There is nothing like this in the states.
Fabulous underground caves. Alfredo was the best guide. Unique experience not to be missed. Expensive pictures. Plan on $69 US for DVD or $25 for one pic.

What an experience!. If you want to be awe struck Rio Secreto will do it :)! As my first caving experience I found it truly amazing. Great tour guide Alfredo was knowledgeable and explained the cave systems as well as the history very well. If you are afraid of the dark and tight places it may not be for you but it was definitely one of the highlights of my trip to the Yucatan.

the under world. The only thing missing was the torches to light your way.at first we thought it was one of those come and look at the cutsey hole in the groung but after taking the tour it is the best we ever been on. it is definitly not for people with mobility problems. The guide adariana was excellantand knows her subject. It is a tour that we would repeat, GREAT!
Mother Earth's True Gold Mine. Jaw-dropping, eye-soaring, mesmerizing sacred Mayan Secret 90mns river along a hidden cave with Earth's real beauty of true nature. 10mns south of Playa del Carmen.

Brilliant. It is a unique natural reserve. They have a 1.5 hour guided tour for 2 different caves. It is a unique experience of mayan underworld. The tour guide was brilliant and she was very informative. The experience of swimming in an underwater cave was amazing. Also the pitch dark experience in the cave was terrific. Truly wonderful experience. Must do it if you are not claustrophobic.

Beautiful. I was so glad I chose Rio Secreto for my tour excursion. I thought it would be a good choice and it was great!. It was such an adventure exploring the caves and swimming through the channels. There are some tricky steps, like some others have mentioned but they are all well pointed out for you by the guide. My husband loved this tour as well and the provided lunch was delicious. I love tortilla soup and tamales. It was a very authentic Mexican meal.Don't miss it :)

Hidden natural gem.... Absolutely beautiful underground world...crystal clear waters running through caves, stalagtites, natural crystal formations. Unlike anything I've ever seen. Definitely would recommend to everyone, but those who have mobility issues should carefully consider. There is some climbing and some tricky steps up and down into the water. Pablo was a great tour guide...very enthusiastic and knowledgeable...genuinely loves his job...a must see!

Best Cruise Excursion Ever. Rio Secreto ("Amazing Secret River" on Carnival Cruise Line) is an absolutely amazing experience. A description or even pictures really can't adequately portray the caves. They are absolutely pristine. The park has done an excellent job so far of keeping them in excellent condition while allowing people to tour through. Our guide, Rodrigo, was great and we did the route called Supreme.Everything else about the tour was great, as well. There is an adequate shower and changing area for before and after the tour. Guests are given lockers and each guest holds onto their own key during the tour. All of the equipment was in good, working order. Last but not least, the food they served after the tour was excellent and there was plenty of it for all.After experiencing this, Cozumel has jumped from the cruise port of call I sought to avoid to the one I like best. Even though this is one of the more expensive excursions, I would definitely do it again the next time I visit the Yucatan.

My experience. Francesca was our guide through this cave, and she was excellent! Her knowledge of cave formations was thorough; her interest in her tourist group was genuine. Her concern about the preservation of the cave was very heartening.

Marvelous, a MUST!. I went with my fiancé, we were expecting just anything but such marvelous experience; it squizes all your senses. Very romantic. The guide made the experience even better. You cannot lose the opportunity, a lifetime experience!

8th Wonder of the World. We are scuba divers and have seen some pretty amazing things.....but Rio Secreto is by far the most exciting, exhilarating, beautiful sites we've ever seen. Its a once in a life time MUST DO! I think it should be named the '8th Wonder of the World'.
All-tour-Native tours ROCK!. Very VERY knowledgeable and respectful guide Benito, Benoit etc.. (respect to nature, the locals and us - the lowly tourista) If you do ONE tour, do this one.

Great experience. This is a great tour, Not too short and not too long. Meal included is a really tasty traditional food. The caves are very cool and creepy all at the same time, haha. Our tour guide (sorry I forget his name) was fantastic! The site is so well kept. Definitely worth the $.

An experience of a lifetime!. Neither my sister nor I are great adventurers and we had just the best time of all in the caves. Our guide was Gonzo and he was the absolute Best! You just have to try and get him if you can - he was so knowledgeable and helpful - he made the experience so very special and wonderful. There was an older woman (my guess would be in her 80's) and a young girl of 5 years plus myself with some health issues and a bit unsteady on my feet - and we managed just fine ... well, my older sister gave me a hand several times when there were step-downs, etc. - thanks, Sis!This is just so worth it - go for it! This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to go spellunking and see the world from a whole different perspective - this is no "cenote experience" - it is so, soooo much more! This was to be about 1.5 hours underground and we were more like 2 hours - and the pictures they take while you are in the caves were absolutely breathtaking - such a wonderful keepsake. The meal at the end of the journey was pretty good too!Thanks so much, Gonzo for such a wonderful adventure - we will never forget it - or you!

Amazing Experience!!!!!!!!!!!!. wow! first, let me say that they are not lying when they say it is a life-changing experience!!! Now, i'm not going to lie. i'm a teenager, and i went to stay in the playa del carmen area with my family a few weeks ago. i was a bit scared about going into the dark caverns, and so was my much younger sister. take a walking stick, because although it is not slippery, it is dark. i was like" awww, i dont need one!" and ended up having to borrow one from one of the more sure-footed members in my group. we got the best tour guide, his name was Rodrigo!!! he made everything simple and fun and interesting, even for a really young kid like my sister. i would recommend this tour for anyone age 6+. the 1 1/2 hour tour just wasn't enough!!!!! be smart. go to rio secret. it is definitely worth your time and money. you are not allowed to bring your own camera, though, so i definitely reccomend you get the pictures, because it is AMAZING in the cenote. GO TO RIO SECRETO NOW!!!!!one thing though, the 7 kilometer ride to the cenote from the entrance is included with the cost of entrance, but be ready for a b u m p y r i d e!
Not to be missed. This is a once in a lifetime experience and should not be missed. Fantastically beautiful and a real privilege to be able to visit. Can't wait to visit again.

Thanks to our guide - Raul. We spent 9 days in the Cancun area with our daughter and husband. The Rio Secreto experience was a highlight !! Our guide, Raul, was just great. He is very well spoken and has the knowledge needed for this tour and much more. He's an animal lover and conservationist, too ! The whole tour, including lunch, was more than worthwhile.Dan & JackieNevada, USA

wow...this is what I call a true connection with nature. If you are looking for cenotes but are wary of all the "Disneyland" type places this will make you elated!Rio Secreto is a true preserve with scientists and guides trying to make sure you learn about the hundreds of kilometers of underground rivers that course under the Yucatan peninsula.Prepare yourself for a 2 hour journey in the belly of the earth....swim in potable underground river where, if you are lucky, you will spot a few very small catfish. You will learn a few bits and pieces from the Mayan cultures as well. They are not too happy to see women go down in their caves :)Our guide had a passion for geology and shared a ton of knowledge with us.One note: the water is at 23 degrees Celsius and though you are wearing a wetsuit you will find it cold if you, like me, you love your warmth :)

Thanks to my guide. I have been privilege to to visit this amazing underground river. Special thanks to my guide, Adriana. She was very knowlegeable, speak french perfectly and super caring on the protection of this beautiful site.

Absolutely Amazing!!! Once in a lifetime experience!!!. The excursion begins with a 20-30 min boat ride from Cozumel to Playa del Carmen which we really enjoyed. There we met our tour guide who split us in 2 groups: Spanish and English speakers. This was really convenient. After giving us all the details of the tour and signing the disclaimers forms, we had a 40 min ride approximately to the reserve. The trip was a little bit long and the road is rocky (it cannot be paved) but it was worth it. When we arrived to the natural reserve we were assigned a Guide, Rodrigo, who was absolutely awesome. Groups were made of 8-10 people and they were very well organized. Do not wear any suntan lotions, creams, etc. since you will have to shower before going down to preserve the environment. After this, we were given all the equipment and the journey began. The tour starts with a Mayan ceremony to receive the blessing, after a short walk through the jungle and then you are ready to go down to the caves. The views are absolutely amazing. Being in contact with almost virgin caves and the peaceful feeling in the dark is something you can't miss. Our guide Rodrigo was very friendly and ready to answer all of our doubts and questions. Depending on your age and training level you may want to take the stick offered at the begging considering that sometimes the road is uneven and little rocky. There isn't much swimming to do in case you wonder, and if you are not very experienced in that department the guide or any member of the group will be willing to help you. After the excursion you are offered a Mexican snack which was average, but at least it was something. Anyway, it is one best the excursions I have ever made. I would definitely recommend this tour and do it again! We had a blast!!! In one word this excursion is AMAZING!! P.S.: As in all the excursions they will offer to take pictures because it is not allowed to take your camera down, they can be a little expensive but they are worth the money. Incredible memories!

Amazing Caves. My husband and I, daughter and her husband went to Rio Secreto and We had the most wonderful views of underground caves and river. I do not swim very well but our Guide Victor help me swim through the caves by letting me hold his arm. He was fantastic. Thank you Victor. Now to the formations of the stalagtites and the stalagmites , they were breath taking and Victor explained how they are formed by calcium and water. If you ever want to enjoy the wonders of nature go to Rio Secreto at Playa del Carmen, Mexico.I am 74 years old and it was a trip of a lifetime for me.

Like an archaelogical expedition. For better or for worse, I think the theme of Rio Secreto as a cenote is "unspoiled".On the one hand, the caves are stunning, especially the sense you get that you could wander off from the group and find all kinds of undiscovered secrets. There are essentially no lights other than the ones you have on your helmet, and only a thin string to suggest a recommended path.On the other hand, the unspoiled element makes everything else feel fairly rustic. To get from the sign-in office to the staging area, you have to ride about 10 minutes in a VERY bumpy road in a van packed with 10 other tourists. Our driver got lost, TWICE. Upon arrival at the staging area, you're given wet shoes & suit. Notably, they are wet, as in someone just wore them and they were washed but not dried. You're required to shower in the outdoor shower area that uses unheated water. When you get finish the trek, you're treated to a meal, although there is no real trace of meat and only a hint of cheese in the options that are offered to you.Finally, you're also offered photos of your trip, since they forbid you from bringing cameras into the caves. The packages are around USD $70.Overall, the caves are truly special. The guides in the caves are excellent. The business of getting there and coming back is quite barebones.
BEAUTIFUL. Very interesting tour. The guide was knowledgeable and took good care of all ages and abilities of the tour group. I highly recommend this tour.

Rio Secreto (but not for long). My sons and I recently booked a trip to Rio Secreto through Best Day Travel ( Thank You Yvonne). Magical, Mysterious, Alien...cliches'? Well, maybe but, every one of these adjectives falls slighly short of my experience there. My sons, 25 and 31 are still talking about our day there some two weeks later. Victor was our guide down under and both his knowledge and passion for this place was obvious. I have seen the photos on Rio Secretos web site. As nice as they are they still don't capture the experience. From suiting up to descending into the cave and underground river, stalagtites and stalagmites of every shape and color, "rooms" entering out of nowhere...and the final exit from the river though the "Throat"...ahhhhh...Magic, no other way to say it! The meal after was nice,but, the company of the people we went in with added to the experience.PS: Might I suggest a hammock after luch while you wait for your ride? They'll wake you up.

Don't miss Rio Secreto!. Could not have been more pleased with this adventure! My wife & I have been to other caves in the area and this was a first-rate experience! The charming JOVANA was a wonderful guide who had answers for any question and was full of interesting facts about the caves and area. The unexpected post-cave meal was delightful as well! We will definitely return to see the other cave areas, guaranteed! One highlight was the opportunity to eliminate all light and truly 'feel' the environment as it exists everyday without people; although it was very close to sensory-deprivation, there was an overwhelming extreme sense of feeling the living cave and being part of something much larger. Very intense, enjoyable tour; not scary in my opinion.This is not a party area, beach club or water attraction, it is a natural, ecological wonder and protected area under current study. This cave system demands and deserves respect; if you take the tour, PLEASE be mindful of the rules that are in place to protect this area's amazing beauty! Can't wait to visit again! Thank you, Rio Secreto!Our entire visit (including travel) was approx. 4.5 hours.

Wonderful time!. We had a great time at Rio Secreto. Our guide Victor was very knowledgeable, patient, and friendly. We had 2 members of our tour that did not know how to swim and he guided them cautiously. The food was mediocre...don't expect to get a feast. But if you like the nature type tours, this is a great choice.

Don't miss this unique adventure. My wife and I truly enjoyed the full experience of visiting these newly found caves. The small group size (8 max.) with time to really explore and experience the caves is unique. Be prepared to walk and swin through the rough and dark caves (not for everyone) with your guide providing some interesting commentary. Took us about 90 minutes to complete. We understand the water levels within the caves also fluctuate somewhat so everyone's experience will not be the same. The provided equipment was new and the whole setup was professionally run. The site is just outside of town so access is easy.You won't find anohter experience like this one unless you are prepared to invest the time and money to take on some 'hard core' cave exploration.

Incredible!. This tour was amazing. You go down into a cave and you are swimming through it. Our guide, Victor, was so knowledgeable and helpful. The group running this tour is doing a fantastic job preserving the property. The grounds are beautiful and the lunch was fantastic! No one tried to sell us anything all day, and even the ride to and from town was good. A must do if ever in the area!

Must See. Rio Secreto was at the top of our list for activities to do on vacation! It is absolutely a must see if you are in the area. The tour guides are friendly and helpful, and the overall experience is once in a lifetime. The only heads up I would give is to bring along about $70 for pictures because you can't bring your own camera in! Also smile when they take your pictures so you can have some good memories to bring home.

Awesome Day Trip!. Pretty amazing to go through caves that were 2 million years old. It was really outstanding and I did not feel claustrophobic at all. I'd highly recommend this trip, it's only about 20 minutes from the hotel and they will come and pick you up. Don't bother bringing your camera as they dont allow it inside the caves and you have to use their photographer.

Must Do This. We visited Rio Secreto and were very pleased with the unique experience. It was easy to access and reach via car or taxi. Though we were a bit late for our scheduled tour, the operators quickly booked us with a bi-lingual tour and Joan, our guide, took care to translate virtually every word for our benefit. The mayan blessing before entering the cenote made it an authentic experience. The cave must be seen to be believed. The geological features are unique and you come into close contact with formations that transform the landscape from chamber the chamber.The extensive tour on foot really was comfortable due to the fine gear provided. The post tour lunch was delicious and substantial. We would recommend this adventure to anyone wishing to take a memorable journey into the caves of the Yucatan!

Breathtaking!. This is a must see while in Cacun!  They tried to sell us tour packets at resort. My friend and I figured out how to get there on our own using IDO transportation for $45 pesos to playa del Carmen and $10 pesos for a 15 minute ride to Rio Secreto. We paid $69 dollars for the price of admission which included a delicious buffet at the end. You are provided with a locker for your belongings. In addition we were provided 'with all equipment ( wetsuits, water booties, helmet with flashlight and towels. All you need is your bathing suit.  You are not allowed to take any personal belongins (this inclueds a camera) inside the caves/river. However, you have a profesional photogopher within your group taking pictures capturing breathtaking  moments of the group and the amazing lima rock formations. The price of photos are reasonable and the money helps the non-profit preserve this natural ecological treasure. Our guide Paulo was very engaging, knowledgeable  and his passion for the Rio Secreto was contagious. My friend and I named his spider friend after me, Brenda.

Buy the picture package. This was an amazing experience. It looks like a total tourist trap, but the experience was unlike anything we had ever seen. Beautiful stalagtites and stalagmites, emerald pools, huge caverns - it's not to be missed. And the professional photographer that accompanies you takes incredible photos. Don't miss it.

An amazing and natural place.. i was there last week and let me tell you that it was one of the best experiences in my life, the caves, all the history that is involved, you can not miss it! the guides are really professional and the food is really good! This is a must on the riviera maya!

One of the world's great wonders. Walking through the underground waterways with a super guide and taking in the most amazing wonders of nature is a trip you won't soon forget. Be sure to accept the walking stick that is offered. You will really appreciate it as you climb up and down through the caves.

Definitively a to do for families. I travelled with my dad (72) and my son (12) and got as recommendation to visit rio secreto. Entrance is quite expensive around USD 170 for 2 aduts and 1 child but the place is worth it. Since there are always guides around in the cenote, elderly and younger people get help when needed. This is definately no adventure park like the ones close by, but a very nicely organised tour of 800 m under ground through caves, rivers and small lakes.Pictures at the end are too high priced, but see if you can arrange for a deal for the whole group.
One of a kind experience. This cave is a must see for adventurist travel. You walk inside this cave, some areas are dry and some areas you ate swimming. The experience is amazing.

Breathtaking. I visited Rio Secreto a couple of days ago. The staff was very friendly and the native foodcoupons they served was delicious. The experience they provide walking and swimming through ancient pdistine caves is one of the most fantastic things i have ever done! The guide was very helpful and knowledgeable also. Definitely a must do.

Long and winding road to Rio Secreto!. Cave trek interesting but what should have taken a few hours from pick up at hotel to return, took 7 hours. Once you arrive at attraction staging area near PDC, there is another over 30 minute unpaved bumpy van ride to actual cave site. You wait again then gear up and hike to cave. The Mayan ceremony interesting and cave guide very knowledgable. Would not recommend this trip for small children or elderly. Dark, narrow steep passage ways with constant reminder from guide not to touch cave structures made it very easy to slip and fall. Ask for the walking stick. The van overheated and broke down on the way back to hotel adding to a very long "day trip"!

Explore a Nature Preserve. So much to love about Rio Secreto. Our guide-Alfredo-was fantastic. He is so passionate about what he does and is so knowledgeable. We were lucky to have him! The cave/underground river was beautiful-a true wonder of the world and worth the visit. Like many of the other attractions, you can't bring in your own camera, but they do have a disk of photos available for purchase. A couple of things to note that I read from other reviewers:-Yes, the road is rough getting from the reception area to the "jungle." But you're going to the jungle, so what did you expect? Some drivers do a better job navigating the road than others, as we experienced first hand as we had a different driver take us back to reception.-You're in the jungle. Its a nature preserve. The facilities are reflective of that. The bath rooms and changing area was a lot like being at camp. The Equinox Athletic Club its not.-The food that we were served after our excursion was fine. Its not a Michelin five star experience, but for $69, don't think you get a meal at French Laundry for that.Also, if staying in Playa del Carmen, and you don't have a car, you don't need to purchase the transportation package from Rio Secreto. Your hotel can arrange a cab for you for $15. And in our case, the cab driver came back to pick us up after our excursion.I should also note that our drive out into the jungle was made worse, not by the bumpy, unpaved road, but because our driver was texting-yes texting-during the entire 7km drive out there. As our friends reminded me, its not illegal to text and drive in Mexico. Sure, but its not exactly a great impression to leave with the folks visiting your location. Oh, and he played completely inappropriate club music. So, fair warning if this guy is still working there.Despite the texting driver, I am happy that Rio Secreto made the short list of activities that we managed during our trip. Well worth it.

SO GOOD!!! THIS IS NOT A SECRET ANYMORE!. Great caves... better photos!!!
Luis from the Photo Shop was very helpful and informative! also the local photographer Balam!
gracias, guys for the great time!
we'll be back soon!!
(all inclusive excursion!!)

Fabulous Experience. In October I was privaliged to do a tour of Rio Secreto. We were well looked after and had a very experienced guide called Lia. She was extremely knowlegable and made our tour fun and informative. The caves were awsome, an experience I will never forget. I felt safe and we were well equiped with wet suits and life jackets. (all supplied by the tour)Lunch prepared by the Mayan community was delicious and I can recomend the tour to anyone, young or more mature (like myself). Don't miss it.

Incredible adventure. We've been to most of the attractions in the Playa area and this is by and far the best. Its unspoiled and a spectacular view of an underground cenote. It has a bit of wading and swimming, so you need to have good balance and some strength. However, the guide was very cautious and warned us of any steps or small drop-offs. The guide was very informative and had a good grasp of multiple languages. Would love to do it again.

Take this Tour. This cavern was only discovered 6 yrs ago and open to the public the last 4. The office and gathering spot is right off the main hwy but you will ride in a van for 20 min down a very dusty, extremely pot hole filled road to get back to the cave. Others have explained the procedures of showering & doning wetsuits etc. There is a "purification" ceremony done by a Myan priest with smoke & incense before entering the cave. This is taken very seriously and everyone paid rapt attention. Our guide spoke excellent english and had a great sense of humor. I think he made it enjoyable for everyone in the group. With it being so dark and wet there is no way you could take pictures on your own. We did not mind spending the $100 to buy their package with pictures on a CD, a bottle of potent liquor & 2 T-shirts as the money goes back to support Rio Secreto and we were happy to make this our donation. If you have a car rental be sure to checkout the advertising on the back of the paperwork folder. There is an ad for one free entry to Rio Secreto with the purchase of an entry. (buy one get one free) This will save you $69This cave is not for those with any balance or walking problems.

Amazing. Must do activity!. This was possibly one of the most amazing experiences of my life. It took me a while to convince my husband to go with me but he also agrees that it was probably the best excursion we did on our vacation. The only possible downside to the trip is the road to get to the caves. I get motion sickness easily and I was quite sick on the way to the caves. Knowing this for the trip back I took from herbal anti-motion sickness pills and it was a lot better. Really this was only a little hiccup and would not prevent me from going back.

Naturally Amazing. Rio Secreto is definitely one of the most unforgettable experiences we have had on this trip. Plan to spend almost half a day here. The actual time spent inside this underground cavern/cave is about 1hr 30 mins. All equipment is provided with your admission, and the tours are split into small groups. Our guide was Victor, he did a great job taking care of us and also spoke very good English. The tour begins with a 7 km van ride to the entrance of the cave, expect a bumpy ride as the roads are unpaved to preserve the natural condition of the site. The inside of the cave and underground rivers are gorgeous, it lets you witness the beauty of nature. The underwater rivers are so clear that you can see the cat fish swimming in it. The cave is very much alive in its natural form. After the tour, the buffet that they serve is also one of the best we've had during our time in Mexico.

Amazing.. Gorgeous nature, in the raw form without the tourist hype. Our tour guide was very good. High recommend this trip. Buy the CD of pictures when you are done. Yea, pricey, but the pictures are good quality and you get a lot of just nature shots of the cave.

Great wonders of the world. If you visit rio secreto is like steppeing back in time to witness something mysterious and truly spectacular, this stunning underground river with thousand of dramatic stalactites and stalagmites.

The Fantastic Wonder of Nature. Rio Secreto is one of these places that nature has produced over the millenia and is almost impossible to do justice to in a written (or verbal for that matter) description - it has to be seen and experienced! Time passes without your knowing it. The guide makes the one and a half hours an unforgettable trip. The caverns are full of stalagmites, amazing needle-like stalagtites and crystal clear water in which you are mostly up to your knees but also sometimes swimming. There is very little artificial lighting, the only light being from the little lamp on your and your companions helmets and this lends to the beauty of the caverns. Don't miss it if you are in the Riviera Maya area!! You can buy a CD with very professional photos of your experience.
Awesome!. So cool! Franchesca was informative and very good. Swam in the cave and took an hour and half tour. awesome time!

Loved it until I went to Xplor. My husband and I went on the tour to Rio Secreto during a 7-day stay at the Iberostar Paraiso Lindo (highly recommend this hotel). We booked our trip online through the Rio Secreto website in anticipation of saving a few dollars. Upon arrival at our hotel, we realized it was five dollars cheaper when booked through Olympus Tours. So perhaps you should call your hotel and find out the tour rates through the resort before making your decision on where to purchase tickets if this is the tour for you. We loved the tour until we went to Xplor. My advice is to pay the extra $25 a person and go to Xplor. If I had the chance to do it all over again, I would not choose to go to Rio Secreto unless the price was cut by 50%. Upon arrival at the tour we took a bumpy ride (about 20min) to the cave entrance. I'm easily car-sick so this didn't sit well with my stomach, but this part of the tour was easily forgotten when everything was said and done. We had to take a freezing cold shower once we stripped down to our swimsuit to help preserve the cave system and this was not enjoyable at all. Next we suited up in wet suits and helmets and water shoes and lifejackets. The wet suit was a nice addition they didn't provide in Xplor. Before the cave mouth we participated in a Mayan ceremony. A little Cotis animal (kind of like a dog but with a long furry tail and cute needle snout) followed us around scurrying from tree to tree to paw at the strings on our life jacket. He was a Rio Secreto pet named Chuck. He stole the show. During the tour of Rio Secreto we did have a wonderful guide so it was personalized with information and the cave was magnificent. We had the choice of taking along a walking stick or braving the tour without one and I was glad I chose to take the stick. The water was brisk and refreshing, clear to the bottom, and most of the tour was spent hobbling over the rocky bottom in the dim light afforded by our helmet lights. There were a few stretches where we could rest and float along the river but most of the tour was a struggle not to trip and fall against very sharp rock. Overall, the experience was amazing and if I hadn't gone to Xplor I would recommend it. We ate a quaint lunch outdoors on picnic tables making selections from a small buffett. Water and iced tea were free to drink but sodas and alcohol were cash items. My favorite part of the tour was the time we spent swaying in hammocks waiting for the bus to take us home. That said, for $25 dollars more, Xplor has an equally magnificent cave system full of photo stops where a motion sensor triggers a camera flash. The river is deep and winding and it is so relaxing to just float along and not worry about tripping and twisting an ankle. We also were able to enjoy the cave system in so many different ways. We could float the 45min swimming route or paddle a boat through the shallow river trails or take a ten-minute walk through the cave or even drive ATVs through the jungle with small portions of driving through waterfalls and inside the cave system. If you're adventurous you can even zip line from high stone towers, spiral down water slides, take a ride in a hammock chair through a high waterfall and splash into the water. Xplor has a Beverage Bar with fantastic smoothies and juice drinks and you can taste them all for free whenever you wish. The restaurant is huge and beautifully constructed with a giant buffet spread and you can visit it multiple times to snack or you can sit down for a long meal beneath the palapa roof. The price difference between Rio Secreto and Xplor was just $25 a person and I have to say the experience at Xplor was more than worth the extra money. For what Rio Secreto offers, I feel that they overcharge in comparison with what else is out there. My recommendation is to jump on the bus to Xplor and perhaps take a tour to the Coba ruins where you can still trek up the pyramid (Chichen Itza no longer allows this). Or if you are part of a travel group with younger kids, go to Xcaret. Whatever you do, you will have a blast, that's for sure.
Great staff... well worth it. Flo deserved some credit on this. Specially if you can find a good deal. Good cultural experience as well.

Rio Secreto RIPPED US OFF & have not returned our overcharged money....Poor administration. Please do not visit RIO SECRETO in Cancun MX. When they overcharge you, you probably won't see your money back. My parents took a much-awaited trip to CANCUN in August this yr. Before they started their excursion @ RIO SECRETO, they paid using an ATM card. They were overcharged (them not knowing it came out to be $925 US Dollars instead of 925.00 MX PESOS). Once they got back from their trip to the states, my dad and I were checking out his bank statement & noticed the overcharge. Yes that is a lot of money folks!!! Ninehundred twenty five dlls instead of 925 pesos (that rounds out to be around $75.00 including taxes that should have been charged for their excursion of 2 people). I am lit !!!! I have been in contact with RIO SECRETO ADMINISTRATION for 2 months now and still have not been refunded the money. They say their going to reimburse us, but nothing yet so far. I'm trying not to lose my patience and cuzz out these people who don't seem to care about the overcharge. I can't count how many times they have promised to refund the money, and nothing shows up on my paren'ts bank statement. It seems like every week if I don't contact them via email and even international expensive phone calls, they won't get a hold of me and let me know what's going on. They seem very nonchalant over the phone and say they understand the situation and that things are in progress, and nothing!!!! Please don't visit RIO SECRETO unless you don't care about your money. They are not very good at handling these situations (poor administration skills). You deserve to spend your money in worth while things... and clearly this is not worth the while!!!

Amazing!. What a truly amazing experience for a honeymoon! We took an excursion from our cruise ship to Rio Secreto and it was breathtaking. The tour guide was great, the cave was beautiful, and it was very convenient that they provided everything for you (all you need is a bathing suit). If we ever visit Mexico again, we have already said that we will do their 4 hour tour because an hour and a half just wasn't long enough!

Fantastic Experience!. This natural wonder is absolutely amazing. Better than any cavern experience I have ever been on. This was only recently discovered and is still in that unspoiled natural state. Enjoy it now! That being said for being open only a few years, they really have the experience down pat. Just wear a swimsuit. They will provide you with a wetsuit, a lifejacket, a helmet and a light on the helmet. They can accommodate almost all sizes. I weigh 255lbs and they had suit that fit my oversized body. The guides are great. We had Alfredo and he was amazing! I actually hugged him and thanked him.This adventure is way better than what you can ever imagine. They say you get a snack afterward but it was a full buffet. Everything was better than expected. They do not allow cameras of any kind but a professional photographer will follow your group and you can buy a cd with your photos as well as other professional stock photos of the place and some of the fauna. This truly is something you must do. You will never forget it.

Rio Secreto. We went to Rio Secreto after reading the many positive reviews on Tripadvisor, and we are so pleased we did. The tour was very well organised, and all equipment (helmets, wetsuits, shoes, life jackets) was provided. The cave was stunning (an over-used, but apt, adjective!), particularly so after a few minutes of darkness. It was certainly not a cheap day out – especially after purchasing the photo CD (which I am sure you will too, as you are not allowed to take your own camera, waterproof or otherwise, into the cave) – but it was an amazing experience that I highly recommend.

Very glad we went. This experience should be on your "List". Let me start out by saying that this trip and experience is not for everybody. The road into the caves and the walking once in the caves takes out anyone who can't handle uneven surfaces or can't handle rough terrain. Pre-Madonna everything has to be perfect people should pass.. Now out of the other side of my mouth I'll tell you that I've been to too many US National Parks to count (Mammoth Cave, Grand Canyon, YellowStone, Yosemite, Glacier, Everglades, Big Bend, Mt. Rushmore, Volcano, Acadia), been to the base of Kilamanjaro/Noromongoo Crater, Niagara Falls, etc and I can say this experience ranked right up there with any those. Serious.Tour cost $129 US pp with transportation. Our bus picked us up at 8:30 at the resort in Cancun and after picking up others the driver took us to the check in area. There are food and drinks available for purchase and a nice waiting area. Beware of bugs and bees. At the check in area you are divided into Spanish or English groups of 8 to 10 in a group and loaded onto vans. The roughest ride you have had in a van will take 15 minutes and 7km to get you to the jungle/cave check in. Once there you'll take a COLD shower to wash soaps and perfumes off you then you get a locker for your belongings. You are issued a wet suit, shoes, and a helmet. There are no walking sticks provided. You walk back a trail for 5-10 minutes then get a Mayan blessing then head down into the cave. The water is cold when you first step in but is tolerable with the suit. There are different sections of the caves that guides go in to try and space people away from each other. We went on the "Joy" section and it was great. You are underground for around 1.5 hours. There were at least 2 sections where I couldn't touch and had to float or swim and I am 6'4". No cameras are allowed so they send a photographer with each group but get ready for some SERIOUS sticker shock on the price of the pics.... Once done with the tour you take off your equipment, you get a drink and the picture packages are presented then a buffet style lunch is served. Great food including; soup, salads, tomalles, sauces, punch and water. After lunch you wait for the pics if you took them to be done then head to your bus. Tour bus picked us back up at 2:30 and headed back to Cancun.I like to pro and con when I rate and then give tips so here goes:ProsExperience is really one of a kind (place would be a National Park in US)Pretty organized operation from check in to getting on the bus to leave went smoothNice buses and facilities for the location (caves are in the jungle)Good food for lunch (authentic Mexican)Guides are excellent (Our guide Ava was from Spain)ConsBus rides in and out are CRAZY bumpy and very very rough.Walking in the cave can be tough, older lady in our group fell down pretty hard.Pictures are way overpriced when compared to price of admission (Had 3 packages 1) One picture was $25. 2) All pics on CD was $69. 3) All pics on CD, bottle of liqueur and t-shirt for $99.Groups are small but if you have any older or not sure footed people in the group that monopolize the guides time it is hard to hear.The groups are close together so if you have slow people in your group you'll miss out on quiet time in the cave,etc.Beer and soda is not included with lunch so take so extra cash.TipsSit near the front of the bus where you can see its like a bumpy roller coaster at times.Stay toward the front of the group when in the cave so you can hear and see everything that is pointed out.Take bug spray as waiting area is in the jungle and you'll need it.Again this trip isn't for everyone but we saw 4 year olds being taken down so if you can physically handle it... You won't be sorry. Have fun.

Phenomenal. I took this tour through Carnival Cruise Lines and it was well worth it. I don't usually book throught the cruise lines, but this is a must since you may get back to the ship late. In fact, we were back within 15 minutes of the last boarding. You take a ferry to Playa del Carmen and a bus ride to the location from there. The ride is about an hour, with the last 20 minutes being very bumpy. Once you arrive you're given a locker and asked to shower in order to remove some of the body oils. You're then given a wet suit, life vest, water shoes and helmet with a lite. Our guide was Alfredo, who was extremely passionate about the caves and their history. Once you start your amazing journey a photographer will be taking pics - of course to sell at the end...tho absolutely no pressure. The journey is remarkable, truly beautiful. The passage through the caves is sometimes challenging if you're not in average shape and for anyone with short legs since there's nothing to hold onto when climbing the higher or slippery steps. The water was wonderful and at times we couldn't touch the bottom. Afterwards we were offered a good buffet lunch. Every aspect of this tour was great and shouldn't be missed.

A beauty of nature you won't forget!. This was one of the most amazing experiences we have encountered. The caves were absolutely beautiful and gives you a renewed appreciation of the natural world. Our guide Paulo from Brazil, was amazing in his knowledge and perspective of the wonders of the cave and a beutiful site to look at as well. I have done many tours of sites around the worls, and this one ranks right up there in my top 2. I highly recommend it! It is an easy cab ride from playa car for 150-170 pesos and the admission was $69 usd. Sounds a little pricey but well worth it and included lunch as well!

Secret River Adventure. Our guide (Gonzo) was the best, excellent knowledge, which he enjoyed sharing. The caves were a surprise with the stalagmites and stalactites. The river that ran through them a refreshing 72 degrees compared to the 86 outside. The 1 1/2 hour tour was plenty with all the walking, climbing, wading and swimming.

Just amazing. We took this trip from our cruise and at first we did not know what to expect, but it was really worth it.... The cave formations are just surreal, the guides are very friendly, informative and fun. Dont bring your camera, they will not allow them into the cave. All the equipment you will need will be handed to you even shoes. Before going into the caves, a mayan priest will make a purification ritual prior entering their underworld. Food was good also, as it was an authentic mexican meal. I have read several complaintns about the ride, yes it is bumpy, still you have to consider the fact that we are going THROUGH A JUNGLE, and it was actually fun. WIll do it again.

Amazing river.......but. Everything about the river was really amazing but that was the only good part of the excursion. We had to take a ferry, or better known as the SS Puke, from Cozumel to Playa del Carmen. They handed out barf bags as we got onto the boat. The boat held about 200 passengers and about half of them were sick during the 40 minute boat ride. Once we got off the boat, it didn't get any better. We then loaded up into vans and took about a 30 minute ride to the cave. This was almost as rough of a ride as the boat. Horrible! When we finally got to the actual river it was truly amazing. They broke us up into small groups which was helpful. They also provided all the equipment that you needed. The best part by far was when the guides had everyone turn off their lights and be quiet. Once we finished, they offered us lunch but the food was not good at all. It seemed as though it had been sitting all day. The fresh fruit was good. The pictures were also very expensive. They offered one picture for $25 and they put it on a disk for you. They don't have a gift shop which was a disappointment. Overall, the river was the only amazing part. The transportation, lunch, pictures and lack of a gift shop put a HUGE damper on the whole experience.

AMAZING. This was our third trip to Mexico and our third trip to Rio Secreto. This is an absolutely spectacular excursion. My husband and I had already been twice so we took our two daughters this time and they loved it. My 11 year old said "this was the most awesome thing I have done in my whole life" Worth the trip!

Very interesting and beautiful. This cave was only discovered in 2006, and only opened to the public in 2008. The guide we had, Jean, was very knowledgeable. The caves were beautiful, maginificent... Two downsides. The first one, the road from the main road to the caves is very long and bumpy. It would be a nice added bonus to be able to ride ATVs in to the main area. Even with an added cost, I would've preferred that... If you get car sick, good luck!!The other downside, the facilities to change your clothes, the bathrooms, the showers, was very dirty and not well kept at all. When we were told that the area was only opened to the public in 2008, we were surprised to see the rundown area facilities. I still recommend going, simply for the caves, that are completely breathtaking!! As for pictures for a souvenir, they are crazy expensive, and since you cannot bring your own camera, bring some money. We paid 69$ for a cd with pictures of us. It was about 20$ for 1 picture. They really get you there!!They provide a good lunch with water to drink. However, you have to pay for soft drinks and juice.

Should be included in one of the wonders of the world. One of those experiences in life you will remember forever. We are a family of four (children aged 9 and 11) and did this excusion from the Disney fantasy port adventures. Because of bad weather we had the option to cancel however we decided to proceed. Fortunately the tour is much better in the wet and we are so glad we did. We have seen many of the worlds natural wonders and heritage listed places and this is just so unique and special it deserves to be up there. The photos are exactly how it is. The kids loved it to.
Excellent. Wonderful except my light wasn't working. Our guide was knowledgable and the place is Eco friendly. The road in was rather bumpy

Amazing experience!. We were debating about whether to go to Rio Secreto or XCarat. When we asked several local people, they all agreed Rio Secreto was the place to go and they were right. This cave was only discovered in 2006 and opened to the public in 2008. Everything was done extremely well. Our transportation to and from the resort was on time and went smoothly. The above ground property was very well maintained and the people were extremely professional and well versed in English. You will meet at a gathering area prior to boarding another van for an EXTREMELY rough and bumpy ride (about 15-20 minutes) back to the cave area. If you get car sick, sit in the front of the van. They had a locker area to store your things but you don't need to bring anything but your bathing suit and if you have them, water shoes. Even towels are provided at the end of the tour. If you would rather change into your suit or bring a change of clothes for afterward, clean bathrooms and changing areas are available. First you will shower to remove any oils, sunscreen and dirt (this protects the delicate balance of the cave) and then you are suited in not-so-well-fitting wetsuits (it doesn't matter if they don't fit well...everyone looks the same), water shoes if you didn't bring them, life jackets, and hard hats with lights. Also provided are walking sticks. I had read on TripAdvisor that the walking sticks were recommended and told the rest of the group. All the women took them and the men didn't. Once we were underground, the men were second guessing this decision. The ground in the cave is uneven and slippery. Take a walking stick! Once your group is ready, you walk through the jungle and prepare to descend into the cenote. A Mayan elder did a blessing ceremony and our guide explained all that he said and why it was done. Very touching. Then the real magic begins as you decend into the cave and the beauty that lies underground. There are three paths through this nine mile cave so you won't run into another group. You wade in and out of 75 degree water with some areas up to waist deep. Toward the end of our tour, we floated through 9 feet of water. Being 60 feet underground was an amazing experience and the colors of the water and cave formations were just beautiful. Our guide, Lia, was very informative and spent a lot of time explaining what we were seeing. Expect to spend approximately 1 1/2 hours underground enjoying this magnificent wonder. Throughout the tour, a photographer took pictures of us individually, with our group and also as a couple. You are not allowed to take camera into the cave and it is for good reason. This allows you to enjoy the experience the cave fully and not worry about getting a good shot. We could never have gotten the photos they were able to capture. After the tour, you are able to purchase pictures. If you only want one photograph, it is $25. If you want all your photographs (we had 70-80 photos) on a CD, it is $69. You can also add your photos on a flash drive for $10 more. A nice buffet lunch was served prior to boarding the vans back to the resort. Since our resort was the furthest out, this was a full afternoon excursion. We left at 11:30 and didn't return until 5:30 that evening. It was well worth it and we never felt rushed at any point. I would highly recommend this amazing experience. It is something you could do with children as well however I would recommend it for ages 10 and up.

Nice place. My husband and I visited Cancun to celebrate our 1st wedding anniversary, and Rio Secreto is one of the good places we visited in the entire trip.The recently discovered underground caves are magnificent, and the tours that they have underground are very informative and fun, you actually get to swim in the underground water, so pack up some swim suits for this trip.

Awesome Experience but rough ride getting there!. Rio Secreto is absolutely beautiful. My wife and I visited at a 1pm time slot. It is just south of Playa. Were were picked up by the Rio Secreto van at our hotel. Unfortunately they were about 20 minutes late so we were stuck in the lobby for about a half hour since you are told to be there 10 minutes before the van arrives, not really a huge deal breaker. Our driver checked us in and we were given wrist bands. Then we had to fill out a short form showing that we were physically able to take the tour. It is not for anyone that is claustrophobic or not nimble on their feet. After being assigned our tour guide we hopped in a van into the forest. This was the worst part of the experience. It is about a 20 minutes bumpy van ride to the final destination. I don't get car sick but there were a few feeling nauseous. The driver tried to avoid bumps but it was inevitable to hit them and the road seemed to go on forever since we had to go slow. Once we got there we were elated to be out of the van. We were met by our guides, ours was Pablo. He is on the website showing Hugh Hefner's old girlfriend the cave. Pablo was great. You could tell he loved his job and cared about the natural wonder. He had a great sense of humor. He explained in great detail about the history of the cave and the formations. The tour is a little over half walking in and out of water and then some swimming. The water was chilly, around 75 degrees. There are three paths and the guide will pick which one you take through the cave. The beauty of the cave erased all thoughts of the van ride. A photographer walks with the group of 10 and takes pictures since cameras aren't allowed. It is for safety reasons since the terrain is pretty rough and you would hold up the group taking pictures, let alone ruin your camera unless you had a waterproof one. Overall the tour was great, the only downside was the extremely bumpy van ride to and from the cave. If you don't get car sick or mind a rough 40 total minutes in a van, this is a must trip!!!!!! I highly recommend it! The picture prices are 1 for $25, all for $69, or all the pictures with two shirts and a bottle of liquor for $99. We went with the $99 package.
Mindblowing!. Worth every penny! We may never have another opportunity like this in our lifetimes to expolore caves with stalagmites and stalagtites!
So beautiful. I went close to a year ago, and cant wait to go again, i never imagined it would be so easy to visit such a magical place

Rio Secreto Riviera Maya. This experience was amazing!! For us it was real adventure exploring the inner caves underground.The scenery was so beautiful!! Our guide explained how these Xenotes were formed and he was very helpful during the tour. After the tour we were given their local drink to sample and a picnic lunch.Definately recommend this experience.

This is the real Deal!!. This is an awesome excursion. Highly recommend it. Must have Alfredo as your Guide. The passion and knowledge that pours out of him is infectious. If you do nothing else but stay at your resort and do this Rio Secreto, you will have a remarkable experience in Riviera Maya.
Thank you to Alfredo and the rest of the group.

Trip of a lifetime.. If you do nothing else while in Playa del Carmen it should be this.Not only is it mind expanding it is incredibly relaxing. One leaves not only in touch with nature and with ones self you will also have feel more balanced,.

A must when you visit PDC. Very impressive trip, beyond our expectation. I was thinking whether I should go to Xcaret or Rio Secreto. After reading reviews of both, I chose Rio Secreto because I brought my mom (60 years old) there and I don't think she can be out in the sun from 8a.m. to 9 p.m. It turned out that I made the right choice.. the experience there was awesome, breathtaking, amazing,etc. words aren't enough to explain. My mom loves this place the most during our visit in Mexico. I recommend you to take the tour. It's something to do once in a lifetime. The experience in the cave made all other imperfection minor and negligible. We ended up buying the photos too. The only complaint is that the size/pixel of the photos should be bigger, given the price we paid. However, most of the photos are less than 500KB.. some are even less than 200 KB.

Nature at her best..... When we arrived at Rio Secreto we did not really know what to expect. Our daugher got to pick our excursion and she picked Rio Secreto and it turned out we were all glad that she did. The staff is great, the lunch was great, but the real attraction is the cave. It is beyond words. The cave is an underground world that few have ever had the chance to see. Our tour guide Rodrego, was the best. He was very well informed, knows the cave and has a great sense of humor. The tour itself is 1 1/2 hours of walking through water exploring the natural beauty of a huge cave. It is a physcial walk but well worth the effort. When all the lights were turned off it is dark,dark,dark. I didn't know what dark was until it went dark in the cave. If you get the chance don't pass it up. It is a one of a kind adventure.

Great Adventure Underground. I toured the Rio Secreto as part of a highly recommended cruise excursion. I was absolutely amazed to be part of a newly discovered cavern system that has been hidden from human eyes for centuries, that is until 2006. Our tour guide was very enthusiastic in bringing us through the caverns sometimes wading, sometimes, swimming, sometimes crouching and squeezing through. The lunch served afterward was a delicious buffet of local foods. While cameras are not allowed, there are several photographs taken during the tour that are made available for purchase after the tour is complete.
Incredible experience!. Amazing and other-worldly!The water is chilly so make sure to get a wet suit that fits!Talk to your guides - they know an awful lot about it!
Relaxing Dreams. Fabulous, magnificent!!!! no words to described.no one allow to carrier own camera. at the end have to buy pics from them, very expensive

Beautiful experience. Other reviewers will explain the basics of this attraction. I particularly enjoyed the Mayan history of the cave and how the Mayans intertwined the cave and its life-giving water with their beliefs about life. The short Mayan ceremony before entering the cave was interesting. As we were descending into the cave, I looked over at the Mayan man who had done our ceremony and he was smiling and he gave me a little wave. For me, it was a special moment between two people from completely different cultures. I particularly enjoyed the colors of the cave....the translucent greens and aqua colors of the water were so tranquil. When the river gets deep, you float through the cave. This for me was the special part of Rio Secreto, the water.

Kantun Chi Cenotes. Instead of the Secret River, we went to Kantun Chi, Ecopark, just a few miles from other attractions. This Ecopark is so beautiful that tripadvisor shoukd add them to the list as attraction.

TRY IT - YOU WILL LOVE IT!!!!!. Magnificent! Enjoyable from start to finish. Everything is provided for the experience - wetsuits, water shoes, helmets with lights, walking sticks (really glad I took one), towels and lunch - all you need is a swim suit. The knowledgeable, considerate, helpful staff are not the least bit pushy - they don't need to be - taking your own camera into the cave would distract from the experience and result in very poor pictures. The pictures taken are incredible and you are given the option to purchase a CD before you leave or purchase online afterwards. We will absolutely go again - there are three different routes you can take in the cave so we can request a different route when we return. This is NOT your typical "what have I gotten myself into" Caribbean excursion - this is a top notch, professional experience!

Great caving adventure. This underground caving experience was amazing. Our guide Alfredo was knowledgable and funny and very patient. The ride to the entrance of the site from the main road was an adventure in itself, but the staff on location were friendly and professional. All equipment is included - some wetsuits were a bit frayed, but many were new and you don't actually need to wear one if you don't want to. The tour consisted mostly of walking and some swimming, and lasted approx. 1.5 hours - but I could have stayed in there for much longer! At the end of the tour, there is a nice buffet to enjoy before heading back to the hotel. Great experience, highly recommended!

Life experience. Is one of the most beautiful places I've been in, from the welcome to the cave, was an amazing experience. We arrived to Río Secreto, and we waited a little for a ride on a Van with other assistants, once we were drove 15-20 min aprox. through a beautiful raw road in the middle of the wild nature, with our guide Angel Guerra we were explained step by step what to do, always with great attitude :) and knowledge. They ask you to get a shower before going into the cave to avoid pollution from the 'outside' world into this marvelous 'almost virgin' place. Through all the tour, Angel was explaining to us with a mix of mayan culture, mysticism, science, etc... We were blessed by an elder Mayan Man with Inciense. They always make you feel great and welcomed into this natural, cultural... sanctuary. Once inside the cave, Angel was always careful with us, telling where and how to walk, always very patient where the most complicated areas, talking and explaining beautifully and answering to all our questions. The place has complicated areas where is tough to bring your own camera, and the idea is to preserve the cave and water as clean and uncontaminated from outside oils as possible.The photos taken by Río Secreto photographer are amazing and very professionally taken, they use special flashes and lights that are spread around as the place is 100% dark. The food was amazing, very fresh and light. Nothing to spicy, and traditional from Quintana Roo. Like Tamales of Chaya :) they were yumylicious. It was an amazing experience, they have 3 different routs and maybe they will be opening more. Try not to wear oils, creams on the hair or on the skin... besides sun screen. Anyway you'll have to wash yourself. Later you can put it again after you go out from the cave.I'd do the tour again no doubt, my sincere thanks and congratulations to Angel who made this beautiful experience into a lifetime memory.

Very enjoyable and informational tour!. Rio Secreto was an incredibly beautiful underground caving experience. The guide Jovana was very knowledgable and proud to share her "office" with us. They provided helmets with lights, wetsuits and booties. There is some walking in the caves, and there is swimming also. At the beginning of the tour Jovana asked if anyone had any injuries or back, knee or hip issues. My knee had been bothering me and they offered a walking stick which came in very handy. Jovana also had me follow her and she assisted me with some of the stair step type maneuvers. The cave was spectacular with many stalactites and stalagmites. Jovana explained many things about the cave. There are photo opportunities for the photographers to take pictures. I am personally glad that they did not allow outside cameras because it would have been very distracting to have many flashes going off in the caves. So yes, if you want photos, you must purchase them, however, you can make the call if you want to spend the money or not - we chose not to.We would highly recommend this activity - it took about 3 hours total. They did provide a nice buffet with various types of food after the tour. We considered it appetizers and then had a light dinner later.We would do it again and tell them we want to see the other cave.

Wonderful experience I will do this one again!. The Caves were beautiful and the water unlike anything you will ever see. I recommend everyone does this at least once in their life. Gonzo was a great guide thanks so much!

Something I've Never Done Before.... We went to Rio Secreto as an excursion on our cruise to Cozumel... what an amazing experience! Yes, the 'no camera' rule sucks but the photos they take are amazing (although pricey!) It's a once in a lifetime experience and the I highly recommend it. Be sure to be sure-footed and steady. Ask for Rodreco as your tour guide.. He's the best!
Amazing Secret River. Exactly that - Amazing! The only downfall is the prices of the pictures, so be ready to pay at least $25.00 for one picture. The food afterwards is great!

Really fun and informative experience!. I visited the Rio Secreto with my family in July and we had a great time! The caves are SO incredible with giant stalagtites and stalagmites everywhere, and it is a very unique tourist activity. Our guide was very knowledgeable and friendly. We enjoyed the simple lunch after our journey as well. I really loved that they had the photographer along to get some high-quality photos in the dark environment underground.A few negatives: for all of the picture taking they did, they did not take the time to make sure that the wet suits my sister and I had even fit us... and in turn, we ended up with oversized wetsuits and a bunch of very unflattering pictures. Make sure to ASK to get a wetsuit that fits well.Also, I accidentally left my bikini there in the changing room, and upon realizing this, had our hotel call them to try to get it back. There was no response. Even once I have gotten home to the USA, they have not returned an email yet trying to let me know if it was ever located. DO NOT FORGET YOUR STUFF! Otherwise it appears you will never get it back... Overall though, a really fantastic experience, and a must-do activity for the Playa del Carmen area! :)
Amazing day xox. Amazing day wish it was longer staff were great location was close to my hotel the meal was a nice touch after

brillant. a real good afternoon the was very good and walking and swimming in the caves was out of this world. Down side the price of the pictures is a rip off $25 for one or $69 for all the pics they took.

Very nice... not outstanding!. I went to Rio Secreto after Reading that they had won the best "green" tour operator in Mexico for 3 years in a row.. did the reservation (limited numbers of people can go in) on the phone and showed up 25 minutes prior to the beginning of the tour.. Hosts took over 15 minutes to get everything organized, only to know that we had to take a ride in a van for another 10-15minutes with sooo many bumps, into the middle of nowhere... got there, and were received by the tour guides who seemed sort of in a rush, asking you for this and that and rushing you... we got all the gear and we finally went inside. I agree with other reviewers that the guide in front of you is walking very fast, and since he tells you every 2 seconds t watch your step, it is very few what you see while you're walking. The idea is to admire nature at its best, but the guide will keep walking and only stop in certain areas... not quite what you're expecting when you're paying for a tour..you spend more time looking at where your next step will be rather than the amazing stalactites and stalagmites there are inside the cave... We encountered 2 other groups while doing our tour, and the guide explains there are other routes, that "you can do when you come back", (leaves you sort of ... ???) Some tips: take your own water shoes if you have them, much comfy that the ugly smelly ones they give out. Bring a waterproof battery torch if you have one..the ones adapted on the helmet cannot really light up with a ceiling 12ft above... you cannot bring any cameras inside, don't even bother... prices are ridiculously high for the pictures taken by the photographer... muchmore expensive than other better places like this in the area... food aftger the tour is very good!, however, then they rush you back to the main entrance... we left after 4 hours of arrving there!

Beautiful and Safe. This is one of the best caves I've ever visited. If you are afraid, don't be, the route is easy and pretty wide open. If you can manage to get a large group together then the tour will go farther. There are places along the tour that they stop to take photos of each group, there were 7 in our family and then a family of three, so there were only 2 pictures to take so it went fast and the guide was able to take us deeper into the cave. Also the grounds around the cave were very pretty and well maintained. The Lunch was spectacular and authentic. Rice, Beans, veggies, potatoes, Taquitos, and wonderful tropical tea. I also really appreciated the Mayan Cleansing Ceremony that they performed before entering the cave! This is a must see for education, adventure, and outright fun!

Cool place but a bit expensive. This a really unique environment as you have the opportunity to move through the cenote style caves and see stalactites and stelagmites growing from the ceiling and the floors. We loved the experience but were not able to bring our camera inside to take photos, however the company took plenty of photos and then opts to sell them to you at the end of the tour (for a ridiculously inflated price)... a pretty touristy but amazing place.

Rush rush rush. Had high hopes for this tour and it had potential. The equipment was ill-fitting, wet suit and shoes too big and caused a few issues. I don't know why we had to hurry so much when walking though the caves - footing was very uneven and we had to watch the patch carefully and constantly - thus not appreciating the walk at all. The shoes were too big (BRING YOUR OWN) and kept twisting and slipping which added a lot to the difficulty of negotiating the path at any speed. Both my daughter and I injured ourselves duing this tour. Some parts were EXQUISITE and really make up for the rest. The visit was interesting and lasted what, an hour? The food at the end was not exciting or even enticing. We spent $99US per person for this tour. Would I recommend it? Not sure. I enjoyed a Cenote tour last Fall and it was better. This is different but we felt it was very overpriced.

Great tour. Great Guide. Great Food.. We loved our day at Rio Secreto. The cave was beautiful and our guide, Rodrigo, was amazing. He was adorable, funny, and very knowledgeable about the cave and had a way of explaining it that made it not only very interesting but really easy to understand. We had our 11 year old son with us and Rodrigo was wonderful to him. So friendly. The food that we were served after the tour was the best food we had on our vacation. Nothing like a good meal and a few cold beers after a long, bouncy, jungle ride and cave tour. Yes...the drive to the cave location is super bouncy and long. You go into the middle of nowhere, but it was fun. I would suggest this tour for anyone who is not afraid of water and walking through the jungle in their swimsuit in front of everyone.

A must do in Playa Del Carmen!. One of the more pricier activities here, but for $69 USD you get a buffet meal and all the equipment provided. The cave was so calming, it's an escape from the world above, it's almost like being in one of those deprivation tanks except when you turn the lights on you see the beautful cave formations. Tour guide was very insightful. My only issue is the transportation from the entrance to the cave site was very bumpy and took approximately 15-20 minutes, so if you get car sick I would not suggest you do this activity. It's so bumpy they should make this an ATV route, the shuttle driver tries his best to avoid the bumps but its nearly impossible.
fantastic. Had a great time. Our guide Alfredo was really informative and answered all our question with ease.Bus ride there was real roller coaster ride,but once on site it was non stop adventure.

Its alright. My 1st experience going inside cave but wasnt that impressed. Since we rushed through the path i didnt really get to enjoy the sight n i was more worry about not landing on my head, when i held on to a rock to stop from tripping i got a notice not to touch cause i would destroy natural preservation.they say its k if u cant swim but i found out otherwise. Pics r $25 each or 99$ for whole cd n u cant take u own

Amazing Secret River in Cozumel. If you are reading this review, trying to decide what you want to do on your day in Cozumel, look no further. Seriously, you don't have to look up any other excursion because this one is the one for you if you are able bodied. I haven't been on as many cruises as most. I've only been on 4 but I have been to quite a few Central American and Caribbean ports. This excursion has to be the best one I've ever been on. The beauty of the caves and the water and the passion the tour guides (Alfredo) had for what he did was incredible. We were debating between going to the Ruins and this and we DO NOT regret our choice. First they take you and suit you in a wet suit, life jacket, hard hat and swimming shoes and then he takes you into the cave. You walk together, and your tour guide tells you the history and science behind the formation of the cave. The water starts at your ankles and in some areas above your head.It's beautiful and peaceful in there and we had SO much fun. It's a amazing experience and this is the only excursion I've ever done that I would do again. Anyone, who didn't give this a 5 star doesn't know what they are talking about. I'd give this 10 stars if it was applicable.

AMAZING experience. I did this excursion a few days ago and I must say it is the total package! All of the staff were extremely friendly and truly made the experience wonderful.
