Folks with knee, back, or ankle trouble should think twice and use the walking stick they have available, as the pace is fast and the footing occasionally treacherous, but the guide points out where to step. Wet suits and flotation devices are provided as are helmets. Swiming ability required is practically nil so long as you can float using the life vest they provide, which anyone can do.

don't miss this amazing experience!. a unique opportunity to investigate a recently discovered, extensive limestone cavern in the Yucatan with a small group, and staff who are knowledgeable and committed to the ecological and preservation aspects of this area. If you are lucky enough to draw Raoul as a guide, then you are in for an extra special tour. He is passionate about and loves his job. And it really shows in how he discusses the geology of the caverns, the Maya's influence in the area, and the natural aspects of the jungle. The tour in our opinion is an experience that most people can physically do, but be prepared to remain observant and careful throughout. Unfortunately, this tour would probably not occur in the United States because of potential liability. If you love the natural world, don't miss this once in a lifetime tour!
Awesome. Refreshing underground river, beautiful scenes! Great staff.

Amazing experience. A truly unique experience. You feel like you are on another planet exploring the depths of an unknown world.
Really recommend this activity
Honeymoon trip. Very good experience, beautiful caves, and the guides were excellent as well as their food.

Not for the claustraphobic. First: when taking an excursion, be sure to ask how long is the total ride. We were told by Best Day travel that the trip was only 1.15 hours but they did not tell us there was 2 hours of pick ups at other hotels before the 1.15 hour trip even began! We were looking for a 1/2 day trip but it was really a whole day because we got picked up at 8:25 AM and got back at 4:30pm. Not cool!! Also, once you get there, you have another 20 minute ride down a horribly bumpy back road before you reach the river. Then you get bitten by mosquitoes as you walk to the river opening and listen to some old man give you a blessing. Then once you get into the cave, the only light come from th dim headlamps on your hardhats. You begin the tour walking through the dry cavern but the rooms get smaller and smaller as you get deeper, and its HOT! I began to get very claustrophobic knowing there are tons of rocks all around you and no quick way out, with no sign of the outside. At one point, the guide tells everyone to turn off their head lamps for a few minutes of meditation but it was so dark and stifling. After barely fitting through caverns (and I am only 130 lbs), you finally hit the cold water. But then you realize you cant feel the bottom and its just creepy. After 1 hour and 40 minutes, you finally see the light of day and it could not be soon enough! The pictures of the site look like there is light everywhere and wide open places but there is not and I would not ever do it again. I do not recommend this to anyone who would get buggy in an elevator for over 1 hours....thats how I felt.

Really Terrific!. We took this as a booked excursion from a cruise and it was absolutely terrific! It's the perfect blend of history, culture and adventure! The transport between the ship and the cave was smooth and organized. They provide everything you need (except a bathing suit). Our guide, Allejandro, was amazing - so knowledgable and friendly. The whole experience was excellent - the caves themselves are surreal, the water cool and wonderful. It can be difficult to walk in the caves, so if someone in your party would struggle with that it's worth noting. We spent a long time in the caves and they took some great pictures. The lunch they provided afterward was quite good. It fit our party of 7, ages ranging from 12 to 50 (including 4 teenage boys), to a tee! EVERYONE thought it was super cool!

Amazing Experience!. This was a once in a lifetime experience! The caves are absolutely beautiful and this was definitely unlike anything I have ever done before. The part I enjoyed most about the tour was swimming through the cenotes, however walking through the caves can be a little difficult at times. I would recommend making sure the water shoes they provide you are nice & tight as your feel slip around a lot in them. Would definitely recommend to anyone that hasn't been in an underground cave or river before, totally a unique adventure. You can buy all the pictures from the excursion for around $60, so if this interests you I would bring some cash or a debit card.
Amazing!. This has to be experienced...the only word I can say is "Wow"! I took 2 children aged 7 & 9 and thought it was a bit too much for them. I would love to go back without children.

incredible.. Absolutely amazing. Magical. Profound. Intense. Other-worldly. Must-do. Must-see. Must-Experience. You can buy photos from the professional cave-dwelling photographers (either $25, $70, or $100) but otherwise, no souvenirs allowed, you may take only memories. You are cleansed before a Mayan altar before entering the sacred cave, and you must leave everything you foolishly thought to take from the cave on another sacred Mayan altar before ascending to daylight. Spectacular experience. Highly recommended.

Ruined at the End!. Amazing trip I highly recommend. My personal experience was that the guides and senior staff were excellent and super friendly and the attraction is incredible. But the machine broke down when it was time to buy pictures. As a solo traveller I made it clear I wanted my pictures (it's a plus to me that they have a professional doing that part). I even watched the guy write my info down on the list. But at the end they had no disc of my pics ready and sort of a tough luck buddy attitude.Eventually they remedied the situation. But my whole shuttle group had to sit for an extra 20 minutes in the van while I sheepishly waited for my disk to burn. For all I know they all thought it was my mistake that caused the delay. Embarrassing.

Rio Secreto marvelous experience. This was the only excursion we did on our short 5 day stay in Playa del Carmen, and it was totoally worth it. It was a half day excursion 3-4 hours total, although the location was only 10-15 minutes from our hotel. The roughest part of the whole experience was the bus ride from the entrance to the river, bumpy, bumpy, bumpy, so be sure to grab a seat closest to the front of your bus. :)Once we got there, we were given a great orientation by our tour guide JULIO, who was awesome, very knowledgeable, passionate and funny. The group size is small 8-10 people total who you get to know during the 1.5 hour tour.You are given a locker for your belongings, and only need your bathing suit. You are provided with wet shoes, a wet suit, life vest and a hard hat with a head light. The wet suit is optional, and if you have your own wet shoes you can bring and use those. After a 5 minute walk or so thru the jungle, and a ceremony by a local Mayan guide, for safe travels within the cave, you enter the mouth of cave and begin your tour. It's beautiful, Julio taught us all about the stalagmites and stalagtites, the cave history, and the photographer tooks tons of great photos.The water is refreshingly cool, maybe 70degrees or so, and feels great after being in the wet suit and lifevest, you get a bit stuffy, so the water feels wonderful. Expect to walk, climb mostly, with a few opportunities to actually swim. Overall the experience was incredible, beautiful and we loved it. Your group will enjoy a local home made lunch following your tour, and can purchase any of the pictures taken by the photogrpaher while inside the cave (pricey $25 for 1 was the least expensive option, but totally worth the picture).Enjoy!P.S. I (Michelle) am mildly claustrophobic and only once or twice did this bother me when we had to take a few steps thru small spaces, but since the cave is so big i was good, and the cool water refreshed me as well. For the most part, it was the wet suit and lifevest that smothered me a bit, so I kept them unzipped and unlatched a little, and completely took them off after the cave on our walk back thru the jungle.
amazing experience. underwater caves that are breathtaking. pitch black and you are given helmets with lights on it, great way to really see how it is down there

Absolutely Fabulous Rio Secreto. Rio Secreto is a fabulous experience and well organised and co-odinated with great guides. Thoroughly recommend it to anyone, it is good value and a wonderful experience. Suggestions - Early morning pickups on Sat morning near Coco Bongos in Playa del Carmen are a bit sleazy as still plenty of drunks coming out of the nightclubs at sunrise, lol. The CD of 12 photos package and tour could be slightly discounted as a better presell package.

Very pretty but if you have claustrophobia I wouldn't do it... A friend of ours gave us tickets as a wedding present and we went with a friend and my mom. It was good to be with other people that we knew because you feel comforted. The place was amazing ... like from an adventure movie but they were 3 things that I didn't like ( and i think this is very personal anyway): I have phobia for spiders and when I asked the guide if there were some of them ( I was already inside) he said that yes and they call it "crab spider" because it has its mouse like a crab and they are pretty dangerous). At this point I got so scared I wanted to run away and of course I had it in the back of my mind the whole time). Then they turned the lights off and I freaked out..you couldn't see absolutely anything and I felt spiders coming out from the walls.. Very scary!. . The third thing I didn't like was that they wouldn't allow us to bring cameras and then they wanted to sell us the pictures the photographer took for $70!! Even more than was the whole visit cost! And this was a CD with digital pictures. . My husband wanted so bad those pics and I felt bad but we didn't want to pay for such a ripoff. He loved the experience though, he was so happy like a little kid in an adventure.

Great experience, but expensive. This cenote was an experience I'll never forget. The sights were amazing and our guide explained everything so well. These are the things I didn't like:- no cameras are allowed, not even waterproof ones- a Rio Secreto photographer accompanies you to take pictures which you can buy at the end of the tour, but the prices are outrageous. The cheapest package is $60US, but that includes stock photos!! If you want just one photo, it'll cost you $25US!! This is just gouging the tourists. This is after spending $100US/ea to get into the site.- I didn't have enough money on me for the photos, so the staff took my e-mail address and said they would send me a link to download the photos and paypal info, but I'm still waiting for them to contact me- if you get car sick at all, then take Gravol or something to help you. The van ride to the site is 15 minutes of kidney-pounding bumps
Luv It. All around beautiful experience. Feel lucky to have seen this exquisite part of Mexico. So peaceful and our guide Rodrigo was a enthusiastic expert. Would go back for sure!
Great place for everyone!. Good for people who likes history, nature. And who doesn't like to be scared (reptiles, animals, rollercoster...) It was a wonderful experience ans I would do it again!
Full immersion in the nature of the Yucatan. A must try experience. The beauty of the caves and the nature around are just great!

Awesome Experience. This is the best excursion we have been on in the Riveria Maya. Great tour guide, made you feel safe and very educational. I am a little scared of tight spaces but this was a breeze. If you have bad knees then this is probably not for you. Lot's of bending down. Great Time at Rio Secreto
Utterly Breathtaking. Freaking amazing!!! Beautiful. One of kind. Pictures were pricey though so take money for those cause you cant take photos yourself.

Cave Tour. The van ride out to even get to the caves is redicules! crowded and hot vans! once at the attraction the tour guide has the group stop for photos at every other turn. The photos really took away from any authentic feel the caves offer. On the other hand my 22 year old daughter loved it! Maybe it just appeals to young people.

DO THIS. Loved this tour. its beautiful, unlike anything I've ever seen. Alfredo was the best tour guide. He made the non-swimmer in our group feel comfortable, He didn't ignore the children in the group and he answered all our questions and was very patient. His passion for this cave shows in how he guided. Thanks for the most memorable day of our trip.

An amazing experience. If you want to have an experience of a lifetime you must visit Rio Secreto. My husband and I visited this place and we were awed at the beauty within the cave. The river is clear, calm and it reminded me of the blue lagoon. Our tour guide was so knowledgeable and caring. There was one person in our group who didn't know how to swim and he made her feel so at ease that she ended up at the head of the group.If you visit the Riviera Maya don't forget to visit this place.My only recommendation to them is PLEASE LOWER YOUR PHOTO PRICES!!! We want to be able to show people this beautiful place but for $99 for a CD of photos or $25 for one picture it is outrageous.
Life changing!!!. this trip was absolutely life changing! the beauty of the caves and the serenity we felt there was a spiritual moment for us.

A MUST, it's something you won't often.. I went to Rio Secreto in last May (2012) and you have to see this. It's wonderfull. I had a great guite, his name is Jean, he is from Europe so he speak french, english and spanish.Don't be affraid to ask question and ask for Jean he will tell you so many things and he had a suprise for us. One I will never forget.Ça vaut le voyage.

Like Nothing You Have Ever Done Before!. We are a family of 3 (2 adults and a ten year old). We booked this thru Carnival and were glad we did. I am a big gal (a bit over 200 lbs) but in fairly good shape. I was concerned that either the wetsuit wouldn't fit or I would have a hard time navigating the caverns, but neither was a problem. Do keep in mind that the walk is long, the footing is VERY uneven and sometimes slippery. This is not for you if you have weak knees or ankles. The excursion is absolutely beautiful! We started out from Cozumel with a 40 minute ferry ride to the mainland.There, Angel made sure our group was accounted for and loaded onto the correct vans, where we were taken on a 25 minute ride to Rio Secreto. Our guide, Alejandro, then outfitted us and took us thru the cavern, explaining many things as we went along. There were only 9 in our group, but I do wish we would have been in the front of the group so our 10 year old would have been able to hear better. This wonderful experience is hard to put into words, so I won't even try. I will say that our favorite part was swimming in the cool water. (My husband and son thought it was a bit cold, but I thought it felt great.) A couple of side notes: 1)if you can't swim or dont want to swim, they will walk you around the water area 2.)if you have trouble with balance, take the walking stick they offer you. I felt much more confident with my footing while using the stick. After the tour, our guide took us back to change clothes and eat. Now, on the Carnival shore excursion description, it says you will have a "snack"...this is no snack, this is a full on authentic Mexican buffet, and a good one at that! We bought the CD of photos they took and 3 shirts. Alejandro was constantly checking on our group of 9 to make sure we had everything we needed and to make sure we made it on the correct van back to the ferry. He really worked hard to make this a safe and enjoyable tour. Back at the pier, Angel was once again waiting for us as we stepped off the van. These people are serious about making sure you make the ferry back to your cruise ship. Angel and Alejandro were constantly counting us to make sure noone was left behind. We had about 45 minutes of free time to shop or walk along the beach, then back on the ferry directly to the cruise ship terminal. Do this, you won't regret it.

Amazing Adventure. My husband and I visited Rio Secreto in late April, 2012. We took transportation from our hotel which drops everyone off in a central location. From there, we gathered with other groups, listened to a short introduction with instructions and then headed off in vans to the area where we would get our lockers, and use the changing rooms (there are also bathrooms located here). There is an outdoor shower for everyone to use to rinse off. They are very concerned with the environment and want to protect the caves and water. We were given wet suits, life jackets and helmets for the cave tour. You need to bring your own water shoes and towels. We split into groups of about 8 and met with our guide, Alfredo.  Alfredo was an awesome guide! He was slow enough for everyone in the group and he explained everything so well. He was so enthusiastic about the cave and our experience. The other guides seemed very friendly and helpful, as well. We spoke with lots of people after our tour and everyone loved their guides! After we got our gear, we walked about 5 minutes down a path and were met by a Mayan Shaman for a brief prayer ceremony before entering the cave. The cave tour takes about 45 minutes. You don’t have to be super-fit, but you do have to be able to bend low, step down, step up, and be comfortable in dark, enclosed places. Also, there is a point where you are paddling through deep water, but even if you can’t swim, the life jacket keeps you floating. The ages that day appeared to range from teens to 70's. The cave is beautiful, and the tour was just amazing.  After the tour, we changed back into dry clothes and had lunch. They served a very good lunch of soup, salad, tamales, potatoes, tacos, salsas, fruits, ice tea and ice water. They also had beer for purchase. It was a wonderful day!

Great Experience...Wow!. Well Worth the drive time. The caves were discovered in 2006 and simply amazing. We left the resort promptly at 7:45am (so don’t be late for the pickup time) and picked up one other group at another Hotel Then made it to the 1st stop at Rio Secreto to sign our lives away and drive 15 minutes down the “Back Roads”, so be ready to hold on for a fun rolling ride. After arriving the pace picked up and everyone rinsed off and suited up…and headed down. I can only say this is a once in a life time chance to see something you will never see or experience and worth the trip. Just look at their website and you will see the pictures; they are all real and you will experience it firsthand! www.riosecreto.com We made it back to the resort by 1:10pm and had the entire afternoon to rest up Beach Side...at Secrets Maroma!

Awesome Experience!. I went to the Rio Secreto with a group of 8 girls and thought that it was a great experience. The tour was amazing - the cave really is beautiful. Our tour guide Linda was really knowledgable and answered all of our questions and was a lot of fun. They give you everything that you need - wet suit, water shoes, and a locker to store your things during the tour. The experience of swimming through the stalacties in the cold cave water was pretty surreal. After the tour they give you lunch which was pretty tasty - empanadas, tamales, etc. People complain that they don't allow you to take your camera on the tour, but the pictures that they take of you are aweseme since they know how to properly light up all the shots. If you buy a disk with all your shots on it, it is only $70 which split between a few people really is not bad. All in all, this was a fantastic experience!

Absolutely Wonderful Experience. We selected the Rio Secreto as a shore excursion during our cruise. My husband, 10 year old grandson and I were thrilled with the entire experience - from the blessing before entering the cave to the lunch at the end, the whole experience was amazing. Our guide, Cecelia, was knowledgeable, personable and made sure that our grandson, the only child in our group, was involved in every part of the experience. The cave is beautiful, but I think the experience of floating under stalactites in dim light is something I'll never forget. I would do it again in a heartbeat!

Rio Secreto Simply Amazing Journey. The RIO SECRETO….What an amazing experience! Traveled with my son (9) and daughter (8)and I was worried the kids would freak out and fight with each other and ruin it for the other tour guests but say la veee. We were at the front of the pack. They were both mezmorized by the beauty of the cave and both were quiet as a mouse. Well let’s just say one of them. My daughter asked a lot of questions :0).The tour consists of treking through the cave and viewing the wonderful rock formations created by water which existed above the level we were standing. As we walked the water became deeper. Some parts you needed to float through. No swimming required. They provide all the equipment. I suggest a walking stick for the older folks. Rember take your time walking. A few of the guest fell and cut or scratched their leg on a rock. I’m not going to go into detail because it best to save the discovery and go to the tour to truly see what a beauty Rio Secreto .At the end they gave you a small buffet. You will be hungry! The food is quiet delicious better then the food we were eating at the five star resort! At the end they do not force you to buy pictures but you can review them. Make sure if they ask to take your picture to say yes! If you are interested in buying the pictures there are three different price points. I got all my pics plus xtra pics with three shirts for $99. I think it was worth it for the memories.Think about it, if Rio Secreto allowed everyone to take photos the tour would never progress. People would separate and not remain as a group and then they would ruin the growth formations permanenantly in the cave which tooks years to develop! The tour was worth every penny. I would buy the transportion option. Getting there by bus is no problem but from the gate to the acutally cave is a long never endng bumpy road.

Unique Experience. I was a little hesitant when we booked this excursion--We are both in our 60's and I am always afraid of everything! The guide took me by the hand--Literally- and I had no problems. I was glad they let you keep your glasses--It is a unique area and I'm glad we got to have the experience. If you have problems walking or can't fit into small to average spaces, this may not be for you. But if you have average fitness and abilities, and no problems being in a crouched position for short periods, give this one a try.
Amazing!. The tour was so amazing. Our guide was excellent and helpful. Seeing those caves was simply magical. This is a must see!!

One of my favorite excursions. I visited these while on a cruise that ported in Cozumel. The caves were amazing. It does require a good bit of physical exertion, so be wary if you are not too able. However, the trip is very much worth it. The commitment to preserving these caves is to be admired. Once inside, you will see many formations, beautiful caverns and an incredible underground lake. I felt very safe the entire time and they do everything to make sure you are taken care of. This is more of an "adventure" then a "walk the paved path through the cave". I highly recommend this. Out of numerous cruise adventures, this is one of my all time favorites. Beautiful.

Interesting Experience. Purchased the tickets from a kiosk inside the 5th Avenue bus terminal. The person selling the tickets said it was merely a 15 minute bus ride. However, the bus was half an hour late. Luckily, the ticket vendor got us onto another bus along the same route. Book through your hotel to avoid the hassle or just take a cab. I ended up getting a ride back to my resort in Playacar for 100 pesos.
Rio Secreto Caves. By far this was one of my most amzing adventure,our guide explain & was very nice & considerate of everyones needs & questions.underground world was breath taking !!
Amazing. The caverns are such an experience is a unique and complete different, very beautiful. The instructor extraordinary he make this experience to be one of the best. The food is delicious.

MUST!. If youre visiting Cancun/Riviera Maya.. you HAVE to go to Rio Secreto. This amazing underground River is BREATHTAKING... Ive travelled lots and havent seen such a natural beauty like this anywhere else. They have professional Staff who will explain you every single detail in the caves. You get to see stalactites from Millions of years ago and just live an incredible unforgettable experience. Rio Secreto is located only 10 mins away from downtown Playa del Carmen. Definetely MUST MUST MUST! A plus is that they give your eally nice local food after the caves.

Underground beauty. This was an amazing tour...though definately not for anyone with a fear of enclosed spaces or the dark. I would also suggest that you be reasonably fit and sure footed, as you really have to focus on where you step, and you can't touch the walls around you to maintain your balance. That being said - they do provide walking sticks for anyone who needs one for extra support. You also need to be comfortable in a water environment, though there are only a couple of areas where I had to swim rather than walk ( I'm only 5ft 2 though) Wet suits and lifejackets are provided...and given that it's pretty cold down there, it's a good thing or I'd have been a popsicle by the time we left.The cave formations are awe inspiring, stalactites and stalagmites abound, shawl limestone formations, catfish and bats all add to the allure. Our guide Jovana was marvelous, we had an all English speaking group and she was completely fluent and super friendly. Along the way there are lights set up and everyone has a hard hat with a light attached. Certain areas along the way were lit especially for photo opportunities, though due to the nature of this tour, you can't take your own camera with you. After the tour, lunch is provided, and it was very tasty - especially the lime soup!! There was no "hard sell" on the photo's they took, which is always a relief. The bus trip there and back to get to the cenotes was a little bumpy, but well worth it.Would I go again......absolutely!!!

Was a nice trip.. We took this trip so that we could see the underground world of Mexico. It was beautiful. It is very hard to look around because you really have to focus on where you are walking. They do stop to allow you to see specific areas up close.This trip is definitely not a trip for large people, people with physical disabilities of any kind, someone who is not comfortable in the dark or is not comfortable in a water environment and definitely not a trip for kids under the age of 13. You need to be quiet so you can hear the guide, you cannot touch anything unless informed that it is ok to do so and it is 1.5 hours in the water with a combination of walking and swimming.The equipment they provided is well used so do not expect new condition. The guide was a lot of fun. We were disappointed in the pictures they took (you cannot take a camera on this trip) so we do not have any pics of this trip. The lunch they provided was good. All in all it was a nice trip.
An athlete's dream!!. Excellent guide and very eco-friendly!!But do not attempt unless you have no claustrophobia and are in shape!!!

The best experience. Our tour guide was the best, Thank you Rodrigo, he know all the things for the cenotes and this underground tour, he puts you right there, and for the price it is great. Can not go wrong with it. Plus everything is included. Thank you Rodrigo for such a great tour

Magical experience. Rio Secreto was an extraordinary experience. When you leave the place, you will actually feel what I am taking about. There is no words to explain what a Beauty and magic is Rio Secreto AND the people that work there seem to be influenced by it, that's the explanation I found. Rodrigo Pinedo, the guide, was so knowledgeable but not only that, he went above and beyond my expectations when he answered questions and his natural friendliness kept it much more fun. He showed everything, he tried to make us enjoying every little detail which was amazing.Not to mention, the Mayan shoot was delicious as well as the food which was local.EXCELLENT!!!

Unique adventure. We experienced Rio Secreto as an excursion offered by Royal Caribbean on a recent cuise in May, 2012. We were a bit nervous with the 45 minute drive down a remote bumpy dirt road in the large passenger van. Once we arrived at Rio Secreto, the organization was clearly legitimate with ample restroom facilities, shower, and lockers for us to use, plenty of staff, etc. We were welcomed by the guides and given clear instructions, given wet suit, life vest, and helmut with light. The tour of the caves was fantastic with our guide being really informative and helpful. The ground in the cave is uneven and wet, of course and may be difficult for anyone limited physically. The swimming part was amazing; you don't need to be an expert swimmer because mostly you just float along in your lifejacket. The guides are also very safety conscious. We had a lovely group of people with us (10 in all) and we helped to steady each other over any especially uneven or slippery steps. The tour was well worth the price and we enjoyed the nice Mexican lunch afterward. I agree that the price of the pictures is too steep. We chose not to buy a picture but I now wish we had bought one, even for the $25 price. Overall, a memorable experience. I also want to add that the guides clearly love the cave, are knowledgeable about it's ecology, and committed to its preservation. They are a neat group of people.

Awesome caves. This was a great excursion. The whole place is very beautiful and the underground cave was really amazing. We enjoyed our guide Roderico. The price IMHO is a little high $99 per person, they can cut out the lunch and charge less. Also the bus ride to the caves is a bit bumpy try to sit towards the front. Enjoy!!

MUST SEE ABOVE ALL ELSE. Okay people...This is a must see! This was by far the most beautiful thing I have seen in the area. It is awesome. Our tour guide was awesome. They have tours in french, english, and spanish. They are truly dedicated to conservation. We visited another small cenote which was nothing compared to this. I promise you will never see anything like this in your life!
Awesome experience!. It was only 15 minutes from Paradisus. So much fun. Not for people with difficulty walking.

a must do :). this is my first review and the reason I write it is because they truly deserve it!! Our tour guide was Alfredo a FANTASTIC tour guide! top notch guide- who truly loves his job and as I told him, his passion reflects in his work! all the way!.. he was great with our group and took great care of my mother in law 60y/o who didn't speak English, and she had a blast! Now the caves, what you see in the pictures is what you get HOWEVER you must experience it to FEEL the caves... that is the most beautiful place I have ever seen in my life... A++++ if I had one day in Mexico again this is exactly what I would do.... when you come out of the caves you feel so sad you have to leave... go go go!

You need to do this once. A very cool experience. Might need to be a little daring to go into the pitch black with just the light on your helmet - but a GREAT experience and something you will not forget. Loved it all

Yes it REALLY is life changing!. I was with a group of people who went on this tour through our company while in Mexico. At dinner the night before I was telling everyone about some of the reviews I read here on Tripadvisor and we all laughed about the fact that someone wrote going on this tour was "life changing"...I mean how can exploring an underground secret river in a cave be life changing? Gorgeous yes, incredible experience -sure- but more than that? Well I rarely post reviews -but after laughing about this just had to come back to say that if you are in this area and have a choice of things to do -you will WANT to choose this one. I can't believe I wasn't afraid -I thought I would be -it was exhilarating and all of us left this experience feeling connected to the Earth, to ourselves. The word "spiritual" was used to explain how awe inspiring of an experience it was. It could be that our guide Santiago Villa (I asked him for his name knowing I would write this) was so knowledgeable about the ancient Mayan history which he shared- nothing like hearing about sacred Mayan cultures in a place that is supposedly a sacred Mayan cave . Perhaps it's the realization that there are things on this Earth that most don't think about, but that exist in this case deep below their feet;that have existed long before we were here and will be here long after we are gone. And they send a photographer with each tour group which is awesome because you are in there hoping that it can somehow be captured and shared -but the pictures captured, funny enough they are SO beautiful -people may think they are photo shopped. MUST do- if you have to travel to do it -it's worth it -that is the only way you'll really understand what I'm trying to say. You'll be SO happy and feel so fortunate that you had the opportunity to do this! Oh and PS -there are at least 2 different routes because I noticed some wrote about tight spaces -not so always -while both are supposedly gorgeous -the other half of our group went on the path that people refer to which can be very tight in places for people who may be claustrophobic -we went to the path that had huge wide caverns- I'd recommend that one to anyone -and our guide said the tour we went on with the large wide caverns is his favorite one. And BTW we were not given a choice before hand -so you may want to ask - particularly if you are claustrophobic to go on the route we did with the wide caverns.

Rio Secreto - one of the best adventures we have ever undertaken - and we felt safe the whole time!. I had always judged people who end up in water in caves were more than a bit crazy. But that is exactly where we spent nearly 2 hours on our recent trip to Rio Secreto near Playa del Carmen and at no time did we feel concerned for our safety. One reason was that this crystal clear cool underground river meandering in complete darkness throuigh a most magnificent series of limestone caves was a safe place to be. The other reason was that our guides were knowledgable, competent and kept us fully informed. It is not a place for the feeble footed, as the trek involves uneven wet surfaces, craggy rocky edges, swimming, floating under stalactites that bump against the helmet - and all lit by the light on the front of this helmet. I guess the fact that at times the large caverns were floodlight to show us the beauty, also showed us we were in a place of big spaces with only the occasional low roofed passageway - but passageways that were still big enough to be comfortable. And the fact that this is a flat country suggests there will be no sudden flooding. I'm so glad we did it My only disappointment was the cost of the photographs that we were forced to buy if we wanted a momento of our experience as we were not allowed to take cameras underground.

Awesome Experience. The whole tour was great, Lea our tour guide was awesome. She was so knowledgeable and enthusiastic. It is so beautiful around the cave, I wish we could have taken our own cameras into the cave. The photographer did not do a great job with our photos unfortunatley so we werent able to get nice pictures inside the cave.. the angle was awkward and the pictures were SUPER pricey .. one photo for 25 bucks! the experience itself was pretty awesome, theres a long bumpy ride to the cave itself -- so beware! sometimes the drivers like to have fun and go fast on hills and bumps to make your stomach flip upside down.

Worth the trip!. Great experience there. Wonderful guide Alfredo. Not for those that can't endure small spaces. Worth the $ spent. Remember, you can't take your camera with you, even if it's waterproof. Only complaint would be the cost of the pictures they take of you and try to sell to you at the end. Packages were $69 to $99 and single photos could be purchased for $25. Lunch provided was good but beer and canned soda not included.

A great experience of discovery. If you love nature,exploring admiring the beauty of almost untouched jungle and river this is the one for you, it was a really exiting experience, lovely simple food but very tasty. For the faint of heart there are nice hamoch areas to observe the wild life.
AWESOME. A little bit of a trip getting to the place, but well worth the time.

awesome experience!. We took our family to this excursion not entirely sure sure what we were getting into, upon arrival we were treated great. I took my 5 year old son and our tour guide alex or alejandro was amazing. He made our trip unforgettable and took care of my son and named him honorary tour guide. It was beautiful I recommend this to everyone. If u book try and request Alejandro for your guide he made our trip.

A life experience i'll never forget. We chose this excursion from our cruise ship and it was one of the highlights of the entire vacation. I have trouble putting to words how amazing Rio Secreto is. Our guide was great. She always knew the answers to our questions and made us all feel very comfortable with our surroundings. The caves were beautiful. It was amazing to see something created by nature that can take your breath away. The tunnel system goes on for miles and every turn gives a new group of formations that I could stare at for hours. The water was a bit chilly at first but we all got used to it very quickly. We were provided with wetsuits that helped us from the cool water and getting scratched by the formations. My wife was a bit worried about there being bugs and other creatures in the caves but aside from a couple of bats (that never came near us) we didnt see anything scary. There are many oppourtunites to have your photo taken and you get to review them after to purchase. $25 for 1 photo of your choice on a disc or $69 for all of them (about 20). The photos are expensive but the whole excursion was not overpriced so I justified it by working it into the cost of the entire trip. There is some swimming (with life jackets provided), a bit of climbing, and some low ceilings. I would go back to Rio Secreto in a heartbeat and I have told everyone I can about this amazing place.
Amazing. One of the easiest and best travel experiences ever. Our 5 year old (swimmer) enjoyed the Cenote. Full free meal after on the premises. Note: If you have water shoes, bring your own.
The best thing that you can do here!. This our second time in cancun-playa and we are so happy that we went to rio secreto This place is 120% of every thing

Spectacular Scenery!. We did the tour and it is beautiful! Our guide Alfredo was amazing and really seemed passionate about showing us around. It is a great way to spend a couple of hours and see something spectacular!.

Nothing like this in the US. We've been to many caves in the US including Carlsbad Caverns. While this doesn't compare in magnitude it makes up for in immersiveness (literally!). Instead of being on a marked path, you are swimming and crawling and ducking through the cave which is only light by the headlamps your group is wearing. Very cool! The lunch was nice too.

Rio Secreto is absolutely gorgeous!. We took a half day trip to Rio Secreto and had an incredible time. Our guide Alex was very knowledgeable about all the different rock formations we saw in the caves and the wildlife both below and above ground. He also made sure everyone was safe and able to enjoy the trip. The underground experience was simply beautiful. I have never experienced anything like it. It really has to be experienced to appreciate the beauty. It is also a nice break from the afternoon heat since you are underground for about 1.5 hours.The tour includes a Mayan buffet afterwards. The food was very good.The only comment I have on the negative side is that you cannot take a camera. They have a photographer throughout, but the photos are very expensive. Having said that, they are also VERY well done, so may be worth the money for some people. We certainly would not have taken photos as nice on our own camera.

A gift from the mother nature. I´m not a big fan of the out door activities, or anything that it could it represent an extreme activity. I doub´t it too much to go to this place because I was told it was an underground river. I´m so please I gave it a try!!! this place it´s absolutely georgous!! and underground Cristal museum, with stalactites and stalagmites from over millions of years... It´s just so beautiful. I really recommended

What an incredible, unspoiled, natural phenomenon. This portion of one of the underground rivers in the Yucatan was only opened to the public in 2006. I can't begin to describe how beautiful it is. What's really special about it though, is the effort the staff puts forth to make sure it stays unspoiled.And I thought the lunch was delicious, especially the lime chicken soup. And the Xtabentun liquor is DEFINITELY worth buying, it is fantastic!

Fabulous!. My mom, brother, sister-in-law, and I had a great time at Rio Secreto. We booked the last tour of the day. The staff was very hospitable and knowledgeable. Many of them spoke excellent English. The 15-minute van ride to the cavern entrance was bumpy, but that's what it feels like on an unpaved jungle road. The wetsuits and helmets do smell faintly of mildew, but through similar water-sport excursions I've experienced, I think that's just what rentals smell like. Our tour guide, Alfredo, did a bilingual tour, and his translation was impressively precise. He's also just a really personable guy. The tour wasn't too strenuous. If the idea of hiking and swimming (life jackets keep you afloat) your way along a guided tour of some incredibly beautiful caverns appeals to you, I recommend Rio Secreto. I'm not sure why previous reviews complained about the lunch. I thought it was delicious. I can understand why people complained about the photos. I do agree with the no-photo policy. It would be irresponsible to allow tourists to bring their own cameras into the cavern, not only in terms of conservation, but also safety. But the pricing of the professional photos ($25 for one, $69 for all, $100 for all + 3 souvenirs) so encourages you to purchase the whole package, that it you do feel manipulated. Still, the pricing is on par with similar excursions, and it does benefit the conservation of the cavern, so I can't complain.
Not crazy. I would much rather go to the other one (not going to give name) but last year I went to other similar big excursion in riviera and it was much better than this one.
Great Excursion. This is a great opportunity to swim in an underground cave. My wife and I went and had a great time!

Cool experience but too long and terrible lunch. The underground river tour is cool, but gets old fast and they try to sell you overpriced photos around every turn. However, the formations are beautiful and unique. The lunch was a sorry excuse for lunch with a meek lime chicken tortilla soup. warm salad, fruit and some sort of cream cheese filled tamales. We paid for the tour with transportation and definitely overpaid- $109 each which meant we spent $40 each on transportation- $80 for a crappy ride in a van with 10 other people on the way back which ended up taking an hour and a half!

Amazing, don't miss it!. I was encouraged to book Rio Secreto by the reviews that I read. I am glad I followed the advice the place is soo amazing it is hard to describe. It's mother nature working!! I have never seen water that clear (no, it's not cold)!! I read a review that complained that it's not time to play, but I was glad the visit was totally guided because I was worried that we would destroy this amazing place with our impact in this ecosystem. However, the staff at Rio Secreto are very organized and very strict. They constantly remind you that nothing should be touched in the cave and point out the few places you are allowed to touch for balance. While you appreciate the beauty of this amazing undeground place, the guide provided detailed explanations and a professional photographer takes de most incredible pictures. Our guide was Antonio and he made this a unforgetable experience. We were picked up at our hotel and the entire trip took about 5 hours, however, the underground experience is about 1.5 hour. They provided you with all the equipment (wet suit, helmet, shoes), locker, and towels.

Amazing. Unexpectedly wonderful. Watch your step though!. We were fortunate that we did not come with a cruise ship group or any other group. We booked this by ourselves and when we arrived we put with another couple who had done the same thing. So our entire group with guide was 5. All the others were 10-12. It is an amazing experience and just wonderful. They provide everything (except swim suit and towel). So even if you have an underwater camera, your own wetsuit, don't bother bringing it - they won't let you use it anyway. They keep strict control on potential contaminants getting into the underground water system. So much so you cannot wear your watch or any significant jewellry. They do have secure places for you to store you belongings so there is nothing to worry about. If you are not sure footed or lack a lot of mobility it can be hard. People have broken ankles and fallen and broken arms in here. If you're careful and listen to the guide and enlist their help when needed you should have no problems. We would do this again in a heartbeat it was just so amazing. You will get presented with the option to buy photo packages on the way out - and they are spectacular pictures, but they are not cheap and staff do take "no" in stride and don't push too hard. We've done lots of things in Mexico - this is one (hands down) that I would say is a true MUST DO!
Excellent. Was something to see and something to experience . I would do it again.Great guides and he spoke French very well.Was fun too
No time to play!. They don't give free time to play freely, the whole thing is guided and around every corner they have photographers to take your picture for selling later.

Fabulous experience!. Our guide Kuri was absolutely amazing. We took our three kids on this excursion with the youngest being only 3 and Kuri was so helpful making it a positive experience for her. The cave is spectacular and our entire family loved every minute of our tour. It was wonderful to have lunch afterward and lounge in hammocks for a bit before returning to our resort. We would highly recommend this excursion and loved that it accomodated all of our kids!

Amazing. We have previously been to this area in Mexico and were not planning any excursions, until we read about Rio Secreto. This place is soo amazing it is hard to describe. It is very natural and I was actually worried that they would destroy this underground cave system with tours. They are very strict - no sunscreens and you must shower prior to putting on the wet suit. No items allowed - rings/earings...etc must be removed and stored in lockers. They take great care that nothing is touched in the cave and point out the few places you are allowed to touch for balance. During the entire trip there are discussions on protecting the environment and what you can do to make a difference, the caves were undescribable. The only item available to purchase is a CD of pictures with 50% going to preserve the area. We took the later tour that left the hotel at 11:30 and we returned around 4:00 pm. Our guide was Kuri and he made this a fabulous experience.

unimaginable. stunning natural beauty. aweinspiring. The staff were great, knowledgable, friendly. The water was incredibly refreshing after the walk about between the stalactites / stalagmites. Here you really feel very insuggnificant against nature and time. Lights out is very very compelling. Go see this natural wonder yourself

An incredible experience. Don't be discouraged by the bumpy ride you have to go on to get to your destination. This excursion is fantastic. Our guide was Allejandro and he was fabulous! You are provided with a wet suit, water shoes, life vest, and a helmet with a light attatched. I'm a wee bit claustraphobic so I was a little nervous but our guide was so incredible and I felt very safe. You enter a majestic cave and the tour begins! Sometimes you are walking on dryland, sometimes the water is up to your knees, and other times you have to swim. The stalactites and stalagmites are incredible. The root system of the above trees is amazing. You are followed by a photographer who takes individual and group photos. My favorite part of this tour was when we were all instructed to be still in the water and turn our lights off and just listen. You could hear the drips in the cave and it was truly an amazing experience. Bring money (you are provided with a locker) because at the end of the tour you can purchase the professional photos. They are worth it! We bought the disk that has all the pics on it and it is a treasured keepsake. Overall this is a must do! We will return.
A Great Experience. It's almost a life changing experience to admire the beauty of the underground river and stalactites. The underground walk and swin are magical and the guides are very good.

Once in a lifetime experience!!. Was transferred to Playa Del Carmen in a boat from Cozumel and then met by a van that picked up the group of 6 to head to the "Rio Secreto." Very intimate setting with only 6 people in the group. Got to know the group and had an amazing time with them!! We hiked through the rain forest for about 5 minutes to get to the caves. Our guide, Alfredo, was amazing and had a great sense of humor!!!! HE MADE THIS TRIP EVEN MORE WORTH WHILE!! He was very knowledgable and constantly asked if anyone had any more questions. Hammocks were set up and were amazing to relax in after lunch was served. IT WAS BEAUTIFUL! I suggest bringing a waterproof camera because they charge $25 per picture! It is unlike anything you have ever seen before. Would definitely do this again!

Very Special Place!!!. This excursion was one I will never forget! Our guide Alex was awesome and very knowledgeable and the tour was a good amount of time (Alot of excursions in the area can run up to 12 or more hours) and ended with a tasty lunch! Don't try to be brave and not use the wet suit... the water is CHILLY down there! A very unique experience for sure =)

Once in a life-time experience. If you are anywhere near here you need to do this. My wife and I travel frequently and both agree that this is one of our favorite things we have ever done. The price includes your entry fee and all the equipment you need (Helmet, wetsuit, water shoes, light and vest.) It also include a really good lunch (try the lime soup!). The only thin not included is the photo CD. At first I was really upset they did not allow cameras and thought they were trying to extract more money from you. 10 minutes into the cave though and I completely understand. First, there are times when you have to have your whole body up to your mouth in the water to avoid hitting the ceiling so a camera must be water proof. Second, the water is not clear in places so if you were to drop it, it would be gone forever and litter the cave. Third, many places you hold hands for support so you need both hands free. Lastly, they had flashes set up everywhere so you could actually see the cave. The little flash on your camera would not light up enough to see anything anyways. The pictures are a little expensive. We paid $69 for all of them, about 25, but they came out great and they even filtered out the rest of our group so it was just my wife and myself, not a bunch of people we don't know.They take you down in groups of 10 or so. Our guide was named Victor and was wonderful! We only saw another group twice in the entire 90 minutes so it doesn't feel overcrowded at all. The formations were awesome. Some places had thousands in one room. The largest one we saw went from floor to ceiling and must have had a diameter of 4-5 feet. Take their caution about claustrophobia seriously. There are some tight spaces. That said however, my wife can be claustrophobic and while there were a few times she was nervous, she was fine and did great. I have to say that everyone was very professional and very helpful. We would do this tour again in a heartbeat if we get the chance to.
Awesome. Excellent. This was my favorite tour. The guide was informative and the overall experience was great. Everyone should walk/swim through the caves.

Awe Inspiring!. Let me start by saying that our guide was Rodrigo - who is FABULOUS! Very knowledgeable, caring, and has great communication skills. The price included: guide, transportation, walking stick, wet suit, locker with key, water shoes, and a good lunch. Very well organized tour lasting about 2 hours. Highly recommend taking the wet suit and walking stick. I'm healthy and hike often and still found the walking stick to be a must. Its a short walk on a trail and then you go into the cave and its about 1/2 mile exploration! The part where you just float thru the cave is one of the best things I've ever experienced. Also, the darkness and quiet was powerful. Its a difficult thing to describe, but I can say its something you should not miss!  Only downfall was that the bus driver to the caves was not very friendly and the ride was pretty bumpy. Cannot bring your camera, which we were upset about at first, but, after doing the tour, I can understand why....definitely glad I didn't have anything but my steps to worry about. I think it is a safety hazard and a pollution hazard and they are really trying hard to preserve the caves.The pics are kinda pricy, but it goes to conserve the environment and also for the equipment maintenance. They have to change out equipment every 3 months due to the humidity within the caves. We bought the mid range package for $69 and split the cost between our group. Totally worth it to us. Clearly, I absolutely LOVED this experience. It's like nothing I have ever done before! If I had not been leaving the next morning, I would have gone back to do this again before I left. There are 3 routes Joy, Palace, & Supreme. We did the route called Joy. Awe Inspiring!

Rio Secreto. this was the 8th time in riviera maya we pretty much done all the excursion so this was something new words can,t describe the beauty and calmness you feel when you go in the caves .We had our guide was Ceci she really took the time to explain in details and answered everyone question really something to do at list one in your life time.

A Secret River Waiting For You. In the middle of nowhere is a refined infrastructure of change facilites and introduction spaces. Our group of 10 (max. #) guided by Alfredo (you can book him in advance if the group is large enough) stopped for a Mayan blessing prior to entering the first cave. WOW!! You have to stop to look up - turn your light on and just enjoy the entire tour of stalactites and stalagmite and column formations. The tour goes fast (1.5 hours) of walking and swimming (you have a wetsuit, watershoes, lifevest, helmet and light) able bodied people only recommended. We saw tiny catfish and phytoplancton, an eco-system in the tree roots taking in the fresh waters of the river and more. Photos are taken by their staff and are worth the purchase. Shower, change rooms and a great Mexican lunch that you never want to leave wrap up the terrific one of a kind in the world excursion. This is a unique river cave system tour not to be missed.

Leave your camera home.... A truly wonderful caving experience. Our only objection was that they don't let you take cameras into the cave. A photographer accompanies the tour and they take your pictures and then sell them at an exorbitant rate. Worse than that, everyone must stand around and wait while all the other group members get their own personal pictures taken. Other than that, it was a great experience.

Secret River Rocks...literally. Awesome excursion, well worth the money and far exceeded my (already high) ambitions. We had a terrific guide and the excursion as a whole is very well run. The caves themselves are something like you've never seen before and the fact you're in there swimming around (at times in areas where you can't touch), is remarkably. It's a one-of-a-kind experience that will not disappoint you. In addition, the cave tour was followed up by a very nice Mexican lunch which was not expected. Followed up with a few hours to spare for shopping at the end it was a wonderful day and again, a highly reccommended trip.

Breath Taking. Amazing experience! Everyone should see it for themselves, our guide was amazing and made everyone feel very comfortable. The tour was about 2 hours long with a free lunch afterwards, the bus ride getting to the spot is very bumpy, so if you get motion sick I recommend taking a gravol.**Only downfall is no cameras allowed and their photo prices are ridiculous.. but worth the money for the memory.

Stunning!. While on our trip we went to Cenote dos Ojos and to Rio Secreto (BOTH ARE AMAZING). In Rio Secreto the river is dryer so you don't go snorkelling, but you spend around 2 hours walking along the cave, swimming and seeing some amazing landscape. The water is crystal clear and very very beautiful! If you have to choose one, I would probably recommend Dos Ojos, but if you have time go to both places!!!

For something different and great choice!. I completely agree with the five star reviews however i did find myself wishing the tour allowed for lingering and really soaking in the wonders that are before you. Our guide was wonderful and gave us insight on the history of Mayan culture. I was happy to spend my money there as it also goes toward the conservation of this amazing sight, however i did wish we didn't just walk through. Most of the time you walk through, watch where you are going....look up and go aaaaah...while trying not to fall. All in all, i was very glad to have gone. Please be prepared for the very rough van ride coming in and out of the site. In a hot van, with no AC or shocks, i was very uncomfortable!

Excellent- Amazing guide- Kuri. We got there and the place looked really cool. The staff was amazingly friendly. We were split up into english and spanish speaking groups...which I thought was weird....until we did a combined excursion which turned into a disaster (but not this trip).1. Our guide was Kuri....he was amazing and made a great trip excellent. He was passionate about his job and the ecosystem and took time to answer any question.2. We got changed/ suited up/....you can take nothing except your bathing suit.3. We took a 15 minute drive in a van....HOLY BUMPY BATMAN....enough said4. Got there...had a Shaman ritual to bless us and teach more about the Cenote...that was cool.5. The terrain was pretty steep for someone that has any difficulty walking, bending or stooping. We would recommend to ask for a walking stick if you do.6. The Cenote was amazing...everything was like nothing our family had seen...we brought our 11 yo son (perfect age to appreciate and keep up). Again Kuri explained everything but was not verbose....really took time to let everyone experience the Cenote. We all turned out our flashlights....and it was darker than dark...very fun....This took about 90 minutes...7. Left the Cenote...got out of our gear....you had the option to buy various packages (they were never pushy or salesy)....and we did a shot of some really tasty liquor to celebrate. Lunch was good and we chatted with the other families...the grounds were perfect.GREAT EXPERIENCE! Must do if you have not done Rio Secreto...highly recommend our guide.THanks Kuri!Taylors

Wonderful Experience. Let me start by saying that it is advisable to book your tour in advance as the number of people in a group is limited.The whole tour is very well organized. First you pay the fee, then they give you a short introduction to what the plan is and then they take you to the cenote area on a van (the trip is about 15 minutes and the road is a bit rough). You are given a locker, where you put your clothes and belongings and take a shower to take off the oiliness of your skin which could damage the cenote environment.Then you are given your gear and after a short walk through the forest you arrive at the cenote. We were lucky as our group was just 6 people, the experience was amazing! One of the most wonderful things I've ever seen/done in my life. For more than an hour you walk, crawl and swim through a beautiful cenote with a guide who is ready to help you, support you on a slippery rock and also provides a very informative narrative.After the tour, lunch is provided and I think there is babysitting on site for people with babies.I would recommend this adventure to anyone going to the Riviera Maya region (there was even a non-swimmer in our group).

Spectacular experience! So unique.. My husband and I decided to go to Rio Secreto because it is an easy way to experience the cenotes unique to this area. The experience exceeded our expectations. Our guide, Alejandro, was very knowledgable and enthusiastic. We were pleased with how much we were able to see and experience inside the caves and LOVED the opporutnity to swim in such a special place. I highly recommend Rio Secreto and thank Alejandro for such a great experience.

Do It! Do It! Do It!!!. TOTALLY WORTH EVERY PENNY! Amazing, beautiful, wonderful and just pure natural beauty. Yes! you SHOULD go see.Great guide, Alejandro to show us around. Good English. Warning: not for people afraid of dark, small spaces or swimming.

Contact with the earth. This is an excellent place of adventure, learn and contact with the earth,this experience is amazing, We have a professional guide name Alfredo who help us to make this trip outstanding, we traveled four my husband and two girls 12 & 18, all enjoyed and remember like one of the best things to do in the riviera maya.

This is a MUST SEE if you are in the Riviera Maya!. This is a must see attaraction for those who are facinated with caves, stalagtite and stalagmite figurations, and geological history.This cave system was recently discovered (I believe 2007) and is soon to be on the UNSECO World Heritage protected list. The guides who work there love the area and our guide, Jean really loved his job!Once you check in at the front location, you are boarded on a bus (with AC) down a dirt road that has its fair share of pot holes. After a 15 minute ride into the jungle we arrived at a lush green jungle location with several buildings. We were given small pad locks with keys and shown to a few banks of lockers to store our personal items. When at the site, no cameras are alowed into the cave system, so be prepared to store them with your personal effects.You are also asked to take a quick shower (outdoor showers) to help clean off all of the sunscreen and lotions that could ruin and react with the calcium carbonate in the rock formations in the cave. Amidst getting some information about the Rio Secreto area you are sized up for a wet suit, lifevest, water shoes and a helemt with light.After a quick team picture, the guide leads you through the jungle on a fairly easy path until you reach a Mayan shaman who blesses the group for a safe travel through the 'underworld'. From there you enter the mouth of the cave. It is absolutely spectacular. There are stalagtites and stalagmites of yellow, blue and red hues. After some walking, you start to wade through the cave system until later in the tour you need to float down long stretches. With the life vest it is really as easy as a simple breast stroke. There are camera men that join the tour and take pictures at certain areas of the cave. We purchased the disc of photos and were very happy with them.After the underground tour you are treated to an authentic Mexican lunch with tacos, tamales, soup, salad, and of course salsa!This is an absolute gem, and it is highly recomended!

Great Experience, but know what to Expect. The scenery was fabulous. They really did a great job with the whole experience from the beginning to end. Little extras made it special like the Mayan prayer service to enter the cave and the buffet after was really good. Beware that several areas towards the end of the tour, you have to swim. The water is deep and requires everyone to swim. Most of the time the water is below your knees but not always and it depends on the season. The adults and teenagers in our group were fine, but my 9-year old was so cold he was shivering through the water and he did have a wetsuit. There are also areas where you have to squat through tight chambers and climb up, down, and through rocks. It is somewhat physical and everyone in our group got a little scraped up here & there. The ride from the entrance down to the cave is a good 15 minutes on really bumpy dirt roads so beware of that as well. Overall it was really good. Be sure to smile for all the many camera's that you see in the cave so you have good pictures at the end!

Very cool!. Myself, husband and teenage daughter recently visited this attraction in March.We took a tour from our hotel. Price from the Gran Bahai Principe Coba was $99 each including a lunch. It was a very interesting experience. We were in a group of 9 believe with Tania as our tour guide. Once at the site, you have to drive about 15 minutes inland to the actual cave area. We were on an air conditioned bus. The ride is quite bumpy but kind of a fun ride! Once there, you are given a wet suit, helmet with a light, water shoes and a life jacket. Wear your bathing suit. You can't take a camera with you but there is a photographer that follows the tour and takes pictures off you at various points along the way. You are totally underground following and walking in the rivers. The coral and different minerals, etc. are quite dramatic to see. There is the occasional bat and maybe a spider but they don't bother with you. One word of caution to anyone who has trouble walking, etc. The terrain is quite rocky and certain parts of the route are tricky to navigate. You can ask for a walking stick to take with you. You must be sure footed and have good balance to walk in these caves. There was an older, large woman in our group who needed quite a bit of help to climb over certain areas. There are some low spots to get through as well. Also, you will walk through water several times and near the end you are over your head, but the life jacket will help anyone who can't swim. There is one point where we all turned off our lights and were very quiet. It was an interesting moment. It's about a 90 minute tour. When you are done they give you a shot of some liquor, Tastes like Sambuca! While you are drinking that, they set up the pictures they took on computers for you to view. We had some cash on us but didn't expect the pictures to be so expensive. One picture was $25US, your group pictures were $69 and I think for $120US you could get a CD with these plus other pictures. A little too pricey. I would have liked to have one of us. So remember to bring enough cash. They did say they could email them and you can pay for it through Paypal. After looking at pictures you get to sit down for a light lunch - salad, soup, and some local mexican fare. It was ok, but I'm a bit wary of eating off the resort, especially soup and lettuce probably washed with local water. Once finished lunch you are picked up by your tour bus and back to the hotel. They were very organized with the tours/group and buses. Overall, a very unique experience and worth the money.

Great natural wonder, excellent tour, lifetime memory. A little less flashy and commercial than the theme parks. This was a great tour of an underground river. All equipment provided. Professional. We bought the pictures that they sell after the tour to remember our tour.
excellent time. fantastic time - our guide was amazing ...........
amazing. This is such an incredable experience, like nothing you have ever seen!! a total must do.

Super Natural. My husband and I did this last February (2011).. We thoroughly enjoyed it. We booked at our hotel and were picked up with a van. We were dropped off at the roadside building for the attraction and were given instructions and a desciption of what we were about to experience.. We were then loaded in to another van and headed off in to the interior of the countryside. It was quite a bumpy ride and not very comfortable but I forgot all about the discomfort of the ride the minute we arrived at the site.. It was great, very well run,we were given lockers for our stuff and then we recieved lifejackets and walking sticks, we then proceeded to showers as they want to keep the caves pristine.. It was very ecologically acceptable.. The guides who work there obviously care very much about the site.. We proceeded to a hole to go underground. I was in awe the minute we started and stayed that way the whole tour which was about an hour and a half.. We walked , waded, swam and floated in different areas. The rock formations and the stalactites/stalagmites were pristine. It was very obvious that it was a natural treasure.. The guide was very informative and answered every question we had. It was obvious she was in love with the place herself..I would not do this if I had any mobility problems or any heart conditions, shortness of breath etc..it is not strenuous but still for the physically fit.. It would also not be good for anyone who feels the least claustrophbic..I don't normally buy the dvd's that these places supply for a fee but this one was worth it..I recommend this tour for anyone who loves pristine nature!!

Incredible experience. My husband and I enjoyed this amazing natural attraction during our vacation to the Mayan. We booked online from home with absolute ease receiving our confirmation and pick up time from our hotel within one day. Upon arrival, you are greeted and given great instructions and put into groups and assigned a guide. Getting dressed takes a few minutes, but it ensures you are safe and comfortable. Make sure you get water shoes that are tight for your feet - it makes it easier once in the water. Our guide Dani (sp) was incredible and provided good history, information and hints to enjoy. Once down in the River, you will see and experience nature at it's best. Approximately 1.5 hours underground and you are tired, but want more! For a couple in our 50's we felt very comfortable and it did not find it physically taxing at all. After exiting, you get a nice lunch and the opportunity to purchase pictures (their are photographers underground along your route) We purchaed the full CD at 69.00 - I felt it was worth it or you would not have any pictures as cameras are not allowed in the river. Rio Secreto - a do not miss when in the Mayan and highly recommended!

Don't keep this a secret!. This was an amazing and beautiful adventure that should not be missed if you visit the Mayan Riviera. We couldn't believe the natural splendor and were captivated by the knowledge and passion for the ecosystem that our guide shared with us. Don't keep this tour a secret...share it with everyone you know!

Beginner level Cave Tour. Really fun cave tour for families, couples, or anyone who is steady on their feet. See both dry and wet cave formations in one trip, with one entry fee. Involves rugged walking and easy swimming, and lots of bending. All equipment except swimsuits provided, along with a surprisingly good buffet lunchTIP Leave your camera behind, you need two hands, to do this tour.Everitt
breathtaking!. Excellent guides providing history and information. The tour was 11/2 hours within the cenote...walking and swimming, beautiful stalmites and tites. Definitely a must see!

Amazing amazing amazing!. I am an avid traveler and do many tours at each location. I have done some amazing things but this was really top notch. It's not an adrenaline rusher but an amazing beautiful experience. We didn't want it to end! On a side note if you have health concerns this isn't the tour for you. ( bad knees, hip, legs, obese)

Awesome!. This was incredible. If you are in the Playa del Carmen vacinity and is physically able to go on this excursion, this is a must do. Thank you so much Gavin and team for enabling us to share this underground river/cave ecosystem with you.

amazing but a little scary. This was an amazing experienc you go under ground into the areas water system. All water rivers ect in this area are underground. It was amazing to be underground for an hour and a half and see the natural formation of staligmites. To walk through these and swim throught the water. Not for the faint of heart

Beautiful cave, eco-friendly company. Our tour was fantastic! The cave is absolutely gorgeous and totally decorated, and the company that runs Rio Secreto is very professional. It's not always the case with commercial caving that the company is concerned with conservation and having a low-impact on the cave, but Rio Secreto definitely is. Our guides, Rafa and Alfredo, were so enthusiastic about their job, and very knowledgeable about the cave. I would highly recommend them. Even if you're already a caver (like me), it's worth the money to see this cave. Also, the buffet after you get out is delicious!

one of the more memorable attractions in cancun/playa. I went to xhel-ha and xcaret, and rio secreto, and for me, rio secreto was the more memorable of the three. I appreciated the preservation of both the ecologcal and cultural value of the attraction. I highly recommend Rio secreto to anyone who has a desire for more than the americanized tourist spots have to offer. Rodrigo was our guide and he was knowledgable and had such a great energy. Every employee I encountered had a similar excitement and enjoyable demeanor. Rio secreto is trying to become a national reserve to protect the sanctity of the cenotes. A cause that goes beyond profit and tourism. I highly recommend.

Awesome.... We went with our three kids (14, 12 and 5). The guide was very accommodating and had my husband walk behind her with the 5 yr. old so she could lend a hand.DEFINITELY take the walking stick. I almost didn't despite reading that it helps in a previous review because when I Iooked around, no one else seemed to be taking one. So glad I didn't follow the crowd. It really helps navigate the ground below that changes constantly and also gives you something to lean on when lowering yourself in the caves (you are not allowed to touch anything in the cave to stablize your weight).Yes, the wetsuits are wet but I didn't think they smelled. The helmet on the other hand smelled. I wished that I had thought beforehand because I would have taken a paper coffee filter to use between my head and the helmet (a camp trick to prevent lice spread in helmets). Just a tip to think about...The sheer beauty in the caves in magnificent. You will not believe your eyes and it will restore your faith in the power of God that something so wonderful was created (and I'm totally not religious but it is awesome).Oh, also, there are different trails so ask the guide if you are afraid of being claustrophobic. We did not experience any claustrophobia and I am assuming that they gave us an easier trail given that we had a small child.Another reviewer mentioned that the photographer was annoying but we loved the photos. They are really unique and so beautiful so I am glad they provided the service.

Thankfully this is no longer a secret. What a wonderful excursion. After briefing from Jaime the guide and outfitting us with all equipment necessary, explored the underground cave and "secret" river. Such a wonderful time. It is not for the faint of heart or unfit because the walking and climbing over cave formations through a shallow river can be quite taxing. It was exciting none the less. Recommend this trip for anyone wanting to have an experience none of their friends have done without risking injury. Not for young children, need to be able to swim at least a little. Can't be afraid of the dark because when the lights are all turned off it is very, very dark. Small groups of about 10 so you don't feel like just one in the crowd. Photographers did a nice job capturing the trip. You can't take a camera or phone into the cave so plan on buying the CD with your pictures. A little pricey but half the proceeds goes to preservation of the sites

One of neatest places I have visited.. Visited with our six year old son. Our guide was Rodrigo and he was extremely knowledgable, passionate and responsible. He related very well to our son making him the "assistant guide". We learned all kinds of facts about the cave both scientific and spiritual. We felt like we were walking into another world. I am so happy that we decided to go.
Very Beautiful. Worth seeing at least once.. After being out in the hot sun most of the day going to Rio Secreto was amazingly beautiful.
Secreto Caves. A totally natural and recently discoved UNDERGROUND cave system. This is a difficult attraction to navigate and I would not recommend it for small children or the faint of heart.

This is a Must Do!. Rio Secreto is a beautiful and fascinating experience. We were lucky to have Alfredo as our tour Guide and he made our excursion both interesting and fun. He is so enthusiastic about the caves and he is very knowledgeable. He also really appreciates the ecological aspects of maintaining the natural environment. Thanks Alfredo, you are definitely the right person for this job! The caves are so spectacular and it is such an interesting learning experience with respect to how our world has changed over the centuries. The food was superb and it was definitely worth every penny that we paid for this adventure!

I had this great feeling of reverence towards Nature as we moved through the cave.. I was deeply touched by the spiritual ceremony delivered by a Maya prior to starting the tour. The quiet, ultimate quiet, experienced once in the cave was memorable. A sense of deep serenity embraced me. I was awed by the delicate yet strong and intriguing sculptures produced by nature. The tour guide stressed the importance of respect for this environnment. The experience was definitely worth the effort. As we are older and not that healthy, perhaps a reduced version (less than an hour) of the tour could be developped. Make sure to bring enough money (minimum 30$ and up to 100$ for the full package) to pay for the wonderful pictures taken by the accompanying photographer. It was not possible to purchase more pictures after the tour and we had not brought enough money. For that, we will be forever sorry. But the memories live on.

Amazing experience! Educational and fun!.
